Reviews.Title: “ahh...Maroma Resort and Spa”
Reviews.Author: rarant
Reviews.Content: We have been wanting to visit Maroma for some time. The best things about this resort are the service and the intimate and private feel of the beach, grounds and restaurants. We thought the food delicious and the variety fine for a five night stay. We are perplexed at previous reviews about the lack of variety and quality of the food. We completely disagree. We had a couple's massage at the Spa, which was unbelievably good. The Spa overall was luxurious (sauna and steam room!) and the walk through the jungle to get to it was heavenly. We spent most of our time the first few days on the beach beds (fantastic!). However, the wind picked up and we moved to the garden pool the last few days, which was heated and surrounded by a small tropical paradise. We loved it! I recommend taco night on Thursday night and the beach barbeque (lobster, shrimp, fish, steak, ribs, paella, salads, etc....) on Friday night. Both not inexpensive, but the food was incredible. We ate at Freddy's bar on two nights for a casual dinner and El Sol on one night. The service and food at El Sol are not to be missed. The complimentary breakfast is a treat. The rooms are of average decor, but the bed and linens high quality. The linen closet was outside our room, so we did hear noise throughout the day, with staff going in and out of the closet. We did not leave the resort during our entire stay. For our arrival and departure from Cancun airport, we used Cancun Transfers. The roundtrip was $82 (charged through paypal on AMEX). The service picked us up at the airport in a nice car (big black Suburban...we felt like big shots compared to other transportation vehicles). Since we had prepaid for the roundtrip, we only tipped the drivers each way. Everything was as described on the company's website.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service, Dirty Beach, Aged Property and Ignorant Management”
Reviews.Author: Brandon T
Reviews.Content: I have been to countless five-start properties worldwide including the Aman resorts, Four Seasons, St Regis, Rosewood and many beautiful boutique hotels. If you have any taste whatsoever and expect a level of service or luxury that is offered in well-managed hotels, do not go to this property. If you simply wish to ignore lack of service and pay premium pricing for 2-star quality, let the pictures on Maroma's website and the Kiwi Collection ratings misguide you. Despite all my travel, I have never written a review of any resort, because I do not have the time. This resort was so tragic that I had to take the time. I have included various photos of the problems so you don't categorize me as a bored complainer. The villa (beachfront, one of the highest categories, ~US$1500++ per night) is generally beautiful, despite the age. The problems at the resort, however, are many: 1. Airport Arrival: The driver had the wrong count (2 instead of 3) of passengers and we had to wait 15 minutes for him to confirm with the hotel (who was not answering) before moving. The driver was extremely rude and could not speak a word of English beyond "Hello". 2. Hotel Arrival: Though they "fixed" the miscount, there were 2 welcome drinks (which I didn't even want) were offered and the very disinterested host showed us around the aged resort. 3. The food, especially at lunch, was terrifying. I had burnt meat on burnt tacos of some sort, and a few other of their limited snack items for US$200. Terrible selection. Terrible taste. 4. The beach is incredibly dirty. Late in the morning, a few people would start cleaning the beach area but would not do the job properly. I have included photos. 5. The A/C unit was completely broken and it took 2 attempts for them to finally fix it at around 11PM. I have included the lovely photo of the technician on the ladder as my bedtime gift. 6. The manager sent us a gift on a note. It was a crumbled-up piece of some sort of cookie in a messy wrapping for the 3 of us. I sent this gift back to the manager in an envelope. I have included a photo. 7. The beach beds were very rarely serviced. The beds were always dirty and towels were piled up on every bed. Clean towels were rarely available after noon. I finally screamed at someone who started cleaning up the beds. I have included many pictures of this mess. 8. I sent an email to the manager highlighting these issues and he hasn't even acknowledged the issues or responded in any way. I assume he's away for the weekend, which is reflected in the ignorant attitude of the staff here. Luxury today means anticipation of what guests may need. I don't need to be called "Sir" and I simply wish for a comfortable time at the resort with staff who seem to be genuine and friendly. This place is simply trash. It may have been better in the past based on some other reviews, but I assure you, it falls below a 2-star in terms of service. My recommendations in this area are Rosewood Mayakoba (far better than here) if you wish for a relaxing place, ME Cancun (if you wish for a hip, modern place) or Blue Diamonds (which has inherited the original Mandarin Oriental design for free). Warm wishes!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent beach”
Reviews.Author: segmd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about the magnificent beach with endless white sand and crystal clear blue green water. There are 3 pools but nothing spectacular. There is a great spa and we had wonderful massages. The staff was incredibly friendly and were only too pleased to get us whatever we wanted. The hotel's food is a little pricey with a lot of heavier Mexican good. It was very special to eat at the restaurant right on the beach. The rooms are fronted by large terraces with hammocks on them. The downside is that you really don't have large windows and need to go out onto the terrace to see the ocean. All in all we had a great time but we are truly beach people. There are no TVs in the rooms and that didn't bother us. There is free WiFi. We loved the feeling of the small hotel with about 60 rooms so the expanse of beach was mostly empty while next door at secrets people are packed on top of each other. We went into Playa del Carmen one night for dinner. What a waste. Skip it and eat at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very good, falls short of great”
Reviews.Author: thefabulousmoolah
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Maroma. A place I usually would not have chosen. Generally will go with Rosewood, Four Seasons properties. But I wanted to try a smaller place with a great beach. Maroma is all about the beach--it is beautiful. Fair amount of seaweed but they are very diligent about cleaning it every morning. Service is very good. Everyone refers to the guests by first name with a Ms, Mrs or Mr preceeding it. Food is ok but not great. Breakfasts are the best meal-it is a bountiful breakfast. good authentic mexican egg dishes. Juice and coffee, followed by fruit, followed by a bakery basket and wonderful tortillas hand made with love by Dalia. Coffee is delivered to your room each morning and left outside the door which is a really lovely touch. Rooms are quite dated in terms of furnishings but the bed was comfortable. Room service is on time and pleasant always. I found the meals outside of breakfast to be very hit or miss. Mostly miss. Spa is lovely. Massage therapists were quite good. The place is lacking in terms of the swimming pools. They are not well taken care of, the grass is worn down around the pool and the area is not really welcoming. I spent much more time at the beach but would have preferred a great pool area. Maroma does not have that. One thing I was not pleased about was that when I arrived at around 430pm, my room was not ready and I had to wait about 30-45 minutes to get into a room. I was told that the last guests had vacated late, which frankly was not what I wanted to hear after a full day of travel. If check in is technically at 3, then it shouldn't be after 5pm before getting into one's room. Once i got into the room, it was another 20 minutes to get my bags sent up. So that felt chaotic to me and set things off on not a good footing. I think that if you are looking for a resort with a great beach, lovely people, and don't particularly care about fantastic meals or great drinks, and you don't want to pay Rosewood prices, then Maroma is a very good alternative. I would not return but I am glad I tried it. There is enough to be said for it on a number of levels. four Seasons and Rosewood it isn't, but it is not trying to be.

Reviews.Title: “Truly exceptional hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tlalocshiva
Reviews.Content: I am an extremely demanding hotel guest (and my husband is squeamish about insects) so i was approaching our stay at the Maroma with guarded optimism even though I had already read good reviews about it. The hotel is simply excellent. The mindset there is all about client satisfaction. The rooms are stunning and spotless. All you have to do is ask and the staff mobilizes in every way to accommodate; be it a private dinner on the beach or a trip to one of the Mayan ruins, everything is done in a genuine spirit of pleasing you. There were no sour faces on any of the staff (even when I asked for all kinds of eccentricities) and the layout brings home a real feeling that the hotel appreciates its guests individually.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: paul s
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th trip to Maroma, and we usually never go anywhere twice. The property is gorgeous, the staff are unbelievably friendly and the food and drink are wonderful. The Maroma Margarita is reason enough to return. Can't wait to get back there, Maroma is a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “another wonderful stay in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: lele0820
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Maroma. It is a beautiful property with a stunning beach, and a perfect place to go when you want to relax. Our room was spectacular - a one bedroom villa with a pool to share with the 3 other villas. The only downside to the villa is that is is close to the all-inclusive resort next door, so you do hear the DJ blasting music during the day. The staff is so accomodating, especially compared to other Caribbean countries. Moses is a terrific waiter and hi to Jessica at Hospitality! As mentioned in other reviews, our only issue is with the food - specifically, dinner (it's not bad, just gets boring.) We enjoyed the free breakfast every day, especially the handmade tortillas, and love the beach menu at lunch. But after eating one or two dinners, we wanted a change from a Mexican/Mayan meal. The chef will accomodate you - we asked for grilled fish and vegetables on the last night - but we would like to see more variety or specials that are different every night. It is pricy but we've yet to stay at a resort outside the USA where the dinners weren't expensive. During our stay, we saw two young boys and an infant, but we are grandparents and they didn't bother us at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with a few not-so-small issues”
Reviews.Author: Pandreea
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Maroma in February 2012. This was my 3rd time in Mexico and my fiancee's first. We wanted a relaxing vacation, away from the freezing cold of NYC in the winter, within a 3-hour direct flight from NYC and with some cultural highlights. The hotel - a former architect's home in the middle of a 500-acre coconut plantation - is superb! A beautiful whitewashed hotel that is right on the beach. And what a beach!! It is pure white sand and turquoise water. The hotel is 30/40 min. away from the Cancun airport and about 30 min. from Playa del Carmen (by car). This is a great location as it is away from the cheap thrills of Cancun and close to the local scene in Playa. We rented a car as we wanted to see Chichen Itza, Coba and Tulum (more on this below) so we were able to travel outside the resort, which we highly recommend. Firstly, the hotel is beautiful, very clean and very well kept. While being right on the beach, it still has quite a bit of nature around the premises including large but friendly iguanas which we grew fond of before we left (though we were petrified when we arrived). The main pool is beautiful and heated. The rooms are large - we booked a junior oceanview suite and were upgraded for free to a master oceanview suite (we were celebrating our engagement). The room had a great balcony with a hammock, a large bathroom with a shower and tub, and a separate bedroom and sitting area. There is free Wi-fi in the rooms which works very well and thankfully no TVs. The beach is absolutely beautiful - it has nice beach beds (if you can get one - see "con" below) and otherwise nice beach chairs and palapas. The beach will not disappoint. Secondly, the Maroma staff is pure gold - very friendly and attentive. They actually go out their way to be helpful and to remember your name. They are the hotel's greatest asset! Belen, who welcomed us, was a sweetheart - she made everything possible, from our amazing free room upgrade to a master oceanview suite to showing us on the map how to drive out to the Mayan ruins. Luis taught us the intricacies of tequila (it's such a fine spirit if you know how to enjoy it) and even emailed us a sangrita recipe which we will surely use! The Maroma staff actually cleans the beach every morning of the seaweed that is washed up by the ocean during the night so the beach is really quite clean and inviting. The one staff-related issue we had was the room cleaning. For our entire stay of over 6 days, the maid NEVER came before 2:00pm (even though we tipped nicely the first day). So if you want to go back to the room for a shower or an afternoon nap, you will find a messy room and will be disturbed by the maid coming in to do the "morning" cleaning. Included in the room is a free snorkeling session per person - they take you inside the great barrier reef (the second largest in the world, after Australia) and they offer private sessions to take you outside the reef. Def. take advantage of your trip - we saw amazing fish and coral during our 40 min. time in the water. My fiancee also wanted to get PADI scuba certified (a long time dream) but the only scuba instructor there was not available for 2 days during our stay and no replacement was considered by the staff, though we understand that the water activities desk is separate from the hotel. The free coffee service delivered in the mornings directly to the room is great and was always on time. The free breakfast in the mornings is amazing - they have full entrees of real Mexican/Mayan dishes - our favorite was the poblano chili filled with an egg omelet but the dishes range from simple eggs to muesli to the Mexican traditional dishes. Also included are unbelievably good exotic fruit juices (papaya, etc.) - definitely try the chaya juice (a local Mayan plant) - yogurt, pastries, out-of-this-world hot chocolate and Santacruz coffee. We loved the coffee so much that we bought a few packs to take home! The sporadic group theme dinners can be great (see "con" below for a la carte dining) - they usually run at US$75-125 per person for a buffet plus an additional 24% tax/tip automatically included. Our favorite was La Cantina night which included traditional Mexican dishes and mezcal - def. try this if it occurs on a night you are there. The beach BBQ theme was also great! Below are the cons. We truly hope that management works on these as we would love to return to Maroma in the future. (1) This is the MAJOR con - The a la carte food and drinks at the 2 restaurants and bar on the premises are insanely expensive (by NYC 3-Michelin-star standards) and of passable quality - we definitely did not travel on vacation with the intent to be cheap or even reasonable and we have the funds to splurge; however, you feel taken for a ride when the entrees are so expensive and so very small. It's almost like this is where they make their profit margins as they know that they have a fairly well-off and captive clientele. It really is an unnecessary way to spend money that leaves you feeling a bit cheated. Depending on your order (say, appetizer, entree and wine), each dinner can run in the high $300. We even saw people ordering inside the restaurants food from the outside bar (we assume it was price-point related). This is just not sustainable. To EACH lunch, dinner or drink at the bar or on the beach, or really to ANY service (including the spa, the gift shop, etc.), the hotel automatically adds a 14% tax and 10% service and every item is presented only in US dollars but not charged this way. So a single shot of good tequila at the bar will run about US$20 with 24% additional surcharge - i.e. ~US$25. This gets presented in US dollars but charged in the peso equivalent (not clear why) and your US credit card will add a forex fee to every such charge. So a single drink can turn into quite a feast! Our best-tasting meals were in Playa - definitely try Las Brisas (best seafood salad/ceviche, beers, whole grilled fish, guacamole for US$20) - in Valladolid - def. try Taberna de los Frailes - and in the village of Coba at a great restaurant called Pyramida overlooking the lake near the ruins. (2) Related to the above, there are no other real restaurant options on the premises. There is only a restaurant called Pavo Real about 5 min. drive away (also, technically, on the premises but run by a different staff) but it is not very good, aesthetically pleasing or reasonably priced, though it does have a live piano player. They gave us Mexican sparkling wine when we asked for Italian prosecco and were planning to charge us as if we were consuming the prosecco (a large price differential) until we finally asked to see the bottle and the label as it was so awful. We were refunded the price, but mistakes like this should not be made - and I'm being kind in calling this a "mistake" and not an intentional plan to pad the bill. (3) The general clientele at Maroma are folks in their 50s (again, we assume for price-point related reasons). This is perfectly fine, but worth a mention. On the other hand, we partially chose Maroma due to their policy of not allowing young children, but alas it seems this has changed as there were young (under 10 year-old) kids at breakfast - not a deal-breaker for us really as we're in our early 30s, but there's something about kids running around that's a bit stressful when you're trying to unwind. (4) The staff allows patrons to wake up early (if not the night before) and place random belongings on the beach beds - i.e. a newspaper or the in-room slippers. So, by the time we finished breakfast at 8:30AM (with, at most, another 2 couples at the beach-side restaurant), we would reach the beach where there were PLENTY of non-occupied beach beds BUT with random items securing occupation. We were unpleased to have to take beach chairs and see people stroll onto the beach to their "reserved" beach beds 3 hours later that us. Unless patrons are going for a dip in the water or a beach stroll or breakfast, they should not be allowed to "reserve" beach beds in the morning...or the hotel should invest in more beds. (5) If you do not have a car to travel around, this can prove to be a little suffocating as well as very expensive. If you add the lunch, the drinks on the beach and the dinner, you'll be spending around $1000 per couple per day. With a car, you can travel to the nearby Playa del Carmen, experience real restaurants - with great fresh seafood - and real locals for a reasonable price point. You can also travel there by taxi. We rented our car from Avis at the airport and were very glad we did so (get the insurance!). We drove 3-hours inland to see Chichen Itza which was absolutely amazing - a UNESCO World Heritage Sight and new 7th World Wonder. The highways - both the toll and the rural - were VERY safe and we were able to get there before the tourist buses. We were also able to stop along the way in Valladolid for a great lunch and for cenote swimming - we can provide more details of our itinerary via private message, but you should definitely travel outside the resort. We also visited Coba where we were able to climb the tallest pyramid in the Yucatan and the Tulum ruins. Overall, the Maroma was a great stay but we did not feel that we received true value for our money. We will not return - it was a great, though unnecessarily expensive, stay.

Reviews.Title: “Maroma changed”
Reviews.Author: llbGreensboroNc
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to Maroma, and sadly, will be our last. It is still so beautiful, but the beach has become overrun with the neighbors walking back and forth. Such a crime that Maroma did not protect its area. Now, jet skis and parasailers are right in front of paradise. And a loud DJ at the all inclussve next door yelling in Spanish. The service is still good to excellent and they try really hard to please. The food is better than before, but the prices are crazy, $35 entrees and $120 wines that you can get at our grocery store for less than $20 and would not drink. The icing came though, when they changed the policy of allowing children and did not tell the guests who had booked under the old rules. Then, when asked, they claimed that there would only be 3 children there for our first three nights. However, there were more, including an INFANT whose crying was heard across the pool. Not the atmosphere we paid for, or expected. It was too late to change our plans when we found out about the change. It is not too late to change yours.

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best”
Reviews.Author: David J
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little gem. Everything about this hotel is what is described in the brochure; its location in relation to town is a little out of the way roughly about 15-20 minute taxi to fifth avenue which costs 250 (Mexican) but to come back you get the same taxi for 190-200 (Mexican). Be warned this is NOT a cheap hotel the special evenings are very expensive circa $200 for 2 people. The other thing to take into account is that all of the prices shown are in US Dollars not Mexican Pesos. The other thing to take into account is that the hotel charges for drinking water on the beach & in the rooms which are in the region of $5.00 per small bottle. Taking all of the above into account I would highly recommend this hotel – do not be lured into a hotel in Cancun; the Maroma Hotel is probably the best.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding resort with great service”
Reviews.Author: RandomNC
Reviews.Content: After staying at Maroma in a deluxe ocean front room for a week, we place it near the top of our “all-time favorites list.” When we vacation, we like to spend our days on the beach, take walks, eat great food, and relax. We’ve previously visited Little Dix Bay, Biras Creek, Cap Juluca (we have visited twice and it is our favorite), Peter Island, Villa Del Sol, Cuisinart, and Nisbet Plantation. Though our room was relatively small, it was very comfortable and we did not feel cramped. The covered patio was a good size with two sitting areas and a hammock. Our room was upstairs in the main building. At first, we were worried about noise due to our central location but we had no issues. The food was good but not great. Our biggest complaint was the lack of fresh fish choices. While we were there, it seemed like the only fresh fish was grouper. Grouper was one of the few fish options on the daily menu. It was also the catch of the day and the feature fish in a special dinner one evening. We’ve come to enjoy and expect a variety of fresh fish when we visit Caribbean resorts and, in this regard, Maroma was a disappointment. Breakfasts consisted of typical Mexican and America dishes plus pastries and fruit and were great (after a few days, we started eating in our room which proved to help us make the best use of our time). We had lunch of the beach most days and found the menu to be enticing and food well prepared. Dinners were good, subject to the previous comment on limited fresh fish offerings. Our best meal experience was the Thursday night “taco night.” It was excellent. The service was wonderful. Each staff member we encountered was warm, friendly, and competent. We heard the phrase “it is my pleasure” in response to almost every request we made – and we could sense the sincerity behind the statements. The beach experience was also very good. This was our first encounter with “beach beds” and we are worried that we’ll never be able to be as comfortable in beach chairs ever again. Imagine a comfortable king sized mattress with some large pillows to prop up against and an umbrella that can positioned according to your whims. It was fabulous. The service on the beach was very attentive. We enjoyed complimentary chilled apples and ice cream each day (and frozen grapes a few days). Our only complaint was that unlike most other resorts we have visited, complimentary water was not provided. We got around this by bringing water bottles provided in our guest room and then getting ice buckets but at a resort the caliber of Maroma, this should not have been necessary. Maroma’s beach was well maintained. There must have been a bad storm right before we arrived because there was a lot of seaweed and trash on our first day but it was all removed before the second day and was clean thereafter. The adjoining beach at the end of the hotel’s property is the Secrets Maroma. Their beach was also maintained but had a different feel – much more crowded and a very different clientele. Beach walking was okay. You can walk a long way on the beach and many of the views are great. That said, portions of the beach in the vicinity of Maroma are not well maintained - there is a lot of seaweed and trash (it will forever change your view on the recycling of plastic when you see all the debris). There’s little the Maroma Hotel can do about trash on beaches they don’t control but it detracts from the beach walking experiences of guests. We had a couples massage and the overall experience was exceptional. Not only were the massages well done, but the physical environment was terrific. We were in a hut and allowed to enjoy a Jacuzzi afterwards. It was probably our best spa experience anywhere. There’s a lot of talk about physical safety when traveling to Mexico. We can only judge things on our own experience but we never felt uncomfortable in any way. As it relates to the other Mexico “thing,” we were told to not drink the water from the faucets in our room. We did drink tap water and use ice in the restaurants without any problems. All in all, we had a wonderful time and place Maroma high on our “we will return” list.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Maroma”
Reviews.Author: top-trippers
Reviews.Content: Great location, ambience and service. Everyone is so welcoming, making you feel part of the Maroma ‘family’, striking just the right balance of friendly and attentive without being intrusive or over the top. A truly unforgettable and relaxing holiday from start to finish - a real achievement given our high expectations. The hotel is set on a beautiful sandy beach which is swept everyday in case some seaweed has floated in overnight. Lovely clear warm water. A good range of sunbeds in a number of locations - all well spaced out. There are only around sixty rooms but there are various categories and locations - the pictures on the website are illustrative only and you will pretty much get what you pay for. We asked for an Oceanfront Junior Suite on the ground floor in a quiet location. We had Room 57 which was as far away as possible from the main building, had lovely sea views and was just a few steps from the beach. It had a separate inside lounge (handy for the odd tropical shower!) plus a very large outdoor covered area with 6 seater settee, patio table and chairs plus hammock. There are no TVs in the rooms – not a problem for us given that we wanted a romantic break. One of the best hospitality services we have experienced (in line with other Orient Express hotels we have stayed at). For example check-in/check-out is tailored to your individual flight times. We experienced some fantastic private tailor made tours (via 4 Worlds Expeditions), in particular Chichen Itza and Tulum plus snorkelling to the underground caves (unique to this area) and the reef. We thought these represented excellent value. Top tip – opt for an early start to Chichen Itza (0600) to avoid the crowds and the heat. Also, you might want to avoid going to the Mayan temples etc on a Sunday as entry is free for locals so the site is busier. Also recommend the Spa - great 80 min de-stress massage. Food quality is excellent and, although the standard menu choice is a bit limited if you are here for a long stay, there are numerous ‘speciality’ nights and the chef (Juan Pablo) is more than willing to flex the menu if you ask. The private dinner might initially seem expensive but you need to bear in mind that Juan Pablo tailors the five courses to your personal preferences. We opted for the ‘Mirador’ tower as our own private hideaway for Valentine’s although the beach front dinners looked fabulous as well. Sheer bliss.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Pure R&R”
Reviews.Author: Paul C
Reviews.Content: We spent five blissful days @ Moaroma in Dec. 2011. Jessica and her amazing hospitality staff took care of our every need and really made us feel welcome. This attitude permeates the entire staff and property. We're pretty discerning travelors and have to say that this resort stands out in terms of beach, food, and spa. The atmosphere is casual while remaining upscale. Costs are in line with other high end properties world wide - ie don't expect it to be cheap. That said, for those that want to relax in quiet luxury, this is the spot.

Reviews.Title: “This is a 10 star Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Mexicomamma
Reviews.Content: I think that to be fair when evaluating a hotel/resort it would be helpful to have categories. For example it is possible to give a nice not too expensive all inclusive five stars but those five stars do not equal the five stars given to an upscale rather expensive resort. So when I evaluate Maroma the five stars I am giving it really should be 10 stars. This resort is spectacular. The resort is just 35 minutes from the airport but you feel like you are hours away. We arrived at noon a few hours before their regular check in time and we were given another room to change in. We then went to the beach. Maroma beach is a long stretch with only a few resorts. The sand is soft white, the water clear blue. The very little seweed was raked up every morning. Comfortable beach beds, loungers and chairs, palapas and umbrellas line the beach at a comfortably private distance. Every time I tried to move my chair an attendant ran over to do it. Towels are large, plentiful and available. Our pool was nice but not heated. The main pool is heated. It is actually very warm and It is under a canopy of trees. We had an ocean view room in the newer section that overlooked one of the pools. We had a view of the beach, palm trees, birds, the pool and flowers. The bed was very comfortable, the room was charming and we had a great balcony with chairs, table and hammock. Coffee arrived every morning at 7 as requested. The evening turn down service included candles and oils. The days were beautiful and the nights were equally spectacular. We walked down tree lined paths lit by torches and/or candles. Candles were lit everywhere in the restaurants. The meals were very good. The past reviewer was absolutely wrong about prices. Breakfast was free and included anything you wanted. One day I asked for pancakes and scrambled eggs and ended up with 2 separate meals all free. Every day they came around with tropical fruits and bread, pastries and home made marmalades. You could have pretty much any juice including the juice of the day which could be mango guava. We were usually too full for lunch. I was however always ready for the daily ice-cream man on the beach who delivered yummy homemade ice cream cones.Our dinners were typically the fresh fish of the day. The fish was always fresh and very moist and flavorful. Prices were comparable to any fine restaurant. Music in the evening was provided by local musicians. All of the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. Maroma is expensive. You get what you pay for. This is a quiet, beautiful resort where the intent is to give you a memorable vacation. And memorable it was.

Reviews.Title: “Another visit to a great resort.”
Reviews.Author: jrj48
Reviews.Content: our third visit to this great small resort,now an Orient Express property for the past several years. Although there is some encroachment of "corporate" they have remarkably been able to keep the friendliness and "home" feel as a culture in theri employees both old and new. Staff learns your name very quickly here. some staff recognized us from our last visit even though they did not remember our names they did our faces. With Chef Juan Pablo and Chef de cuisine Edgar the food remains very good to outstanding. Chef has added some concepts (wine dinner, chef's table, home cooking in the cantina) as well as taco night and grill night besides the restaurant's food. The spa is also excellent. but why do we go back? It's a special place with special people. We feel like going home. Belen meeting you with a welcome margarita. Gabriel, Moses and Javier in the restaurant. Dahlia making the perfect corn tortillas (and trying to teach you how). Luis, Freddy, Manuael, and Angel sharing their knowlege of the Yucatan, her people and of course tequila. Johnny and Sergio on the beach. Maroma is not cheap but like most high end resorts it delivers. If you, like me, don't have a trust account or sold your dot com company then save your money so you can come here once. After that, you will come back I am sure of it. . But

Reviews.Title: “Superb,high-end intimate resort on a phenomenal beach”
Reviews.Author: alexshulman
Reviews.Content: We are very particular in our vacation choices and visited Mexico 5-6 times in a last 2-3 years. We love Esperanza, Ventanas/Cabos/,BanyanTree,Rosewood/Riviera Maya/ Maroma is very unique and outstanding place. It reminded me Royal Palms/Arizona/ and Rancho Valencia/California/ but IMO MR exceeds all above mentioned places. Previous reviews outlined in a great details major aspects of this property. Not to be repetitive but 3 major areas were MR shines SERVICE LOCATION AMBIENCE We most definitely will return to this amazing paradise. Alex Shulman

Reviews.Title: “Our adventure to Maroma!”
Reviews.Author: hollyhockster
Reviews.Content: Hands down the most romantic spot on the planet. You have to get there to experience it for yourselves. It's so romantic, you could take your dog and have fun!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Maroma Orient Express - Luxury Breakfast on the Mayan Riviera”
Reviews.Author: OliveOilandLemons
Reviews.Content: This is a second instalment in a series I am offering on breakfast on the Mayan Riviera. Most hotels on the Riviera are all inclusive and it is often difficult to find resorts that are open to non-staying guests. We love good food, perfect settings and excellent service, right along with simplicity and authenticity and have developed quite a repertoire of breakfast places to go to wherever we travel. I have decided to share my collection of Mayan Riviera breakfast experiences with you. Enjoy. Maroma Beach - the Maroma Orient Express Rated one of the most beautiful beaches in the world by Condé Nast (a few recent experiences with their "Best in the World" recommendations made me think of them as Condé "Nasty"), this time they are not far off the mark. The beautiful Maroma beach is located half way between Playa del Carmen and Cancun. Watch for signs or the large blue peacock painted on a wall at the turnoff from the highway. Maroma beach fronts a few resorts (almost all are called "Maroma" this or that) but without a doubt the destination here is the Maroma Orient Express hotel. The Maroma Orient Express is a 65 room hotel with a spa set right off the gorgeous white sand beach. Reservations for breakfast are required but unless you are traveling between Christmas and and New Year when the hotel is fully booked, you shouldn't have any problem getting in for breakfast (or lunch). Breakfast is served at El Restaurante on the beach and it is a gorgeous, transforming, setting. Tables with white linen clothe and white umbrellas are arranged on the open stone patio at the edge of the white sand that separates you from the beautiful turquoise carribean waters. You feel at one with the sea and sand. Hola amigos, I am home. The breakfast menu is fabulous, offering anything from birchmuesli with papaya, scrambles eggs with poblanos, tostadas with eggs or chicken, juevos motulenos with beans and ranchero sauce over corn tortillas to, of course, pancakes, waffles and other classic breakfast varieties. The tortillas are made fresh by a Mayan woman, rolling them in plain view just inside the restaurant. The woman walks between the tables, offering the tortillas, still warm, to go with your breakfast. The juice selection is enticing, with watermelon, pineapple, Chaya and the likes offered throughout breakfast. Good coffee is served in large cups, inviting you to linger and watch the scene. As always at the end of breakfast we walk down to the water's edge and enjoy a long beach walk, feet in the water, checking out new developments along that beautiful stretch of beach. We sometimes stop by for a drink back at the Maroma, before leaving to return to our own Mayan Riviera abode. Breakfast at the Maroma is one of those special experiences etched in your memory that you can draw on for a spiritual lift when needed.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be.....Sadly”
Reviews.Author: lulu33469
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Maroma & I'm heart-broken.....it is now grossly overpriced and not the intimate hotel I remember from 7 years ago.... Yes, you pay for the amenities and the exclusivity of the property. Yet, I found the cost of dining quite high, $100 for breakfast, which consisted of eggs on a tortilla, some bread, juice & coffee. $250 for lunch & $350 for dinner. This is far reaching especially in this economic climate & considering the location.....Mexico!!!! I'm sorry but $22 for a Margarita is ridiculous. Management needs to reconsider the pricing for food. It's ridiculous and takes from the overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect”
Reviews.Author: torontojeff
Reviews.Content: A magical, romantic hideaway. Impeccable, friendly service. Stellar food. The best spa in the world. Dessert in the tower under the stars is orgasmic!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Lovely People”
Reviews.Author: jean c
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to the Maroma Resort and Spa for a short get away at the end of January. The hotel was immaculate, the grounds were lovely, the beach was perfect, the water was warm and inviting and most of all, the staff could not have been more accommodating. Our room had a gorgeous ocean view from a beautiful terrace. The food at the hotel restaurants was exceptional. Can I say more? Most of all, the staff could not have been more attentative. Expensive? Yes, but totally worth it. Make sure you go to the spa and take a snorkeling trip with the dive master.

Reviews.Title: “Maroma - many happy returns”
Reviews.Author: Amanda0561
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Mexico took place in April 2011, we chose Maromo purely based on the website, and some good reviews on Tripadvisor - we were not at all disappointed, in fact the resort exceeded our expectations. From the first moment we arrived we were greated with warm smiles, a Maroma tequila, and "welcome home". We very soon came to realise that nothing was too much trouble, from housekeeping, to reception, to Freddie and his boys at the bar, to the restaurant and service on the beach - all requests were greated with a smile. Our room had direct views to the beach and was light and airy, we did see some other rooms at the resort, they also had the same feel, the Mexican tiled rooms we saw were in a good location but set a bit back from the beach. The gym area was very well equipped with up to date machinery, and was often visited to ensure all was clean and tidy for all guests. There were many favourite aspects to this holiday, but one of our favourites was the time spent in the late afternoon at the beach, on the day bed, with the sun going down. The resort was quiet in April, however this only added to the already tranquil setting. We are returning to Maroma in March this year, so thanks again to all who work at the resort and spa for a super holiday, especially Manuel, the Hospitality Manager, and we look forward to seeing you again in a couple of months.

Reviews.Title: “Maroma Beach”
Reviews.Author: Julie J
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Maroma for the first time in January for a five night getaway. We have had numerous Caribbean vacations but this was our first time in Mexico. The resort was gorgeous; the beach looked beautiful, but we couldn't stay in the water. It was filled with trash - construction debris, clothing, plastic, bottles, etc. There was a tremendous amount of seaweed all six days we were there. I recognize that they cannot control nature, but we had no storms and the seaweed did not lessen, to the point that we were surrounded by it in the water. The service was eager and cordial, but the Spanish to English translations created problems when you got past yes, no, and table for two. Loved the accommodations but won't go back. Food was fair to good, but certainly not worth an average of $120 for lunch and $250 for dinner for two.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jointbrowne
Reviews.Content: My wife and had a wonderfull time at Maroma. Best beach I've seen in Mexico. Ultraluxurious beach beds. The service was great. The staff was nonobtrusive but always available. Hospitality can arrange anything you want: private tours, spa, helicopters. Even contacted us prior to our arrival to find out likes/dislikes about food and had obtained certain dietary foodstuffs for us prior to our arrival. Spa was able to accomadate my pregnant wife with a special table for a massage. Been to many other hotels in Mexico, Hawaii, Costa Rica, and the Carribean but none have been better.

Reviews.Title: “No better place to completely unwind.”
Reviews.Author: Soccerbeds
Reviews.Content: This is my wife and my third time back to Maroma and it is as wonderful as the last 2 times. Like many of the reviewers, we continue to return for Maroma's unique experience. Unlike The Rosewood and Banyan Tree, Maromas starting Garden Rooms are only 315 sf versus the 3,000 sf monstrosities at Banyan Tree. I disagree with the earlier reviewer that it is a closet...but to some 315 sf is not large enough. The have larger rooms and huge villas for those that need more space. It surprises me that people don't do more research before they select a hotel. For us, we love the bed, the wonderful bathroom w gigantic mexican tiled tub and fantastic balcony w/ hammock to unwind. The service is as warm as you would expect. Freddie at the bar, gabriel, alvaro and marcos on the beach and cute Dalia who makes homemade tortillas in the morning. jessica and Mabel at the front desk are terrific as well. The food is wonderful. Juan Pablo (former chef at Las Ventanas in Cabo) does an amazing job along with Edgar who prepared for us the most romantic meal we have ever had under the stars on the Mirador. We highly recommend it, but be prepared for the steep tab. (bottle of champagne, bottle of wine and 5 course meal with your own server). The beach is stunning and the only negative thing I can say is that in Jan it can be windy due to the northerly winds so expect a little seaweed. The pool is in the garden and of the 3 is most recommended as it is heated around 85 degrees. For those unsure about Maroma this is the only place to stay for those that want to experience a hotel right on the beach without needing golfcarts to get around, amazingly warm service, great cuisine and just truly unwind for the week. We have done the bigger hotels like Four Seasons Costa Rica and Ritz Grand Cayman yet we continue to come back to Maroma for its romanctic and intimate setting. We look forward to returning again soon. David Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: UmbrellaGuy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the Maroma Resort and Spa in December after friends of ours had been recommending it for years. But, they warned us that it might be much different because it had been purchased by Orient Express,and that they had not been there in over 5 years. We have travelled extensively, are not afraid to spend money at the high end resorts, and have very rarely been let down. Maroma was definitely a let down. Our room was extremely small, no television, and it was in desperate need of an upgrade. Our room had a terrible musty smell. We were disappointed that this room was not yet designated a broom closet and not a room at a 5 star resort. While the staff was very nice, the service was extremely inconsistent. The food was just fine, and not nearly worth the price we paid, or representative of a 5 star resort. The gym had three treadmills and two of them were out of order. Some of the equipment was rusted and in need of replacement. The overall feeling we were left with was being underwhelmed and overcharged. Highlights were the amazing and well manicured beach, the ocean, a very good spa treatment, and the nice beach bar. After staying at the incredible Rosewood Miyakoba 20 minutes to the South a year earlier, we expected so much more from this 5 star resort and spa. We would not return and would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: ZumbaGirl982
Reviews.Content: I have never had a more magical vacation experience as I did at the Maroma. I can't say enough about this classy, welcoming and friendly resort. The entire staff was so efficient and accommodating, anticipating our every need. I will never forget Johnny, our beach waiter, who always wore that special smile, and whose service was so prompt and courteous. Thank you to everyone at the Maroma for making this memorable visit one that we will treasure always ( and definitely hope to come back to)!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: kclittle
Reviews.Content: My husband, Michael, and I just returned from our second visit to Maroma, both times to celebrate our anniversary. Our stay was as incredible the second time as it was the first. This is a fantastic place to celebrate a special occasion -- intimate and romantic. The setting of the hotel is absolutely breathtaking - pristine beach (constantly tended by the hotel staff) and beautiful grounds. The service is amongst the best we have ever experienced. Everyone on the hotel staff is friendly and warm. They anticipate your every need without being intrusive. Jessica (the day manager?), in particular, is fantastic. Like the rest of the staff, she always has a smile on her face and can always be seen greeting guests and checking to see if everyone is happy. A truly magical place with a truly magical staff.

Reviews.Title: “Maroma”
Reviews.Author: Yves I
Reviews.Content: We found Maroma to be a wonderful place where we plan on going again and again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Maroma”
Reviews.Author: ArnieF
Reviews.Content: My name is Arnie & I have been to Maroma 30 ++ times. I have nothing to add to the mostly great reviews here. For those of you who are researching Maroma for a first time stay: I think that my going 30 ++ times & agreeing with with other posters; you cannot pick a better place!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise also with kids”
Reviews.Author: Lulovy
Reviews.Content: We just paid our bill but I could not stop by the business centre of Maroma without writing immediately this review. This has been so far the best hotel/resort me and my family stayed so far in our life. The resort itself is in the middle of the nature with amazing gardens with many different plants and flowers. We stayed in the Villa Karolina (the hotel has many private villas/rooms) with private access from the beach. Beautiful room with huge walking shower and with more then 200 sky channels. Amazing terrace overlooking the ocean and the beach (the most glorious I have seen in my life). Service from maintenance to bar, restaurant just perfect and most of all that comes from the heart. The food is fantastic and it is really mexican and every night the hotel offer different experiences. Every single employee of maroma remember my name and the one of my kids. They have a brand new kids club with great children activities. Ideal for families as well for honeymooners since the space is so huge and despite the hotel was full we have not been disturbed by anyone and our kinds did not disturb anyone!! We loved the Maroma and we will definately come back next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding once again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Melody5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from yet another outstanding visit to the magical Maroma. We travel extensively and we have stayed at some of the finest properties in the world but Maroma remains our favorite place to visit year after year for our anniversary. There is simply no place anywhere that is as special as Maroma. It is classy yet comfortable, understated elegance. It is a very private, intimate, discreet boutique hotel that is the very definition of the word "romance". Every night they light thousands of candles all over the property. During the day, you lounge on your "beach bed" reading a book and listening to the waves gently rolling in while the wonderful Oneisomo (sp?) or Alvaro serve you food and drinks or adjust your umbrella if you prefer the shade. The beach is absolutely glorious with powder white sand and Caribbean blue water. The buildings with the Mayan architecture and beautiful landscaping and stonework are stunning. Apparently, the 65 room hotel was mostly full during our stay but it never felt full. It always feels private with plenty of room to breathe. It's truly like staying at someone's private hacienda. The food is superb. We highly recommend the romantic dinner for two in Mirador Tower in the moonlight. We also recommend the special Chef's Table dinner where you gather with others to sample amazing food while the charming Chef Juan Pablo sits with you and talks about the spices and traditions of cooking. We also loved the seafood grill outside with torchlight and the Taco Night dinner with the charming lighting and decorations. We so appreciated the marvelous waiters such as Luis and Moses. Gabriel was always so warm and welcoming to us as we entered the dining areas. We love the fact that there are no loud or overly scheduled activities at this resort. This is not a "party" atmosphere at all. It is truly a place for couples seeking privacy and romance. It's very nice that they offer special dinners as mentioned previously, but they still maintain an air of romance which is wonderful. Thanks to the thoughtful planning of our lovely friend Laura in Guest Relations, we were truly blessed to stay in a Sian Nah suite. I can't recommend that highly enough. We had glorious patios on two sides with a plunge pool and hammock. We had an exquisite view of the ocean from our living room and bedroom. The bedroom had a domed brick ceiling (stunning) with a beautiful canopy bed. The bathroom has two sinks and indoor and outdoor showers and plenty of closet and drawer space. We had our own workout room with a treadmill and our own spa palapa with a view of the ocean. Wendy did a terrific job of keeping our room clean and she was always so kind and friendly. We enjoyed a soothing massage in our spa palapa while listening to the sounds of waves crashing and birds chirping. We also enjoyed a spa and jacuzzi at the Kinan Spa. We love spas and enjoy them frequently in our travels but Kinan Spa is our favorite. It is absolutely gorgeous and the treatments are wonderful and done with a sense of the sacred, as is true of everything at Maroma. Everything is done with love and reverence and kindness. For us, it is a spiritual retreat every time we visit. We love everything about the place but what really puts it over the top is the lovely staff. They are some of the warmest, kindest people we've ever met. They go out of their way to get to know all of their guests and they treat you as if you are part of their own family. We love them all so much that we greet them with hugs and we are sad to say goodbye when we leave. From the charming men that greet you at the door upon arrival to the lovely Anna in the gift shop, to the amazing Laura and the wonderful GM Federicho, to the gardeners and the housekeepers and the wait staff - the focus on service with love and kindness is uniformly present. Thank you, to all of our dear friends at Maroma, for providing us with another magical visit!

Reviews.Title: “No other beach resort could be more beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: StephanieVal
Reviews.Content: This hotel blew us away! It is paradise. The attention to detail - amazing! Jessica took amazing care of our family - her service was above and beyond our expectations! The entire staff is friendly and attentive! Our new favorite beach resort in the world.

Reviews.Title: “amazing maroma”
Reviews.Author: jordan s
Reviews.Content: It is my Last nite here maroma. Iplanned on being for 11 days. By the time the 11 days were up, this place was like home to me.. I ended up staying for 20 days. wow maroma!!!!! This place is like no other just take a lokk at the pictures on the internet site and you will see what I mean. The entire staff have made me feel so incredibly welcomed. One nite I was having dinner alone and chef juan Pablo came and sat with me. His cooking is truly legendary I have travelled all over the world to amazing beaches but have been blown away by this beach and water. If yopu looking for the mos romantic and relaxing getaway of your life look no further call today and ask to speak with Jessica manuel edgar laura Elizabeth belen Carolina mable margarita all the staff at hospitality office tell them Jordan sent you as I do feel like my family after this stay.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite places on Earth”
Reviews.Author: Pecadora
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Maroma three times, and can honestly say that it is my favorite place to stay when traveling without my children. The beach is gorgeous, and the rooms are simply magnificent. My last two stays have been in Sian Na suites, and they are incredible. Private plunge pools, amazing bathrooms with indoor and outdoor showers, spectacular views, and a great espresso machine….what’s not to love? You will have an amazing time if you choose not to leave the property, but the staff can also arrange a number of excursions. We had a great time snorkeling in a cenote (local underground fresh water system with caves) with a wonderful guide. The food at Maroma is unbelievable. It’s modern Yucatecan, with bold flavors and fresh seafood. On our last trip, my boyfriend and I were enjoying lunch on the terrace. One of the chefs walked by with a tray of freshly caught fish. He noticed that we were looking his way, and came over to our table. He offered to make us a special dinner since we seemed so interested. A few hours later we were treated to a whole fish baked in salt, which was filleted at our table by the chef. It was accompanied by grilled vegetables, fresh bread, and three different salsas (beware the habanero!). After we finished, my boyfriend looked at me and flatly declared that it was the best thing that he had ever eaten. Although the resort is phenomenal, the people are what make Maroma truly special. The staff is incredibly warm and friendly. You will be greeted by name and treated like royalty. They will remember you on subsequent trips. You will feel like a rock star. When I think of the perfect luxury beach resort, I think of Maroma.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise. Beautiful setting. Never crowded.”
Reviews.Author: Oppen45
Reviews.Content: Wonderful resort. Lots of space. Beautifully landscaped. Wonderful selection of beach chairs and service on the beach. Food extraordinary but expensive. Ditto spa.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and private resort”
Reviews.Author: ckblue01
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in Maroma for five days over Thanksgiving. We stayed in an ocean front one bedroom suite. We really appreciated the comparatively small scale (in comparison to the mega resorts that dot the coast) and seclusion that Maroma offers. The room was very nice with a great view. The beach fronting the resort is beautiful, and the chaises set up by the staff were very comfortable and a great place to spend the day. The staff could not have been nicer. They remembered our names and really made us feel pampered. The spa was amazing. We had 4 or 5 of the treatments offered over the course of our stay and were very satisfied. The food at the resort was also very good. The Maroma margaritas which can be ordered on the beach or at the restaurant are highly recommended. Overall we were very pleased with Maroma, and will likely stay there again when we come back to the Yucatan. There are a few minor things that prevent me from giving Maroma 5 stars, but they are all really minor and did not affect our overall experience. The first thing is that the resort offers a free coffee/newspaper service in the am. This was a very nice gesture, but the delivery times were often give or take 20 minutes from what we requested when we first arrived. Rather than set up an expectation that the service will be delivered by a certain time, it would be better for management to just give a 30 minute window. Also the level of service in the restaurants decreased on Saturday and Sunday. It seems that the managers we saw on the weekdays did not appear to be on duty for the weekend. Service was still friendly, but it took much longer and there were several forgotten items. Other than these few minor issues, Maroma was near perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Maroma is heaven!”
Reviews.Author: josie c
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 5 days at Maroma. If you are on line reading and researching where to go, stop now and just book Maroma. Everything about it is exceptional. The location, right on a perfect white beach with crystal clear water, the food - amazing and I loved that you could eat from any menu, anywhere in the hotel - they even served me my poached eggs and bacon on the beach each day on my sun bed which was heavenly. The bedrooms are beautiful, try and have a sea view if you can. They bring coffee every morning so you can quietly wake up looking at the sea, drinking great coffee. If you like yoga , the teacher Gabriel is amazing and I had a spa treatment every day - every one was great and every therapist was lovely. I have nothing but good things to say, its worth every penny and I will be back as soon as I have some time! Thank you to all the staff, you are truly what makes the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Anita155019
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Maroma on the recommendation of two good friends of ours who couldn't say enough good things about the resort. We were not disappointed. The resort is the perfect getaway to 'decompress' - no TV, fantastic food, fantastic service, fantastic beach. And, all of the rooms are just steps from the beach, most with a spectacular view. Because the resort is so small, all of the staff are able to be incredibly attentive, and for the most part they knew our names after meeting them for the first time. I must say though that from the moment we arrived to the day we left, Jessica took incredibly good care of us. She is a gem. And Gabriel went out of his way to be exceptionally warm, welcoming and helpful. We were early to bed and early to rise every day - spent the days reading, sunning, and in the gym/spa. My only complaint would be the lack of sound-proofing that we did not notice until the last 2 days of our visit, when new guests arrived above us. I gather this is only an issue in the rooms that are far away from the original house as our friends stayed in the original house and never heard a sound from any of their neightbours. The upside to our room was that it was huge, had a spacious bathroom and had a big beautiful porch to enjoy the day/evening. If you are looking for lots of activity and night-time action, this is not the resort for you, but that didn't stop us from enjoying our cocktails in the room, at Freddy's bar, on the beach and at dinner! I understand why the same people keep coming back year after year... Anita

Reviews.Title: “Estancia perfecta (perfect stay)...”
Reviews.Author: SarahFlores
Reviews.Content: I was looking for the perfect beach place for my husband and I to spend a few days, to relax and enjoy something different. I chose Maroma simply because of the beach. I read in different places it's been voted the best beach of the world several times and no wonder why. We rented a car, so we drove from the airport to the resort, which was easy to find, and fun to get to, since you get to drive through the jungle and see some 'tejones' and other little animals. I was tempted to go for Secrets Maroma next door, but I loved the idea that Maroma is a small hotel which makes it totally relaxing, personal and a very special experience. It is pricy, but I think every cent is worth. There are so many details that make the stay wonderful, starting with the delicious welcome margaritas, or the coffee and bread brought to the room every morning. We stayed for 4 nights, and we chose ocean view room, which is totally worth the price difference since there's nothing better than going to sleep with the sound of the sea and the cool air - we never had to turn on our AC, ever. The rooms are small but cozy, the beds are wonderful, there is no TV which I loved, there is internet so you can check on places to eat outside or where to visit (however you don't even want to leave the place!), the bathrooms are beautiful and have organic body lotion, soaps, shampoo, etc., and at night they light up essential oils of your choice so the room smells wonderful and it makes you have the best night sleep. Breakfast is very good, since they have typical mexican dishes and components put together in a very unique way; I loved the egg chile relleno, and well as the cheese crepe with chilorio, the chilaquiles con pollo, and my husband the enfrijoladas. The juices are wonderful combinations of exotic fruits, and the chocolate drink spiced up with lemon grass was the best, as well as the yogurt, the fruit and the hand made tortillas (Gracias Tía Delia for the morning lessons! I just made my first tortillas back home and will send you a picture of them!). Breakfast is very satisfying so I would feel hungry until the evening, and even though we know the food is excellent at Maroma, we drove to Playa del Carmen (~10 min drive) and explored a few of the great restaurants in town too. The marina services at Maroma are excellent, they have just the professionals! We tried the scuba diving for the first time and it was amazing. We learned the basics in about an hour at the pool, and then we were taken into the ocean to a part of the reef called the aquarium, to dive for the first time. I think I have a new hobby now, so thanks to the marina staff for making it a great first time experience! We enjoyed the beach a lot just sitting on the beach beds and jumping into the water, so delicious I wonder why there was not so many people in the water since it is so relaxing... The beers, and the cocktails were great and the service is perfect, you don't get bothered at all and you're never missing a drink or anything. I could write pages about the details that made our short stay so enjoyable, but I guess you have to figure out for yourself. We are Mexican, and I was very pleased with the experience at Maroma, even though the place is visited mostly by foreigners we were treated with the same standards, and I am very proud of how professional and excellent the team at Maroma is. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “memorable vacatiion”
Reviews.Author: goosekellner
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel, through the american express fine hotels and resorts program and contacted the hotel manager prior to our stay.i was concerned about the fact that my wife has a physical disability and he reassured me that this would not be a problem and, in fact,it wasn't. our stay was truly first class in every way starting with our being picked up at the airport. we were met at the hotel by the manager with a welcoming cocktail.i found the staff to be very attentive and courteous and they generally knew our names.throughout the stay my wife was assisted by staff in walking to the restaurant.our room was upgraded to a one bedroom ocean suite and we could see the sun rise from our bed. when we first saw our room, the bed was decorated with flower petals.we really felt special.this is not an inexpensive vacation but there were alot of amenities including free wi fi,bottled water,snorkeling trip(1 per person).we each had a free massage which we had in a grass hut adjacent to our room. it was so good that we paid for a 2nd one on another night. the beach was pure white and the sand was powder soft. the beach was cleaned immaculately every morning and you didn't feel any shells or rocks aas you walked ito the water.the food was delicious. i particularly like the breakfasts with specially prepared juices and regional mexican dishes.several times we had a specially prepared frsh whole fish for dinner. the spa is truly world class but we didn't visit it more than once since it was so relaxing to just sit on the beach in these incredible beach sofas. my wife said that this was the best resort that we have ever experienced and that includes many first class hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: gr8fulamy420
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed at the Maroma Resort from November 16th - November 21st, 2011. It was an amazing experience. The resort is spectacular! The staff is nothing less than attentive and kind! The service is impeccable and no request will be denied. For me, everything was perfect! My best friend got married here, during our trip and it was more incredible than I could have imagined. The ambiance, the amenities, the FOOD and drinks, everything was perfect! No one had any complaints. I stayed in an ocean view, bottom floor room #55. I woke up to a perfect ocean view each morning. The staff will bring you coffee or tea at your preferred time each morning. The little birds are thieves! They steal your sugar packets and will try to poke through your cream container if you don't get to it before they do! I found it quite amusing and enjoyed waking up to them each morning. I walked around the beautiful, lush, garden filled resort and saw many different room options. Many rooms appeared to be much larger and more spectacular than mine, with private pools and such. Others appeared to be well off the beaten path, which left me feeling overly pleased with my room position. Although, since staying there, I can stay that any room would have been just fine with me. I was never in mine except for early mornings, afternoons to shower and back home at night to sleep. There is A/C in every room. They are very comfortable. The beds are so....comfortable and I loved the netting. I could easily hear the ocean from my room. The staff lights candles and turns down your bed each night. Anything you need, comes right to you. Everything that I ate at the restaurant was AMAZING! Breakfast, lunch and dinner. The food was 4-star! I did not have one single thing that I even kinda didn't like. Chef Juan Pablo is so talented and eager to meet any requests. He is personable and very easy on the eyes. Glady's was my sweet, smiley housekeeper and Johnny was my favorite server on the beach. All of the staff deserve a compliment. They were all very hospitable. I could go on and on about how much I enjoyed my trip and how I wish I was still there and how I cannot wait to return! If you are looking for a luxurious, peaceful, rejuvenating experience then do not look past the Maroma Resort & Spa. You will not be disappointed. Bring your wallet, but it will be so... worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite”
Reviews.Author: Gbowie
Reviews.Content: We had shuttle service pick us up, they were standing out front of the airport with our name on the card waiting for us. As soon as as we arrived to the resort, the bellhop opened the car door and greeted us by our name. They were expecting us!!! As soon as we walked in the door, the concierge greeted us with drinks. Everyone remembered our name from the first introduction, and politely used throughout our stay. the service is unlike anything I've ever experienced! Maroma Resort only has 60 rooms, so it feels intimate, and private. The food is delicious and the atmosphere was breathtaking. We had a remarkable time.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: JoeP849
Reviews.Content: I've gone twice now and plan to return as long as possible - the service and staff are excellent, professional, warm , friendly and super relaxed. At the restaurant, the breakfasts actually are my favorite. They serve traditional Mexican dishes all with a modern twist, with the best ingredients. Fresh tortillas and juices, and delicious lemongrass coffee every morning, including dishes such as eggs benedicto with fresh tomatoes. For the dinners, by candlelight, on the beach, I'd usually go for the catch of the day, again always prepared in an authentic Mexican manner, and beyond. The pools, the grounds, and the spa are fantastic. Everything is taken care of for you, so you don't have to worry!

Reviews.Title: “Very good but falls short of great”
Reviews.Author: ChinaKat
Reviews.Content: If you want an uber romantic location on one of the nicest streches of beach in the world then you should consider the Maroma. The staff are very well trained to be corteous and cater to your every need. They seem to be very happy working here and as a result their service is as good as it gets. the candlelight walk back to your room from dinner will stay etched in your mind forever. The hotel is also uber expensive and plan on paying a hefty bill when you check out. I should mention that we felt uncomfortable at times due to the fact that they wanted to be sure that our bill was "caught up" each day. I wasn't thrilled being bothered while sunning in my cozy lounge chair to sign a credit card reciept. They should try to be more discreet.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Paradise”
Reviews.Author: VLailah
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our honeymoon at the Maroma Resort and Spa. We cannot say enough about this place. It was amazing! Everything from the cocktails at the entrance to the quality of service from their kind staff, this hotel is just remarkable. They will do everything in their power to make sure your stay is wonderful. One morning during breakfast, my husband asked if they had melon juice, and while they regretfully explained that unfortunately they don't, they came back minutes later with fresh melon juice that they just squeezed! The food was incredible, breakfast and dinner is served practically on the beach and the waiters (Moises, Manuel and all!) were so helpful.The hotel is small, cozy and very authentic in its Mayan traditions, unlike those large resorts. By the second day, the staff remembered our names and greeted us with such warmth. The service is first-rate and very personal, the rooms are comfortable and amazing. Each evening, the staff prepares your room for a good night's sleep with a special note, robes, Mayan desserts, aromatherapy candles, etc. We had an ocean-view room with our own hammock and it was paradise. The hotel is situated in a jungle, so it is very quiet and a perfect place to get away from city life. They light The beach is absolutely stunning, there are king-size beds on the beach and the staff is always close giving out complimentary fruits and desserts. There are always fresh clean towels in a basket near the beach beds, and the staff take special care to shake off any sand. The water sports staff were so helpful and kind, we received a complimentary snorkeling session upon arrival to the hotel. I was really upset to leave! We'll be coming back in the future to celebrate an anniversary! This is a truly relaxing, warm and beautiful place to stay. Please don't hesitate to book. You won't be sorry. It is worth every penny. Thanks to all the Maroma staff for a truly wonderful and heart-warming honeymoon. See you soon! Best regards, Varda and Raphael.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic, Blissful Paradise”
Reviews.Author: KMichas
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just spent a long weekend at Maroma, and truly didn't want to leave. Absolutely stunning property just a short drive from Cancun airport. The size of the resort is what makes it so special: with a fraction of the number of rooms as most of the surrounding resorts, the service is truly personal and first-rate (after our first day, everyone referred to us both by name). Laura in guest relations, Luis in the dining room, and Freddy the bartender all went far out of the way to ensure we had a trip to remember. The room was beautiful, well-appointed, and kept immaculately clean. The beach is stunning, and it was the little touches that went a long way (they literally rake the beach free of seaweed in the morning(!!!), and bring you complimentary treats throughout the day, from cold towels to frozen grapes to ice cream). We had dinner one evening up in the mirador...a splurge, to be sure, but very romantic and well worth it (our waiter, Fernando, treated us like royalty with a five-course dinner beneath the stars). Our only trip outside the property was dinner at Saffron at the Banyan Tree in nearby Mayakoba...the Banyan Tree is quite possibly the most beautifully designed hotel in the world, as its many reviews can attest. It's certainly worth a trip, just to see the property, but jaw-dropping as it may be, we were happy to head back to our more intimate, more authentic room at Maroma. All in all, we loved every minute, and will undoubtedly be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: PattiP1957
Reviews.Content: This was truly one of the most pleasnat experiences we have ever had! My husband and I were celebrating our 25th anniversary. Everything was perfect. Everybody that works with this hotel makes you feel like you are the most important person in the world. And I mean EVERYONE that works there! The room was samll but I loved it! It had everything in it you could possibly need. I was quaint and intimate with a terrace to sit on and look at the ocean. It had the most beautiful view of the beach. The location was perfect, right on the beach. It is very quiet and the only people we would see were the people staying in the hotel or the one next door. No children. I love children and mine was at home, it was a good break from that. I could go on and on about this resort, pure perfection and beauty.

Reviews.Title: “Best Things Do Come In Small Packages”
Reviews.Author: lgaynor
Reviews.Content: There is only one thing that spoils a luxurious getaway more than rain: Kids. We opted out of the Four Seasons and Ritz destinations years ago as they cater to kids. Not Maroma. In fact, no kids under 16 allowed. No kids pool, no kids camp, no kids running on the beach in diapers. Maroma is an adult-only paradise that caters to couples who don't want to be bothered, don't want to do a whole lot except eat, drink and relax and who want an experience to remember. The property is spread out along the one of the best beaches in the world. Maroma beach is pure white sand and the water azul in color. Other resorts up and down the coast have plenty of seaweed and rocks, not Maroma. The beach is perfect for walking, running and on special nights, having dinner. They bring out the torches, candles, set up the table and deliver an incredible experience. We stay in the Sina Nah suite right on the ocean (second level). The balcony opens up to the ocean and features a day bed and two chairs for being memorized. Inside you have more space than needed with a separate living area, bedroom, master bathroom suite that features his and her sinks, indoor/outdoor shower, soaking tub and if that isn't enough, the room next door features a treadmill, climber, some weights and if you can imagine, if you leave that room and walk up a flight of stairs, you come to the massage room. That's right, his and her massage beds in the open air. Food is always a critical component of a luxury experience. Maroma excels in most areas. Breakfast is overlooking the ocean. The tortilla lady (same lady since Maroma was founded) makes homemade corn tortillas and passes them around. Waiters serve fresh fruit, bakery basket and you can order anything off the menu. All good. Lunch is at the beach in all its splendor. They make several ceviches each day and a great assortment of lunch specialties. At 3PM, the "ice cream man" strolls the beach serving up homemade cones and the flavor of the day. Amazing. Dinner features two restaurants in the same building and I think the same kitchen. So while the menus are different, the food is similar. Good but not great. They offer a Friday night beach barbecue that is excellent. At night, they light thousands of candles throughout the property for a great touch. There is also live music during happy hour on most nights. The spa is OK. Don't look for a traditional changing room with all the amenities. They do have a small locker room but certainly not what you would expect. The yoga studio on the top floor is fabulous however. The gym is small and the selection of free weights very small as well. With the spa pretty much open air, there are nice scenic areas and relaxation rooms along with fresh fruits and nuts. The shining star however is the service. By the second day, they call you by your first name and remember everything you ordered and like. The staff is super friendly and will do anything for you. Many have been there since the resort opened. Going into town is a 45 minute ordeal. This is one place you really don't want or need to leave. Maroma is a top 10 resort catering to special people. We love it.

Reviews.Title: “BEST BEACH IN THE WORLD”
Reviews.Author: LuvMekiko
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome. The staff is real hard working people. We had a butler for our room. I felt like a princess.. And the beach is the best in Mexico, even when I walked along the shore and visited other hotels I realized this was the best because there are no rocks or any algae leafs infront of our private beach area. The only thing is .. it can be boring... Yes :) if you are looking for other activities like dancing and a club, its not for you... this is a place to relax and to be in nature.... One more thing- if you have the funds for this trip... Get the suite that has a gym.. and make sure the tredmill works. BREAKFAST is a must, dont skip it... there is a local lady that hand makes tortilla right at the restaurant. She is soo sweet :)
