Reviews.Title: “Amazingly Intimate, Welcoming, Romantic Resort”
Reviews.Author: Michelle D
Reviews.Content: What a perfect, intimate, gorgeous, welcoming, beautiful stay at a special place with a perfect powder sand beach. Friendly, welcoming staff, delicious food, great snorkeling, and wonderfully romantic rooms. Do bring your mosquito spray and leave your perfume at home. I did stay at Rosewood and Banyan Tree as well and Maroma is far more intimate and unique. The beach is perfect, soft, and rock free.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, Romantic,Relaxing place”
Reviews.Author: Stela G
Reviews.Content: We already have decide that twice a year we wiil be there..... We really feel relaxing.... The team is so friendly and make this place perfect. Food is exquisite... Excelent for couples

Reviews.Title: “Todo Bueno!!”
Reviews.Author: debkhan32
Reviews.Content: Recently spent a week at the luxurious Maroma Resort & Spa....and to date it was one of the best beach resorts we've been too. The resort is about 30mins from Cancun airport. Upon arrival we were greeted by a warm friendly staff & a refreshing Maroma margarita! We were given a tour of the surroundings then shown to our gorgeous suite, we stayed in the Karolina Villa, which is steps from the talcum powder white sand beach!! The villa was extremely clean at all times. The beach is one of the best we've experienced...comparable to south pacific beaches. The food is gourmet and top-notch. We enjoyed the Cantina tasting room for traditional mexican fare, where the exec chef Juan Pablo joined us. I would recommend doing this! Also try the sushi, the beef burger and the tamarind margarita located at the beach dining area! We also enjoyed dinner at the chef's table, where Juan ate & drank with us. It was a very intimate setting and you really experience the flavors of Mexican food! I'm not referring to tequila & taco's either! The prices coincide with the meal, you are def getting what you pay for. The couples massage was very relaxing and rejuvenating I would also recommend this. Overall, the highlights were the personable staff, they remembered your names and details of what you like & dislike, for instance my hubby enjoyed a specific fruit for breakfast, the waiter made sure he had it each morning...The beach side service is great also...always someone there to adjust your umbrella or bring you a fresh coconut! We ran into other couples staying onsite and 2 of them were visiting for the 2nd time! This place is on my return list!!

Reviews.Title: “Magical Place”
Reviews.Author: travel_ann_NY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved Maroma; it's really special. Loved the candlelit walks at night around the property, the amazing margaritas on the beach each day, the beach was beautiful, the food was amazing....I could just go on and on. Expensive dinners, but well worth it. We didn't need to leave the resort for anything. Beach bbq and taco nights were fun evening meals which were unforgettable. Service was amazing, appropriately attentive and not overwhelming. Just a gorgeous place, we will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: TimWandMelG
Reviews.Content: The location, the beach, the view, the resuarants, the bar staff, the reception staff, the rooms, the gardens, the pools, the handmade hospitality. Everything from the complementary arrival drinks to the departure complimentary shuttle back to the airport was perfect. It's just a shame it's so expensive or we would happily just live there!

Reviews.Title: “Only hotel to stay in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: nichollola
Reviews.Content: LOVELY hotel - great beach, service and restaurant. Food and wine list excellent (quite expensive). Traditional design which was nice - in bed by 9pm every evening as we were so relaxed! Very quiet in the evenings, but that suited us. Spa was excellent - the best I have ever been to but again quite expensive. As the hotel was flawless we didnt mind the expense and its what is to be expected in that type of hotel. There was one wedding whilst we were there and it was beautiful, was disappointed to not be a guest!.

Reviews.Title: “all in all close to excellent”
Reviews.Author: BM2535
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a spectacularly successful stay at Maroma. They clearly have a very professional, dedicated and cohesive team. From everyone we met (whether acting General Manager, Food and Beverage Manager, Sommelier, Executive Chef, restaurant service staff, hospitality team and room service personnel) no matter what their day was like they appeared dedicated to ensuring our day was exactly what we wanted. This was a consistent approach and very impressive for that. We enjoyed a really nice environment, good wines and delicious food. This was our first visit to Mexico and it was a pleasure to be introduced to so many of the nice things which the Country has to offer in beautiful surroundings by people who seemed genuinely interested and enthusiastic in what they were doing.

Reviews.Title: “Orient-Express has the best properties in the world”
Reviews.Author: thecruiseladySeattle
Reviews.Content: In the incredibly diverse world of Orient-Express a couple of things always hold true. The resorts/trains/camps/you name it are breathtakingly beautiful and the staff is the most gracious, warm and hospitable you will ever encounter. Never stuffy, not pretentious in the least, always luxurious but relaxed..............that's O-E. Maroma is the best in casual elegance. You can spend the whole day in a swim suit and a cover up, and dress in a very relaxed fashion for dinner and that's the way a beach resort should be. I was lucky enough to have a Sian Nah suite but all accomodations here are gorgeous. The ocean breeze is a constant, the summer temps and humidity were much more comfortable than I thought possible; there are great summer prices so don't delay! And yes, they allow children in the summer - They were all beautifully behaved and the beach is so immense that you're never that close to anyone. But I do think if there's a lot of yelling going on from next door (as indicated in the prior review) the resort would probably be happy to move you if at all possible. I do believe O-E will do anything they possibly can to make you happy; they are just the best. I highly recommend the cooking class and tequilla tastings so check to see when those are available. The spa is heaven. The food is really traditional Mexican with some wonderful touches and so delicious; loved breakfast as everyone has reported. I did tip the tortilla lady on my last morning - I wondered if anyone did; she so deserved it as she is a treasure and her tortillas are the best I've ever had. Do get the transportation to/from the airport to help with the relaxation mode and, when you leave, pay in advance for the VIP lounge at the airport so you can get away from the duty free crowds. Keep that Maroma feeling going as long as you can. It is truly paradise and I will be longing to go back to my Mexican home.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place...too many screaming kids.”
Reviews.Author: joekellyjk47
Reviews.Content: We had a really good time here and the place is FANTASTIC. But... We wanted to be in the middle of nowhere... secluded, private and peaceful. We almost got that, but the FEW other people who were there...and housed right next to us or on top of us, seemed to be families with screaming kids. Maroma seems like an awful place to take kids, but they were there. We're in our thirties. And all the other people staying there seemed to be much older...or families with kids. Screaming kids. So we didn't seem to quite fit in (not that we minded, we were having a great time by ourselves and with all the Maroma's many, many activities). Let me say.... That was the ONLY knock on this place. And maybe we just got some bad luck (or maybe the hotel should have kept the screaming kids away from the young couple trying to relax). Everything else about the Maroma, the service, the food, the atmosphere was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Ptmm
Reviews.Content: Have been to Maroma three times and every time I am so sad to leave. The staff is wonderful and cares for your every need. Beach is beautiful. Just watch out for the driveway in!

Reviews.Title: “Leaving Maroma....”
Reviews.Author: u89taper
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently decided to splurge and treat ourselves to a stay at Maroma Resort and Spa. Wow! Having both worked in hospitality, we were both incredibly excited and expectations were very high, however we didn't realize what we were in for until we were greeted at Cancun Airport by Maroma transportation. The ride to the resort was short (about 25 minutes), but we were already feeling a bit of heaven from complimentary chilled, lemongrass scented towels and relaxing Mexican music playing over the system. The resort is tucked away off the main highway down a long winding dirt road through lush jungle. Once through the gates, we entered into a beautiful little courtyard surrounded by vegetation and highlighted by a soothing fountain. No fewer than 4 members of the resort staff were on hand to greet us by name and we were handed signature margaritas before we could pass through the foyer. As there wasn't an actual front desk, a member of the hospitality team offered to take us on a tour of the property before taking us to our room. We had reserved a Garden Room and were blown away by the accommodations. The room had a nice sized living area, beautiful bedroom with canopy bed, an enormous bathroom and a porch with what must have been a double bed on it (most of the other porches had hammocks). The bed was decorated with a beautiful floral arrangement and the bathroom was filled with homemade soaps. Our bedroom did not have a TV (who needs one when you have a view of the gulf), but did have a CD/iPod player (with a mix CD that we must have listened to 20 times) and wireless internet. After a quick nap we headed down to Freddy's Tequila and Ceviche Bar which is literally located on the beach. Freddy's features fresh ceviche and what must be at least 100 tequilas and mezcals. We sipped on a variety of signature margaritas, tried some local beer and nibbled on their octopus/shrimp ceviche and guacamole. We both love to eat but we never expected the food to be as good as it was. All of the ingredients were fresh, local and perfectly prepared. After spending some time with Freddy, Sommelier Alexandre and F&B Director Alexis personally introduced themselves to us and invited us to partake in their first ever Cantina dinner hosted by Executive Chef Juan Pablo. We are soooo happy that we took them up on their offer! The Cantina dinner is basically a high-end homage to the Mexican cantina tradition. We sat at a large, elevated table with 5 other hotel guests and got fat and happy on a variety of mezcal and no fewer than 11 different plates of food (my girlfriend loved the noodles with sour cream, I loved the racks of roasted suckling lamb!). Wow! Definitely check this out if you like to eat, drink and have a good time! After the Cantina dinner we strolled the property and couldn't help feeling like we were being pampered to the fullest extent when we found that all of the walkways had been lined with glowing candles (I can't imagine how long it takes to place, light, then remove those candles everyday). Again, having worked in the hospitality industry, I was blown away when, during a 1:30am swim, we were brought fresh towels within 5 minutes of entering their main pool. Breakfast is complimentary every morning (whether in-room or in the dining room) as is in-room coffee service. We opted for in-room lemongrass and cardamom scented hot chocolate every morning with fresh baked pastries and a trio of homemade jams. Again, wow! While every bit of food we ate at Maroma was amazing, we both agreed that breakfast was our favorite. Every morning there were ladies in the restaurant entry way making fresh, handmade tortilla shells. Breakfast offers a variety of fresh squeezed fruit juices to choose from, delicious coffee and, again, homemade pastries and jams. Servers offer table-side fresh fruit service (yeah, old school French fork and spoon service if you're paying attention) and, like clockwork, when your entree arrives, the ladies offer freshly warmed tortilla shells. My girlfriend stayed with the yogurt with homemade granola every morning, I say do not miss the pulled chicken over tortilla chips with a red sauce, sour cream and cotija cheese! Oh, and try the tortilla shells with a light drizzle of the local honey... mmmmm! Again, every bit of food we ate was amazing, however the other treat you may want to consider is their Mirador dinner. While very pricey, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The Mirador dinner is a private tasting menu at the highest point on the property (4 stories up). It offers 360° views of the property with the Gulf of Mexico on one side and the sun setting over the jungle on the other. There was a beautiful breeze blowing throughout and sporadic light drizzle added to the experience. We took advantage of the complimentary snorkeling trip and were treated to an array of sea life including eels and sea turtles. Unfortunately, we didn't get to do the whale shark snorkeling trip Maroma offers which really hurt considering reports that it was the season and there were hundreds of whale sharks in the area. Kinan Spa. Couples, Anti-Stress Massage. Wow! We did the 50 minute treatment. I can't imagine what the 80 minute massage would have been like. Our therapists started with a foot massage then moved to a full body massage. I have never experienced anything like this. I didn't mention any of my problem areas to my therapist but she certainly found them and 6 days later I still feel amazing. After the massage, there was therapeutic whirlpool already bubbling, waiting for us to hop in. On the side, chilled bottle water and fresh fruit. The whole Kinan Spa experience was amazing. Just standing in the entryway and looking into the facility was relaxing. My girlfriend took advantage of one of their Yoga classes and had nothing but great things to say. We spent our last day at Maroma sitting on the beautiful white sand beach sipping on margaritas and eating ceviche. For 2 people who don't love "sunning", we loved relaxing on Maroma's big blue beach beds under thatched roof umbrellas. It was like sitting on our own private beach. Everything about Maroma Resort was absolutely amazing. We were called by our names for the duration of our stay and treated like we were the only guests on the property. The staff, from house keeping to management, was wonderful and service rivaled that of good old Charleston, SC hospitality. Leaving Maroma was the only low point of the trip and we look forward to making a return visit in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best.....”
Reviews.Author: tellat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Maroma over spring break and can't wait to return! I am a mature older traveler who often travels solo, and have noticed that sometimes this results in less than stellar service. Not so here.....The staff here made me feel like a queen. No request seemed too great and everyone seemed to sincerely be interested in making my stay a great one. The beach and spa here are lovely and the food is very good (although expensive). Spent one day at Excaret Nature Park and found it very enjoyable as well. However, it's definitely the freindliness and attention to detail of the staff that makes the resort so outstanding. I recommend you go and stay for as long as you can!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Got Better!”
Reviews.Author: TedHeffernan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our 2nd visit to Maroma. The first time was for our 5-year anniversary, and it was a complete surprise for her. This was our 10th anniversary, and I wanted to surprise her again. However, after our time at Maroma, I knew it would be difficult to top, so we just went back! The resort is amazing, as it was 5 years ago. Beautiful grounds, beautiful local craftsmanship, and beautiful rooms. The spa is world class, and you would be crazy not to take advantage at least once during a stay. We sprung for an Ocean View room this time, and it is worth it! Having the patio overlooking the beach is a great way to relax. As always, the local staff is EXTREMELY friendly. From the welcome drinks, to the restaurant staff, everyone is authentically friendly. We especially loved the woman who made fresh tortillas at breakfast every morning, and the beach staff that brought around special treats every afternoon. You haven't lived until you are offered mango sorbet, or a hand mixed margarita while laying at the beach! We would love to single out Freddie, who runs the beachside bar and grill. Many a drink was shared with friends before and after dinner at Freddie's! He even showed my wife how to make her favorite - the Maroma Margarita! Freddie, we made sure to get 100% agave tequila and the Xtabentun before leaving to make our own at home!!! The beach is what brought us to Maroma, and the beach will bring us back again. I originally picked this beach because it was rated as among the best in the Caribbean. It is no lie. We would lie on a giant beach bed all day long, while the staff brought lunch and drinks, and constantly adjusted the umbrella to keep the sun off. The water is a beautiful blue, and the nearby reef provides great snorkeling. You are far away from the big Cancun hotels, and there is only one hotel in walking distance. As a result, the beach is very private. Finally, the biggest change since our last visit was the addition of Juan Pablo Loza, the resort's new head chef. The food is utterly fantastic. We ate at both the regular restaurant and the fancier el Sol. Both menus have great choices, and the food has taken a huge step up since last visit. If you go, try to do the Chef's Tasting Dinner. We had this on a Saturday, and dined with Juan Pablo and other couples. We had the best time trying his courses, all paired with Mexican wines. Juan Pablo literally sat with us for the entire dinner and we really got to know him and his inspirations. We were also shocked at the variety of good Mexican wines - who knew! we also enjoyed the barbecue on Friday. Our biggest regret was not being able to try the new Cantina meal. This is Juan Pablo's newest addition, and is only done on Tuesdays. If have a feeling this will be expanded to other days if it is as good as it sounded!!! Drawbacks are few. The mattresses are not quite up to the standard of an American 5-star resort. You will see some bugs around the hotel - it's a jungle in Mexico! You will also spend some money! While many discounts can be had (air-hotel packages, online hotel discounts, extra nights free), know that you will be paying probably as much for your food, drinks and services as you did for your air/hotel price. Hey, all-inclusives don't give you the level of luxury and service that Maroma does. Live a little!!! I cannot wait for our next trip. I don't think we will be able to wait another 5 years to return. We love this place!!! Ted and Ali Heffernan

Reviews.Title: “Maroma-worth all the accolades received”
Reviews.Author: popartpooch
Reviews.Content: Maroma is the ultimate getaway on the Mexican Riviera. Every morning, we had huge mexican breakfasts on the patio. It began with house made pastries, jams and tortillas made by a lovely senora right in front of us. I loved all the huevos rancheros, chilaquiles, etc. They were served with an incredible avocado, lime and cilantro creamy salsa. I also recommend the pancakes with Yucatan honey, coconut cream and Kahlua butter today. Yum! I will miss all the fresh juices and spicy mexican hot chocolate too. They even served Veuve Clicquot mimosas one morning. At the beach, there was one guy whose only job was to make sure your umbrella was adjusted to cover your beach chair as the sun moved. Another guy was in charge of bringing you all the food and drinks you wanted from the restaurant. I recommend the chicken quesadillas and the tacos pastor for lunch on the beach. A third guy would come by every hour or so with a shot of cold gazpacho, an apple, an ice cream cone, or a cold towel. The water was the color of a coke bottle and felt like bath water. We snorkeled one day and saw incredibly colored fish, coral and a sea turtle! In the late afternoon, they put out a table full of Mexican candies and cigars .You would return to your room and find candles lit in every room and homemade cookies. Evening dinners were on an outdoor patio a stone's throw from the beach. The beautiful beach setting with the candles and the ocean breeze was heavenly. I would skip the dinner on the beach pkg they offer and just sit on the patio. It's side by side and you will save yourself about $300. Also, we were in the highest suite # 23. While it is the best location and apparently Prince Charles and Robert Plant have stayed in this suite, it seemed to be the meeting spot for all the grackles. We were awakened to loud squawking every morning starting at 5am. It was terrible. I would opt for something besides #23. The spa was good but it is in the jungle alongside the resort. I was bitten by mosquitoes both as I walked to and from the resort and while the massage took place both times. So despite the few negatives I mentioned, I would definitely stay here again. It is lovely, intimate and indulgent.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: vitaliiKiev
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels in the world. People, a spa, the ocean, the hotel is everything - well, I love Maroma. Necessarily go!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: voyagerWLA
Reviews.Content: One of the best vacations ever. Great service, perfect beach, beautiful rooms. Friday beach barbeque was wonderful and a lot of fun. My husband loved the tequila tasting and we both enjoyed the chocolate dinner. I miss the tortilla lady. My husband, a television addict did not miss the in-room television and never made the trek to watch television in the two television rooms on the property. Great sleep every night. Making reservation to return in April. Bottom line-Maroma does everything right.

Reviews.Title: “Maroma improved with time!”
Reviews.Author: Christopher R
Reviews.Content: I have been to Cancun several times staying at the Hyatt Regency (great), and Ritz Carlton (superior).As my wife and I had been in the Turks and Caicos we were flying from Provinciales to Miami and connecting through to Cancun before heading to Cuba.So I chose Maroma for a two night stop as it was 30 minutes from the airport (one of the closest going south) and was on a beach largely to itself.We arrived after 9pm and were put in a rather dim and dark restaurant completely on our own to eat a rather disappointing meal.We felt we were keeping the staff of three from going home.After dinner we were shown to our room which in the dark looked very kitch,rather small and poky.I wasn't particually happy at this point as I was expecting better.Surely a week at AMANYARA in Turks and Caicos led me to very high expectations.The next mooring we brushed away the blinds and had a reasonably good view to the beach through the gardens and main restaurant/bar area.We did appreciate the outlook and activity,the beach front restaurants were good and the beach delightful for swimming and walking.Maroma is a four stay hotel and I was expecting more.Its interior's are dated and it needs a refirb in lots of ways.The Mexican staff were terrific and trid very hard to make sure we enjoyed ourselves.We had a massage which was good but not spectacular.I would go back again but would need a good deal to make it attractive and don't go with expectations of a super five star property because it isn't! WiFi was included.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort, but skip the meals”
Reviews.Author: HarryMarlin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed 4 days of Maroma in May in a Jr. Suite. It is a beautiful beach, and the service is outstanding. Here are a few pros/cons we saw: Pros: - There is an amazing almost 1 to 1 employee to customer ratio. There seems to almost always be a person around to help you or to pamper you. - The beach is soft and the water is beautiful - We *loved* the queen sized beds on the beach, and each one had a movable umbrella. There were no problems finding one when we wanted one - The breakfast (complimentary, for us) was very nice, and had a plethora of food choices - The rooms were large and well air-conditioned. There appeared to be a wireless access point in every room. - Our room had a bookcase filled with many best sellers and interesting books. It was definitely not just for display. If I forgot a book, I had a number of books I could choose from to read. - Unlike many hotels, this one is centered around the beach, not the pool(s). It made for an interesting flow, and really highlighted the beautiful view over the ocean. - The beach is long, and we both enjoyed walking miles down it near sunset. Cons: - Despite the 1 to 1 ratio, it was at times difficult to get the attention of someone at the restaurants - Food and drink is *extremely* expensive at the hotel. That being said, neither my wife nor I were very impressed by the food. My $42 steak was not as good as one I could have gotten for 1/2 that in Virginia. $11 for a bottle of water seemed a bit high, and our almost $200 dinner (together) at one of the event nights was disappointing to say the least. Unfortunately, you feel like you are almost trapped at the resort since it isn't anywhere near anything else (it's almost worth it to take a cab) - While we were there seaweed was continuously in the ocean and on the beach. Next to other resorts, Maroma did a *fantastic* job at cleaning it off of the beach and out of the ocean (a completely manual process) - the other resorts looked *awful*. That being said, there were many times in which going into the nice, warm, ocean did not seem appetizing because it felt like you were wading into a jungle. - All of the rooms may be ocean view, but that doesn't mean they all have a good view. Our first one was much farther away than we cared for. That being said, they quickly fixed it for us, and gave us a room where we could hear the ocean. This could almost be put in the "pro" category. If you want to be pampered at an excellent hotel, go to Maroma - but eat elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly beautiful and tranquil”
Reviews.Author: histtrav
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take a vacation on the Riviera Maya to see a part of Mexico that was new to us. After doing some research, we decided to visit Maroma and it was a wonderful trip. We opted to have the hotel pick us up from the airport which is pricey but useful if the area is unfamiliar--we took a taxi back to the airport. Maroma is off of the highway south of Cancun down a long, tropical dirt road. We were greeted at the door by Carla who handed us margaritas and showed us the property. The resort is very quiet which we loved but if you are looking for action, this is not the place to go. The room we stayed in was on the far side of the hotel which felt even quieter than the main area. There was a pool directly in front of the room and the beach was a few steps away. Let me say that I've been to beaches all over the world and this was the nicest one I've seen. The sand was silky and clean and the water was spectacular--very warm too! Back to the room--it was cleaned promptly everyday and the turndown service was very nice with a treat and a letter highlighting the events of the next day. Morning coffee service is a huge perk. It came promptly every morning with the newspaper--only on the last day, milk was forgotten with the service. The food at Maroma was very good. We had a package that included two dinners which gave us the opportunity to try each restaurant. Breakfast was quite good. The pastry chef at Maroma is outstanding--all of the breakfast pastries and breads at dinner were excellent. The fresh tortillas in the morning are wonderful as are the fresh jams and juices. We enjoyed dinner at each restaurant and we ate at El Restaurante twice and El Sol once was stellar. As many posters have mentioned, this is not an inexpensive place but given that this is an Orient-Express hotel and the quality of the food, I didn't find the prices out of sync. We also had an early dinner with Freddy at the bar which was quite good. He makes the best margarita that I've ever had! We definitely appreciated the work of Freddy, Moses, Sergio and Alex each day. One of the perks of being on the Riviera Maya is that there are choices if you want to leave the resort. We went to Agua in Playa del Carmen for dinner one night and had an excellent dinner. We had planned to do all kinds of activities while on vacation but we ended up mostly lazing around the beach. We did snorkel which was fun and this is something I would have like to do again. The resort is so peaceful and beautiful that it is hard to muster up the energy to leave. We found the service to be excellent on all levels. Everyone knew our names, everyone introduced themselves and everyone seemed genuinely interested in making our trip as good as possible. Not only would I highly recommend Maroma but I will certainly consider another Orient-Express property for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST. EVER.”
Reviews.Author: blueroanvet
Reviews.Content: I don't know what went wrong with the last poster's visit, but mine was exactly the opposite, and based on all the positive reviews, probably similar to others. I stay in hotels weekly and am VERY, VERY hard to impress. We were part of a reward trip with a company, and my husband traveled with me. We had a Master Suite. It was in one word: AMAZING. Huge rooms with unbelievable view of the beach and ocean--right outside. Perfect. The place is expensive--but who wouldn't expect that in a property like this? Room service was quick, and the food......oh, the food. I had the mexican eggs and the green juice, oatmeal, and fresh fruit over several days, while my husband had the burrito and chiliquiles. All were cooked perfectly and delivered promptly with excellent service. They bent over backwards to make your stay the best. Service in the restaurant was slower, but it ain't fast food and it's not the airport! The guacamole was OUT OF THIS WORLD. One night, my husband and I had a couples massage, then were allowed to sit in the hot tub and relax. The white sand beach was the best I've ever seen and the service on the beach also attentive. Fresh tortillas were being made in the lobby. Have one-they are great! Coffee service to your room every day was awesome, since we didn't have to venture down to get it. Candles lit in your room every night added to the ambiance. Gabriel made sure everyone was having a good time and all the staff greeted us by name every day. I wouldn't have left if I didn't have to! It was paradise here on earth. I will be back. Thank you, Maroma, for an unforgettable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Eye watering prices and awful service spoiled the last days of our holiday”
Reviews.Author: Martinicus
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews on tripadvisor before finally selecting the Maroma over Tides and the Banyan Tree as our final destination on our trip to Mexico. One theme that was often repeated was that the prices in Maroma are very expensive - I assumed that this was referring merely to the room rates, but we got a rude awakening upon arrival. Everything here is vastly expensive - you can expect to pay between 3 and 6 times as much as you would elsewhere. Just some examples: the morning yoga will set you back $35 (+11% tax, +15% service charge = $44), the cheapest 50 minute massage will cost you $125 (+11% tax, +15% service charge = $157), a meal for two with 2 glasses of wine, 2 mains and a shared appetiser and dessert will set you back $132. A two-tank dive with the resort to the house reef (fairly dead) costs around $240. But, such prices might be considered acceptable if the hotel can deliver on what the prices promise: great food and awesome service. Unfortunately, Maroma delivers neither. Every day (save for our last, more anon), our breakfast was a disaster. Twice I ordered dishes with cheese in them and both times the dish tasted rancid, twice, the dishes we ordered arrived cold. Every time it was a lottery as to how long you would wait for tea or coffee - once my coffee arrived quickly, but I had to wait 20 minutes for milk (asking 4 people, including people offering me things like hot chocolate...), by which time my coffee was long gone cold. Room service was another disaster - our room was only cleaned once before about 2pm, and twice our room had its first clean and its turndown service at the same time! We made our disappointments known to their hospitality staff, and were told that someone from the management would try and fix things for us. Much later, the manager of the hotel spoke to us on the beach and asked us what he could do to 'make things better'. We were unsure how to react as we thought that surely most hotels would know how to make unhappy customers happy. We said we would think about it, and just asked if they could make our last meal there perfect if at all possible. We were assured that this would indeed be possible. Ha! What a disaster from start to finish - to begin with we were forced to eat in their 'premier' restaurant 'El Sol' - I'm not sure why they consider it 'premier' as it is musty and dated, when we would have preferred to eat on the beach (which really is a beautiful setting). A very quiet alarm bell went off when our server chose to 'remember' our order rather than write it down, but I figured they would have given us one of their better members of staff. But no, it was just a simple disaster. They forgot our starters and delivered our mains to us first. The person who delivered the dishes didn't know what they were and asked us 'who wanted the chicken?' - neither of us had ordered chicken - eventually saying, hmm, maybe it isn't chicken - what did you order again? Eventually we realised what had happened and asked for our starter instead. I made the point of asking if we would get fresh mains as I didn't want to eat a cold main (2 cold breakfasts was enough) to which I received the astoundingly insulting response "Don't worry - be happy". Seriously. A five star resort, and the waiter spectacularly screwed up our order, and rather than apologise, he tells us 'don't worry - be happy' - incredible. Twenty minutes later, our mains arrived. Mine had clearly been microwaved, while my wife's fish had been cooked afresh while all of her side dishes were allowed to go cold. Since it was our last night, we tried to put a brave face on it but my food was cold and inedible and I had to send it back. When we were finished, we asked for the bill and told "don't worry, it's been charged to your room." We insisted, and insisted again, and on the fourth asking, we finally received a bill - we were mostly interested to see if they were going to charge us the customary compulsory tip of 15%. When the bill arrived, I was somewhat surprised as a number of the dishes seemed to have cost more than they did on the menu, so I asked if I could see the menu again - instead of receiving the menu, I received a new bill with one of the over-priced reduced. I again asked for the menu to check the bill against it, and again I received yet another bill with another item reduced in price, at this point we said can we please just have a bill with everything matching the price that was in the menu and the service charge removed please. Finally, the manager came over and we tried to explain the situation and how utterly contemptuous we had found their definition of 'service' and ot his credit, he said he would not expect us to pay anything towards the meal as we clearly had not enjoyed it at all. We went straight to the hospitality desk and asked them to take the compulsory service charge completely off our bill for the entire stayas the whole experience was just awful - we spent more time saying to each other 'and another thing that is awful here is...' rather than just enjoying the last few days of a holiday which, up until we arrived at the Maroma, had felt like a second honeymoon. The following morning, they made an extra special effort for us, and our breakfast experience was pretty positive with some excellent coffee for me, rather than the usual watery brown stuff we had been served the few days before. The swiss hospitality manager apologised to us in person and offered us a bag of sweets to eat on the plane, and confirmed that the service charge had been removed from our bill. Sadly, it didn't make up for the experiences of the previous 5 days. Our suspicion as to 'what is wrong with the Maroma' is that the fact that the service charge is automatically added to your bill for every single little thing means that there is no incentive whatsoever for the staff to provide you with anything like acceptable service. Coupled with this, at breakfast they do not seem to have people assigned to tables to make sure that you get everything you want or need - it is totally haphazard as to what you get and when you get it. I would strongly recommend anyone to go elsewhere if they are looking for a fantastic experience on the Mayan Riviera.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly, magical paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Melody5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are very fortunate to be able to travel extensively and stay in the world's finest hotels through Andrew Harper Travel. We have been to Maroma three times - once a few years ago, twice this year (once for our anniversary and once with our family), and we will probably return for a third time this year for our anniversary. Why? Because it provides everything we love in a vacation. It's very classy without being pretentious - it's understated elegance. There are plenty of places in Mexico that are glitzy and glossy but Maroma has a very authentic Mexican vibe that is all too rare nowadays in hotels there. It is beautiful - luscious landscaping and beautiful stonework with lovely Mayan-inspired architecture. At night, there are candles lit all over the property. It is extremely romantic! The hotel is small, private and quiet. People who love a party scene should go elsewhere. Maroma is for couples seeking romance and tranquility in a gorgeous setting. The spa is one of the most beautiful and relaxing I've been to - and I've been to many. The food is wonderful and the service is excellent. What sets Maroma apart is the authenticity - the authentic kindness of everyone who works there, including housekeepers and gardeners - the authentic decor, the authentic food. They have captured the spirit of their Mayan heritage and it's truly beautiful. We love lounging on the wonderful outdoor "beds" under an umbrella on the white sand beach while listening to the waves and the wind in the palm trees. I always feel centered and grounded here. It's like a personal retreat for us. We love the staff so much that we greet them with hugs now! It's like returning home whenever we visit. Thank you, Maroma, for providing us with such a heavenly, magical paradise!

Reviews.Title: “World-class service”
Reviews.Author: TravelLoveWrite
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip on www.kiwicollection.com as it was rated very high, and for good reason. The hotel was beautiful, the staff was so friendly and you could tell they genuinely were passionate about working there, the rooms were large and luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location & Beach... Small Rooms & Service Lacking...”
Reviews.Author: TweetieBird_11
Reviews.Content: So... this was the last stop on our riviera maya "tour." It had a lot to live up to given it's reputation and cost of rooms. I was let down almost immediately and it was almost immediately transparent that we were not going to get the same quality & level of service that we had received at the other two resorts we had just come from.... Their rooms are a little tired and outdated not to mention small for what you pay to stay there... On the upside, the resort is quaint, charming and lovely! The beach & bar staff left a lot to be desired... I observed several guests, including ourselves, often looking for help and anyone that may be available to tend to their needs?! Strange experience after just having come from The Tides (amazing)! and Banyan Tree (love the Villa's & property)! The dinner staff just seemed "out to lunch" for lack of a better explanation (sadly this attitude continued fairly consistently throughout our two-day stay) and several times I saw the bar staff talking amongst themselves and ignoring guests that needed assistance with their umbrella's and getting drinks on the beach. On the contrary, there were some staff that were on the mark with the service that they were providing and we had some lovely, unique staff-related experiences while there but the most that I can say, was service was "spotty" at best... Truly unacceptable for a resort with such a high-rating & past reputation. Management could really work with the staff on improving some of these issues - it appeared to be a lack of management involvement and consistent help?! I would give the resort another chance however; they need to "revamp" the rooms, offer simple free treats on the beach and possibly some enhanced turndown service amenities and I would love to see the ALL OF THE STAFF on the mark at all times before I would feel comfortable paying these prices to return again... Happy Travels.

Reviews.Title: “Leisurely stay at Maroma”
Reviews.Author: SueLoo
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Maroma in December 2010 and had the most relaxing vacation you could hope for. For about 6 days we did nothing but lounge/wander on the beach and drink tequila and frozen drinks at the beach bar. I loved the fact this resort is very quiet (we came during a week when the occupancy rate was low) as we are not the kind of couple that enjoys random chatting with fellow guests. There were no children at the resort (I think there is an age limit of 14) and in our walks along the beach into other resort properties, we were struck by how much more elegant the property was than the tacky Vegas/chain resorts next door. We got exactly what we were looking for in a fairly isolated, quiet place with a great, friendly staff. The only thing I would criticize about the resort is their dining options. Though there is a "fine" dining option available, I was disappointed by the quality of the food as it was just a very typical, possibly 3-star, menu at 5-star prices. I was really hoping for a more authentic taste of Mexican cuisine, not a Mediterranean restaurant with only a small Mexican twist and ended up only eating there once. The majority of our time was spent at Freddy's bar on the beach, where we indulged in delicious cerviches and other small dishes from El Restaurante's menu. Overall, a wonderful experience that I loved and would recommend highly to vacationers who are looking for relaxation rather than adventure. A few quick things: take advantage of the sauna with plunge pool in their spa, be super careful about mosquitos (I was practically eaten alive), and consider renting a car for a night out in the actual city of Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “In a word....paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Joan1969
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Maroma was 10 years ago for a Honeymoon. Wow. What a lucky start to a fantastic 10 years. In fact, for the past 6 years, we haven't missed an anniversary in Maroma. Why? I call it Maroma Magic! This place is well described elsewhere on the site in terms of lovely authentic rooms, the best beach, awesome food, amazing spa, etc. But they didn't tell you about the Magic. The magic of Luis, Alex, Gabriel, Marcos, Moises and Freddy. And so many others. They can take all the worries and stress of life away in a days time. They transport you to paradise so you never want to leave. They create magical dinners on the roof, on the beach, and at the pool. They are magical and I can't wait to return next year!

Reviews.Title: “2 Star Hotel Pretending To Be 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: wlltrvld
Reviews.Content: I'll will lead with the positives of the Maroma resort: --The grounds are immaculate, I truly admire the manner in which they have placed the resort in the Yucatan jungle while preserving as much of it as possible. --The beach in terms of size and quality of the sand is quite spectacular--but there is one caveat, more on that later. --The wait staff who tend the beach are very attentive, friendly and professional. Now, for the not so nice bits about Maroma, we stayed in an "Ocean View Junior Suite" and had several issues with the accommodations: --Roaches, found several scurrying about at night and often woke to a find a few dead ones laying about in the morning.  One stowaway attempted to illegally cross the border, but his getaway was thwarted as we found him in our luggage while packing to leave. --Sewer gases emanating the toilet were just unbelievably bad, remnants of an old improperly vented sewer system, I suspect. --Mold in the shower. These are not things I have come to expect from a resort that likes to posture itself as 5 star and I feel pretty well versed on this because we have pretty much completed the Condé Nast list of Top Caribbean Resorts. Lastly, my beach warning, the amount of garbage that washes up onto this stretch of beach is staggering, shoes, plastic bags, plastic bottles, etc.  The hotel does a valiant effort trying to keep it clean with a staff raking the garbage and the seaweed throughout the day.  However, depending on the current and time of day, it can still get pretty nasty, one morning I came within inches of stepping on a hypodermic needle, not so fun.

Reviews.Title: “5 days in paradise”
Reviews.Author: vikki41
Reviews.Content: my wife and i went to maoma resort and spa to celebrate our 40th anniversary.when we arrived there our room was not quite ready but they offered us another room to change in which was great. because we were celebrating our special occasion and because we booked it with our platinum amex card manuel in the hospitality department was so wonderful and upgraded us to an oceanview junior suite which was beautiful and only steps from the ocean.the beach was magnificent and on the beach they had the most comfortable huge, plush, soft giant mattres like cushions to lie on. the service was unbelievable.beach attendants were there for us in seconds and came around several times offering different little things to eat or drink at no charge. when we left the beach for lunch and retuned the sand on our towels on the cushion had been removed and the towels were either changed or freshened up.housekeeping sevices were also great and our room was made up twice a day.the sevice at the restaurant was superb. luis who was in charge came to us often to make sure all was ok . speaking of the restaurant and food , the restaurant sits right on the beach with tables covered with white long tablecloths and it was just like being at a restaurant in the south of france. the breakfast which is included in the room rate was unbelievable as was lunch and dinner.literally whatever you wanted they would make you. one day we asked if we could have a whole ,grilled fish for dinner and the next day luis came over and showed us 2 whole fish to choose from and asked how we would like it prepared.that evening we had the fish for dinner cooked to perfection. the chef even came out and asked what we thought. the next day the chef found us on the beach and said they had a different whole fish and would we want that for dinner and how we wanted it prepared. what can i say but the food was amazing. as for the beach it is one of the most beautiful we hav ever seen with turquoise water and a great walking beach where my wife and i took two 45 minute walks a day. last but not least since we booked with the platinum amex card my wife and i received in addition to the upgrade two 50 minute body massages and round trip transfers. in addition the hotel offers 2 snorkelig excursions at no charge. all i can say this was truly 5 days of paradise and we cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful gorgeous and pricey......but worth every dime!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dfleming09
Reviews.Content: We went for the first time. !! Being from the new York area my husband and I are used to staying at wonderful hotels and eating at wonderful restaurants!!! We loved maroma!!!!!! A romantic getaway!!! Spa amazing.....Only negative was that our week was windy. Hotel itself is outstanding!!!! Miss my little tortilla lady making fresh tortillas everyday!

Reviews.Title: “Magical Weekend at Maroma”
Reviews.Author: TamsenTM
Reviews.Content: Sometimes I spend so much time researching and reading about a destination that it's a let down when I finally get there . . . not with Maroma. I think it exceeded my expectations! I could gush on and on but the bottom line is, if you want a luxurious, relaxing, non-stuffy special getaway, this is your place. You can read my full trip report on the Playa Del Carmen travel forum here at trip adviser.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful, but....”
Reviews.Author: Ellen0551
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent an incredible week at this beautiful resort. Everything was top-notch - the room and amenities, the service, the food, the atmosphere. It was just what we needed after a long, cold winter in the midwest. So we were lulled into a false sense of security. On the day we were to leave, we locked our room and went to breakfast for 45 minutes. When we returned to finish our packing, we found our cell phones and chargers gone, along with a bit of cash and a very nice necklace that I had planned on wearing home. Thankfully, our wallets and passports were locked in the safe. It really put a sour end to our trip and we left in a very unhappy state. Management responded well and has offered us a complimentary stay but it is hard to erase that feeling of being violated. We learned a valuable lesson - no matter how nice the resort is, do not leave ANYTHING of value out in the room/villa. Another note - they knew how upset we were on the morning of departure and we had asked for transport to the airport. We were charged $140 for that ride and my husband and I both felt that if they had offered that as complimentary, considering that we had just been robbed, it would have been an appreciated gesture of goodwill. So, all in all, the resort is everything we wanted but unfortunately, it ended badly. Yes, it is expensive, and for us, it ended up even more expensive, but if you want a high-end vacation, this would be a great spot. Just be sure to use the safe!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful And Expensive”
Reviews.Author: stuben
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Maroma and really loved it. It is not perfect however many reviews make it sound that way! The setting, beach, grounds and spa are all extraordinary. It apparently is often very windy there which takes a bit away from the beach. We loved the fact that it is set in the jungle and saw some beautiful birds and what appeared to be a family of anteaters as well as many iguanas. The food at the restaurants is excellent. We loved the breakfast. I highly recommend the mayan dish huevos mortelenos (something like that). We ate at El Sol and the main restaurant as well as went into Playa for a meal. They were very good but crazy prices. People rave about the service here and while we found everyone to be friendly and helpful it was sometimes misleading. For example, our last night the sommelier came up to speak with us and then urged us over to the bar and told the bartender to get us drinks. The way he said it, we thought he was getting the drinks for us after we had just spent alot at El Sol. The bartender then started talking about tequilas and poured 3 for us to try (wo us asking). At the end of the conversation he mentioned one of the tequilas was $22 for basically a taste. We did not know if we would be charged or not for this. My husband gave him a handsome tip for his friendly info and what he thought were the tastes we received. The next day. we found out we'd been billed $55 for what we thought was them being nice and treating us. That type of thing took a bit away from the experience. The only other complaint was that the bed while soft and felt comfortable, we had a hard time sleeping on it. Other than those things, we really liked Maroma very much and I hope we can afford to return someday soon.

Reviews.Title: “Now that we've stayed here, nothing else will compare!”
Reviews.Author: kteising
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Maroma for 5 nights on our honeymoon (luna de miel) at the end of February/beginning of March. I had been to the property in March of 2008 on a work incentive trip and hadn't forgotten my incredible experience! Maroma was where we had to go for our honeymoon- sharing this magical place with my husband was a wonderful experience and we look forward to going again in the future. To give you some details about our experience: Affording it First of all, Maroma is very expensive and quite honestly, we couldn't afford to book directly through the resort. I found a fantastic deal through LuxuryLink.com that included a 5 night stay, Ocean View Room, breakfast every day, a snorkeling trip for two, a 50 minute massage for two and a three-course dinner with a house bottle of wine. However, although Maroma is expensive (in fact, the most money we've EVER spent on a vacation...but hey! it was our honeymoon!), we thought it was all worth it. The beach is stunning and well taken care of (they literally rake the beach five times a day!)...it's very low key (no kids), secluded (you won't have people hawking sunglasses and t-shirts on the beach) and the service is impeccable. From the wait staff on the beach to the hospitality staff and folks manning the Maroma Activities spot, they're all top notch. Dining/Cuisine Excellent. We booked a private dinner at El Mirador (at the very top of the resort with a 360 degree view) with our own personal waiter and a menu designed by the head Chef, Juan Pablo. We also took a cooking class paired with a tequilla tasting where we learned the secrets of making ceviche, tasty guacamole and tinga. The Chef's Table night was phenomenal- a four-course meal focused around the tomato, with a wine pairing....mmmm! We also enjoyed fantastic breakfasts every day-- with fresh squeezed juices, fruit (never tasted better mango!) and huevos. We did partake in taco night and yes, it's quite expensive at $75 per person not including beverages (as other reviews have lamented), but it was a feast reminescent of a wedding reception....traditional soup, salads, tacos of all kinds, tostadas, desserts like flan...amazing. Don't forget the enthusiastic Mariachi band! Drinks Freddy's Bar is the best! We love Freddy and his team! The Maroma Margarita is so unique! We got some of the anise/vanilla liquor to make this special cocktail for our friends here in the US. They also have an extensive wine menu, so if you're into wine, this is a great place to induldge! Room I've stayed in a Garden View Room (Room #3) an Ocean View room (Room #20) and quite honestly, I liked the Garden Room better. More space with double sinks, a huge bath tub, nice outdoor space with a hammock. It faces the Garden pool where the temp almost 90 degrees and soooo relaxing! The Ocean View room we got through LuxuryLink was fine, but it only had a standup shower, no hammock and just an okay view of the ocean. Kinan Spa I really induldged in the spa! Three treatments in three days! I highly recommend the Anti-Stress Massage and the Kinan Ritual. There's a fantastic sauna/steam/cool plunge pool room that's open to anyone on the resort as well. Very tranquill space and wonderful service. Activties My husband went out with Dive Master Laura for a scuba excursion one day and he also took the snorkel trip. He loved every minute of it! There are other trips offered- like to Tulum to see Mayan ruins- but we were pretty content to stay on the resort. Bottom line If you're into a TJ Maxx kind of vacation, this probably isn't for you. This is like shopping at Bergdorf Goodman-- you may find things on sale (like our deal with LuxuryLink), but you'll always spend waaaay more than at TJ Maxx. You can't go on a trip like this worried about what you're spending. You have to decide ahead of time to just enjoy it and be okay with it. We estimated what our costs would be and they came in right around that amount. So, we charged it to the credit card and are transfering money over from our "honeymoon trip" savings account to pay it. Overall, we highly recommend Maroma and will continue to sing its praises to our friends and throughout our marriage.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculously Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Davenation74
Reviews.Content: My wife took me to Maroma for three nights as a birthday trip. God bless her, she picked the place because it had such good reviews on here. The hotel is nice enough, the service is just fine and the bungalows are charming. However, $600 a night for the cheapest room off season is just insane. Added to that, we ate dinner the first night at the hotel and almost fell into the pool when we saw the taco bar for two with two bottles of water and one beer was $220!!!! The place is certainly above average but for these prices, you could be sleeping and dining at five stars hotels and restaurants in Paris, London or New York. Save your money and stay at the Marriott or Hilton in Cancun.

Reviews.Title: “The Maroma - almost Paradise”
Reviews.Author: DJFLondon
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Maroma and it is one of the very few hotels we will make a point of returning to. The service is one of the friendliest we have ever encountered in a hotel and, despite a few lapses in the dining room, it was very efficient. When we arrived we were upgraded to a master suite and whilst this was most generous of the management, having seen our originally booked ocean view junior suites, we were disappointed with our suite (Room 21) as it is not worth the increased cost. Whilst the room had its own seperate sitting room, the bedroom faced the back of the hotel with a view of roofs and one only had a sideways view of the sea from the sitting room. We felt that the quality of the furnishings and general decoration fell slightly short of a five star hotel requirements. That said, the management make a virtue of it being rustic - in our view a bit too much so! We had a few rainy days and the lack of television in the rooms made life a bit boring. The hotel is in a truly fantastic position, opening onto a gorgeous long white sandy beach, and the restaurant is virtually on the beach. It was stunning. The food was 'correct' without being memorable and we found it extremely expensive. The one great plus was the staff was very accommodating and would prepare almost anything one wanted, even if was not on the menu. The best meal was breakfast - lots of choice and do have the double fried black beans; delicious with a fried egg. There are two main restaurants, the 'Signature' one being El Sol. Again this was very expensive and we found the decor slightly gloomy. The main restaurant was, in our view, better value and is in a much nicer position, most of it being in the open. We had one big hiccup in that El Sol is not open on Sunday. On our second Sunday the hotel and restaurant were extremely busy. We were told that we would have to wait 40 minutes for a table - not justified in a five star resort hotel. Why did they just not let people sit in El Sol, as it is next door and you can have the normal restaurant food there? The service was sometimes very slow and haphazard but as we were on holiday and all the waiters were so charming and friendly this did not really matter. We visited Chichen Itza, taking the hotel arranged tour at an eyewateringly expensive $750. We found this to be, actually, reasonable value as we had an excellent day. However we avoided the nearer and shorter (4 hour) Tulum arranged tour for $600. We found a friendly taxi driver who drove us there and back, and waited the two hours we were there, for $150 and we got a very good tour guide there for $50 - a saving of $400! My criticisms are mainly petty and the overall impression of our stay in this lovely hotel was wonderful. The position, general quality of amenities and service were outstanding. However we did think it very expensive. We negotiated a discount on our original booking and were upgraded, however if we had to pay the full 'rack' rate for our suite we would have been very disappointed. That said, it is no more expensive than most top flight Caribbean hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Maroma Has Set The Standard By Which I Will Judge All Other Resorts.”
Reviews.Author: razorweb
Reviews.Content: Quite simply, Maroma Resort has raised my expectations for what a hotel can deliver to its guests. I did not want for anything during our stay. The staff bent over backward to accommodate our every request, and always asked if there was anything they could do for us. I don't think I've ever been to a place where each and every staffmember was so helpful and friendly. The grounds are gorgeously maintained. Night-time is when Maroma is truly in its glory - hundreds of candles line every walkway, hallway, and everywhere else you can think of. It is really magical. At night, we played pool and board games (provided by the hotel) as we sipped margaritas and watched the moon rise over the ocean.. The rooms were clean and authentically decorated, a welcome departure from the modern chocolate/beige collections so many other hotels are sporting these days. Each room has a hammock on the balcony which we used after a long day on the beach. We also took full advantage of the oversized tub (the resort provides bath salts daily) and rainshower. Each night after turndown they would leave a little treat to enjoy which I thought was a great touch. The beach was impecabbly clean, as it is cleaned regularly by hotel staff. About two dozen beds line Maroma Resort's beach, where we relaxed all day while table service and the occasional refreshment were serendipitously d We partook in the included coral-reef snorkeling trip, which was a fun thing to do after a full breakfast. Maroma has its own boat to take you out to the reef, and a friendly dive instructor who guided us along. The food was excellent and varied, both at the beachside restaurant, and at the indoor fine dining restaurant. We took part in a special chef's menu one night, and it was incredible. We later learned that the head chef had previously trained at Le Circque in NY, among other places, which explains the high quality of the restaurants. Every morning we had breakfast at the hotel, where fresh juice, fruits, pastries, were available (in addition to your breakfast entree). The drinks were also excellent, including the passion fruit margarita. Maroma is a very different experience from the cookie-cutter resorts I've known (and formerly loved). It feels like a more authentic experience. What distinguishes it from its competitors (in my humble opinion) is its seclusion (a far more private resort than others nearby), its authenticity, its excellent staff, and its amazing food. I would definitely return and would not hesitate to recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: JVC1967
Reviews.Content: After reading the numerous excellent reviews of Maroma, we decided to give it a try and in most aspects it was near perfect. The setting is beautifully laid out with spectacular views and overall the property is excellently maintained. The staff couldn't be nicer or more accommodating. They work incredibly hard and are always pleasant and kind to their guests. And considering most people will eat all their meals there, the food is great and prepared well. A couple things stopped us from giving it 5 stars though. First, while the staff in the restaurants tries hard, a little more training is needed. A couple times the wait staff forgot we were seated and never came to our table until we had to get up and find them, another time my husband was brought the wrong dinner order so I had my dinner 15 minutes before his and a few times the waiters brought us meals for intended for another table. And one other thing, Maroma DOES allow children. There were several children there on our last stay. All were well behaved but we asked the management about this. Their response was "Oh, you caught us. We do allow children when a VIP guest comes". This sounds like a policy that is waiting to backfire on the Maroma. These are the difference between a 4 and 5 star resort. When you are paying in excess of $1,000 a day, things need to be near perfect and they almost were. The vacant property directly to the north of Maroma is rumored to become a Four Seasons. Maroma will have some real competition.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to be”
Reviews.Author: gzones1974
Reviews.Content: I was there for president's day long weekend. Service and food are above expectations. Everybody are very friendly and make guests feel special. Food is espectacular and the chef gabe us personal attention.

Reviews.Title: “need to comment”
Reviews.Author: 100spf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Maroma a little over a year ago. At the time, we truly enjoyed our experience and were delighted with our stay. But now, a year and a half later I feel like I must leave a comment for others considering Maroma....why? because other resorts just aren't matching up...in a sense, Maroma has spoiled us rotten. Pros Service is pleasant, welcoming and not forced in any way. Food, fantastic. Our worst meal was actually when we went into town. They do a great job at Maroma of making dishes that are ethnic but still palatable to americans. The Beach is calm and beautiful. It is cleaned everyday of seaweed and you are relaxing on a nice bed (if i'm not mistaken, everyone gets a bed). The service on the beach for us was extremely attentive and friendly. Clientele... if seeing this in the Pros column resonates with you, I need not explain further. But if you are looking for quiet and relaxing, you want to be surrounded by the same mentality. Our experience was just that. That doesn't mean people don't talk mind you, we met some great people who we'd spend afternoon and evenings talking to. Its hard to explain I guess, but there is something to be said about everyone there leaving their problems at home. Maybe thats a credit to the service, I dunno. No kids...its not that we don't like kids...its that not all kids are angels...and you don't want a devil on your trip. okay, Cons The room was somewhat small...no TV and the toilet was behind a saloon style door. To be honest this didn't really bother us, its more to prepare you for what you are going to see. The room is adequate for the amount of time you spend in there...I wasn't sure how I would feel about no TV, but it actually set a nice tone for our time there... you don't care after a day or two...and if you do, there is a place to go watch TV. The saloon door toilet issue, well I had to ask my wife to read on the patio a couple times...but it worked out. Nightlife...yeah, there is none...at least not during our stay. we might have a drink or two after dinner but that was about it. I'm putting this under a con because it is fun to meet and talk with other people, but keep in mind there are only 60 something rooms at Maroma...its not a packed place. (Pro) To wrap it up.... Maroma may not be perfect, but it was perfect for what we wanted. They clearly worked very hard at making our stay pleasant and enjoyable. And we are learning more and more each trip how lucky we were with our experience at Maroma. we have recommended Maroma to others who have walked away feeling the same way as we did and we will continue to do so. So to the staff at Maroma, please continue to provide a true 5 star service...don't make a lair out of me. And to people considering Maroma, I wish you the best in your decision...If you want to do absolutely nothing but sit on a beach and read, you are correct to consider Maroma.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine_1482
Reviews.Content: We stayed there a few days for our honeymoon. Although we overall enjoyed our stay, here are a few comments. The hotel and decor felt a bit dated. The bathtub in the bathroom was uncomfortable and the tiles, when wet, were quite dangerous. Although the room was nice and spacious, and very close to the beach, the sound was poorly insulated and we could easily hear outside (waves). Also, the internet connection in the room was intermittent and slow. Considering this was a 5* hotel, it didn't feel to us like so. On a good note, the food was very good (especially breakfast) and the staff was incredibly nice and available. At night, candles are lit throughout the hotel, which gives it a very romantic and soothing feel.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: rgsc
Reviews.Content: 5 night girls' getaway. Truly perfect vacation. I have never felt so pampered and relaxed (and have stayed at many "5 star" spots. Not much to add to the other glowing reviews, but wanted to say THANK YOU to Federico and his staff for making this an amazing restorative vacation. It was almost as if they could read your mind to know what you needed. My requirements were all met and expectations exceeded: over the top service, beautiful spa, amazing food, peaceful beach. And the hacienda was absolutely GORGEOUS, especially at night with candles lit everywhere. Already planning my return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place but......”
Reviews.Author: Greg289
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been here 3 times and are going back this March. The only thing that bugs me is that they send us a free room upgrade and $250 dollar spending chit for drinks/food, and we are told that it is in their "blackout" period so it is no good. I think that is pretty poor thing for this resort to do for a couple that is going there for the 4th time.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, excellent staff, wonderful beach”
Reviews.Author: jrj48
Reviews.Content: Second trip to Maroma and was not disappointed. With Chef Juan Pablo food quality has improved to excellent. Staff here become like family after only a few days. Somewhat pricey but for us worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Rates among the best in the world”
Reviews.Author: Rod1941
Reviews.Content: Spectacular beach; restaurants with great views; beach bar rivals best anywhere; attentive, dedicated, cheerful service from large ever-present staff; great room with strong a/c, free internet, great beds; fantastic spa; architecture throughout reflects origin of hotel as architect's personal residence; hard to describe all the good things. Expensive, but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Magic at Maroma”
Reviews.Author: TravelKym
Reviews.Content: A short but decadent stay at Maroma Resort and Spa didn't disappoint. The resort itself sits on one of the best beaches in Mexico and the king size beach beds get an A+ for relaxation and romance. For me it wasn't the excellent and authentic Mexican cuisine, the 1000 candles that illuminate the resort every night or the lovely spa we enjoyed every day...it was the sincere and outstanding service that Maroma offers. They get it right with just enough optional activities to keep it interesting ie. cooking classes, snorkelling and tequila tastings while also letting you flop and flake if you prefer. Granted the rooms aren't a large as some of the other hotels in the same price point until you get up to the 1 bdrm suite size but the view is hard to beat! Just go.

Reviews.Title: “Marom-ahhh...”
Reviews.Author: coquetita
Reviews.Content: It hasn't even been one week and I am ready to go back. Really. Maroma was a wonderful getaway for us. It is quiet, secluded, on a beautiful property, but it was the excellent customer service that really made our experience top-notch. When we first arrived, we were greeted by the smiling Maroma staff and tasty Maroma Margaritas. Katerina and Claudia gave us a tour of the grounds and gave us some helpful information about the area. They were very welcoming and friendly. Whenever they saw us on the property, they were sure to call us by name and genuinely interested on how we were enjoying our stay. The spa is wonderful, we got a couples massage and it was an excellent way to start the trip. If you can get an appointment with Artemiza, I promise you will be in Heaven. She is wonderful!! The Ceviche bar is YUMMY!! Try the Maroma Guacamole, it is amazing. Even more amazing are the passionfruit margaritas. They were perfect during/ after (and anywhere in-between:) a day in the beach. If you come across Angel or Moises working at the bar, they will take care of you! Last but not least, that management of the hotel deserves a special thank you for making sure all of our needs were met during out stay. Manuel Ramirez and Federico Echaiz deserve a huge gracias for their wonderful hospitality. So, if you are thinking about staying at Maroma, and are looking for a quiet, romantic getaway with a wonderful hotel staff who will treat you like royalty, I recommend that you stay here. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else in Riviera Maya?”
Reviews.Author: JustinNYC
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd visit to Maroma Resort & Spa. We debated whether to try something new (i.e Mandarin Oriental, Tides), but in the end my wife and I decided that Maroma was just too perfect the first time for us to venture away to try a new resort. Let me say that we were very happy with our choice to return, this 2nd trip was even better than the first, and not only because of the location/beach/seclusion/intimacy of resort, etc.. but rather the service this time was flawless, and here's why: The first night we happen to stay on the end of the resort closest to the largest villa. This was a disaster because for such a quiet, peaceful resort it was anything but this. Reason being because there was a very large, LOUD group of young europeans who had ZERO class and kept us (and other guests) up all night. We literally could not sleep until close to 3AM, it was awful. Here's why Maroma is a cut above the rest.... The next morning the manager (I believe his name is Eduardo) completely turned our vacation around. After apologizing over and over he not only moved us to the opposite end of the resort away from the loud villa, but upgraded us to the master ocean suite which was amazing. The next 4 days were perfect and the first night was a thing of the past. Many resorts would have just apologized and moved on with their day, but not Maroma. They are a class act resort, a class act company (Orient Express) and deserving of our business moving forward. Anytime we go to this part of Mexico there is really no need for us to consider staying anywhere else. The white sand beaches and beach beds, the privacy/intimacy of the resort, the great food, and the impeccable service....paradise. If you are looking for an upscale resort I hope you decide on Maroma, you will not regret your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced & Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: adriand99
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews but was just so disappointed with our stay at Maroma that i wanted to share it with others. We recently stayed at the Maroma Resort and having stayed at resorts around the world this was truely disappointing. We had 2 of the better rooms - a Master Ocean View Suite ($1500 USD approximate) and a Garden Room ($850 USD approximate). The rooms were cheaply furnished and very basic. There was not even a TV in the rooms, and hot/cold water did not work reliably. There are only 2 restaurants on the resort and the food is average at best. We dreaded eating at the restaurants. Sure the beach is beautiful, the staff  are very friendly but the resort is just not worth the price. In comparison we have recently stayed at Las Ventanas at San Jose Del Cabo. This is an amazing resort with beautifully appointed/luxurious rooms, beautiful pools, amazing landscaping, great beach   and just a little less than what we paid at Maroma. I would rate Les Ventanas as one of the best places in the world we have stayed - up there with the famous Burj Al Arab in Dubai (the worlds only six star hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Old School Mexican Luxury”
Reviews.Author: mdlgto
Reviews.Content: Maroma is a dyed in the wool Old School Mexican resort. The Orient Express chain has managed to let the hotel keep all its funky charm. There is none of that tropical wool and brown stucco faux bali nonsense. Our bath was giant, made of talavera tile, the walls "popcorn" white stucco. Rooms are quite large. Floors have been upgraded to stone. Beautiful, mature landscaping--the gardens look like they have been carefully attended over the years and this accretion shows. This is the luxury of time--for a garden to mature and shade paths and create dappled light. The resort is remarkably under built--60 some odd rooms over a big swath of beach, all room close to water if not exactly on ocean view. Staff was impeccably polite, service spot on--coffee brought to the room on the minute requested every morning. We could ask anyone in the hotel for a favor and they would get it done (e.g. more coffee to a bellhop who then brought us another pot). Friendly without being unctuous. This is possibly the best service -- across all points of contact - restaurant, bar, house keeping, hospitality--that I have ever experience--without a doubt the best service I have had in Mexico. Tons of staff per guest and to the last delightful. The restaurant is remarkably good and consistent--good supper choices, surprisingly good meat dishes, fresh fish, chef specials daily. Enough variety to not get boring over 3-4 days (and probably a week). Breakfast v. good and to die for handmade tortillas every morning. Charming mariachi (toned down) group every evening in the restaurant. Room was spotless. Not a grain of sand outside of beach. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: DWEDDS
Reviews.Content: The best trip I have ever taken in my life. I have been to many exclusive resorts around the world and two weeks here was the best disconnect from real life ever. Service is impeccable, beach is gorgeous and food is to die for. It's expensive but worth every dime. The kinyan spa is amazing! My highest recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place”
Reviews.Author: mbknyc
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place. We loved it. Staff is incredible. Food is great. Rooms were great. Beach is beautiful. A very special place. Great diving and dive shop as well. Far and away the best staff we've ever encountered. We stayed for a week and loved it. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: masticate
Reviews.Content: We asked for Room 9, which had been described by friends. We paid a premium for a junior suite--$1215 a day, plus tax and surcharges. What we got was a beautifully located long narrow room directly on the beach. The staff and surroundings were excellent, but not worth the expense.

Reviews.Title: “Bar-Raising Beach Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: DennisM4919
