Reviews.Content: It's all been said below - fantastic service, absolutely beautiful beach and grounds, and excellent food make Maroma incredibly hard to beat. You get what you pay for. My pictures say more than anything I could write, so have a look. We'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Third time and it's still tops!”
Reviews.Author: Beachbulldoglover
Reviews.Content: We love Maroma and visited for the third time in 3 years the week before Christmas. Great to see some of our old friends still there. Hospitality is outstanding and you really do feel like you're leaving friends behind when it's time to head back to reality. The most difficult decisions we made during our stay were what kind of fresh juice to have at breakfast each day and which kinds of tequila to try in Freddy's Bar. I did get up early to claim our beach bed but it was nice seeing the ocean and the grounds very still and quiet that time of morning. The beach BBQ on Friday night was really great and not something we'd done before -- glad we did! Still highly recommend this place especially for a romatic get away! Spa is really outstanding, too. Thanks, Maroma!

Reviews.Title: “Intimate & secluded...luxury, charm & service”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkerJournalist
Reviews.Content: Boy do I wish I was still there. And returning to bitter cold and endless Christmas commercials doesn't help! I've traveled to many luxurious places, but Maroma is a new favorite. If you want an enormous, sprawling resort with lots of nightlife, this is not the place. If you want laid-back luxury, intimacy, quiet, romance, top-notch service, charm, sophistication and a spectacular beach setting, keep reading....Maroma is for you. I'd like to thank all of the previous reviewers, yet again your thoughts and suggestions proved very helpful. After a quick flight, you're whisked away by a friendly driver and a clean SUV w/water, hand towels, etc. A fairly quick ride, and you are there...(sure beats our trips to Hawaii) Like a few of my favorite spots, there is no front-desk/check-in routine. You are given a tour and then shown your room. Rooms are just personal preference, garden-view, suite, etc., but if you want a larger room, spring for the suites. We were in an ocean-view room and it was perfect. A little small, but not bothersome. It was open and airy. And hammock, huge tub w/rain shower. Nice art and authentic Mayan touches-- you feel like you're in someone's home rather than a 5 star resort that's over-the-top, trying too hard to maintain their 5 stars. Maroma is not stuffy, which we loved. Most importantly, the BEACH. One of the finest stretches of private beach I've ever seen. And I guess you could call me a beach snob. I like my beaches! I'm not going to pay big money to stay at a beach resort with sub-par beaches. Pools are nice, but it's the beach that gets me. This one is clean, immense, wide, private and great for wading or serious swimmers. (It's even roped-off in deep water which is helpful for laps) There are beach beds, quick service with a smile, and a view that transports you into eternal bliss. I do hope that they eliminate the tolerated bad habit of saving beach chairs/beds. I'm told mgmt is ordering more beds, so that should eliminate the problem. 30 mins is one thing, but putting your book down at 8am not to return until 11am is unfair to other guests. But for those of you going during high season, they should have more beds, and also--keep walking...the further you go down the beach, the more beds there are, which you don't really see on your first day! FOOD-Excellent. Portion, flavors, variety. Enough said. I'm not an expert foodie, but each plate was vibrant, delicious and fresh. Authentic. The chef and his staff did a magnificent job. Next time I'm doing a cooking class! And the waitstaff hustled. They were always on their toes, wanting to please. And like other reviewers have noted, you can order from various menus, ask the chef for variations, switch entrees and apps, etc. You get the picture. The alcohol is pricey, but we kept it in moderation (and brought some wine with us). And yes--spend time at the beach bar. It's friendly, cozy, and the margaritas are excellent. And again, great service with a smile. Oh--and one of my concerns...water. Potable water is free here, and that is where they could really get you, charging for water...but they don't, thankfully, and there are free bottled waters in your room and available at meals. (And Evian, Fiji, Pelligrino for those of you that prefer that) And yes--the included breakfast is deeelicious! And it's not just muffins and juice--a very plentiful menu! And yum, Mexican hot chocolate... No car needed. Sometimes when you don't rent a car, you feel trapped. Not here. You feel like you're guests of honor in someone's beautiful home, and we never even felt the need to leave. But yes, if you want to see Mayan ruins, go into town, or take one of their tours, they'll happily set it up for you. SPA. Wow. Best massage my husband and I have had in a long time. Beautiful, beautiful spa, without trying to hard. I've been to some nice spas, but the setting and service here was top-notch. Special touches. I don't want to ruin it for first-timers, but this is one area that helps set this resort apart from others. From turn-down service, coffee service in the morning, mid-day thirst-quenchers on the beach, and candle-lit pathways at night, I was impressed by the details. I like having no TV's in the room--but they have TV/internet/lounge rooms that satisfy that craving. The Reef snorkel was fun, but we weren't impressed with the reef. Perhaps the section of the reef we visited is just a smaller section, not too vibrant, etc. Because if that's the 2nd largest reef in the world, you come w/high expectations. But then again I've been fortunate enough to visit the Great Barrier Reef, so everything pails in comparison. The guys who run the snorkel/dive/marina spot are friendly, helpful and do a good job. Another thing we liked about Maroma is not having to think about tips and costs at each meal or activity. But they will happily print you a receipt per meal so you can keep track, verify, etc. Fitness Center: I was pleasantly surprised, the fitness center was great. New-ish Cybex machines, free weights, balls/mats, treadmills (they worked fine, but I hope to see new ones next time I go) bikes, elliptical-style machines...It was cool, clean and well-maintained. The right size for the resort, not huge, but not cramped. I just wish you didn't have to pay extra for yoga, but it's nice that it's offered, as well as other classes. POOLS-We saw two beautiful pools and swam in one of them. (The heated one!) Gorgeous, tranquil, clean...and just a stone's throw from the beach. And beds there too... I wish I could thank the staffers individually, because they make your stay so enjoyable. There is an enthusiasm, genuine smiles, and a work ethic that is very impressive. And if there was ever a stumble, they'd work hard to make up for it. And if you try your Spanish, they will be happy to help you along and teach you new words. One thing I really like about this resort is the size. 65 rooms. So again you feel like you're guests in someone's home. They learn your name, and it doesn't take 20 minutes to find your room. And when it's low season, it's even quieter. Heavenly. And unfortunately, the resort is pricey, but like others have said, it was worth it. A very relaxing vacation. Can't wait to go back. Thank you Maroma! Feel free to email me w/any questions. David & Christina, Princeton, NJ Also--if you're headed there over the next few months, bring a light fleece, sweater, etc. It gets a little chilly at night. (Just a little chilly, but it really warms up during the day)

Reviews.Title: “Most incredible travel experience my wife & I have ever had”
Reviews.Author: DanBostonWW
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Maroma with one goal in mind - to relax with one another. The resort was completely perfect. The staff could not have been more accomodating and professional. Of special note, my wife is a vegetarian, and the Executive Chef Juan Pablo Loza, personally suggested her menu, and visited us at our table to make sure that we were satisfied. Both of us were amazed by the quality of the facilities (very quiet / perfect private beach), the quality of the service, and the food. The large beach futons and umbrellas were my personal favorite amenity. We will certainly return to the Maroma resort and would highly recommend it to our friends. In summary, everthing was absolutely perfect. Our rating is A+ on every element of our vacaction. Dan & Lisa, Boston, Mass, USA

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to love Maroma, but ...”
Reviews.Author: LarryCable
Reviews.Content: There is so much to love about Maroma, the beach which is tirelessly cleaned by the staff each day of seaweed and human detritus, the restaurant, Freddie's Bar, the spa and most of all the friendly staff; Freddie and his fellow bartenders,Alex the sommelier, Ysidro in room service or Daniel on the beach amongst others, but ... we just completed a stay at the resort over Thanksgiving, 7 days in a Sian Nah suite; we got a great deal including airport transfers, breakfast, a free dinner and two massages included... But a few minor hiccups spoiled my unreserved recommendation... Firstly, my room was not available upon arrival; the hotel knew when I was arriving, they even picked me up at the airport, yet when I arrived on time, housekeeping was still working on the room. Secondly, the showers in the room seemed incapable of delivering truly hot water, warm yes, but hot no... This may just be the particular room, as I had a hot shower in another room prior to departure... However the biggest disappointment was some aspects of the service; room service and the restaurant were flawless, however coffee service in the morning, and turn down service at night was patchy at best ... bar service was occasionally "forgetful", and the worst was the lack of available beach service. don't get me wrong, the guys at the beach are great, but the service was confused (at the bar) and there were not enough staff on the beach to cover the guests adequately. To their credit, management responded very positively when we raised these issues and we noticed an improvement thereafter, but the overall experience was not what we expected of a $1000+/day resort. Of note, when I felt unwell one day the management were very helpful, offered a doctor, and brought me some chicken soup, and a TV+DVD player at no cost ... much appreciated! Overall Maroma is beautiful and very unique, a few minor slip-ups spoiled its perfect score but it is still a destination to be considered

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent!”
Reviews.Author: tabloidqueen62
Reviews.Content: This was by far the best hotel/resort I have ever experienced. The staff were so hard working and helpful. I never got the impression they were being nice just for Brownie points but sincerely wanted your stay to be stressless and joyful

Reviews.Title: “Paradise continues, with better food.”
Reviews.Author: Hamilton6
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Maroma. We rarely return to a venue but found this one so perfect for its beauty, quiet, understated elegance, and extraordinary level of service that it made for a perfect 4-night getaway of total relaxation. Our second visit exceeded our very high expectations. Without exception, every member of the staff we ran into met us with a smile and greeting and could not have been more warm. Our accommodations (a one-bedroom suite) were spacious and tasteful beyond words. We could easily have just set out on our balcony looking at the ocean for 4 days and had a wonderful time. All of the good things about Maroma have been said many times before. In my prior evaluation (and in those of others), the only weak area has been the on-property food. I'm happy to report that serious progress is being made. Breakfast continues to be, in our opinion, the highlight of the dining experience. Excellent and delicious offerings of Mexican cuisine on the oceanside terrace with the option, of course, to order whatever you'd like, accompanied by fresh fruit and delicious baked goods. Guests may order off any menu for dinner and lunch in the main restaurant, and we prefer the "Beach" menu (with many more choices added since our last visit), which can also be personalized. On most nights, we were happy to eat a late breakfast, skip lunch, and eat dinner (usually chicken quesadilla) at the beach bar in the company of the most amiable of bartenders - Freddy or Fillip. Both make you feel like you're part of the family. Just to give a fair evaluation, we also tried El Sol and the main menu at El Restaurante and found both restaurants to be much improved from our last visit 6 months ago. El Sol now boasts a menu that includes tapas and small portions. Kudos to management for hearing the concerns and making adjustments. Be prepared to learn some spanish, as the staff takes pleasure in assisting willing guests with a few phrases. So good are they that when I got to the ticket counter at Cancun for our return flight and greeted the agent in spanish, he started a full-bore conversation with me in spanish, necessitating a quick explanation of my limited vocabulary. One last anecdote and then I'll stop. The last time we visited, we bought an arbol de la vida (a ceramic "tree of life") from the gift store which by the way, has a wonderful inventory of authentic crafts. We wanted to get a few more of them for holiday gifts and emailed Maroma before our arrival and asked if they could arrange to have a few on premises to choose from and avoid our having to take a taxi to Playa del Carmen. Sure enough, when we arrived the gift shop remembered our request and had brought in an assortment for us to look at. Yes, I know it meant a sale, but to me, that epitomizes the type of individual attention and service that distinguishes this property. There is a sincerity to the service at Maroma that resonates with us. Most seasoned travelers are accustomed to the forced smiles and the subtle (and even not-so-subtle) sense of imposition and resentment that can sometimes accompany a response to request. Similarly, at some places the sincerity seems hyperbolic and uncomfortable and the service hovering and suffocating. Not so here. At Maroma, the smiles seemed genuine, the service at just the right level of "presence", and there was never a moment when we didn't feel welcome and appreciated. Maroma is now our "go to" place for a quick getaway from the northeast. We look forward to our return.

Reviews.Title: “Maroma is Wonderful BUT.....”
Reviews.Author: suzikyp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this resort for 5 days - the first 3 were amazing , the place is beautiful. We stayed in a master suite and it was a nice room , it had a somewhat odd layout and I don't believe I'd bother to stay in a suite next time we visit. And we both said we would decidedly visit this hotel again - The beach is beautiful - the service is amazing. We did a special Mirador dinner and it was fantastic. Our only complaint is that THERE WERE CHILDREN - little , like under 5 years old children - about 5 - 8 of them starting on the last full day of our stay. The resort website CLEARLY states that children aren't allowed under the age of twelve - but we were told that the up coming weekend a wedding was taking over the resort and the children were part of this wedding . In my opinion the resort should have informed guests that this was going to be the case ahead of time - our final night the bar was completely over run by wedding guests and it made us feel as if we were intruding on someone elses party - OH and there was a toddler in the bar.... So we would decidedly return - but I would insure first that there was NOT going to be a wedding at the hotel any time around booking my stay

Reviews.Title: “WHATEVER YOU PREFER”
Reviews.Author: wafflemom
Reviews.Content: The title of our review is the phrase we were told every time we made a request. We are here for my husband's 41st birthday. We try to go on an adult trip every other year by ourselves. We read about maroma 10 years ago in a travel article but never dreamed we would someday be here. Three children later a friend mentioned this place and we revisited the idea. Within one month we were here. We are on day 2 of our dream vacation and NOT disappointed. The beach covered in powder like sand without shells. The water is like bathwater. There are small waves in the afternoons. We spent many hours just floating in the water today. The service is exceptional. Moses is our favorite so far. He truly wants everything to be "special". As stated by others these people make you feel like they would do anything to make every moment unforgettable. The spa couples massage was wonderful today (my husband's first massage) The rainforest setting is magical. We spent time separately in the sauna, steam room and plunge pool then sat outside near the waterfall in complete serenity. Tonight we went to try Freddy's famous margaritas. We were not disappointed! We had appetizers and skipped dinner. We think the menu variety is superb. If you don't like what they have they will make you anything you want. Last night we selected our own fish and side items. Try the caesar and tortilla soup!! Tomorrow we plan on snorkeling about 1mile off shore at the world's second largest barrier reef. As for our accommodations: we stayed in cilantro and splurged for a master beach front suite no 56. It is the top suite at the right end. It is upstairs and has the best view. We can see the pool to our left and the ocean for miles. We highly reccomend this resort/spa and can't wait to come back. We are here two weeks before high season begins and a great special taking place. There are less than 20 people here and at times we feel like we have the whole resort to ourselves. I have dreamed of staying in a bungalow style resort and this is it!! Steps away to the water. Did I mention that the last night they are doing a candlelit dinner on the beach for us? I can only imagine how "special" moses will make it for us!!

Reviews.Title: “I'm running out of Superlatives”
Reviews.Author: benandtara
Reviews.Content: We went to Maroma Resort and Spa as "refugee's" from an all-inclusive. I had heard about it on some TV show about beach resorts. Had we not gone there this would have probably been our last and only trip to Mexico. Now we cant wait to go back. These reviews are not hype. Someone has to be the best and when it comes to beach resorts, Maroma is clearly the best. Of course I have not been to every beach resort in the world and I'm sure there are many wonderful places to stay scattered a round the globe, but these people are clearly the best at what they do. They don't just make you feel welcome, they truly welcome you. It feels like at every turn someone is there looking for another way to be sure you enjoy yourself. Every smile is genuine including yours! In a resort of this quality it comes down to details... a simple example, Every day at breakfast they offer a blend of juices and they change the blend every day for variety. One morning my wife mentioned she liked the blend from the day before, so they made a batch for her and a few minutes later they brought her some... she never asked for it.. they did it because she said she liked it. Imagine every aspect of a vacation being handled like that one little thing and you will start to get an idea what it is like to be at Maroma. I'm sure this resort will please even the fussiest of travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Like in Paradise.......”
Reviews.Author: cocarast
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week at Maroma and it was an incredible time. . Maroma is just one of those places where you can forget about everything and relax from the moment you wake up till you go to sleep. The Hotel is hidden behind a fantastic tropical forest located right at the beach. I think it is one of the only Hotels at the Riviera Maya that has an intimate size with an highly personalized service. The beach is as well one of the most beautiful at the Reviera. The sand is white and the water is like a turquoise colored swimming pool. The hotel has a very special arquitecture mixed with the mayan cultural elements. We took as well two sessions at the Spa. It was just so relaxing and amazing. The spa is hidden within the tropical forest…it’s unique. The service was spectacular, everybody is so friendly and they make you feel very special. The meeting point was Freddy Bar, where you can enjoy a fantastic selection of Tequilas and great Drink mixed up by Freddy. It was the first time for us at Morama, but definitely not the last time….we will come back

Reviews.Title: “2nd time - it's the same world class resort but a few things to improve”
Reviews.Author: PedroPortugal
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time in Maroma. I stayed in an Sian N´ah Suite my first time and in an ocean front junior suite this time. The grounds and the beach are awsome. Service level is very good and this is a top resort that I would recommend. There were a few details during my stay that I would recommend Maroma to improve. The food is of good quality although for a 5 day stay the menu is somewhat repetitive. Specially deserts - I know it's maybe a silly detail but for me food indulgence is part of the vacation experience. The dessert menu didn´t change during my stay - always the same few options for lunch and dinner. Apart from theme nights the main restaurant's menu is always the same. However I have to say that Breakfast is excellent. Almost all staff in both restaurants are very friendly however we did find one of them to be rude and always had an angry face, so we just avoided his area of service - no big deal but when paying 1000USD a night you would expect consistent service from all employees. Something that really upseted us was that on the left side of the hotel there is a cheminee and they burned something there every afternoon during our stay (I have no idea what). The problem is that the wind is coming from that direction so we couldn´t stay in our terrace during the afternoon because of the smoke and smell. We made a comment to a staff member but nothing was done about it. Regarding the rooms, both were really nice. However the water of the plunge pool in the Sian Nah suite is very cold, so we didn´t used it - therefore I would say that the junior suite is better value for money. Again, this is an excellent resort, one of the best in the Caribbean... but I think that when you reach the level of 1000USD per night all the details matter - But I have confidence that Maroma management will try to improve these!

Reviews.Title: “Estupendo”
Reviews.Author: voyageur à paris
Reviews.Content: Maroma is a beautiful hotel,where the service is impeccable. We recently spent a week there with our two daughters and had the holiday we had imagined. After a week of crossing the Yucatan, pulling into the Maroma was like coming home. The staff were warm and friendly, and could have done nothing more to make our stay memorable. We booked adjoining suites with a sea view and had more than enough space. The view from our 3d floor terrace was beautiful, and since there are no televisions in the rooms (a huge plus, from my point of view) there is plenty of time to admire the sea or just be with your travel companions. The two restaurants at the property (one European, one Mayan) are very good, but they should try and vary the menus over the course of a week, because the selections are somewhat limited. The beachside bar, while small, has an incredible selection of tequilas, and Freddy the barman shakes up a mean margherita. The beach at the Maroma is very well maintained, and the beach service is excellent. The dive shop is staffed by a great team, and the diving possibilities are great: reef, wrecks, cenotes....The spa is one of the nicest facilites I've seen anywhere in my travels, and the treatment menu is innovative and well priced.

Reviews.Title: “Cultura, comida y gente increible.....not your cookie-cutter Mexican experience”
Reviews.Author: Pepino_78
Reviews.Content: There are not so many vacations you go on that you feel obliged to send a thank you to the region Managing Director of the hotel. Below is a long excerpt from that note that I would like to share, and encompasses everything you would need to know about La Maroma. I will say we were a little hesitant to explore Mexico during these times, but with anything, use your common sense and stay away from those areas of concern. You can rest assure that you will find your peace and tranquility at La Maroma. To add one extra note, the spa located at La Maroma is exquisite, refined and done right. I will not tell you much more, only that your experience will be as memorable and unique as ours: "Dear Senor **Managing Director Orient-Express, Mexico* I wanted to take the time to forward on our personal appreciation and thanks to you and the family at Maroma. With so many commercialized cookie cutter hotels available, it is comforting to know that your little family that has become ours, still know how to add the correct personalized warmth you rarely see. After a tiring morning traveling to Mexico, our "experience" began from the initial pick-up at the airport in Cancun. There, we were greeted by an attentive polite gentleman whose welcome to Mexico set the stage to what awaited us at Maroma Resort and Spa. Upon our arrival, Laura's welcome, as well as our refreshing Margarita Maroma's, to the hotel began our journey that would last for our week's stay. Our week in paradise consisted of superb food personalized to tastes, outstanding service and a very special feel of traditional timeless warmth. Everything from the architecture to the original furniture and pottery throughout the hotel, and especially our discussions of Mayan language and culture from our hosts has made our five-year anniversary one that is all honesty surpassed our expectations and will forever be immortalized in our memory. I would like to take some time to thank particular friends that we will always be thankful for making our stay "perfecto": Senor Ansielmo, whose morning "special" Mayan comida and discussions of his culture began our daily journey with guava juice and a smile Senor Moises, whose friendliness and attentiveness to our every detail made it hard for us to say bye A very special note of thanks and appreciation to my amigo nuevo Filiberto, who really took the time to establish for me an appreciation for tequila. From sangrita's of mango, tomate y tamarindo that I never knew of, to the recognition of the tastes and essences of a reservado y un anejo that I will always remember whenever I order tequila. A great deal of thanks to Senor Manuel from hospitality for setting up a perfect adventure to Coba, Tulum, the Cenotes, and Playa de Carmen. His assurance in making our day memorable and unique by setting up our day with senora Gabriela Calderon Aviles (Guide*) and senor Johnathan (Taxi), is one that we will always remember. Our adventures with Johnathan and Gabby not only ended with over 100 pictures for us the remember, but also a wealth of knowledge that we could never have experienced alone as well as a special lunch at Don Cafeto with senor Johnathan. I hope that this letter tells you how special your family has touched us and has become a piece of our family. Our week in paradise was not noted by grandiose buffets, commercialized experiences and bad tequila, but will forever be engraved in our memory with and indescribable subtle genuine perfection of culture, tradition, food and people (all noted above). It is in rare circumstances that you are able to name all the individuals that actually make your stay so unique as Maroma has made it for us." **Gabriela Calderon Aviles (gcalderon@mistikterra.com), www.mistikterra.com, was our guide and now our friend. Her knowledge, passion and expertise of Mayan culture, language and tradition, is one that left us speaking Mayan (few phrases) well after our vacation ended. Buon Viaggio y Bien Viaje....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway... Cannot Wait To Return”
Reviews.Author: srosssimon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from Maroma and for the first time in our extensive and by most anyone's standards extravagant travels, I felt compelled to write this review! Before going on this vacation, I was torn between Rosewood Mayakoba and Maroma, to the point that we were going to split our time between the two.... thank goodness we were swayed by reports of a beautiful beach and no kids allowed and chose to stay solely at Maroma. The service at this hotel is absolutely extraordinary... as one would expect from an Orient Express Hotel.... truly world class. We heard reports of small rooms, which was easily remedied by getting a Master Suite, which they then upgraded us from to an even larger and more impressive suite right on the sand... spectacular and huge. The beach is amazing, the spa is great.... but what makes this a special place is the staff... they could not have been nicer, more accommodating, or professional. We had two days of rain, so Manuel, the concierge set up an itinerary for us of things to do in the pouring rain... they were the highlights of out trip! I am admittedly difficult and discriminating and came away from this resort being thoroughly impressed and cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Relaxing Weekend of My Life”
Reviews.Author: byoho23
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Maroma for a family member's wedding celebration. The entire resort was rented out and the service was beyond first class. My wife and daughter had never traveled overseas before and I fear that this experience has spoiled them for future trips. I would highly recommend this trip to anyone who needs a relaxing getaway, and while the prices may be high, the service and amenities will make it worth your while.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel on the Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: farrago
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife for 4 nights. We were picked up at the airport by hotel staff and driven in a luxury suburban. Service was efficient getting us to the hotel and checking us in. We had a large oceanfront room that was over the bar / overlooking the restaurant area. The room itself was very nice, comfortable and had a great balcony to view the beach and ocean. The toilet was behind "saloon-style" doors, which was a bit odd and did not quite provide privacy (but I would not say this detracted from the overall comfort of the room, though.) The grounds of the hotel are quite nice and well maintained. Several pools make it nice for a "change of scenery". Quite honestly, though, we spent the vast majority of our time sitting on one of the large, incredibly comfortable beach beds staring at the ocean, ordering drinks and food. The beach was very clean (swept each morning by hotel staff), and the water was calm and beautiful. The beach service was very good, bringing us cool towels and water in the morning; more towels and ice cream treats in the afternoon. The beach and pool areas were not crowded at all, though there were plenty of people at the restaurant at dinner. We figured the additional people were staying in one of the many large villas with their own pools and beach area. We enjoyed the resort so much we didn't leave the entire stay. The food was tasty, upscale Mexican. My wife is strict vegetarian -- the menus, as well as the chefs offered her some selections. Having delicious coffee delivered to the room each morning to be enjoyed on the balcony was also a nice touch. The spa was nice and the gym was fine. We did the temazcal, which is similar to a sweat lodge where you go into a special hut with a small group of people and an instructor/leader. Hot lava rocks are brought in and the room gets progressively hotter. It was a very interesting and enjoyable experience. Hitting the ocean afterward was perfect. Also to mention, we chose it over some of the other luxury hotels in the area because it provides the feel of Mexico (i.e., as opposed to Asia.) All-in-all, I would highly recommend Maroma.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here...you will not regret it!”
Reviews.Author: shanmac00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were debating whether to stay at Maroma or an all-inclusive, like Secrets down the beach from Maroma. I am so thrilled that we decided on Maroma as we had such a great vacation there! From the moment you drive up, prepare to feel pampered and genuinely welcomed by the staff at the resort. They are so friendly but the service does not feel forced at all, like I have experienced at other 4-star properties. Even though we were staying at Maroma when they were hosting a wedding with 40 guests, which meant almost a 1/3 of the guests at the property were attending the wedding, we never felt ignored or like we were receiving less than great service due to their focus being on the wedding. I will attempt a detailed review below, as we relied heavily on Tripadvisor when making our decision on where to stay. Rooms: We had an Oceanview room booked through a luxurylink.com package. Room 22...we were in the main building, near El Restaurante. I was concerned at first that there could be noise as a result of being located in the main building, but we never heard a peep at night. The room was on the third floor which meant that our terrace offered maximum privacy. The terrace was comfortably large and included a built-in comfy bench and a table. The room itself was small but more than adequate for our needs. The bed was very comfortable. The A/C worked great and since we like our bedroom extra cold at night we pumped the A/C down alot every night, but it continued to work great the 5 nights we were there. The bathroom, as other reviews have mentioned, was smallish but again, adequate. I would not call the bathroom luxurious by any stretch, but it was comfortable. We thought it offered plenty of privacy, as there was a door that closed off the shower and toilet area from the sink area, contrary to what others have said about other rooms. We liked having no TV in the room. Beach: FANTASTIC! Sand is so soft, and beds are great. We never had a problem getting a beach bed. The service provided at the beach is great too...a mid-morning snack of fruit juice and skewers and ice cream around 2pm...fantastic. Not much else to say about the beach that others have not discussed. Food: As others have said, the food is expensive. And the wine list is not great...we actually had to send a bottle of pinot noir back one night at dinner. But, the quality of the food is great and we did not mind paying for it. The guacamole and homemade chips are great, as was the ceviche. On our last night there was a seafood BBQ, and my husband had the best chilean sea bass he had ever eaten. The hashbrowns at breakfast were not great, but that was literally the only bad thing I had here. We ate every meal at El Restaurante, the main one on the property, and never got bored. The Mexican eggs benedict at breakfast was to die for. Spa: Great, very relaxing. Just walking around the spa is fantastic, it is so peaceful and beautiful. We had massages and facials, and we both agreed the massage was better than the facial. The steamroom and sauna in the locker rooms are also great, and can be used any time. Pools: there are 3 pools on the property. As noted in other reviews the "pool scene" is not what this place is about...stay elsewhere if that is what you want. The pools here are, however, secluded and relaxing, and never crowded. We enjoyed ending our day in the pool with a swim before dinner after a day on the beach...very refreshing. The pool was so close to our room that it felt like we had a private pool, which was great. Bottom Line: If you are trying to decide between Maroma and Secrets, stay here if you want to spend quality time with your significant other for a vacation you won't soon forget. The potential extra expense from the food, drinks, etc will be worth it. We enjoyed not having to fight for beach space, and not having obnoxious people and blasting music around all the time. The staff at this resort really cares about their jobs, which makes staying here so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise found...”
Reviews.Author: mmdesjardins
Reviews.Content: We flew 40 of our family and friends for our wedding in Mexico. Maroma was our first choice after visiting a few other resorts in the area (in Dec. 09). And we were right... Where to begin... The service is really outstanding. All the staff remembered our names, our family member's names and our friends name throughout the whole week. The food is amazing - upscale Mexican cuisine with no fuss. Simple, quality ingredients, fresh, just perfect. The resort is more beautiful than the pictures, the beach is one of the best in the world and so well maintained. Our wedding was perfect, the organization was fun and easy. They never say no... there is always a yes with a solution. The concierge is great, she will arrange anything for you at no greater cost than if you'd book it yourself. I would highly recommend this resort for vacation, honeymoon, weddings... anytime. Seriously, we've travelled a lot around the world but this place is magical. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “What better recomendation than telling you that we came back pregnant!”
Reviews.Author: Aspacia16
Reviews.Content: A must go for sure!!!! Unforgetable place, amazing hotel, service, food, rooms, bed:) Can´t wait to go back and see my Family grow. Thank you so much for all your atentions P.S. from a delighted mexican who loved it in Maroma!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found...the perfect honeymoon!!!”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethAndrade
Reviews.Content: I just don't know where to begin. Maroma Resort & Spa is truly a paradise not to be missed. I had read all of the glorious reviews ahead of time and our experience there far exceeded what I had imagined ahead of time. :) :) :) We stayed at Maroma for our honeymoon for 4 nights and 5 days and it rained every day except for the day we first arrived....and I can STILL say this was the best trip I have ever had and the very best resort I have stayed at. The staff at Maroma is like none other and every person we encountered made us feel like the most special people there. The secluded and private atmosphere makes you feel like a VIP from the start and everyone at Maroma continues that feeling during your stay. We reserved an oceanview room and upon arrival we were upgraded to a beachfront room (Room 29) in the main building and from our window we could see Freddy's bar below and the restaurant off to the right side....we loved it! The rooms had character and we especially enjoyed the nightly turndowns and special letters and notes we would receive. :) We also loved the daily coffee and tea delivery to our room every morning! Considering it rained almost the entire time, we appreciated the location because we were close to everything! :) I ordered a rose petal turndown on our first night and it was absolutely gorgeous and we came home to a super romantic candlelight tub with rose petals....great way to start our honeymoon. ;) We had originally planned to have a private beach dinner as well as a private dinner at the Mirador, but rain cancelled both of those plans...but...Maroma to the rescue. :) Narcisco (who is an absolute treasure!!!) surprised us with a private dinner in the wine cellar the night of the planned beach dinner and the table was decorated so beautifully with flowers....just awesome. :) The night of our planned Mirador dinner, again we were surprised with a beautifully decorated table at El Sol and we were able to have the dinner menu we had originally planned for the beach dinner! Maroma provides so many lovely details during your stay, you can't help but feel loved there. :) We really want to thank Narcisco for helping to make our dinners there so lovely and wonderful....he was a great help throughout our stay and Maroma is very lucky to have him there!!! :) We also want to thank Anselmo for the amazing service he always provided at breakfast every morning....we always looked forward to seeing him. Additionally, Gilberto, Miguel & Pablo were always there greeting us with smiles and warm welcomes and we always appreciated that. :) The few hours we did have sunshine on that first day, we were treated like royalty thanks to Daniel at the beach and Gabriel always greeted us whenever he saw us...he felt like an old friend! :) Although we never got to hang out at Freddy's bar due to the rain, we did finally meet the infamous Freddy indoors and he is as cool as we anticipated. :) We really enjoyed chatting with him! He made me a tamarindo margarita that was out of this world!! Finally, we wanted to thank Jaime and Miguel at El Sol. They both provided excellent, excellent service during our 3 dinners there and in particular, Jaime. :) He is just the sweetest man and he made us feel like kings. It was a joy to see him every evening and he is also a great treasure at Maroma. :) As everyone mentions....the stay will cost you a pretty penny....but it is SO WORTH IT!!!!! :) You can't match that kind of service anywhere else (at least in my experience so far) and the location is just out of this world....from the rooms to the beach.....paradise, paradise, paradise. My husband promised me we will go back one day so we can have our beach dinner and one at the Mirador. :) I can't wait!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I could truly go on and on about every detail of our stay, but you have to have some surprises when you go yourself....so go already!!!! :) :) :) Book a trip and go there now!!! :) :) :) hahaha! Thank you to Maroma for an unforgettable honeymoon!!!! P.S. Don't forget to make a trip to Kinan Spa...my husband and I had massages (Lomi Lomi for me and deep tissue for him) and we were able to have a big room to enjoy the massages side by side AND we got to enjoy time in a jacuzzi decorated (as always) with beautiful flower petals....amazing!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “A Magical Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: landshark75
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed in some very nice high-end hotels over the years. However, the setting and service at Maroma far exceeds anything we have ever experienced. We stayed there for 5 nights in April 2010 to celebrate our 5th wedding anniversary. We chose to rent a Jeep at the airport and make our own way down to the hotel which we're glad we did because it gave us the freedom to come and go as we pleased and take excursions off the property on our own when we wanted. Finding the hotel wasn't easy and we passed up the main entrance several times before locating the main gate. At first this was a little frustrating but when we finally found it the fact that the hotel entranced is not well marked on the main road significantly added to the allure of the place. Many other luxury hotels in the area have monstrous gates that you cannot miss but we loved the seclusion of Maroma and it's long winding gravel road from the main highway to the hotel lobby. It felt like a hidden gem. Upon arrival at the gate, a staff member took our name down and let us through. When we arrived at the main lobby, we were greeted by name and offered complimentary margaritas (the best we've ever tasted; so good in fact that we each ordered one again every day during our stay!). We were given a short tour of the property and led up to our room where we completed the quick check-in process. Our room was an ocean view room on the 2nd floor of a building adjacent to the main building. We were set back a couple hundred feet from the beach which was just far enough to experience the beautiful view and warm ocean breeze while maintaining complete privacy and tranquility. The room was somewhat small by most standards however the size was overcome by ambiance and character and the large balcony out front with two chairs, a table, a built-on sofa along one wall and a very comfortable hammock (which holds two!). We spent quite a bit of time on the balcony and really enjoyed it. We ate breakfast there (room service) every morning except one day when we ate at the restaurant. One thing to note about the room itself! It provides little to no privacy. There is an open shower that doesn't have a shower curtain and the saloon-style door to the bathroom doesn't leave much to the imagination when you or your significant other are using it. However, if you're completely comfortable with your significant other you will not find these items to be a problem. The beach at Maroma is unbelievable. It has the softest sand I have ever felt and is the whitest I have ever seen. Every morning they rake up any weeds or trash that have drifted in from the sea. It is spotless. There are a variety of options for enjoying the beach including large beach beds, loungers and Adirondack chairs under thatch roof umbrellas. I loved sitting in the Adirondack chairs on the beach with a cold margarita and just covering my feet with the cool, soft, clean sand. It was wonderful. On the day of our anniversary, I had previously arranged for my wife and I to have a special private dinner in the Mirador (a tower at the top of the hotel). The 360-degree views of the region and the property were spectacular! The food we were served (prepared by our chef, Felipe) was incredible and the hotel's sommelier gave us a wine pairing with each course that was spot on! Our server Luis (El Conde!) was fantastic and was very good about bringing each course at the right time and making sure that we had everything we needed. This was a very romantic experience and my wife and I cherished every moment of it. Other activities we did at the hotel included horseback riding on the beach (fun but we've had a better horseback riding experience elsewhere), treatments at the Kinan Spa (excellent and very tranquil), snorkeling on the reef (very worthwhile and would definitely do it again) and the Tezmacal (an awesome experience; glad we did it but probably would not do it again). Lastly, a word about the service. We were treated like royalty or celebrities (neither of which we are) every single day! The staff went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. If we wanted to move a chair and I would begin to move it, a staff member would appear quickly from out of nowhere to assist. Any special requests, no problem. We ate at El Sol one night and I ordered something completely off the menu. No problem. The staff seemed able to accommodate our every desire. Definitely go and enjoy Maroma! If you're concerned about reports that the cost is high (and it is) know this: It is worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “No "no's"”
Reviews.Author: AirMilesLuvr
Reviews.Content: After much research & debate over where to stay, we settled on Maroma as it appeared to meet our needs. We were looking for a relatively small/intimate property, not family/children oriented, luxury service & direct beach location. Not only did Maroma meet our needs, it surpassed our expectations! However a fair review you will get. POSITIVES: -Although I've had friends rave about the Bayan & Mandarin Oriental, they completely agree that paying such high prices without being on the beach is ridiculous. We enjoyed the most amazing, uncrowded & clean beach daily from our villa directly on the beach. Fantastic. -During our entire 5 night stay & despite any & every special request we made, we did not hear the word "no". Not even once. We were accommodated each & every time & always with the best of dispositions & warm smile. I've traveled the world, always at 5 star properties & had never before experienced this. -Since the property doesn't allow anyone under 16, we were never disturbed by any children. For those that don't have kids, this is obviously great. But even for those that do, as we met a couple who purposely chose this hotel as their 1st romantic getaway from their infant child & didn't want to be bothered with others'. -The food (even from room service) was great. --The property offers a romantic candlelight dinner on the beach (it's on the website). I highly recommend this dinner for any couple looking to do something special. NEGATIVES: -Although the food is in fact great, it lacks variety. By the 6th day, I don't know of many people who will not be fed up with Mexican food. It is also overpriced, as we paid close to US$20 for a salad that was lettuce with a few tomatoes thrown in. Not kidding. -We reserved a standard room w ocean view. Although this was technically what we were given, the fact that it was in the main building & directly over the restaurant made us feel like we'd be staying in the help's quarters. Not only would the noise never allow you to fall asleep & wake you up the moment they begin serving breakfast, you have zero privacy while on your balcony. We upgraded to a villa whose price ended up being more than what we were originally quoted, but was SO worth it! CONCLUSION: I will overlook the minor imperfections & gladly return to Maroma in an instant!

Reviews.Title: “My most favorite place in the world !”
Reviews.Author: DT7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to this resort at least 6 times over the last several years. When you arrive the staff makes you feel like you are "home". They remember your name, respect your privacy, but at the same time try to please you in every way. We have only stayed in the ocean view room and it is very cozy. The beds are some of the best I have slept on. They are more comfortable than the bed I sleep on at home. My favorite thing there is the Beach. It is awesome!! It may be one of the best anywhere in the world. The sand is soft and white. The color of the Caribbean Sea is turquoise and it is extremely clear. I have a hard time leaving to eat. Speaking of eating, the breakfast is wonderful and it is included with the rate plan. We think the Huevos Motulenos is gourmet. We eat late for breakfast and usually eat a dinner meal as well. The dinner is very good. If you are there during the night they have "grill night", don't miss it. It was gourmet!! They have a snorkle trip to the second largest reef in the world. It is worth the time spent doing this. It is also included. While there do not miss the Spa. It may also be one of the best we have been to. We also have done the Temscel in the past and it is a wonderful experience. I cannot brag enough about the resort, staff, food, our room. If you like the beach this is THE SPOT. There are several things around the area to see and do, but we just cannot leave this place once we get there. I already want to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “a dream come true”
Reviews.Author: cdc2f
Reviews.Content: my husband and i spent 4 amazing nights at maroma and long to return. WARNING: it's a game changer, you will end up comparing all other hotels you stay at (in the future) to maroma. seriously.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: FirstResort
Reviews.Content: “Paradise,” an often overused, and overworked, exaggeration---but not when you are at Maroma. Our ten day stay from March 15 was perfect in every way. --- Maroma’s beach is finest we have ever seen. You can walk for miles in either direction. --- Beach beds of regal feel and design, with always present service for moving the umbrellas, food and drink service, etc. --- Hospitality is a religion there. Everyone is happy to greet you, most by your first name. They satisfy your every wish. --- Food was excellent, with many variations. No problem asking for, and getting, what was not on the menu. --- Our “Special Dinner,” to celebrate our 19th Wedding Anniversary, will always be remembered. The attention to every detail was perfection. --- Clean rooms, and done so in a timely fashion. --- Morning coffee always there, on time, and piping hot. --- Great touch, with a phone button for “At Your Service,” to immediately have a positive and prompt response to any need. --- Extensive and beautiful grounds making any walk anywhere a real pleasure. --- Hundreds of tea light candles set on the edges of all walk paths, especially artistic when going to and from dinner. And much more than we can possibly say.

Reviews.Title: “Still Magic, maybe even better than ever!”
Reviews.Author: Lemonesq
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned yesterday from what was perhaps the most enjoyable and relaxing vacation we have had in the last several years. Having been enchanted by Maroma during our first visit in 2004 and lucky enough to have stayed in the same room that Tom Cruise occupied, we had always intended to return for the special type of hospitality offered by this beautiful resort. True, there had been not one but two hurricanes in the tim since our visit and the hotel had been devastated by both. Also true that two other resorts, one an all-inclusive, had been built just down the beach. How would they impact the scene? We frankly wondered if our little slice of Mexican heaven would be the same, which explains why we tried Villa del Sol in Zuatinejo, Sandy Lane and Cap Juluca numerous times, before returning. While those other resorts offer their own special experiences (we remain concerned about Cap Juluca's new ownership and plans to expand) we can report that Maroma has pretty much covered all the bases and offers two things the others don't: (1) greatly improved fitness and spa services, along with expanded choices for eating and (2) the most sincere and friendly staff we have yet had the pleasure to experience. Names? Oh yes, Moses at Cilantro waited on us for breakfast and lunches, with attentive, perfect service, always followed with "it is my pleasure [to serve you]". Knew our names and remembered them, knew our likes and introduced us to the pleasures of Pineapple an Chaya, a most refreshing drink like no other. Then there is Anselmo, who works at other primary (casual) restaurant (next to del Sol). He was certainly special in his own way, charming, friendly, a great story teller and a local of Mayan ancestry who personally directed a special ordered Mayan breakfast on our last day, taught us Mayan phrases and introduced us to his brother, also a waiter. Anselmo and Moses were stand-outs in a stellar staff, and hopefully if those at the resort are reading this, they will be lauded for their efforts. We again met Nancy who operates the Temazcal (clay pyramid sauna). I will not describe it here as it is well characterized by others on the site and in the Maroma webpage. I will say that we have now done it three times (2 x in 2004, 1x last week) and highly recommend it to anyone who is curious about Mayan culture, are organic-oriented eaters or enjoy Yoga and the like. It's a wonderful experience and Nancy is truly devoted to her craft. Everyone else, including the woman who sits at a stool and makes tamale shells in a clay pot (she'll show you if you'd like to make them yourself), all five stars. The Kinan Spa, which had not been built the last time we visited was a place we spent too much time and money, but it was well worth it. Rueben performs a Thai massage that is relaxing in the extreme. We also had chocolate-based massages followed by a couples jacuzzi, and a couples 80 minute massage, all perfectly executed. The spa is architecturally in harmony with the Mayan theme and a place to easily spend an entire day reading or sitting by a pond of trickling water. Our trip was a perfect 10 out of 10, off to a great start when the hotel was unable to honor our request for the "Tom Cruise suite" this time around, and instead upgraded us to a villa-sized suite with private gym, his and hers dressing areas, inside and outside showers, soaking tub, 270 degree ocean view living room, king sized bed, day bed outside, hammock, two ponds, fully stocked wine cellar and snack bar and privacy, privacy privacy!!! We can't wait to go back this Summer! True, it's not inexpensive, but it does deliver on everything you can hope for, and more.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: kcs0331
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Maroma and were upgraded to an ocean view room free of charge. The staff was incredible and attentive to all our needs. The food and atmosphere was perfect. We just booked our trip to go back.

Reviews.Title: “As close to perfect....”
Reviews.Author: Hamilton6
Reviews.Content: I would echo many of the positive reviews on this property. And offer the observation that when one’s expectations are so very high and there are so many opportunities for lapses, there will undoubtedly be some. But in my opinion, they are minor and do not affect my overall perception that this place is pretty darn close to perfection. The transportation from the airport went well. Don’t be distracted by the gauntlet of private transportation companies trying to convince you that you need to deal with them to secure your ride. We had a comfortable vehicle with cool facecloths and water. Upon arrival, we were given a marguerita and a tour of the premises. Our guide was a well-meaning and pleasant intern. Being in a service business myself, I understand how important first impressions are, and I would not have had a guest be met and introduced to the property by an intern. While fine, she naturally lacked some of the polish I would have expected, and I wonder if some of our uncertainty about various services would have been clarified at this juncture. We had paid for an oceanfront room and received one (#32) in the main, older building. The difference between cozy and cramped is a matter of perspective. This was right on the line. We did ask our intern guide about a possible room change but she never got back to us. The great part about the room, however, was its convenience to the beach, the bar, and the restaurants. We could easily drop in and out during the day to check email or whatever. I guess the message is to try to find out in advance what room availability is and try to snag one that meets your preferences. Kudos to the property for having free facility-wide wi-fi. In fact, I’m sitting at the outdoor bar at 6:30 am right now doing this review in draft. Service is amazing. The guy washing the floor behind the bar just asked if I would like any coffee. It seems like everyone here is committed to guest satisfaction. They all make an effort to learn guests’ name and call them by name at every opportunity. Coffee/tea arrives as promised on our patio every morning. And, yes, there are candles along the walkways still. Turn down took place every night while we were at dinner. A shout-out here to Carlos and Fili, the nighttime bartenders. Carlos is an amiable host at the outdoor bar (where we stopped enroute to dinner every night) and makes the world’s best bloody mary. This was our first “relaxing” vacation where a big part of the day is spent doing nothing on the beach. This is a perfect place for that. The beach is immaculate and uncrowded. Of course people from other properties walk along the water, but hey, it’s a public beach and it’s not a big deal. In fact, as we walked up and down the beach, it made us appreciate the quality of our own beach even more. And the mid-morning cool drink and the afternoon sorbet cone (hopefully these won’t show up on our bill!) were nice touches and exemplify the small details that in the aggregate make this such an extraordinary place. Someone earlier mentioned hearing music at night from an adjacent property. That happened to us one night (out of six) also. It wasn’t so bad, but I did talk (not complain) to the manager so I could get some information to pass along in this review. Apparently, that is the second time this has happened, and it’s not the adjacent hotel per se, but private parties that it hosts. As you will see when you walk the beach, the other hotel is much more a spring break destination than Maroma! Maroma management is jumping on the problem and working with management of the other property, and I would not worry about it. And kudos to the management for taking the time to talk with me about it. They most assuredly care about preserving the very high and well-deserved reputation of the property and take the observations of guests quite seriously. We abandoned our commitment to vegging on the beach for 6 days to take two trips off premises. We took a taxi to Playa del Carmen for an afternoon to see the town and hopefully pick up some hand-crafted pieces that serve as souvenirs of our various travels. Sadly, it is a pretty tacky place, and the shops that Fodors had recommended for such things were long gone. We did find (and recommend) two places for better quality items. The first is Yulunga, located at Calle 14 Norte off 5th Avenue, with beautiful and fairly priced handcrafted silver jewelry made by the co-owner. The other shop we liked was Caracol, on 5th between Calle 6 and 8, offering a wide variety of quality Mexican crafts, including a selection of ceramic arbol de la vida (trees of life), which we had never seen before. We were pleased to find that the shop on the hotel premises itself had high quality crafts and other items as well, staffed by very knowledgeable and friendly salespeople. Unlike most high-end hotel shops, the offerings were priced quite competitively and fairly. We also took a day trip to Chichen Itza (we got the CI package for 3 of our nights here, which I think is cheaper than paying for the trip by itself when dinner is added in). We also had the Richard/Galo combination and enjoyed the trip very much. It would be hard to imagine being this close and not seeing this stunning sight. Finally, a word about the food. As mentioned before, the restaurant staff was attentive and professional and service was fine. The live music every night was a nice touch. The food itself, however, was just ok, and pretty expensive for the quality, which was, frankly, less than we expected. Although Maroma itself is very expensive (and worth it!), we were not keen to overpay for food on top of it, and the logistics of eating off premises are difficult. The trick here, which we learned a few days into our stay, is that there is no need to limit yourself to the menu offered, so you can get something light. Our strategy was to eat breakfast (included in the room charge) late in the morning, skip lunch, and order off the lighter and less expensive lunch menu at dinner, which was just fine with the restaurant. It’s not like we were burning calories big time sitting on the beach, so eating a big meal at dinner wasn’t a high priority. Mid-afternoon on some days, we did succumb to the Maroma nachos at the beach bar; they are delicious and held us over nicely. We didn’t use the spa, but everyone who did absolutely raved about it. It is a beautiful facility. My wife took the yoga class one morning and reports that it’s not for novices, but was in a spectacular setting and the instructor was very good. She reports (I wouldn’t know) that the fitness center was very well equipped. A one-hour walk on the beach provides a good workout as well. We have traveled the world extensively and stayed in some of the nicest properties. Except for the room size and food, Maroma met our very high expectations handily. We recommend it without reservation. It’s now 7:15 am, and I’m watching two guys raking up the very small amount of seaweed that washed up on the edge of the beach last night. A fair metaphor for the attention to detail Maroma provides.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: greenwahoo
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Maroma and were so sad to leave. We have stayed at 5-star hotels around the country and the world and this is one of the best. We had a fantastic experience. Maroma is nestled in a beautiful jungle setting that opens up onto one of the most prestine white sand beaches I have ever seen. From the moment you arrive it is clear that this vacation is all about you. The bellmen are all extremely helpful and courteous. Our room upon arrival was gorgeous. We had a beautiful third story view of the ocean. The beds are adorned with mosquito netting and have a very romatic feel. We were in the main house - the original home from which the resort evolved. It has amazing old world charm with all the comforts you could want. Each morning tea/coffee is delivered to your door at a specified time. The beach is amazing. It is well groomed with people constantly cleaning even the most minor amounts of seaweed. The water is warm and relatively calm. Maroma has lots of beach beds set up as well as chairs set up under thatch huts. The staff is extremely attentive. They set up your towels for you in the morning, constantly check to see if you want drinks or food and there is a free sorbet offered in the afternoons. Just great. There are three pools. One by the Cilantro restaurant, one by the spa and another just off the beach. All are well kept and the one by the beach is nice and warm for a post-beach swim. At night, the main pool at least was surrounded by candles for a very romantic setting. The restaurants are overall very good. El Restaurant is quite good although some additional variation would be nice, although they do "grill nights" on Mondays and Fridays to mix things up. While there isn't a lot of variation for breakfast, we thought it was great. There is enough of a difference from Cilantro to El Restaurant to keep it interesting for our one week stay. The best part of breakfast is the women making fresh tortillas and brining them directly to your table still warm. El Sol is a bit overpriced since it is on par with El Restaurant, but the food is very good and its a nice change of pace. We didn't feel the need to leave the property to eat and it seems that many of the guests with us felt the same since we saw the same folks at dinner each night. The outdoor bar is also a great treat. The civiche is excellent and Carlos and Fili (the two evening bartenders) are great fun and very knowledgeable about their tequila. I would say this is primarily a couples focused resort. While there were some families there with older children, I would expect they may get bored in the evenings as it is a bit quiet and there are only two common TVs. There are lots of activities during the day. We had a great snorkeling trip, essentially private with only one other small group, that is close by and beautiful. We did a private tour of Chitzen-Itza which is well worth it. Our tour guide and driver, Galo and Richard, were so friendly and knowledgeable and the ruins are a once in a lifetime experience. We highly recommend doing this. Other than that we primarily enjoyed the resort - the tennis courts, the beach, the pool and enjoyed the peace and quiet for a week. Playa del Carmen is close by and there are some good restaurants there but in our opinion it was somewhat chaotic and the local vendors are somewhat aggressive and we were very happy to return back to Maroma. The one thing to be aware of is the Maroma is expensive, but you get what you pay for. We thought every dollar was well worth it. I have read many of the reviews on this site before going and since returning and think many of them are spot on but I think the ones that give low marks are being overly critical. As with any place, if you want to find flaws, you will. It is set in a jungle setting, there are going to be a few bugs here and there, but nothing that should disturb your stay. The restaurants can be a bit repetative, but if you do ask, the staff is more than willing to bring you something different. Sometimes it does take 5 minutes to get a drink when sitting on the beach, but you're on vacation, I never saw this as a problem. We always felt like everyone there was striving to give us the best stay possible and succeeded. We would absolutely return to Maroma and recommend it to all of our friends. As you arrive the attendants say to you "Welcome home" and this is truly how we felt while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beach - Service and food need upgrading”
Reviews.Author: Travelscambuster
Reviews.Content: We have now had a week to reflect on our experience at Maroma. Overall we enjoyed our stay but do have a few comments and suggestions that significantly improve the overall experience. We want to provide a balanced review because clearly Maroma has a lot of things going for it, especially the beach and overall setting. We thought our pick up, greeting and check-in process were outstanding. We arranged to be picked up at the Ritz Carlton in Cancun and thought that the incremental fee charged for this deviation was reasonable and appropriate. We were disappointed in our original room. It was much too small for 2 people considering that we were staying for 5 nights. There was nowhere to put our luggage and my wife and I kept bumping into each other in such a small space. There was only one chair in the room and therefore only room for one person to sit down at a time unless we used the bed. This room was much more appropriate for a single. We had to upgrade to a junior suite (at an additional cost). The suite did have an ocean view, but only barely. While the suite was much roomier, the only seating was 2 very uncomfortable straight back chairs. A small couch or love seat would have been much more appreciated and would have easily fit into the same space. We booked our trip through Expedia and felt that due to the discounted price we paid through them we were given a substandard room. We thought the beach was world class. The couches, palapas and service at the beach were outstanding. Also the late morning complementary cold beverage of the day and mid-afternoon ice cream snack were great! Special kudos to Sergio, his service was terrific. He knew our names and preferences after one day. Overall we were disappointed with the food quality and especially the pricing. The breakfast menu never varied and got to be boring after the first couple of days. The fresh tortillas were outstanding. Lunch was the best meal, especially the cevice. The lunch menu also had good variety and was reasonably priced. Dinner was a big disappointment in terms of menu, variety and especially price. Why in the world would you think that a lobster dinner was worth $85.? We ate at the Mandarin Oriental one evening in their top restaurant and paid $42. for lobster. We ate at Pavo Real just outside the main gate of Maroma and paid $35 for lobster. BTW - Pavo Real was a great find. It is a beautiful restaurant, in a great setting, reasonable prices and excellent service. The menu is somewhat limited, but the food is at least as good as Maroma and in many cases much better. Maroma never mentions Pavo Real when you ask for restaurant recommendations because once people try it there would be no reason to eat dinner at Maroma. Several other guests discouraged us from eating at El Sol (Maroma's top restaurant) because of quality and price. It was disappointing and inconvienient that we had to go off-site so often for dinner. In general we found the staff to be friendly and attentive. The one exception is the wait staff for breakfast and dinner. While they were friendly they seemed to be poorly trained and disorganized. On multiple occasions we asked for something (a condiment or additional cup of coffee or juice) and it never arrived or we had to ask for it again. They seemed willing to please, but clearly lacked the ability to provide the type of service that you would expect at an Orient Express property. We never used the Spa (not our thing) but did tour it and it appeared to be world class. Would we come back? Probably. However, we would hope that some of these issues were corrected so that the property lives up to what we expect in every area when we book a resort with the Orient Express name attached to it.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful place...but, not as good as last year”
Reviews.Author: tjandfv
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our second stay at Maroma Resort. We went last year the same time (end of Feb first few days of Mar) and loved it so much we returned this year. While we were very pleased to have a wonderful oceanfront room this year and terrific weather, we were disappointed to experience a decline in service. Housekeeping services were definitely not as good as last year. Our first full day, we returned to the room at 2:30pm to find housekeeping had not yet cleaned the room. I had to call to request service. And, turn down service was almost non-existent. Three of our five nights we returned to the room after dinner to find it was not done. One night we saw the staff downstairs and she told us to return in 30 minutes. The next night I called and they came and cleaned while my husband and I stayed on the terrace. Our last night we returned after dinner to find the room not turned down but, we did not bother calling since we had to pack. Someone came at 9:30pm to turn down but we did not have them bother. Also, the service in the restaurants and on the beach just was not as attentive as it was last year. It was obvious that there was not enough help. This year there seemed to be quite a few smokers on the beach and at the outdoor restaurant.....cigars and cigarettes!! At this level of hotel, Maroma should be smoke-free. Lastly, last year candles lit the walkways everywhere every night. This year that did not happen during our stay. One night there were not candles on the sidewalks and the other nights varied as to how many were out. We missed the full effect of the previous year. Please know the waiters and all staff that are there are nice, helpful and always ready to try to meet your needs. But, the management seems to have decided to go with fewer employees.....definitely a mistake if they want to continue to attract those who are willing to pay the rates at a place such as Maroma. One last suggestion we have is that Maroma consider a little more creativity with the menu. Since there is really only one restaurant for breakfast, lunch and dinner, some variation would be good. On the positive....Maroma is a gorgeous setting with lovely rooms and a beautiful, soft sand beach with beautiful water. The beach beds are wonderful, the spa is very luxe and the staff does its very best to accommodate your requests. Hopefully, Maroma's management will address some of the above issues. We would love to return next year. We'll see.....

Reviews.Title: “Gem is more polishedWe”
Reviews.Author: sunsfanatic
Reviews.Content: We returned this year to find the amenities still excellent and the food just as good. Last year I wrote that this wonderful place needed at least one of its pools to be heated for cold days. Well we found that the main pool this year had water in the 90's which was great since the ocean was too cold to swim in and the weather was windy and overcast several days. Kudos to the management as we swam every day!

Reviews.Title: “Special”
Reviews.Author: mrc25
Reviews.Content: I researched Riviera Maya hotels quite a bit before booking Maroma. Still, I didn't know exactly what to expect. I hate the feeling of booking a very expensive hotel and ultimately being disappointed, which seems all too frequent. Happily, Maroma surpassed expectations in all areas. It has an intangible qualities which are hard to put into words in a review; it feels very exclusive but quietly so, very elegant in an old-world way, amazingly beautiful and truly classic with seamless service. When you check in, it is all about you. They wisk your bags away, hand you a drink, and tour you around the property. The small amount of paperwork gets done once you arrive in your room, rather than standing in the lobby. We stayed in a garden-view room, which was lovely and charming but not luxurious. It had a sweet terrace overlooking a beautiful pool and gorgeous landscaping. Turn-down service happened every evening when we were at dinner, and was never a bother. Morning coffee service was like clockwork. Our room was close to the spa, which turned out to be a real advantage. We had breakfast each morning (included in room price) at Cilantro, the spa restaurant. It was a beautiful setting and delicious, healthy food. The spa itself was absolutely gorgeous, and even if you don't have any formal treatments, you can enjoy the relaxing steam room, sauna, and plunge pool-which are all easily accessible on a complimentary basis for all guests. Food at El Restaurante was good, though service varied. Restaurant service seems to be the holy grail of the hotel world. It ranged from very good to somewhat indifferent. Perhaps that staff didn't get the same memo that everyone else did, because by and large the staff was amazing-friendly and helpful. The beach service is over the top, and the beach beds make you feel like royalty. They deliver your food on a tray to your beach bed, which is a very decadent experience. The hotel is more spread out than I expected, but everything is within easy walking distance. Strolling over to the main building at night for dinner was one of the best parts of staying at Maroma. The paths are lined with hundred and hundreds of small candles, and it is hauntingly beautiful and very romantic. My husband and I marveled at the effort involved in doing this every night. It is just one of those touches that makes you feel that you are at a very special place. When you arrive at the main building, a wonderful group of Mexican musicians are playing in the gorgeous lobby. Maroma is an expensive hotel, but it feels exclusive and pampering in a very elegant way. I highly recommend it for a relaxing and luxurious get-away.

Reviews.Title: “Dreamy”
Reviews.Author: jll1960
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this trip to celebrate a big birthday of mine. Our 16 year old son was with us. We have done some pretty deluxe traveling, and Maroma is the best resort I have been to in a long time. They accommodated our every desire: when we checked into our room there was no hammock on the terrace, so they put one in. On my birthday they weren't serving dinner outdoors because it was cold, so they lit a fire and served us dinner. When we didn't want to eat off the menu, they made us whatever we wanted. Nothing was a problem. Our son was the only kid at the resort until another family showed up. What could have been awkward for him was made so comfortable by the friendliest staff on earth. We felt like we were leaving friends behind. Our room was gorgeous, the food was good, the beach is perfect...the weather wasn't great but we were still unbelievably happy. I will remember this trip forever.

Reviews.Title: “Good Luck if you made a reservation there!--You might not get to go”
Reviews.Author: Chaseferrari
Reviews.Content: I haven't actually arrived at Maroma but am writing to inform all of you of a very frustrating practice of the hotel, before I even got there. I made my reservation on January 9, 2010, to visit Maroma Resort the third week of May. I paid my deposit (approximately $1500) on the day I made my reservation and I bought airline tickets. I just got a call from the hotel, informing me that the hotel just booked a wedding that has reserved the entire resort, and they asked me to change my dates, since the wedding party is going to basicaly be taking over the whole hotel. I advisd them that changing dates is not an option.
