I booked my flights, and our work responsibilities have been taken care of, and I have lined up care for my 4 year old son so that my husband and I could travel for 4 days. The hotel rep repeatedly asked me if I could change dates. When I said for the 5th time that changing dates was not an option, he told me he would look into alternate accomodations at another hotel in the area. Unfortunatley, he mentioned Rosewood Mayakoba, which I have already visited. So, now I am stuck with plane tickets and no hotel. Let's face it... no one wants to go to a hotel where the entire facility, including beach, restaurant, all rooms, spa, is catering to one event. I am just so frustrated. I have never heard of something like this and the fact that the only thing he kept recomending was that I change my dates is unacceptable. I should get a full refund PLUS interest plus a very nice room in a comparable hotel plus perks for this hassle. I will never visit Maroma Resort.... So if you have a reservation with them, watch out. This could happen to you and all they will keep insisting to you is that you change your dates. How easy for them!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel....but”
Reviews.Author: lobco
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself have been coming to the area for 18 years but this was our first stay at Maroma Resort. We have stayed at many hotels in the 100 mile stretch between cancun and tulum. It is a beautiful hotel on a beautiful beach. Really classy, awesome landscaping, gorgeous rooms and views, and very expensive. I have no problem with super expensive hotels, but I do expect certain levels of service for high room rates. These are my beefs. 1. I stayed for 4 nights and got turndown service on 1 out of 4 nights which is pretty much not acceptable. Everynight my husband and I left our room at dinner time to return 3 to 4 hours later, to come back to our made bed and dirty towels on the floor. Good hotels know when you leave for dinner and come sneak in and turn down your bed. They did not at Maroma. However someone would call at about 9:30 and ask if we wanted turndown service and the maid would knock on the door after we were in bed.So I didn't think this was to cool for a 5 star hotel that is supposed to anticipate your needs. 2. The first morning we went down to have breakfast outside on the dining patio .It is quite lovely with fresh bread and fruit delivered to your table, choice of juice and whatever you wanted for breakfast. I sat down and asked for an ashtray. The waiter kind of dissapproving said " You want an ashtray??" gesturing to other guest seated 5 tables away. So I figured you can't smoke OUTSIDE even though you can smoke everywhere else in Mexico, but I was like o.k I won't smoke in the dining room and will have my breakfast in the bar with the ashtrays on the table 20 feet away. No problem. So the next day I asked to be seated in the bar for breakfast.... where we were basically ignored. No fruit, no breadbasket until I asked. Which arrived after the food.On an uneven table.As i got up from my rude breakfast ,low and behold there were people smoking on the dining patio. I think this was totally unacceptable, very rude. The waiter did not try and say that I had to move to a certain section of the dining room to smoke, or try and accomodate me in some way. He just blew me off and made me feel quite unwelcome. It you are selling cigars in the dining room, guest should be allowed to smoke. But it would appear that only I was not allowed to smoke. I don't know why, but it was not cool and pissed me off. 3. The beach service kind of sucked.Understaffed .The beach boys were very nice, but they seemed to have 1 waiter trying to serve 100 people on 1000 feet of beachfront. So you waited a long time for a drink or your food. You had to wait a while for towels or to have your beach bed swept off. You had to move your own 300 lb beach umbrella. I stayed at Esencia last year and if you even tried to move your beach chair the beachboys came flying down the beach at a dead run to move it for you. Here they didn't. 4. Couldn't have dinner in the restaurant because all I had was flipflops and boots ( coming from Maine). No "beach sandals" in the restaurant for dinner. Which is just stupid. They "dress for Dinner". Thanks for letting me know. Again more unwelcoming snotty crap.I understand when its one of the all inclusives trying to keep you out of the sitdown restaurants and in the buffet, but for $600+ a night joint they should let you in with no shoes. So although the hotel is very nice, very intimate and beautiful, I found the service to be lacking, and in my case downright unwelcoming and rude. I would recommend you try Esencia if you want superior service in an elegant setting, without the attitude.

Reviews.Title: “A Top-Quality Boutique Resort”
Reviews.Author: Manny164
Reviews.Content: My wife an I had a most relaxing and thoroughly enjoyable week at the Maroma Hotel. The staff was friendly, service outstanding, the facility impeccably clean. With only 62 rooms, we felt like we were living in a private villa. Amenities include two pools (one nicely heated), a well-equipped gym and a beautifully appointed spa, with a complimentary separate steam, sauna and dipping pool area for men and women. The suites are spacious with ocean views, some have their own dipping pool on the ground level as well a a small personal one on the rooftop. Aim for one of those, otherwise the garden view rooms are small. Food is generally quite good in the everyday restaurant, as well as in the fancy one (Sol). It would be nice if they expanded the menu, especially breakfast and lunch, so that items could be rotated. Playa del Carmen isn't too far - a $20 cab ride one way - where there are some good restaurants to break the monotony.

Reviews.Title: “This place is Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: otterbox
Reviews.Content: We will be back and are looking to make this a yearly week of total relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: MSoca
Reviews.Content: WAO!!!! What a wonderful experience. This place is a small gem hidden at about 20 minutes from the action of Playa del Carmen restaurants, shops and galleries. This is a boutique hotel, very chic and rustic at the same time. Great food and service with magnificent views of the ocean. Our room was a suite with private plunge pool, a treat after a long day of sun and beach activities, the bathroom was a masterpiece with a very private outdoor shower, the turn down service was very romantic and after sunset they lit more than 100 candles to mark the path to the restaurant and the loby, gorgeous. Maroma is perfect for a honeymoon or a getaway from the traditional hotels in Mexico....YOU WILL LOVE IT!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, beautiful, delightful little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: agent10014
Reviews.Content: Beautiful beach, amazing romantic getaway just an hour from the airport. It is the exact opposite of all those giant, glitzy, manufactured large hotel establishments.

Reviews.Title: “If you demand the very best ,this is it!”
Reviews.Author: RS86
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at Maroma and must say it was awesome. We had been there for dinner one night five years ago while staying at a different resort(Ikal del Mar, now The Tides) and always wanted to return. It just so happens I came across a great rate so I couldn't resist. It all starts at the airport when you are picked up in a brand new black Suburban. Once inside you are offered moist hand towels and cold bottled water, great after a long flight! As you turn off the highway you head into the jungle down a long dusty road to paradise. The resort is built right into it's surroundings perfectly. Upon arrival you are given a nice welcome margarhita and a tour of the beatiful grounds. The grounds are kept immaculate. There are three different pools and various spots to lounge about and relax. The largest pool near the entry is heated to an almost hot tub like temp and the other two are cool. Our room was ocean front and very nice. We had a fluffy king size bed and a patio with a hammock. The bathroom was somewhat small but had everything you would need. The beach is amazing with the finest white sand and bluest clean water. They rake the beach every morning. We always had a lounger and the guys would bring you anything you want to eat or drink. Now I must say a word about the staff. They are the nicest people ever and will do anything you could possibly want. They remember your name and are very happy to help but never in your way. I miss these guys already as we made friends with many of them. The food is very good. I think the prices were a little high for some of the basic Mexican stuff but everything we had was great. We had a private dinner in the wine cellar with a tasting menu and wine pairing, amazing!! The spa is very nice and offers all the good stuff. I really can't say enough about Maroma. We have stayed at many great resorts but I don't think it can get any better than this one. We will certainly go back again. To sum it up you have to pay a good bit but you get what you pay for and can't go wrong with Maroma.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: bostontraveler20
Reviews.Content: The resort is situated in a great area, close to Playa del Carmen. A little secluded. No nightlife whatsoever. The food is OK but expensive and lacks variety. We stayed in a garden view room which was next to a nice pool that we had almost exclusively by ourselves. The room had problems (drainage in particular) but overall was very nice. The staff is very courteous and helpful. This is a very expensive resort and probably closer to 4 rather than 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “If I could give this hotel 6 stars I would!”
Reviews.Author: JDAMWFB
Reviews.Content: This IS the place! We have traveled frequently to the Caribbean and Mexico over the years staying in some of the best places the region has to offer. No place surpasses Maroma for service, the facility,, the spa, food and beach. We were so impressed by a hard working who understand it's all about the customer. The staff genuinely seemed to appreciate the beauty of the place and they liked they co-workers and jobs. We did not feel the tinge of resentment that one can sometimes experience. They were courteous and responsive and attentive without being intrusive. T The beach is to die for. All the reviews of this beach being one of the best in the world were well deserved. The sand is very white and closer to talcum. The compound is beautiful. Every night, the staff lights and lays out hundreds of candles to guide the path. The food and wine list were great. The chef changed the menu every night and the wine list was great. The spa, was one of the, if not the best we've ever been to and we've been to a lot. We both had amazing massage therapists skilled in ancient Mayan ways. Make sure to try the dry and steam sauna followed by the plunge pool laced in scented flowers. We'll absolutely go back as soon as we are able. Be prepared to bring your Amex cause you're going to need it. All great stuff!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful beach and grounds and superior service”
Reviews.Author: longballs
Reviews.Content: The Maroma is a gorgeous property set in a very secluded area with a fantastic beach. Any need that you had was graciously taken care of by the very friendly, efficient and competent staff. All of the staff from the beach boys to restaurant, bar and hospitality were extremely helpful and always acknowledged you by name and seemed genuinely happy to serve you. It was also nice that a service charge was included on all charges for food, beverages, etc so that you did not have to worry about tipping unless you felt like tipping someone for extra service which I did on numerous occasions. It is an extremely peaceful, quiet, relaxing resort. Although the food was very good at the resort restaurants you cannot get anywhere else unless you have a car or plan on taking taxi's. The resort is more expensive than many in the area, however, I believe for the most part you get what you pay for, it did help that I paid substantially less than the going rate.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation and seclusion”
Reviews.Author: Jasonh23NewYork
Reviews.Content: Its been a long time since I have been to a beach resort that really focuses on service. Yes it may be more expensive, but I never had to place a book on a beach bed to reserve it, I didn't have to flag anyone down for a drink or food, only once did we have to make a dinner reservation and that was at the super fancy restaurant. I am amazed the grounds are kept in such pristine order, even after a rainstorm the paths are clear of debris. I found the spa to be lovely, especially for men. Food was great! I haven't seen a Caribbean resort with such an extensive wine list in a long time. Service at all times in the restaurants was attentive and they could sense the pace you wanted to move and made everything happen according to your needs. Breakfast was complimentary with a large selection, not just toast and coffee but omelettes, pancakes, fresh squeezed juice, etc... The fresh guacamole is to die for. Drinks on the beach are such a nice treat, especially when coming from a cold place up north. There were some special items we did on the trip which included a private tour to Coba, the tour guide was not only knowledgeable but taught us a great deal more about the ruins, the people and the Mayan culture as it is today. I recommend booking the spa ahead of time. The concierge was extremely attentive and responsive to requests within 24 hours of email. One of the highlights of the trip was a fun Tequila tasting class taught by Stephan. He is so much fun and I learned that tequila is much more than what I drank back in college. However, the most special item that I highly recommend is the wine tasting private dinner in the El Sol cellar. the menu was customized to our likes and dislikes and the chef prepared some very impressive dishes that went beyond our greatest expectations. In addition, Alex created the perfect pairings for the menu. The wine list is quite impressive and Maroma deserves to receive its 3 consecutive Wine Spectator award. All in all, the staff is friendly, the food is great, the overall atmosphere is fun. If you are looking for the "it crowd" or a trendy spot, this isn't for you. If you want expansive beach, and just pure relaxation its worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, but overpriced and they nickel and dime you.”
Reviews.Author: sunnybear2010
Reviews.Content: Maroma is a beautiful resort located on the Riviera Maya. It has won all sorts of awards and even been rated as the most romantic beach in the world by the Travel Channel. For these reasons, I wanted to stay at the resort. Even though the resort is quite pricey, I decided to go with this resort b/c it was "the best". My advice is the following, if money is of no object or concern, then you will be happy at this hotel. You will be charged $11 for a bottle of water at dinner and the food is extremely expensive and the spa services are overpriced. If you care in the least about your pocketbook, go somewhere else. You can visit the resort for lunch or dinner if you really want to see what it is all about. The hefty price tag is not worth the stay. Also, be wary of the "gifts" they give you in the hotel room. A bag of M&M's will cost you $8. We were given a tray of snacks as "gift" by one of the staff, later to find out that this was part of the "mini bar". The pricing sheet was located in the actual mini bar, so we didn't find out there was cost to these "gifts" until the end of our stay. My husband ended up eating half of a $15 chocolate bar.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous private resort with amazing beach”
Reviews.Author: Dderriere
Reviews.Content: Maroma Resort is beautiful. Set among a coconut plantation overlooking white sand beach and pristine light blue waters, it is the place for rest and relaxation. I brought my parents and sister here for a special Christmas vacation and Maroma delivered just what I expected. I have a special thanks to Gabriela Sanchez for being so helpful. I had a ton of questions before our arrival at the resort and she was very good at responding quickly and answering all my questions. We had two ocean view rooms, both with spectacular views. My only regret is not having spent more time on the balcony in my hammock overlooking the ocean. We observed the staff cleaning the beach of seagrass and setting up the outdoor tables for breakfast every morning. Breakfast was always served with fresh pastries, fruit jellies and fresh tropical fruit. My favorite breakfast entree was the Huevos Benedictos. Always served perfectly. It was very windy during most of our stay at Maroma, but the wind was a warm wind so it wasn't cold. You could hear the roar of wind and the ocean crashing against the shore all the time, but this didn't bother us. I would not consider the noise a negative at all, because it was actually very nice soothing background noise and adds character to the resort. We were fortunate enough to have a clear night sky and no wind our last night at Maroma so we laid out on the beach bed and watched the starry sky. To our amazement we saw shooting stars! It was magical and utterly romantic. The staff was genuinely friendly and helpful. We were served homemade passionfruit sorbet in waffle cones on the beach. My sister and I couldn't get enough of this and requested seconds. One of our waiters saw that I was struggling with moving a beach table closer to my lounge chair and ran over immediately to help. Kudos to him for the service! Issues: Both my parents and my rooms were not served our morning coffees. We notified the resort well in advance of our coffee orders for the mornings in our Guest Profiles, and our host confirmed our orders and time of delivery at the end of our resort tour the first evening of our arrival. Since we were going outside of the resort for early tours our first two mornings, we requested to have our coffee served at 6:30 a.m. Neither my parents room nor my room were served. We kept checking and nothing arrived. The same thing happened the next morning, but since it was so early and we were having breakfast anyway it wasn't such a big deal the first two days. It was, however, important to us to wake up with the coffee service for the remainder of our stay. I notified Hospitality services of this issue the second day we were without our coffee. I also changed the time of the delivery thinking perhaps it was too early and unusual for the staff, and also we no longer needed to receive our service that early. We did not receive our coffee a third time. I notified hospitality a second time of the issue, re-emphasizing that this was the third time it had happened, and we were personally reassured we would definitely receive it this time. The same thing happened again, and it was our last morning at Maroma! Normally, something like this would not have upset me, if it had been handled differently by the staff. When I checked out on Saturday, I mentioned this to hospitality services again and they had no idea what happened. When a member of the staff personally guarantees the service will be provided, I expect her/him to follow-up personally. Obviously he/she did not. What was even more upsetting was that the person that helped me during check out said he couldn't really do anything since he did not know of this issue. The response was that this was the first time he was hearing of the complaint and none of the other guests had this issue. I brought this up THREE times with hospitality! And the two women I spoke with previously regarding the issue were sitting right next to him managing the bills! Another issue was the christmas dinners. Before our arrival, I checked with Gabriela what the food programs would be like during the holidays and she informed me of the special prix fixe menus but the entire regular dinner menu would be available if we did not want to participate in the arranged dinners. I'm very particular about what I eat, and I did not want what was offered in the prix fixe. When we arrived at the restaurant for X'mas eve dinner, however, we were told only a special prix fixe dinner was being offered. I explained to them that I was informed that the regular menu would be available, but our waiter explained to us there was only one menu. Instead of making a fuss, I consented thinking that maybe the food will be ok. The problem with mass prix fixe is that the food is cooked beforehand and set in a heat source to stay warm, which dries out the food and overcooks it. This was the problem we encountered with our appetizer (portabello mushroom & crab cake) and entree (beef wellington). It was HORRIBLE! The portabello mushroom was dried out as well as the mayo style garnish decorating the plate. The beef wellington was dry too. I requested something else to see if it was possible to replace the entree with something else. Our waiter returned later to tell us the best he could do is give us a new beef wellington done medium rare. It was better the second time around, but what was supposed to be a fabulous dinner was ruined. AND, what I wanted was the options from the regular menu (which is fabulous by the way), NOT the prix fixe. I guess what happened was the resort changed the plans to offer the regular dinner menu, which is fine, but I was not notified of the changes. I was disappointed this had not been communicated to me in advance and even more disappointed that little effort was made to make up for the mistake. This is a high end boutique resort and my expectations will be no less than that of a high end resort. The food, however, was only terrible ONE evening and fantastic all other times. I blame it on the prix fixe, and preparing too far in advance. Our first dinner at Maroma was wonderful. We had the most amazing seafood. I LOVE fish. I would've preferred just to eat seafood the whole time. I will post some pictures up later, but the texture of the fish my mom and I had, scallops for my dad, chicken for my sister, were perfect. I loved the use of veggies on the side, all grown locally and so delicious. We had lunch at Cilantro on Christmas day and my dad and sister loved their beef wraps. It is difficult to please my dad's palate, and he was very happy with his beef wrap. I ordered the grilled baby vegetables and that was delicious as well. I hope to return soon. Maroma is amazing, but there are certain aspects of the hospitality services that could use improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, One-of-a-Kind Luxury Resort with Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: Padrino1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Maroma from December 12-19, 2009 for our belated honeymoon after getting married earlier this year. This was our first trip to Maroma and we were in awe of the incredible beauty and unbelievable service we experienced at this wonderful resort!! For brief background, we are a couple in our early 30's who in the past five years have stayed at a variety of excellent 4 & 5 star resorts throughout the Carribbean (Caneel Bay, Galley Bay, Couples Swept Away, etc.). In deciding where to stay, we specifically look for smaller scale resorts/locales that meet our list of different criteria (i.e., beautiful beaches, wonderful grounds, spacious rooms, great food, charming people) that will allow us to unwind and detach from our hectic lives back home. The Maroma Resort & Spa exceeded our high expectations in every way and we are already dreaming of returning to this very special paradise!! The attention paid to every single detail at Maroma is truly remarkable and one-of-a-kind and has left a distinct, lasting impression on us from which we will judge all other resorts in the future. Booking/Airport Transfer/Arrival: We booked our honeymoon at Maroma by winning a vacation package auctioned through LuxuryLink (1st time we ever did this). After winning the auction at great savings, it was incredibly easy to book the exact week we wanted through the resort and I highly recommend people check out this process. The resort even allowed us to add 2 additional nights onto the package so that we could stay for a full week. 2 weeks before leaving, the Maroma staff emailed us a short questionnaire to complete listing our preferences (early morning coffee/tea service, newspaper delivery, dietary requests, activities, etc.) in order to make sure our stay would be special and tailored to our desires. It was sign of great things to come. At the airport, the Maroma staff was waiting for us and quickly took our bags and whisked us away in a private SUV on our way to the resort, offering us bottled water and cool towels along the way. It's an easy 25 minute ride to the resort. The entrance to the resort is very low-key and located right off the highway. You then travel down a long, single-lane dirt road through the mangroves for about 10 minutes before reaching the actual resort property itself which is jaw-dropping. As one previous poster described, the resort resembles a large Mexican estate spread out over a lush landscape. The main building was originally built by a mexican architect and his wife as their personal residence and the architectural detail and thought that went into every aspect is profound. The newer, expanded section of the resort is seamlessly spread out over the property in the same intricate style and atmosphere as the main building. Gabriela greeted us by first name on arrival, handed us some punch, and offered a personal tour of the property, which was wonderful. Her tour made us feel like family and got everything off on the right start. We arrived in the morning, and at the end of the tour she offered us a hospitality suite to change into our bathing suits so we could relax on the beach until our room was ready. The property is pretty large and we wandered down the beach until settling in one of their great beach beds where we had drinks and ate lunch. Gabriela found us a few hours later on the beach and led us to our room where our bags were quickly delivered. Room/Resort: We stayed in a wonderful Oceanview room, Room #54, located in the new section. The huge, comfortable bed in our room was wonderfully decorated with roses for our honeymoon. The room had great mexican accents, a large bathroom with water closet, large shower/tub with handcrafted tiles, and an attached closet for our clothes. The room also had a spacious verandah with a hammock, table/chairs, a built-in sitting bench, and an unobstructed close view of the gorgeous beach and beautiful water. The different sections of the resort primarily consist of 2-story, white stucco buildings with beautifully curved walls/archways and thatched roofs which are carefully spread out over the large property. The buildings are connected by meandering stone walkways and blend wonderfully into a landscape dotted with ancient mayan accents. At night, all of the stone walkways throughout the resort and the interior of the main building are lined with tiny small candles to create a dreamy, romantic ambience as you walk from your room to the main building. The staff completes the look by lighting lanterns on the umbrella stands along the beach beds up and down the beach. Many couples headed out to the beach beds after dinner to gaze at the stars. Beach/Pools: If you're reading this, you have probably already heard about the beauty of Maroma beach, which stretches for a few miles and is now dotted with a few resorts that have been recently built directly south of the Maroma Resort. The beach is rather large with soft, white sand that never gets too hot, making it great to walk on. The ocean water was a bit wavy for our first 5 days causing a bit of a seaweed issue which the staff did a wonderful job of raking the beach clean every morning and during the day as needed. The last 2 days of our trip, the ocean flattened out and was absolutely tranquil with beautifully clear, turquoise water like the islands we've visited in the Caribbean. The best part about the beach at the Maroma Resort is their exquisite beach beds and the wonderful beach service they offer throughout the day. Johnny and Alberto took turns serving us throughout the week on the beach and both were absolutely tremendous. You can order food delivered to your beach bed from any 1 of the 3 restaurants on the property, no matter where you are along the beach. The frozen Mudslides we enjoyed on our beach beds were to die for. The resort has 3 pools spread out across the property. Directly outside our room was one of the 3 pools located on the property, built with a curved stone patio, glass tile, and decorated with palm trees and comfy lounge chairs. It gets a bit breezy and the pools were a bit chilly due it being December. My only suggestion/critique for the resort would be that I think the pools should be heated for the winter months, based upon the luxury level of the resort and the price you are paying. During the first few days of our stay when the seaweed was present, we would have liked to use the pool more. Restaurants/Service: The service at Maroma is truly exceptional and at a level we have never experienced anywhere before. Any request you had was always met with a warn smile and the response of "It would be my pleasure." The entire staff knew us by our first names by the 2nd day and their genuine, warm smiles and wonderfully pleasant attitudes makes this resort such a special, one-of-kind place to stay and one we are eager to return to. In particular, we want to give praise to Johnny, Alberto, Jorge, and Freddy for making our stay so memorable. they are great assets to this resort and we look forward to seeing them again. Everyone else was fantastic as well and we apologize for not being able to remember everyone by name. There are 3 restaurants on the property. 2 are located in the main building (El Sol and El Restaurante) and offer both indoor and outdoor seating. The indoor dining areas are so beautiful with their floor-to-ceiling windows, stone floors, wood ceilings and low lighting that it is just as wonderful as sitting out on the terrace on the beach with the water just steps way. Breakfast is included in the room-rate and they offer a variety of made-to-order options sure to satisfy any taste. We enjoyed the omelettes, pancakes in particular. They also serve you a great selection of fruits and breakfast pastries. Lunch and dinner was also extremely good. My wife loved the hand-made gnochhi with shrimp in a red sauce so much she got it twice. Because it was our honeymoon, I arranged for a romantic beachside dinner one night and although it was expensive, I am really glad we did it. The staff put together a beautiful table set up on the beach at the end of groomed sand runway lined by tiki torches. We had a private waiter and were allowed to create our own menu for the dinner. The chef did a masterful job and even came out to speak to us to make sure everything was perfect. Well done. Finally, one last compliment I need to mention....our 2nd night, there was some sort of beach party by a small group of guests that lasted well into the night near our room. The resort is definitely not a party place at all and the noise kept my wife up to the point where she emailed the managing director of the resort in the middle of the night (mainly to make sure it didn't happen the rest of our stay). The next morning, the managing director (Federico Echaiz) called our room, profusely apologized, and informed us that he had already taken the previous night off our bill. Despite us telling him that it was not necessary at all to take anything off our bill, Senor Echaiz insisted and said that it should have never happened and assured us it would not happen again (which it did not). His prompt response and genuine concern for our stay and the manner in which he handled the issue was remarkable and something that was greatly appreciated. We can see where his great staff get their work ethic and professionalism. Our stay at Maroma Resort was an absolutely wonderful experience that we will always cherish and one we hope to repeat again in the near future. This is a one-of-a-kind property where guests are truly pampered and treated like family by the delightful, enthusiastic staff.

Reviews.Title: “SPECTACULAR getaway w/ unparalleled service”
Reviews.Author: Cea617
Reviews.Content: I visited Maroma Resort and Spa for the 2nd time - in Dec 2009 (1st trip Dec 2008) and once again, remain in AWE of how wonderful the place is. The resort is perfect. From the moment I stepped out of the airport and was cheerfully greeted by hotel rep to the moment I regretfully went back in to airport, 6 days later- I was consistently amazed. Ocean view rooms are worth the extra money - for sea breeze and listening to waves crashing at night. The service and staff is probably the best part, although the resort is stunning itself. I traveled alone, for a quiet and relaxing getaway and the staff did everything possible to make me feel comfortable, relaxed and special each and every day. I cannot say enough great things about this place. You just have to experience it yourself. Food and drinks were fabulous also- healthy and creative dishes in all restaurants. Spa is expensive but loved it- so unique and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “It was magic - and there were coatis!”
Reviews.Author: NY72
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a special place for my wife and I for our honeymoon - Maroma turned my dream into a reality. From the moment we were picked up at the airport to the moment we left - it was perfect. It's not as big as a number of other places - which is just what we wanted. While we saw other guests - for the most part we felt it was our own little paradise. It was easy to find a place without anyone else around. The beach was perfect. A hardworking and dedicated staff keeps the beach picture perfect. During the day you can see staff members raking up the seaweed. The beach does not get big waves - so it's very easy to swim in. The staff kept on going above and beyond on a daily basis. Ask for a drink - done; set up a morning snorkeling trip - done; take a trip to Tulum with a driver and expert guide - done. At every meal the servers greeted us by name. The spa was amazing. It is a true gem. I had five massages - they were all great. They were very professional. One thing that may have been overlooked by others – the wonderful resident coatis! These very cute and harmless animals (something between a lemur and a raccoon) can sometimes be seen off some of the pathways and at Cilantros (one of Maroma’s restaurants) in the morning. My wife was taken by surprise when she saw one during breakfast but then fell in love. A few thoughts: This place is great - but you are paying for that perfection. If you are on a budget - this might not be the best place. This is a perfect place for honeymoons, anniversaries, etc. That said - I would not recommend it for people looking for late night parties or nightlife. Maroma is a place of peace and quiet - a place to listen to the sound of the ocean. This is a place to decompress. Also - Playa del Carmen is a good 20-30 minutes away. This is also not a place for people who need their daily TV fix. While Maroma has two TV rooms with a good selection of DVDs - the rooms don't have TVs. I know that we will definitely come back for an anniversary trip!

Reviews.Title: “A delight for the senses”
Reviews.Author: atispo
Reviews.Content: If you are accustomed to paying for low key luxury, you will enjoy Maroma. It is a beautiful intimate resort that tries to please every one of your senses and usually succeeds. The staff is exceptionally helpful without being the least bit unctuous. The grounds, beach and ocean are exquisite. The food, while very good, gets a bit repetitive if your stay is more than 4 days. We would have taken more advantage of the beautiful spa if was a bit less costly, but the workout room was spacious, comfortable, well equipped and complimentary. A lovely, quiet place to relax with someone you love.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in the Yucatan”
Reviews.Author: pinkysmallz
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying that we travel somewhat often and always to 5 star hotels / resorts. However, after being a member and reader on this site for a few years, this is the first time I have felt the need to post a review because our stay was simply something we have not experienced anywhere else. My wife and I just returned from our 1st trip to Maroma and WOW, what an experience. I planned this trip months ago at the suggestion of our travel agent. I planned the trip as a surprise for my wife for our first anniversary, only telling her she needed bathing suits and a passport. While taken aback at first flying into Cancun (brought back memories of different times?), she quickly forgot those as the Maroma staff met us at the airport and quickly whisked us away in a private black Suburban with cool water and air conditioning waiting for us. The majority of the 30 - 45 minute drive is simply a long highway. You then take a turn down an unmarked entrance which brings you down a long, jungle road which only has room for 1 car. This part takes about 10 minutes to finally enter the Maroma main gate (after passing through a primary gate) at which point you feel like you have entered a different world. Upon arrival there are a number of staff members there to greet you. They greet you by name when you get out of the car and immediately hand you some delicious Margarita Maroma (what better way to start your stay)? A staff member then takes you on a tour of the hotel while your bags are brought to your room. The grounds are, to say the least, amazing. Every detail has been thought out and carefully constructed and maintained. This is by no means some super modern, clean lines type of hotel that some expect from a place that has this cost associated. Instead, it is a very warm hotel that immediately makes you feel like you are home. For only being 65 rooms, it feels larger than some resorts I have been at such as the Four Seasons Maui. This is because Maroma is filled with winding paths through tropical landscapes. Simply walking the grounds is an amazingly relaxing experience. Our room was a junior suite at the end of the hotel. This was perfect for us as there was a wedding going on towards the main building and this allowed us more privacy and quiet to enjoy our trip. We woke up every morning to coffee, tea and delicious hot chocolate waiting for us on our patio as well as the mornings newspaper (well usually, this did not show up everyday). After our morning get me up we would either eat breakfast at Cilantro behind our room (if we wanted to be healthy that day) or stroll down the beach to El Sol. Both options are delicious, however very similar in fare. Cilantro simply offers healthier versions of what El Sol serves. The food was very good, though I can see how after a week we started to tire of it a little bit. The BBQ on our first night was different than is typically served, but we were enjoying hanging out with Freddy a the bar and tasting tequila to realize it... The staff at Maroma is something on another level. After the first day everyone we came across referred to us by name. They also figured out my wife was fluent in Spanish and she enjoyed conversing with everyone as such. They really go out of their way to make sure your stay is as pleasant as possible and try to tend to every need you can imagine. From the hospitality staff to the F&B staff to the spa attendants. At no point was anyone ever anything beyond extremely helpful and nice (and genuine too!). The hospitality office had helped me arrange a few special treats for us during our stay. The first was a Muyil Float and Forest tour which came highly recommended above the others, and I must say it was quite an experience. Except for the mosquitoes that is... Our guide was amazing and extremely knowledgeable about the Mayan culture and the tour itself is simply out of this world. Floating down a natural canal taken by the current, in fresh water for over an hour while it gently takes you around curves was amazing. You are surrounded by mangroves and little fish and you truly feel like you have entered into another era. The private tour also included a snack and a lunch which were both delicious and served by a waitstaff at a table that they set up for you... my only recommendation is to bring long pants / shirt and some bug spray for the hiking portion or suffer the wrath of the mosquitoes. Gabriela also helped me set up a special anniversary dinner on the beach which was simply stunning (I would post pictures but they are on my other computer). If you are looking to have a romantic dinner, there is nothing better than this option. They set up a private table on the beach in front of the main building and have a sand "carpet" laid out for you. You are surrounded by tiki torches and candles and the night sky. It was truly a special moment and almost brought my wife to tears when she saw it. The beach is another gem of this hotel. It is simply magnificent. Pure white sand (which is cleaned daily by the staff as they rake up any seaweed from the tides), warm water in shades of blue and green and crystal clear. The beach beds are absolutely fantastic and the beach side service for drinks and food is just as good as at the restaurants. They have a delicious beach side menu of ceviche and nachos among other things (those were our favorites). The snorkeling trip was fun as well and worth going out. We also enjoyed the spa a bit. The staff was amazingly helpful in helping us choose our treatments and the couples room was fantastic. It was very relaxing and we both enjoyed it thoroughly. The rest of the is very beautiful as well. At night however is when Maroma really shines (pardon the pun). They lay out countless candles along all of the paths on the property. It really sets quite a mood when you are heading to dinner or just relaxing. They also set candles out on the beach so that you can relax on a beach bed or chair as well. The lighting is so perfect on the property that you can tell a lot of thought went into it. Even though the hotel was about 50% occupied, we still felt as though we were the only ones there because the size of the property. Finally, what can I say about Freddy? We loved hanging out with him at Freddy's Bar and trying the tequilas, margaritas and other concoctions he gave to us. It certainly gave us a little bit of that fun we were looking for. Overall, I would certainly recommend this hotel to the discerning traveler. However, one must remember that this is a hotel meant for relaxing, not partying (if you want that, go to Secrets next door). There are no TVs for entertainment and people are typically in their rooms by 10pm (i.e. no partying). However, we both enjoyed being able to hang out in the hammock on our patio with the sound of the waves reading books and enjoying each others company. After all, isn't that what it's all about?

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit...Maroma is paradise”
Reviews.Author: pax671
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from our 2nd stay at Maroma (last visit was 2yrs ago). Our stay could not have been more perfect. The grounds are beautiful, the staff is excellent and the food/drinks exceed expectations. The guests consist of mostly couples, as Maroma is a very romantic setting. We spent most of our time either relaxing on the "beds" which are all along Maroma's beach, or lounging in the hammock which is on the porch of every guest room. I cannot stress enough how helpful and friendly is the staff at Maroma. By day 2, they know you by name. The staff arranged for us to take a cab into Playa Del Carmen for a few hours one day, and also arranged a tour of the nearby Mayan city of Tulum. Other than that, we had no desire to leave the grounds. Maroma has its own dive shop on the beach. We went snorkeling one day at the reef which is just off of Maroma's beach. On our last visit, we had really enjoyed our room location, so we requested the same room once again. Of course, our request was met. On the last night, I asked the hospitality staff if there was any chance of trying a similar room but in a different location of the hotel, just to try it out. Not only did they grant our request, but the manager at the time moved us into an upgraded room right on the beach. And that is what Maroma is all about...service which exceeds expectations. The spa is first class and all about relaxation. My wife took a Yoga class there a few times during our stay. We have friends that have visited Maroma on our recommendation, and they were extremely happy with their stay. We will definitely return to Maroma.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, though you're paying for it”
Reviews.Author: wdcmpj
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Maroma, though not as much as our subsequent visit to the Banyan Tree. The two are very different resorts but on balance we preferred the latter. Here are what we considered the pros and cons of the Maroma: Pros: The resort grounds are beautiful and filled with lots of nice touches, not the least of which are the candles on the walkways at night. The small number of rooms and very high staff to guest ratio make for a intimate and well-attended experience. The staff is wonderful and friendly. The waitstaff and meals were also exceptional. The rooms are only steps from the beautiful beach. The workout facility has good equipment and was spacious for a resort of this size. And now the cons: The services and amenitites at the Maroma were quite expensive, particularly in relation to other resorts at which we've stayed in the area. A visit to their spa ended up costing almost as much as our room for the entire stay. The rooms were somewhat dated and generally not up to the level of a five star hotel. A knob in our shower, for example, kept falling off during our stay (others have had similar experiences based on the reviews) and the front plate to the safe broke off. Also, the air conditioning was supplied by a noisy wall unit. None of which was anything more than mild disappointment in what was otherwise a wonderful experience; rather, the cons are examples of some things that were unexpected given the cost and category of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: nychuman
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler to Mexico, Maroma resort is the most authentically Mexican and yet, luxurious hotel that I have been to in the country. My husband and I just returned from a 5 day trip to Riviera Maya where we stayed at the Maroma resort. The rooms were positively gorgeous and the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. The entire staff speaks English very well, but they entertained our broken Spanish. The beach is absolutely beautiful and the ocean was like a turquoise bubble bath. We reclined on the well-equipped (towels, umbrella and comfortable cushions) beds on the beach every day. And each day, Daniel was there to bring us beverages and food all day long. I’m a huge spa fan and the Kinan Spa at Maroma is really one of the best spas that I have ever been to. In addition to the grounds of the spa being completely beautiful the treatments are all incredibly well-done and begin with a ceremonial washing of your feet, which feels terrific. Every day I took the morning yoga class at the spa, which alleviated all sense of guilt from enjoying the deliciously prepared fare at the restaurant. Having just returned from our vacation, I eagerly await my return to this paradise in Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Still in a Maroma Coma”
Reviews.Author: Yachtsman82
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Maroma from November 8 -- 14, 2009 for our annual anniversary getaway trip without our children. Like many, my wife and I find a Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton to be dependable, but also predictable. We have very discerning taste and really seek out hotels that execute a notch better than the "standard" for excellence that a high-end chain like Four Seasons typically sets. We find that most often the smaller, quaint boutique hotels can cater to this better because there are less guests, giving these properties more latitude to individualize the service and enhance your vacation experience. Toward this end, I must say that Maroma qualifies as an absolute "jewel box." This place is a find! Prior to departing on our trip, Maroma sent us an email with various questions in an effort to elicit our likes and preferences, ahead of time, so that upon arrival they already know how you want your in-room bar stocked, which choice of newspaper you prefer to receive each morning, how you take your coffee (or substitute if desired) that is delivered to your room everyday before you wake up, etc., etc., etc., -- all in an effort to diminish the "getting to know you" part, and instead make you feel like you have returned home to your regular staff that has already "got it." When you arrive at the airport, a representative of Maroma greets you outside baggage claim and escorts you to a new Suburban SUV, complete with bottled water and fragrant towels to cool off with, which then takes you to the resort down a surprisingly quick, "smooth" divided highway getting you there in about 25 minutes. While you pass other resorts having huge grand entrances along the way, Maroma's entrance is, by design, discreet and looks more like a gate to someone's estate. It is no wonder that the several celebrities that frequent Maroma on a repeat basis love this place. Indeed, you pass through the gate and proceed down a dirt path for quite some distance before the resort finally appears in front of you. With only 66 rooms, you arrive at the manor house (you really do feel like it is an estate, not a hotel) and are greeted by name, with a cocktail waiting, as if they already know you. Indeed, you are truly treated like you are the only guests arriving that day/time. You actually check-in inside your room, following a personal escort through the property getting you familiar with the amenities and setting the mood. What we admire about Maroma (which is distinctly true about other Orient-Express properties, too) is that there is nothing cookie-cutter about it. The buildings' architecture and mahogany materials and bamboo/thatch ceilings remain, intentionally, indigenous to its Caribbean setting so you feel immersed in this tropical oasis. We don't travel all the way to the tropics only to arrive at some place that looks and feels like you're really still only in south Florida. Indeed, we looked at the Myakoba resort nearby with its Rosewood, Banyan Tree and Fairmont hotels within it, and while its glitzy, ultra-modern architecture would really appeal to us if we were enjoying a California coastal vacation, it most definitely does not appeal to us when visiting the tropics. You don't travel to Italy to eat hot dogs. I cant' tell you how sterile it feels to sit at a beach bar in a Caribbean resort that has poured-concrete columns, a granite countertop and a standing-seam aluminum roof to it (Four Seasons, if you can believe that -- both in Nevis and in Great Exuma, Bahamas)! Maroma, on the other hand, is exactly how a beach bar should be in a Caribbean environment -- twisted bamboo tree columns, with a varnished, solid wood countertop and a bamboo and thatch roof with a clever glass window at its peak filtering light in. Oh yes, and complete with upscale higher-end and higher-maintenance furnishings and cloth rather than paper napkins, creature comforts that remind you that you are staying at "the best." The indigenous ambience of Maroma by day gets even better at night time. This is the only Caribbean resort we have been to where you actually don't care if you are eating outside or inside -- the atmosphere inside (both) restaurants' indoor areas are so atmospheric with the stone floors, wood ceilings, indirect lighting and largely-open-to-the-outdoors windows, anyway, is just as much fun as sitting outside on the terrace right on the beach with the ocean literally steps away. It's that nice. The same applies to the bar/lounge area where you enjoy drinks before or after dinner (although the beach bar is open, too, at night and offers a splendidly contrasting atmosphere compared to day time, as well). But the real treat at night time is walking from your room to the main building -- and seeing literally 1500 candles lining the stone walkways to, and then throughout the interior of, the main building. All set out and lit, by hand, each and every night. They even light lanterns on the umbrella tables alongside the beach lounges up and down the beach, just to complete the look. I mean, this place is nothing short of "dreamy" at night. It's almost indescribable. They even light candles in your room at turndown, which no other hotel has done for us. Very romantic setting. One of the candles comes with aromatherapy oils that you select before leaving for dinner, and then the maid pours it in the special dish that gets heated by the candle she lights underneath, which then disperses the fragrance throughout your room which you enjoy upon returning to your room at the end of your evening. One evening I requested the romantic turndown, and we came back to a flower pedal design on the bed, and a bubble bath drawn with candles lit around the tub and flower pedals strewn around the candles and throughout the water. Well done. Lastly, the service. Unmatched, says it all. Can't read the menu in the candlelight? Before you lift your head a waiter (who all know you by name) anticipates your problem and hands you a menu flashlight, which he attaches to the top of your menu before you can say a word. I mean they anticipate, rather than react to, your preferences. Their execution is impressive. Even on the beach, they operate a second service bar for the beach waiters so that you never have to wait for him to walk all the way back to the main bar to retrieve what you're looking for (like happens at so many other beach resorts). They will even serve lunch right to your beach lounger -- complete with silverware and cloth napkins and real glassware (not plastic). It's not inconvenient to them; they're properly setup with special beach trays etc. so that it is as easy for them to set you up as it is for you to eat without disrupting everything else you have with you. It's a neat experience eating on the beach some days as an alternative to the terrace -- because they execute it in such a no-hassle manner. Compared to other Caribbean destinations, we must say that the service that Maroma delivers is striking. We say this because even the nicest resorts elsewhere in the Caribbean still have to rely on the island natives to carry off the service, and they are so often either friendly but slow and impossible to train to high enough standards, or worse, act disinterested on top of it all. The Maroma family in contrast is a "well-oiled machine," with staff that has been there for a long time, and really, truly cares. They have just delightful personalities and enthusiasm for their profession. And it shows.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: kangabear
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Maroma for our honeymoon October 13-18. We had such a wonderful stay. The food was incredible, the ocean was spectacular and above all the service was amazing. We took advantage of the snorkeling trip which was great but mostly we just camped out on the beach and read and enjoyed the view. Johnny was a key figure in our beach days - he is a really wonderful nice guy - thank you Johnny!! I would and have already recommend Maroma to anyone. We hope to come back soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: lakate
Reviews.Content: Perfect spot for couple. Easy to get to. They have a drive who picks you up at the airport...no charge. This is a wonderfukl service. The hotel is small and beautiful. It is perfect for couples. We would go back again in a heart beat. The staff was wonderful. They treated us like family. They gave us an upgrade b/c an ocean view room was available.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this place...”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaNewYork
Reviews.Content: These people are so sweet. from the moment in a Tatoo type of voice I hear, welcome home....LOL Am I in fantasy island! I loved it . It is lit at night with 600 candles. the beach is beautiful. Wide , soft, never hot, seaweed and rock free beach! They are generous kind, attentive, I cant say one bad thing. There are no cons. Maybe closer to ny , like bermuda distance!!!! great staff, great top 5 beaches of the world, out door seating for break, lunch , dinner, all white cloth, simple, serene. Rooms huge lovely, great bed sheets, MOLTON BROWN soaps etc, or ALL ORGANIC MX home made stuff. GREAT spa, ohh so so nice. A true treat. Know its a little rustic, Walking to spa, lotta trees flowers, but I loved that about it, natural. Also huge house and villas for rent. I think one has like 7 rooms, Kathrina:) maybe?? own pool on beach. great Great GREAT hotel. Top roof has 360 views, romantic, simple lovely......Like a giant home in MX on the carib waters. Also GREAT GREAT snorkeling boat took us out, included in room price, so nice, might be a one time thing but go , its special. THE fish are all around you , swimming with you , very close, very friendly friendly fish:)) Done alot of diving, one fish never left the right side of my mask,,,,very sweet! :))DONT PET OR FEED THE IGUANAS,,,,,I got a little nipped at my fault, fed him a cherry!!! And someone brought their cat...so pets accepted,,,who knew! LOVE IT!!!! Go to Esencia Hotel for a SPA and DINNER if you get a chance....n maybe try that place too! !they were Both lovely...:)))

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic - a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pilgrimgreen
Reviews.Content: It is hard to say anything about this hotel that hasn't been said already. It is absolutely beautiful, with first class service and wonderful facilities. I stayed here with my wife for a few days at the end of our honeymoon - having spent the first three weeks back-packing in Guatemala. The Maroma was quite a change of scene... The view from our the balcony of our room (Rm 25) was fantastic - down over the terrace to the beach and the sea. The room itself was gorgeous - lovely bed, amazing shower, and lots of little extras that made the place really special. The food, too, was brilliant, though we found ourselves cutting down to two meals a day to do them justice. Above and beyond any of this, though, was the service, which was first class. The staff couldn't do enough for us - everyone took the trouble to learn your name and greet you on a daily basis, and were all incredibly helpful. The spa, predictably, was wonderful and the bar tender made delicious cocktails. The snorkelling tour was a lot of fun, too. The Maroma isn't really the sort of place you come to use as a base for exploring this area (though there were plenty of tours on offer) - best to see the rest of the area and then come here to chill at the end. Once you arrive on site at the Maroma, you really won't want to leave. I can't recommend the Maroma highly enough. For pure luxury and relaxation, this hotel is very hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach, gorgeous rooms, but the staff make your stay perfect.”
Reviews.Author: kkdkkd
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay at Maroma and this time we introduced our friends to our "secret." It continues to be one of our favorite places to get away, to relax, to just enjoy where we are and each other. The rooms are fantastic (we stayed in a Sian Nah suite) with incredible views of the sea, lovely sitting area with wrap around windows directly onto the beach, bar, table for four (with champagne and fresh fruit welcoming us), an incredible bathroom, with large indoor shower and incredible outdoor shower and a marble bathtub more than large enough for two. What really sets Maroma apart are the Mayan people working there. They could not be kinder, nicer, or more helpful. Coffee and hot chocolate outside your room every morning (we asked for it early so we could sit on the beach and enjoy the sunrise), breakfasts with incredible homemade breads and pastries and fresh fruit plate, lunch at the beachside restaurant or lounging on the beach. and then dinner under the stars. Everything was wonderful and everyone made sure we always had anything we could think of. The Kinan Spa is wonderful, and the Thai massage - on the shaded rooftop on mats - was one of the the most incredible massages my husband had ever had, the lomi lomi was very good too. Thank goodness there are no children and no TV (although there is a TV room if you must see a game, show, etc.) This is paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent food, excelent location, and the service couldn't be better!”
Reviews.Author: APUL
Reviews.Content: I would deffinitlly go back to this hotel. By far one of the best in the "Riviera Maya".

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place for relaxation and rejuvination”
Reviews.Author: Irishclover22
Reviews.Content: Out of curiosity, I had to read the negative reviews for Maroma. I must say, I was rather surprised and found that anything negatively said about this resort is directly opposite from my own experience. I found the resort to be amazing. Yes, it is somewhat secluded and not necessarily convenient to any nightlife or dining. But what it may seemingly lack in convenience it more than makes up for in its ability to soothe the soul. As an experienced traveler, the Spa was one of the best experiences. Try the different types of mud treatments! The customer services was extraordinary, from my morning coffee and hot chocolate delivered to my door each morning at precisely the right time, to them addressing me by name each morning at breakfast. No sooner had I finished a drink on a cushioned lounger by the sea, did one of the servers appear to replenish or ask if I needed anything. I didn't so much as have to fluff my own pillow...they were right there to assist and accommodate. If you are looking for TV and internet, I am not sure this is your place...it is definitely a place for romance and/or rejuvination. However, I have no doubts the resort will do their best to accommodate. Happy Travels! Tiffany

Reviews.Title: “Among 1000 Places to Stay Before You Die”
Reviews.Author: meaningofheart
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at Maroma for our honeymoon. Upon arrival in a complimentary black SUV, we were immediately greeted by the staff, a welcome margherita, and the resident guacamayas. Then, we were escorted around the resort to get familiarized with our new surroundings. And what surroundings! The most subdued, calming, peaceful place I have ever been. Luscious jungle foliage, hand-built Mayan/Moorish architecture, tranquil pools, pathways, lounges. We were then brought up to our room in the main house (which, mind you, is designed and built in an open manner to where you look straight through to the beautiful turquoise ocean). The room was peppered with romance- a bottle of champagne on ice, rose peddles scattered over the bed, a gorgeous balcony overlooking the ocean. After picking our jaws up off the floor for several hours, we settled into the mantra/aura of the place. One can get used to extreme luxury and comforts. The beach: Perfect. Soft sand. Calm, warm waters. Comfy beach beds. Amazing beachside bar/food service. Wonderfully friendly attendants (who will cut up and serve you a fresh coconut if you ask!). And a man who combs the beach every morning for the seaweed that washes up on shore for heaven's sake! The room: Simple. Elegant. Not posh or tricked out. No TVs (but yes there is A/C). Great views, spacious balcony. comfortable bed and sheets. Romantic candlelight turn down service with aromatherapy. Room service at all hours. Don't forget the handmade soaps and local/organic bath products! The spa: Top of the line. In tune with nature and its surroundings- Mayan and spiritual/peaceful. The plunge pools, saunas/steam rooms are free. All other services are billed to your room. They have signature "Mayan rituals" that I would recommend (including the temazcal- a Mayan sweat lodge) beyond the usually spectrum of spa services. Workout facility and 2 pools: Looked nice. Never used. The food/restaurants: 2 restaurants. Beyond breakfast (complimentary), which was very delicious, and the bar/beach food menu and room service, we only ate off the 'El Sol' menu once, and that was for a private dinner in "El Mirador," the tower atop the main building offering 360 views of the surrounding area. What I can say about the food is that it is 5 star. My wife and I are foodies, so believe us when we say 5 star. Mayan, local flare to all dishes which were mostly seafood based. Try the ceviches. Fantastic. The cost: Very expensive...but not unfare. You don't see a bill until you check out, so brace yourself. But relax- it's well worth the expense. Pros: See above. Let me also mention here the fact that the grounds are bathed in tea lights at sundown (super romantic) and that there were maybe 9 other couples staying while we were there. The place felt like it was our own! Cons: Struggling to think....Leaving?! Probably cost-prohibitive to some.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly the Best”
Reviews.Author: TheScatenaFamily
Reviews.Content: This was our 7th trip to Maroma in the last 10 years. This time for my 60th B-day. We've beached it in Sardina, Costa Rica, Belize, Nevus, St. Barts, So. Africa, and most 5-stars in Hawaii and on Mexico's Pacific coast. Yet each time we go somewhere else, we compare it to the gold standard-Maroma. And why not, it's a sure thing. Everything's terrific. The staff is fabulous, the food and coctails are wonderful, the rooms are great, the resort is small, and the beach is the best we've seen anywhere. If you want something big, spalshy, over done, or pretentious, don't go to Maroma. And if you're interested in an "all-inclusive", please don't go to Maroma. Yes, it's expensive, but it deserves to be. The best recommendation I can give is that we're already talking about our return, for the 8th time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent; As Good as all the Hype”
Reviews.Author: RickStevesJunior
Reviews.Content: Just got back 3 days ago and had an excellent experience at the Maroma Resort and Spa. My wife and I never are the type that would go to the same place twice, but if we ever go back to the Yucatan again, and can afford it, we're going to stay here again. Since everyone has an opinion, I will try to fill the below with more useful information than opinion. For starters, so you understand where I am coming from, my wife and I make a fairly good living and so can afford to stay in nicer places like Maroma, but we do not make so much money that when we go to a place like Maroma we can just spend whatever we want on drinks, dinner, spa services, etc., without flinching. We like to be spoiled like the rich, but have to watch our money closely once we are in their presence. We generally try to stay in the nicest of places, but our lifestyle usually only allows us to stay one notch below, with the occasional splurge, which is what we would consider Maroma. Accordingly, our expectations may be slightly lower than the elite travelers that no-doubt frequent Maroma. Economy/Swine Flu - According to Maroma staff, they are currently running at 30% occupancy, and actually have the southern portion of the resort largely shut down, though the ritzy beach-front villas and spa are still open and the pools are still useable. What this currently means is plenty of attention (not too much) from staff, no having to fight for reservations/beach chairs/beds, and a couple of apparent cost cutting measures (but my perception was it generally was a plus for us). Location - Maroma beach is nice; can't comment on how nice verses other areas on the Yucatan, but the water seems as crystal clear as it could be and the sand is white. Waves are present but small. The resort beach is situated towards the middle of the crescent cove that makes up all of Maroma beach. There are two all-inclusives immediately south of the resort (Secrets and Catalonia; Maroma actually share an entrance with Secrets), and there is an empty lot and a partially completed condo development immediately to the north, with tons more all-inclusives visible in the distance (over half mile away). Playa del Carmen is no more than 20 minutes to the South. As for driving directions, the hotel seems shy to admit that you have to use the same entrance as Secrets Maroma, and so the driving directions they give are not adequate. Get their directions, and then on your drive down, look for Secrets Maroma and that is the gate. Grounds - Beautiful and constantly being cared for. Maroma cleaned its beaches of seaweed and trash each morning, whereas the all-inclusives directly south did not, and the difference is obvious (and nasty for those at the other resorts). Unfortunately there is a lot of litter that comes in off the water and collects on the beach (if not picked up) and these other resorts had lots of garbage and seaweed on their sand and in their water but Maroma kept its beaches virtually spotless, and picked up items later in the day if the need arose. In fairness to these other resorts, they seemed to amass more junk because of the way the current worked and because they were near a point and behind a reef, as well. But a walk south down the beach and look at these resorts completely affirmed our decision to go with Maroma over any all-inclusive. Room Choice - This is not a cookie-cutter all-inclusive, so the rooms/buildings aren't fungible or easy to compare. We stayed in Room #6, Ocean View and couldn't have asked for anything more. Ocean View means you can see the water from your balcony, but you don't necessarily have an unblocked view. Our original room was a first floor, and we asked at check-in to move to a second floor, and they accommodated without any issue or delay. In previous reviews we read that second floor was better for bugs and/or privacy, and again, it's kind of a crap shoot. Second floor rooms may generally have more privacy because your balcony is not a patio on the ground, but some of those balconies are directly above the restaurant or bar and actually offer less privacy. A few ground floor Ocean Views open directly out to the beach bar (less than 10 yards). The garden view rooms open onto the pools and walkways between rooms and look like they may be short on windows, but we did not go into one. Room 6 was perfect FWIW. Food/Prices - For starters, just as with the room prices, everything is hit with 25% of fees, so add 25% to everything below and anything you spend money on at the resort. We booked our reservation through Expedia as part of a package with air travel, and got a discount off the rack rate. As is noted in previous reviews, the food and dinks are expensive, but there are ways to mitigate this. For starters, the food quality was extremely good, and we enjoyed our meals. There is the fancy restaurant, Sol. Entrees run $35+. There is the less expensive, but very nice restaurant (that is really the same restaurant, just one room over), that has basically a Tapas menu ($12 or less each) plus entrees in the $20-$30 range). This restaurant is just as good and seemed more popular, including because you could sit outside basically on the beach. Then you can also eat at the beach bar at least through the afternoon, not sure about the evenings. Great selection of appetizer type foods like Quesadillas, Nachos, Guacamole, for $15 or so, and the portions are fairly large so you can easily share one. Regardless of where you are, beers are $6, mixed drinks and wines are $12+, and bottled water is $6 (except for your room; more below). To keep cost under control, eat your free breakfast (which is very filling), order a late afternoon item from the bar menu and share it, and then just get a few Tapas to share for dinner at the outside restaurant. More advice on saving on drinks below. Again, the food was excellent and of good quality in our opinion. Service – Every person we met was extremely friendly, happy and helpful, and they made the stay so much better. At the beach, there is the perfect level of service throughout the day; not to much, but there when you need it. You get a free fruit skewer and juice at 11:30 AM or so, and then they bring around free sorbet on waffle cones at 2:30 or 3:00. Doing it on the Cheap – We took the advice of another reviewer and stopped off at a 7-11 on the drive in and loaded a cooler with beer, bottled water and snacks. I would carry what we needed down to the beach in a bag, and the waiters would actually provide ice buckets to every person on the beach, which they didn’t seem to mind me using for my own beverages. Because I was not buying as much of the resort’s refreshments, I tipped them throughout the day. May not be the classiest, but they didn’t seem surprised by it, and it saved us a ton. I actually could have gone without the cooler, as they also bring ice to your room every night. Bugs – We read reviews that had us scared of the mosquito situation, as my wife is allergic to them. We found the bug/mosquito situation not bad at all, and worst case, on par with what you get on the U.S. Gulf Coast. As long as you were in sight of the beach, the breeze completely kept them away, and the hotel provides a fancy non-chemical repellant with your room. Cons – No place is perfect, so I will spell out the few cons we encountered, though for us these didn’t even represent a minor blemish on the trip as a whole: (i) our room had one of those wall-unit type A/C’s that was making lots of noise the first night and started dripping water. Without even asking, we walked into our room after breakfast and they were fixing it the next morning, after having noticed we had placed a trash can under it to collect the drips. It was much better thereafter; (ii) this is the only evidence of cost-cutting we saw; they supply your room with two quart size bottled waters at all times. If you leave the empty bottles in your room, they refilled them, as opposed to providing you new ones, which is a little weird; (iii) at the beginning of the trip, they ask you if you want a tray of coffee/tea/juice on your patio waiting for you in the morning, and the time, and what paper you wanted. They didn’t seem to follow our time, and the paper service was a bit spotty; (iv) getting hot water in the late evening seemed spotty. The hot water was excellent through early evening, but after around 10:30, it was iffy; not sure why, and you could still get warm water, so it wasn’t a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful place and experience”
Reviews.Author: littlebit_9
Reviews.Content: The beach was beautiful so is the resort. Staff went above and beyond, the service was unbelieveable! Had a great time telling everyone about our trip and Maroma is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “I will never go anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: mbroadus2000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Maroma for our honeymoon and we're planning another trip back during the Christmas Holidays and our 1st anniversary. There are no words that I can say that does this hotel and its staff justice. The most friendly, accomodating and entertaining staff that I have ever had the pleasure to meet.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: luxuryexpert88
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 6 nights at the Maroma to celebrate our 13th anniversary and have nothing but good things to say. The staff is the friendliest and most thoughtful around. On the evening of our anniversary they surprised us with a quiet dinner by the water which was as pleasant as it was unexpected. The waiters on the beach worked very hard all day to keep us in the shade on our large beach beds and to ensure we had everything we needed. The complimentary snorkel trip revealed itself to be quite fun and full of exotic fish. The Temazcal sweat treatment was energizing, mystical, and very well guided by Nancy. Our standard room had a great sea view from between the palms and a spacious terrace to lounge privately on (Room 33). The textures and lush foliage envelop the rear side of the resort inviting one to lounge under the cool jungle leaves by one of the pools as a pleasing alternative to the beach. Unlike many hotels, nature is the principal companion to the architecture, not design. This lets one feel like each corner is special, unique, and private. Although in the end we opted for the beach every day anyway. All the details in the Maroma are hand-made, and the feeling is one of simple pleasures made luxurious through the inherent quality of the materials. There is no multi-layered sophistication attempting to hide over weaknesses. The very foundation of the property is based on principles that come through as pure, fresh, aromatic, and full of color. It is the best place to go to simply disconnect, relax, and be pampered. The staff manages to make you feel like each gesture is genuine and meant especially for you. A very romantic setting! The food was great too. 5 stars all around.

Reviews.Title: “Maroma...not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: misscotrona
Reviews.Content: I am writing to express my disappointment in the way a recent unfortunate situation was handled and our poor stay at Maroma. My husband and I stayed at Maroma Spa and Resort from April12 to April 18, 2009. After weeks of preparation and planning, we arrived on April 12 and were looking forward to a relaxing week at the resort. The grounds and the location were beautiful. From the servers on the beach to the waiters in the restaurants, all were very courteous, friendly and helpful. We stayed in room 55 and from the moment we began to unpacked we noticed the room had its problems. As we opened the shutters to let some light in the shutter broke off and fell. In the bathroom the toilet paper dispenser broke and fell to the floor. I then wanted to take a relaxing bath and the faucet came unscrewed and the top piece fell off into my hands, little did we know that this was just the beginning. We thought they were minor problems and had no reason to believe that the problems would be indicative of the days to follow. The first two nights were the only nights we slept peacefully. Every night after, for the rest of the week we were woken up in the middle of the night from noises from the plumbing. The noise was so loud that it woke us up out of a dead sleep. The first night I was so frightened that I ran into the bathroom and saw rust colored liquid backing up in the sink and in the tub! That evening when we tried to take a bath we noticed the bath water had the same rusty-tint. I called the front desk and they said to they would let the manager know and he or she would get back to us. Unfortunately, the manager never got back to us at all. Since we were leaving the next day we decided not make a big deal about it and reported the problem to guest services and never received a call from anyone regarding this problem during our entire stay. I then called the front desk to ask for new soap because the soap was sitting in the rusty and filthy water in the tub. Again no one got back to us or provided any soap.
