I then asked one of the maids and she was happy to help. My husband and I decided to let the water run and after 10 minutes the water was still rusty. We had a car scheduled to meet us at 7am and didn’t have time to wait for someone at the hotel to get back to us. We were determined not to let this ruin our vacation and hoped the problem would be solved upon our return from our day trip. We had arranged for a private tour to the ruins and my sister who staying a few minutes away at a different hotel and joined us for the tour. On our return we had planned to stop at our hotel for drinks and appetizers at the beach bar. After being in the sun all day my sister asked to take a quick shower in our room. The water seemed to clear after letting the water run for 5-10 minutes. I then called guest services for soap and was told I needed to buy it at the gift shop! This was rude and shocking!!! On our last night we stopped at guest services to express our disappointment and the problems we faced. We were told that the manager would be told and we would hear back from him or her. We did not, as a matter of fact to add insult to injury our experience got even worse! As we were checking out of the hotel, my husband and I settled the bill and pulled away from the resort. We were chased by an employee from Maroma and the driver was stopped as we were pulling away. I thought to myself that perhaps it was the manager wanting to apologize. To our shock and amazement it was guest services, who wanted to collect $8.00 from us from an unpaid bill from the gift shop, which was never applied to our bill. After spending almost $10,000 in one week at Maroma, we were chased for $8.00! Not only disappointed, but now embarrassed by other guests that witnessed this scene in front of the hotel! Words cannot describe how humiliated we both felt when we were stopped. It seems ironic that the values and philosophies that Maroma stands for were the very things lacking in this situation. There was a clear lack of concern and not even the slightest of considerations were extended. As a frequent guest of Orient-Express for business and pleasure, I will certainly think twice about booking a room at Maroma. I am most dissatisfied and extremely frustrated by the sequence of events resulting in this review for future travelers to Maroma.

Reviews.Title: “Go back NOW!”
Reviews.Author: kimhoney
Reviews.Content: We were at Maroma May 17 to 24. This is our fourth time to this resort. We found out about it on the Travel Channel several years back when it was number one on the Ten Best Carribean Beach resorts. We decided to go to all ten (we have been to Little Dix Bay, Caneel Bay, Ritz in St. Thomas, which were also on the list) but once we got to Maroma we stopped and now we just go back there. The swine flu thing really has caused a stress in Mexican Riviera but we had no trouble at all. Took lots of hand sanitizer. Some people at the airport were wearing masks and they made you sign a document saying you hadn't sneezed in the past few days and they even took our temperature once. Maroma's occupancy was extremely low when we got there (we were told that 25 hotels in the Hotel Zone in Cancun were shut down completely and the Italian resort next to Maroma was shut down too), like10%. So you basically had this entire resort to yourself (even when it's busy it is very quiet). The airport was no problem. Just be sure you keep walking all the way outside to get to your Maroma driver, who will pick you up and give you water and take you to the resort. We stopped in Puerto Moreles and got a styrofoam ice chest, ice and beer, and some liquor, to take to our room. When you arrive at Maroma they will give you a margarita and a tour (we didn't take the tour because we've been there before). They upgraded us from a garden room to an ocean view room and it was just beautiful. The beach is to die for. The blue beach beds are fabulous. The beach service was incredible. In fact the service is incredible across the board. While the scenary is idyllic, the service is what really puts this place over the top. Take them up on their offer to make special food requests. We had homemade tamales, molletes for breakfast, empanadas, enchiladas, all off the menu stuff that they will prepare happily for you. Even had a BLT for breakfast one day with fries. Be sure and try the various sauces that are available. Ixni pec is very good. Cilantro was closed but the menu was still available. We had fish, shrimp, lobster, chicken, just everything. Expect to pay $14.00 for a lunch of shrimp and chicken k-bobs. I am not a ceviche fan but people who are say it's great too. Most of the dishes at lunch will set you back more than $20.00 per entree. A bottle of chardonnay (which would retail here for about $13.00) will cost $50.00. Since we are wine heads this cost us. Dinner at El Sol is expensive. The entire resort is expensive. I agree with what another reviewer said: if you can't afford it, just come for fewer days, because you just have to see this place. We had four spa treatments with Toni and Carmen who were both just great. We had snorkel trips with Cinthya and Sandro and they were just fabulous. We even have an underwater video that Cinthya took while we were snorkeling. We left the resort only one time to look around with Cinthya and Ernesto in Puerto Moreles. Lots of property for sale down there. They were both so friendly. I need to e-mail them our recipe for pasta and meatballs. At night the resort is just enchanting, with candlelight everywhere. The breeze blew most days so it was not so hot. It only rained one day and only for a short time. Finally, I come back to the service. While we were there they were switching out staff weekly, so from the first Sunday to Friday I think we had the same people helping us. They were all just fantastic. In addition to the above, Anzelmo and Gilberto, Moises, Carlos, Joaquin, Michelle at the dive shop, Gabriella, Belin, Juan Jose, Victor, Frederico, Irvin, Alberro, Samantha, Jorge, Guillame, our housekeeper Rachel, our chefs Mario, Guillermo, and Gabriel, who remembered us from last year, and all those whose names we have forgotten, gracias from Kim y Rafael. See you next time!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return - amazing service in a low key, beautiful haven”
Reviews.Author: goeuws
Reviews.Content: I visited with my husband for a quick trip. We loved it and the service was attentive and friendly without being intrusive. Our ocean view room was beautiful but it would have been nice to have a more private bathroom (only the toilet was in its own room). My only complaint is that the food, while good, lacked in spicy heat and was often a bit bland to me. I live near a great Mexican restaurant in NYC so maybe I'm conditioned to their seasoning levels. Didn't use the spa b/c the trip was so brief but it looked inviting and I'm sure the staff is great. It was wonderful to awake to fresh coffee waiting outside my room.

Reviews.Title: “A 5 STAR HOTEL IT IS NOT”
Reviews.Author: maluna2000
Reviews.Content: The Good News: A very friendly staff Good food and service The Bad News: Rooms are in urgent need of repair Prices for room, drinks and food are on the high side The dense jungle around the hotel give rise to a lot of mosquiotes, spiders and fleas so bring lots of spray. The hotel needs to spray more.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the Best for Casual Warmth and Ultimate Luxury”
Reviews.Author: skylark274
Reviews.Content: One of the best vacations I have ever enjoyed. Everything was personalized and just right for me. Some of the nicest staff members I have ever encountered, a magnificant beach, a lovely room with a patio overlooking the ocean, beautiful grounds and many interesting side trips close by. I also enjoyed the food, well prepared using lots of fresh, local ingredients - indulgent, but mostly healthy, too. I'd go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “A very special place”
Reviews.Author: Luxury-Bliss
Reviews.Content: We (couple, 40ish) just came back back from 2 wonderful weeks (Mar 10th-24th 2009) at Maroma Resort & Spa. We have stayed in other similarly priced hotels and resorts in the past and while we have sometimes liked the food better than we did at Maroma or stayed in nicer, larger rooms than we did at Maroma, this is place that we most likely would return to. The first reason for this is the beautiful beach (nicer than anything we have so far experienced in Mexico, the Maldives, Mauritius, Bali etc etc). The beach is wide and clean, the sand is white and powdery, the sea is clear and turquoise with a little surf. The second reason is the size and "special feel" of the resort: with about 60 rooms it is quite small and to us felt more like a spa-hotel than a Mexican resort. Some further comments (partly in response to other reviews here): 1.) Food and Drinks Quality of food and drinks is very good (we liked the lunch-menu best). Definitely try the "Tuna+Grapefruit" Ceviche (at the beach-bar) and the Guacamole and chips (brought to your day bed on the beach). For variety, go to Playa del Carmen (see 6.). 2.) Rooms We had a very nice room with direct ocean-view in the main-building. While there definitely are resorts with more spacious and luxurious rooms at similar rates, we did not mind at all because we spent most of the day at the beautiful beach anyway and slept very well at night. There was no TV in the room which we actually found very nice (full relaxation and time for books). 3.) Cost Food and drinks ARE expensive but NOT at rip-off-level. Since you are not required to sign anything when you leave a restaurant or a bar, the place has an "all-inclusive" feeling to it (an illusion that is destroyed rather harshly upon checkout when you get your bill). Only go if you can afford it. (If you can't afford it: go anyway but stay less days.) 4.) Service Service was very good and quick, everyone is trying to adress you with your first name which we thought has a nice touch. 5.) Specials For a special evening, do the rooftop-dinner on the "Mirador" (great view, beautiful stars). Make sure to tip the poor waiter who has to schlepp your food the 80 steps upward to the roof. 6.) Nightlife There was virtually no nightlife at Maroma. Mariachis play almost daily at dinnertime but there was no music at the bars and they closed at around 10pm. If you want to go out at night, you can take a taxi to Playa del Carmen though (20 Minutes, US$20) where there are heaps of restaurants/bars/clubs. As I have already written above, Maroma was a beautiful, relaxing and entertaining holiday. If we would have to choose to re-visit just one place that we have been to in the past, this would be it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, shame about the extra costs”
Reviews.Author: BasherLondon
Reviews.Content: Sorry for the belated review, I stayed at Maroma in Feb 2008. We had spent 1 week in Merida and transferred by coach to Cancun where we had arranged for the hotel to pick us up for transfer to the hotel. From the first welcome by the staff to our drop off at the airport we had a wonderful week in Maroma. The staff are excellent, the food is fabulous, a couple of restaurants with different characters, rooms are full of charm and we were made to feel very welcome. The main downside for me was a recurring fee of 'nickle and diming' over every extra. If you wanted water you were offered VOS at highly inflated prices, with only 2 small bottles of complimentary water in the room each evening. Even the transfer to the hotel we had to pay an additional $50 because they were picking us up from the coach station and not the airport. There are no tours or activities out of the hotel, even organising a taxi into Playa Del Carmen was a fortune. The second small downside, was that the hotel was beautiful and quiet every evening until the weekend. On Friday a large number of loud Americans descended on paradise, obviously because its an easy weekend trip from US. Although they all tend to eat dinner at 6pm so if you are European most of the rush has left restaurant by the time you get there :) I would recommend this hotel to others, but we aware that you'll have a hefty bill at the end of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Dreams do come true...”
Reviews.Author: bijoooou
Reviews.Content: Maroma Resort is heaven! My husband and I booked Maroma for our destination wedding and from the moment we stepped foot on their grounds it was pure perfection. It's an intimate boutique resort with understand elegance. The resort is magnificent and you feel like you're part of real architecture and home...definitely not a typical chain hotel. The staff was great (sweet, funny, hospitable) BUT not annoying. In addition, our guests were blown away and commented that this was the best vacation and wedding of their life. I need to stress that the guests in AWE were also the guests who originally complained that we were getting married in 1) Mexico 2) at VERY expensive resort. I need to stress that EVERYONE was high on life once they arrived! They LOVED it, no one wanted to leave and they all mentioned going back one day! As for the food, it was pretty good...better then expected! After a week its definitly gets tiresome but you can drive to 5th Ave and dine out! I have to be honest...the negative reviews about the hotel made me extremely nervous. I read so many complaints but if you do your due diligence there is no reason to be disappointed. This is a romantic, relaxing, stunning location! As for our room, we stayed in an upper level Sian Nah Suite. I couldn't imagine staying in another room since for our wedding. It was absolutely amazing...I think everything about Maroma is better in person and their website and pictures don't do it justice. Since we had about 20 guests I was able to see lots of rooms types specifically (ocean, garden, villa and sian nah) Feel free to contact me if you have any questions. If you want to plan a special dinner I highly recommend doing a private dinner on top of Maroma (the miranda). Yes its pricey but it is super romantic...a MUST for an engagement or anniversary dinner. The banquet manager, Carena, is an absolute doll. She did an amazing job with executing our wedding and it truly was a dream come true. I highly recommend this resort for a desti wedding and wouldn't change a thing or do it any other way! I'm probably missing a lot of info but I'm still on cloud 9 trying to think how I can get the hell out of NYC and go back to heaven on earth!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Second Time Around!”
Reviews.Author: DavidBed
Reviews.Content: My background: 35 years old, married, living in Chicago. Have visited many fantastic hotels from the Four Seasons in Maui, Ritz Grand Cayman to One and Only in Bahamas. My wife and I just returned from Maroma on Feb 24, which was our second visit in the last 12 months to Maroma and just as special. After reading the positive reviews and few negative ones, I will say if you do your research, you won't make the mistakes the negative reviewers had. This is an incredibly special and romantic place, but you need to understand it is not trying to be an ultra modern boutique hotel.....This is what makes Maroma different from the other choices in the Riviera Maya. Rooms: My wife and I stayed in Garden Rooms 14 last May and Garden Room 15 this February. These are 2 of the larger and better garden rooms, and I highly recommend both. We did not miss an ocean view as these offer more privacy than many of the ocean view rooms and the Hammock on the oversized patio overlooking the jungle trees is fantastic....I almost didn't mind the day it rained. If you are looking for an ultra modern room which is 1200 sf with plasma tv's and high speed internet connections, then Maroma is not right for you. Those that complained about these things should have simply done more research. Our room was well sized at about 350 sf including the bathroom. The bed was very comfortable, but beds are always very personal. The bathroom was great. Loved the huge tub with no shower curtain, great water pressure and double sinks with plenty of room for both you and your significant other. One night they filled the tub while we were at dinner and put rose petals in the tub for us. Just one of the many personal touches that many other hotels neglect to do. Service: Those that question Maroma's 5 star status cannot question Maroma's top notch service. As I mentioned, we were in Maroma last May and the entire staff was still there and most of them remembered us by face or name, which we found incredible. Gabrielle, Jorge, Alvaro, Cesar, Tachi (at the bar) were all fabulous with great personalities and a sense of humor, which often times is lacking at other more stuffy resorts. Each morning, coffee was on our patio at exactly 8 am or earlier, on the beach they are extremely attentive but not overbearing, and the waiters are all on their game. Beach: Let the other reviews speak for themself. The negative reviewers do make a good point about the trash that you will see past the resort, but I recommend walking to right on the beach, which is much cleaner. They keep the beach spotless at Maroma and the beds are fantastic. The only time you may have a problem getting a bed is if you get to the beach later on in the AM, but we were always there by 9 am and could choose any one we wanted usually. A beautiful beach whether it be Ritz Grand Cayman, a nice beach in Nantucket or Four Seasons Maui, I feel Maroma's beach rivals any of them and the water is great. Pool: The garden pool is your best bet.....While many people state it is not heated, I found that one was plenty warm. I guess if you are older or are used to 85 degree pools, then Maroma may dissapoint, but the pool by the garden was about 75 degrees, which was refreshing for us. Food: If you want a resort with 5 restaurants with sushi and Italian and other choices, then don't stay at Maroma. If you like high end Mexican cuisine, we found the food to be very good. By top US standards, it is always hard to compete, but the chef definitely knows what he is doing. Try the ceviche at the beach bar for lunch. The breakfast was fabulous....amazing fruit plate, bread basket and everything from eggs, to fresh granola to pancakes. I would recommend if you are staying for an extended period to try a restaurant in Playa Del Carmen and maybe one at another high end hotel (Tides or Mandarin Oriental). We enjoyed our meal at Mandarin but were SO happy to be staying at Maroma. Mandarin beautiful but was way too spread out with so many golf carts driving around like rush hour in Chicago. Note: I asked on my first stay if they ever did sushi, and later that day the concierge informed me that the chef would be happy to put together some sushi for us. I declined, but that was another touch that amazed me. Spa: Is gorgeous and we loved our couples massage. Was very peaceful and for 80 minutes was $150 for each, which is really very reasonable for a high end resort. We took a great jacuzzi after in the same room which was a wonderful touch. In summary: My wife and I truly believe Maroma is one of those amazing places. Once you visit the other resorts in the Riviera, you will quickly see how amazing the beach is at Maroma. The staff is phenomenal and you will be sad to leave the friends you have made while you stay there. Vacations are very personal and we all have our own opinion of what makes a resort 5 star. For us, the service, beach, personal touches, grounds and food all make Maroma an amazingly relaxing vacation, which is hard to find these days. As far as children go, supposedly they do allow 12 and over at all times except for Cmas time where they allow younger children. We had no issues with young children. I cannot imagine ever seeing more than a couple of younger teens. We saw 2 the whole week. Finally, the hundreds of lit candles every night is the icing on the cake. Enjoy Maroma....I have trouble understanding how you can't.

Reviews.Title: “This Place Is Oh My God Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: dsidocrane
Reviews.Content: I like to start the review with a few words about me to help you evaluate my comments: I am a 34 year old gay guy from NYC. My partner and I stayed here for 4 nights in February. We have traveled quite a bit and tend to stay at higher-end properties that are boutique-y or unique, rather than chains. This was one of the greatest resort experiences we've ever had. This place is magical. The arrival sets the stage. After finally finding the enterance and struggling with spanish at the security checkpoint we were let in and directed to drive down a road through the jungle that must have been a mile long. It ends in front of something that looks like your rich uncle's Mexican mansion. We were greated at the car where our keys were gently snatched from our hands and were replaced with a margarita. We were the wisked inside while two men took away our car and luggage, We were then given a truly personalized tour of the grounds which was like a finely orchestrated dance among the staff, What an enterance. Then we hopped into a golf cart to be taken to our room which was gorgeous and had our luggage already delivered. The room was one of their least expensive garden rooms, which had no view but was nevertheless spacious and well-appointed. Then Roxanna, our guide, offered us their complimentary coffee service each morning at the time of our choosing. We'd like one decaf and one hot cocoa with the NYTimes at 7:30 am please -- pinch me I'm in heaven. The breakfasts were outstanding, complete with an adorable older woman making fresh tortillas on the patio; if we could have put her in our suitcase, we would have taken her home. We ate lunch at the bar most days, which was excellent (ceviches, sandwiches and tequilas - need I say more). The formal dinners were just ok, the food was a bit ambitious at times. But the Friday night BBQ is a must, and you're on vacation so splurge on the outrageously overpriced lobster, it was delicious. Now for the real crowning glory - the beach. It's perfect. Cool, soft sand that gently slopes into the water for what seemed like a 1/8 mile and you could still stand up. The beach is very wide and so peaceful. Never once did I feel like someone was too close to me. They have beach beds set up and we never had a problem getting one. It was pure beach bliss. In fact, the resort was fully booked (all 66 rooms) and we felt like there were only a handful of people around. The place is designed that way, which is why it is TOTALLY AWESOME! OOOH, and they light the walkways each night with individual votive candles, There must have been hundreds of them, It was spectacular. Only downside is that the pools aren't heated. Please MAroma, heat your pools! Oh and there were kids there - several of them. It didn't bother me much, but others I spoke to were irratated because they thought it was adults only. One last nitpick: The food, drink and room is priced in US dollars, so at the end you will get a bill in US dollars, but then they charge your credit card in pesos. I found this a bit annoying because they are essentially tying themselves to the dollar, and therefore, you get no benefit from a weakend peso, which I could live with if they actually charged your card in dollars. Instead they charge the final total in pesos, which means that your credit card will then charge you an additional currency conversion fee on top of it. In the end I didn't care because it was a fabulous trip, but I did want to mention it. In conclusion, I would like to be on the next flight there right now,

Reviews.Title: “A very special place”
Reviews.Author: designers5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at Maroma over Valentines day and absolutely loved it. We travel the world and always stay at very fine hotels(Four Seasons, Ritz...) The Maroma is a very special place that deserves every award it has won. We stayed in 3 different rooms during our stay-a garden, and two different ocean front rooms. Each room was unique and gorgeous- the beds are draped in netting, the bathrooms are beautiful with lovely tiled, open showers(ours had a window overlooking the ocean). The service is incredible- the turndown especially as they dim the lights and illuminate the room with candlelight for the evening. The entire resort is illuminated with what must amount to several hundred tea lights every evening-every walkway and even the winding stairwells leading you to your room. The breakfeast is wonderful with fresh juices, tropical fruit and an interesting selection of entrees...we especially loved the older mexican woman who cooks fresh tortillas on the veranda and comes to your table to offer them directly out of her clay urn. All our meals were excellent- they use lots of fresh herbs with unique combinations...we always dined outside right near the ocean under the stars by candlelight. Now to the beach- my husband and I are huge beach people and walked many times a day in both directions. Yes, there is trash up away from the shore in some areas away from the resort. You can walk the beach without going near it, but it is disturbing to imagine how we pollute our waters. With that said, the ENORMOUS area in front of the Maroma is kept immaculately! They comb it throughout the day and it is stunning. The sand is the softest white powder you will ever step foot on. The Maroma cannot be expected to clean this entire stretch of the Carribbean....on many occassions I saw them go way beyond their borders and that is grueling work in the hot sun. Please just go and enyoy the natural beauty of this stunning stretch of beach and think twice before you litter yourself as you can see firsthand where it ultimately turns up. The people of the Maroma are extremely warm and welcoming. They work exceptionally hard and are very proud of their magnificant resort-as they should be. Everything is spotless-the pools are beautiful and my husband and I enjoyed them after our long walks on the beach as they are cooler than the ocean. We felt like we were staying in a private estate as we were typically the only people in the pool, at the workout facility etc.. If you wander about the property you will find different stairways which as you ascend lead to private sitting areas which overlook the Carribbean as far as the eye can see. Take a glass of wine up and enjoy!..I promise you will be the only one there. We rented a car and went to the charming village of Playa Del Carmen for dinner a few times. We had a delicious meal at John Grey's restaurant which is tucked back in a little enclave in the pedestrian zone. The hotel will make a reservation for you-we also tried John Greys other location and prefered the atmosphere in Playa. We can't imagine how anyone can stay at the Maroma and leave with complaints. We stayed the year before at the Ritz Carlton in St. Thomas, paid more money and can't even compare the experience. We also prefer Maroma to The Four Season's, Maui, The Ritz Carlton, Grand Cayman and The Fairmont Mayacoba, Playa where we had stayed two years before. We usually don't go to the same place twice as we enjoy trying new locations, however we make an exception with the Maroma. We very much look forward to our return.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not amazing”
Reviews.Author: lamn
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. However, it is priced as a five star and it isn't. First, the good -- the staff is friendly and helpful. The food is very good. The grounds are beautiful and the beach is amazing. Problems -- the rooms, at the least the two our friends and us stayed in (42 and 47), are showing their age. The three pools are relatively small and not heated. We didn't see any of them being used with any regularity. Activities are priced ridiculously. We went scuba diving and booked directly with an operator because Maroma's prices were double those offered by most dive shops. Spa prices are higher than at even the fanciest U.S. spas. The food at El Sol (the fanciest of the three restaurants) was good but not any better than El Restaurante (but, overall, we were impressed with the food). We had a great time and thought the staff of Maroma were wonderful, but were I inclined to spend the same amount, I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Faboulous !!!!”
Reviews.Author: chicoporto
Reviews.Content: We stay there for 7 days in january 2009..... it was absolutlely marvelous !!!! food (miammmm).. beach (wow !) the sand is white and so soft .. services was excellent. Everything is beautiful.. hope to go there again ! It's definitively the best place to go. Thanks !

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing resort!”
Reviews.Author: simms2009
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an amazing stay at Maroma. From the moment we arrived it felt like home. The staff were attentive and respectful. The food was remarkable. You can't find a more relaxing setting in Mexico. The little touches made all the difference during our stay. We were upgraded to an ocean front room and the view was truly breathtaking. I highly recommend the additional fee for an ocean front room. There are three pools and plenty of quiet places to enjoy a drink or read a good book. Highly recommend this resort without hesitation. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but many things we disliked during this vacation”
Reviews.Author: Fred75Paris
Reviews.Content: We stayed the 2 last weeks of Jan 2009 at Maroma. Normally, we mostly go to Asia (Thailand, Malaysia, Maldives...) at the same period, but this year, we thought that we were ready for a change. We always stay in hotels like Small Luxury Hotels of the World or Leading Hotels of the world. Airport pick up was no problem, like I read in other reviews. We arrived at night, the arrival at the hotel is great with all the candle lights spread out through the hotel. Check in was also no problem. Since we are very sensitive to noise, we had requested a really quiet room. We had booked a garden view room but were upgraded to a room with partial sea view close to the gym. The room was spacious although nothing real luxurious, the bath is really simple with only one washing basin. The king size bed was very comfortable. There are no curtains in the room, and it is difficult to get real dark at night. We found out that the room was really noisy, since it was close to Cilantro restaurant. They start to set the restaurant at 6.30, so this is how you get woken up unless you use some earplugs. Furthermore, there was an annoying generator noise, linked to the air conditionning. We had the impression to sleep on a boat, so finally, we used earplugs during all the stay. We asked to change room and the "hospitality" has tried to find another room. The best we got offered was after 8 nights, so we finally decided to keep the room and use earplugs. - Weather : coming from Europe (Paris) we were very surprised to find chilly weather when we got there. Temperature dropped to 16C in the evening, there was this cold wind, and it was difficult to eat outside for dinner. There was always a cold wind. The night comes very early, so after 4.30 on the beach, you just start to thing about going bacjk to the room. I guess it was not the right season to go to Mexico. There were 3 swimming pools in the hotel, but none was heated, so we could not swim in the pool and never saw anyone during the stay, this is not acceptable for such a hotel. - Beach : the beach in ront of the hotel was really beautifull and clean. The great thing about Maroma is definitely the beachbeds, very comfortable and well maintained. Service at the beach is good. Most of the guests reserved those beds early in the morning just putting some personnal belongings. This was the only way to get a beachbed. We dislike this method and would expect enough beds for the guests. Since it was the only possibility to get those beds, we just did the same. In order to get the most of the day, and although we like to get up late, we decided to get up at 7.00 and have an early day. We like to walk on the beach, and it was one of the reasons of our choice of Maroma. The beach in front of the hotel was clean, but as soon as you leave it, whether going north or south, the beach is littered with all kinds of garbage, plastic bottles of all kinds, shoes, ropes, all kind of junk. This is really a shame and very disappointing to us, it looks like the Mexican people and also the tourists do not really care about their environment. Most of the garbage comes from the sea throught the storms, and there is nothing done about it, really disappointing. Each hotel only cleans in front of the hotel, but no further. - Food : breakfast was good with a wonderfull scenery in front of the sea with sunrise. It was always the same a la carte menu, which was quite boring after a few days, nothing new or special. Since it was not a buffet (which we would have prefered), service was sometimes really slow since you have to ask for everything. Lunch on the beach was OK for small dishes, but also there always the same menu. - Dinner : this was the main problem and our disappointment for that kind of exclusive hotel. Food was very simple, no real difference between El restaurante and El Sol. We like fish, and there was no variety (mostly grouper), which was always overcooked and oily. Food was simply not our taste and was we expected, no variety, nothing special. Worse of all is the price you pay. Since you add 25% service + tax, for us it was like paying in EUR. So you pay around EUR 20 for a starter, EUR 30 - 35 for main dish (EUR 88 for a 500g Lobster !!!) and Around EUR 10 for dessert, portions were not big. This is simply overpriced for the quality and choice and really not good. The wines and drinks were overpriced too, EUR 100 for a bottle of Mexican wine. At the end of the trip, we were really glad to go back home and not spend our money ther anymore. Only good thing was the impeccable service, with really nice and kind people. - Spa : great spa area, but also here overpriced, EUR 130 for a 50 mn massage. All in all, and eventhough I recognize that this hotel has charm, we were really disappointed by our stay at the Maroma, and we would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation at Maroma”
Reviews.Author: BuellerNyc
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time at this beautiful place. Staff could not have been friendlier or more welcoming. Service was excellent. Relatively small size of resort made for very relaxing, "home-like" atmosphere. Beautiful beach, snorkeling was great, and great tennis courts also. Definitely plan on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven On Earth For a Small Fortune”
Reviews.Author: LIZZYHEURTE
Reviews.Content: I have been to Maroma twice and loved every minute of it. The beach is the best in the area and the staff is just superb. The rooms are comfortable and the place has an amazing intimate feel. I plan to go back there as many times as I can. The cost is a small fortune, but worth it for those willing to splurge. If you are on a budget, do not even consider this place. The only drawback is that there are no TV's in the room and the food is too Mexican for my taste. But, those are easy things to forget when you wake up hearing the sound of the ocean at Maroma.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: How2UK
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. The service is impeccable, the food is delicious and the rooms are big, comfortable and scrupulously clean. This stretch of coastline is being ruined by big-scale developments but Maroma is still an oasis of calm and real luxury and has managed to retain a sense of place, for example by the staff greeting you in Spanish and keeping plenty of local food on the menu. It is expensive but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Maroma ....a once in a lifetime experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: pek2383
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to Maroma, and it just keeps getting better!! From the moment you touchdown in Cancun airport and go get in your private SUV to take you to the property, you become in another world. Maroma is a good 25-30 minute ride from the airport but use that time to relax and get into vacation mode! When you arrive to check in , they greet you with a welcome margarita and a lovely young lady will show you to your room! We have been so many times that we get upgraded to our favorite room .. it is right next to the workout facility and is so nice!! The mood at Maroma is very serene and quiet. There is certainly not a lot of action or nightlife but we go just to chill out, get away from the world, eat some good food, and enjoy each other's company. I am 25 and this is the perfect vacation for me!! The whole entire staff is super attentive and will do whatever you need to make sure your visit is superb. In response to the high price of food, might I suggest you do what we do ... upon arrival we hop a cab into Playa del Carmen and stock up on waters, snacks, diet cokes, and alcohol.. we go to the Mega Mart ... then at the resort we simply ask for glasses of ice ... they are really nice about it and we always take care of the staff before we leave. And we always take those big bottles of water they leave in your room with us to breakfast and lunch!! Why wouldn't you to save the ten dollars for a bottle of water? We actually do this at all luxury resorts!! Maroma is an absolute slice of heaven on earth and thank God that I have been given the opportunity to go not once not twice but THREE times!! AMAZING!! We are going back in May and couldn't be more excited!! Maroma is a home away from home!!

Reviews.Title: “A "Mixed Bag"”
Reviews.Author: susu9
Reviews.Content: Maroma is a slice of authentic Mexico in an otherwise sterile, glitzy row of hotels on the Riviera Maya. As a resort it is beautiful, well appointed, gracious staff, on a beautiful piece of beach with a well appointed spa as part of the resort. My husband and I had wanted to go there for years but it was extremely expensive so we passed it by for other wonderful Carribean resorts. More recently we discovered "best deal days" and booked a Master Suite for the week which included breakfast, airport transfers and snorkel trip for two. Still pricey with 22% added to the room rate for service fees and taxes, but worth a try given what we had read about the place. It is romantic, highly personalized as its small and intimate and everything is first class. By day two, all the staff know your name and you do not need to sign for anything. Beachfront there are wonderful lounging beds - altho you need to get there early to put your book on one to "reserve". We had a second floor ocean view suite. Those on the first floor may have little privacy if you like to sit on your outside terrace. We live in NYC where prices are high. However, prices at Maroma are even higher . A car rental for a day runs $100. Taxis to Playa del Carmen which is 35 minutes away are $40. A bottle of water on the beach runs $8. Most wines for diner are over $50. Barbeque nite featured a 12 oz. lobster tail for $88. Add service and tax and these prices are over the top. Yoga and pilates classes run $33. You can bring the bottle of water from your room to the beach and ask for ice. As far as activities, these are limited. There are no TV, radio or clocks in the rooms. There are two communal TV rooms on the property , one with FREE! interernt access. You can ask to watch a DVD in these rooms. Our last day we found out there are board games also available. Day trips are also offered to more local sites but not very advertised. Night life includes some music at dinner - maybe. Barbeque nite has a fire dance at 7 which is not advertised. Those coming to dinner after 8 miss this. Also unadvertised is a lounge room for guest at the airport. Its on the second floor near the escalators. A pleasant place to sit while you wait to go home.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: hs0702
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Maroma with very high expectations given the reviews on this site and the lofty price tag. Most of what we enjoyed has been shared by others - the beach, the quiet - made Maroma a true getaway from civilization. However, we were very disappointed in the food. For a 5-star facility, we found the menu lacking any creativity, and we had to cross our fingers that any particular plate would taste good - dishes came out too hot, too cold, none came out inspired. We're very far from "foodies," but at an average price of $125 for lunch and $200 for dinner (mind you, that's with no more than 2 cocktails, 2 appetizers, 2 entrees, and one shared dessert), we certainly expected the food to equal the world-class beach experience. Sorry, but for the prices they charge you should be able to rave about every facet of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Maroma in Many Ways”
Reviews.Author: yogiblossoms
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married at the Tides in Zihautanejo and loved it everything about it close to town, great food, and excellent customer service! So when we decided to go the Playa Del Carmen for our honeymoon we wanted to stay at the tides but they don't have any beach front rooms so we started to look elsewhere. After doing extensive research on internet and with my travel agent we decided to stay at Maroma. We paid over $10,000 for the week so in my opinion not a cheap vacation. My husband and I usally stay at 5 star hotels and thought we would be very happy with our Maroma decision. To begin Maroma is about a 30 minute drive into town for some people this is great but if you want to eat elsewhere or just go out you will spend anywhere from $20 to $30 one way so at least $50 just to get into town and back. My husband also has a bad back and the dirt road to get there didn't help. The cobblestone pathways didn't help his back either. The weather in December was horrible super windy, cloudy, and rained some too. So because of the bad weather we wanted to watch some television or a move but there are NO TV's in the rooms. After complaining they gave us one on the house but other wise you have to pay for it as a rental. Okay so the tech. gets worse no wireless internet they have a cord that is 5 feet long and you have to sit there to get on line. We got on line about 50% of the time we tried and when you try sometimes you get on and sometimes you don't. I am a vegan/vegetarian and had heard great reviews about the food. The first night we got there they offered me a salad. Being that town is a half hour away I thought I was going to be screwed. When we tried to get out and move to another hotel they denied us. I told the manager I was in tears and not happy she said sorry let us try and they offered us a tv to watch movies on because there is no satellite in the rooms and we had to call numberous times to get it delivered and when it did it didn't work and then they brought another one and the screen was ripped. The food is crazy expensive and no other options cause everything is so far away. The food is not that great. We thought the Tides was 10 times better for food. Also the one day we got some nice weather it took them forever to bring us a drink or food. They were quick to lay our towells out but that is it! We had a plunge pool on our deck which was cold We had to call to see if they could warm the tub. Took a while for them to get it heated. The spa is ranked in Travel and Liesure but was nothing special they didn't even have a hot tub. You have to sign up for a couple's massage to use the one hot tub. Also when they take you around for the grand tour they mention the yoga/pilates classes and the sweat lodge so we were going to attend yoga and the sweet lodge and then realized for an additional charge. The yoga classes are $33 and the sweet is $150 a person. I am a yoga instructor and have never had to pay for yoga classes ie. the tides, Miraval, or anywhere we have stayed this should be included. Also most sweats are by donations. Total rip off esp. since we were paying over $800 per night for our room. On the flip side the beach was beautiful a little boring and the 3 pools they have were all freezing. I saw one lady one day in one of the pools the pools should be heated. No infinity pools and no pools by the beach. We had a private scuba dive which was amazing and I was not certified so the guy certified me there at the hotel in the pool and the pool was so cold that the guide had me in a full wet suit. may i remind you we are in mexico. the pool temp was much colder than the ocean. we needed to buy some dental floss and it was $9 . Anyways I think I have made my point Maroma may be for some people like older people or someone who wants no contact with the outside world and that may be for you but we 36 and 34 and so for mid 30's I would say go elsewhere. We were highly disappointed and would not recommend it to anyone we know. When we checked out we told them how unhappy we were in a nice way and she said well hey at least it was your honeymoon and i said "exactly my point"!

Reviews.Title: “maroma---beyond superlative”
Reviews.Author: brucestoddard
Reviews.Content: I shall make this brief since maroma already has so many fabulous recommendations its hard to say anything unique here. My wife and i have traveled extensively and usually staying at only 5 star properties, 4-seasons hotels etc. this resort is one of the greatest in the world, hands down. Certainly in the top 5 that i have ever stayed at. the sian nah suites cannot be believed...outdoor showers and private plunge pools are rarely available anywhere unless one is at the 4 seasons in bali. The service exceeds all standards anywhere and the food was some of the best that we have ever had ...anywhere in the world...and i don't even care for mexican food. Be sure and do the Alltournative tours trip to coba and be sure to have dinner one night at the rosewood mayakoba just down the road....another gorgeous hotel, extraordinary contemporary design with quite fabulous food. Nothing more to say here except that this resort will blow your socks off.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: IG0
Reviews.Content: We have traveled around the world and Maroma is our favorite beach resort. It's romantic and luxurious. The staff make you feel like you are in their home not at their work. I've seen reviews about the price and I think it's worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect escape”
Reviews.Author: CBtripper
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a six night stay at Maroma in celebration of our 10 year anniversary and we could not imagine a more perfect, peaceful way to escape from the real world. Everything (repeat: Everything) is done first class from the moment they meet you at the airport to the moment you arrive and are greeted by what feels like your own personal concierge. There is no typical hotel lobby for check in. Instead you are taken on a tour of the property (margarita in hand) which concludes with your hotel room where the final check in takes less than a minute. From there you are on your own to enjoy the pleasures of Maroma - from the beautiful beach to the tasty drinks, the top-notch food, the spa, walking around perfectly cared for grounds.... This is one place where the pictures you have seen here and on the resort's website are the real deal. It looks just like you expect it to. And even though so many reviews speak about the friendliness of the service, you'll still be blown away. People like Moises, Sergio, Guillermo, Edgar, etc. (and Nancy and Jesus at the Tezmecal) are all wonderful, approachable and a delight to be around. Another thing that does not come through in the reviews is just how much space you'll have to yourself as it is a big property with limited rooms so you can pass the day without really noticing anyone else. Yes, it's pricey but well worth it. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “"Welcome Home"”
Reviews.Author: mariNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: The greeting you get when coming out of your private car from the airport. The are waiting for you with drink in hand and a warm smile. The reviews are mostly good but the few that are bad, I just don't understand. The staff does make an effort to know who you are and what you like. I stayed during the renovation of part of the resort, which was a concern of mine before going. However after e-mailing manager and travel agent contacting them i was assured that it would be ok. They were open and honest about the closure of one of the restaurants and we could hear some construction noise on one side of resort However this did not disrupt our trip. The resort staff was so attentive and concerned that we had a great time. The're modo was "handmade hospitality". This means handmade soaps in the bathroom, eco-friendly options on the whole resort, limited use of lights (candle light instead) so romantic. The food was mexican gourmet food. We also enjoyed a BBQ on the beach. This resort is immaculately clean. These people take pride in what they do. The spa is not to be missed. Ask what you wish and they try to get it for you.. This was not a inexpensive vacation but it is easy enough to see where your money was spent ! Breakfast on the balcony is the best, it arrives quick and always hot ! I will make this one of my top picks to return to. I was in a premium room on the second floor with a part ocean view and pool view. This room was on the lower end of price range. This room was large. If you are looking for quiet,romance,retreat, without television this is your place. There is a very relaxed atmosphere, and casual, however,they expect you to dress properly for dinner in dinningroom..This resort looks just like the photos on the website. I hope this will help...

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Romantic”
Reviews.Author: HideawaysIntl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 10 days along the Mayan Riviera inspecting various hotels in the area. Maroma was by far our favorite. Located on a beautiful stretch of beach, this hotel offers a very romantic, and intimate setting for those looking to escape it all. Totally hidden away from the road, it's a 5-10 drive through the "jungle" down to the hotel which is located right on the beach (no high rise hotel here!). The rooms in the original section of the hotel are in several small buildings offering garden and ocean view rooms. The rooms are simply but elegantly decorated in a rustic mayan theme (think white stucco walls, mahogany furniture, creamy linens and mexican tiled floors). We had an ocean view room with a private patio complete with a breakfast table and hammock to retreat to when we'd had enough sun. The restaurant here offers the ultimate in gourmet cuisine and it really is an experience with the way they set up the dinner service. Lots of candles, soft music and a breeze coming in off the Caribbean sea. The Kinan Spa is large and offers a wide range of spa treatments. They also have yoga and other special classes for those looking to have a total wellness experience. While we found this resort to be very romantic, I could also see getting the girls together for a spa weekend here for total pampering. Especially in the newer section of the hotel that has more mainstream hotel accommodations. Being a travel agent for 12+ years I've had the opportunity to experience hundreds of hotels around the the world. Maroma easily ranks in my top 10. If you're considering a stay down in the Riviera Maya - this is an excellent choice. Feel free to contact me via email [-]. We are a luxury travel club and can offer exclusive discounted rates and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Trip!”
Reviews.Author: aba640
Reviews.Content: All I can say is how fabulous this hotel is! I am currently sitting in the VIP lounge of the Cancun airport waiting for my flight, so sad to be leaving such a special resort (the VIP lounge is a nice little feature they throw in for the guests complimentary). We spent 8 nights in a gorgeous ocean front room. Every positive review hit it on the head regarding the service, the beach, and the people of Maroma. We felt like we were part of their family from start to finish. The beach is by far the nicest beach weve ever been to!!! It is an aqua blue that you need to see to believe! Quite ideal for long walks with your loved one. The food is of the highest quality and we even scheduled a Mexican cooking class with Philippe and Alejandro (some of the chefs) who taught us all about Mexican cuisine. I cannot say enough good things about this resort. Everything about Maroma is pure decadence and we cannot wait to come back very soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Magical experience”
Reviews.Author: Reef3PB
Reviews.Content: Maroma is a breathtaking and magical resort. Upon arrival we were picked up in a very nice sedan with cold drinks. The arrival to the hotel was a breeze and was upgraded to very beautiful room with increadible ocean views. The hotel was very clean and the room service was amazing. The room service would always light the candles in the room every evening and our last night they filled the bath tub with roses petals awaiting our arrival. The staff always new us by name and were very much on the ball. The food at the resort was very good and we never once had a bad meal. The resort is very peaceful and calming. The spa was a nice treat and found the services to be spectacular. My only one complaint about the hotel were the beds on the beach. The beds were always filled up by 10:00 which left you with beach chairs. There beach chairs were not awful but I must admit the beds on the beach were a much better way to spend your day lounging around the palya :) I would highly recommend this resort to anyone and would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the Sun”
Reviews.Author: LifeInTheFastLane
Reviews.Content: First off, the Maroma is warm, welcoming, beautiful, and caters to one's every need: from the leather-seated Tahoe that picks you up at the airport to even the smallest of their rooms. That being said, it is not for the faint of wallet. We were there for the wedding of some dear friends, and the rates we paid were fantastic, but if you are not in a group, be prepared to shell it out. But if you are prepared, then it is a slice of heaven: plenty of cushiony chairs and beds by the beach, food that is always good (but don't be late to breakfast or you will miss the chocolate chip muffins and the fresh corn tortillas), and a very reasonable workout facility (you need it after the chocolate chip muffins et al). The rooms were very nice, and the housekeeping staff earn their gratuity. Would we go back? We'll see how this year's bonus turns out. But after a few wild college spring breaks in Cancun, I was truly in a world apart.

Reviews.Title: “Best romantic trip!”
Reviews.Author: Haverford
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Maroma last December during the Christmas holidays. It was a very special trip that we've talked about often with our friends and family. I used the TripAdvisor site to get other people's reviews and found it helpful when planning my own trip, I hope I can do the same for someone else We were met at the airport by a nice man who greeted us with water and a towel, when he knew our name we just assumed it was because he was sent to greet us. We arrived before our room was ready so the hotel offered us a clean room to use to change and freshen up. We sat at Freddy's bar for our first taste of delicious ceviche and some drinks. When Freddy called us by our names (they use first names with everyone) we didn't understand after being there for only an hour how he knew us. What we didn't realize was that everyone already knew our names and our room number. This was all before checking in to the room. It was amazing how they didn't overlook any details, we were impressed. The service the entire stay was wonderful. Many waiters were available during the day to bring us drinks or food and set up chairs. The beach lounge chairs were as large as a queen bed built for two and were fantastic. Your feet never have to touch the sand. But I implore you to take a walk on the beach, the quality of which is amazing. We live in Los Angeles, have been to other beaches in Mexico, the Carribbean and the Hampton's, to us nothing compared to this sand. It's soft fine quality was beautiful, the water was a gorgeous blue and calm. It was easy to sit in the shallow part of the water or jump in for swimming. The only negative experience I had at the beach was often these wonderful beach beds were "saved" by greedy guests. Often we came down in the morning to find just a magazine out on a bed and no guest arriving until hours later. It became a bit of a game, perhaps based on the time of year that we went. However, we always had a chair and an umbrella and once they even carried a beach bed down from the pool for us to use at the beach. At night they entire resort is lit by candle light creating gorgeous and romantic lighting for the walkways leading to the different parts of the hotel and to your room. The restaurants were great, for variety we went into the town of Playa del Carmen one evening. We enjoyed having the chance to people watch and check out a new place, but the food was fair and I wouldn't recommend it if you have a limited number of nights. There are two restauarants at the hotel, we never felt like this was a problem. Also on specific nights there are special buffet dinners in the sand. We enjoyed that we saw the same small group of people during the day and night. The spa style restaurant is open for breakfast and lunch, they were able to make anything we wanted which was great for a lighter bite. We enjoyed egg white omelettes in the morning and fresh salads for lunch. My boyfriend also treated us to a very romantic dinner on the beach. The scene looked out of movie or TV show. It was gorgeous and decadant and wonderful. The menu was created specifically for us with wine pairings, we had a five course meal under the moonlight. The path to our place in the sand was lit by candles and torches and in the middle of this circle was our beautiful table. It was amazing to eat five feet from the ocean sitting at this gorgeous table. They even provided blankets for us when the weather dropped and I was a bit cold. It was a magical night that I will never forget. If you want more of a nightlife, this is not the hotel for you. It's a small boutique hotel and very much feels that way in the evenings. They do offer a room with computers and a television, however we never went into it other then to check on our flight home. I feel that the purpose of this resort is to relax, unwind and float away. We enjoyed a couple's massage at the spa which was great. I thought the amenities were great and even used the small hotel gym a few mornings. We also did a full day tour to explore ancient ruins of Coba (set up through the hotel). The day trip was a bit pricey but we did a lot of things - we went repelling into a cenote, climbed Nohoch Mul Pyramid, was witness to a Mayan ritual ceremony, zip linned, and took a canoe. It was fun to explore and I would highly recommend it for those visitors who want to break up the beach routine. We did a ton of research when looking into this trip and felt thrilled with our decision. It is a magical place. In full discloure however I feel that it is necessary to make one further comment. We traveled in high season during Christmas. The day we were leaving a large family was arriving, and my boyfriend and I were both thankful that we would not overlap. It's not the kind of place to bring kids, even sophisticated and well behaved kids. We were happy that the hotel had a policy of no one under the age of 16. However during holiday season they are a bit more lapse about this rule. We saw kids who were 12 and 13. We were surprised parents would take their children here given its quiet, secluded beach and tranquil setting. However, I would make sure when booking to inquire about the policy if you are looking for a romantic trip. No one wants to hear a kid when trying to get away with a romantic partner.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach and service. Disappointing rooms. Ok food. Largely overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: AlessioLondon
Reviews.Content: Beach and service were excellent. Rooms a disappointment. Clearly in need of renovation: aircon system rather primitive, old fashioned interior. Also, very small room for any given price level. Food was just about edible. All in all, it's Incredibly expensive for what it really is. However, in this part of Mexico this is probably the only option if you want to have a high standards hotel, staying away from the all inclusive resort life. Comes with a hefty price tag though, probably given scarcity of alternatives. Beware, tennis courts are un-usable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Slice of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: LawOnTravel
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 5 days and 4 nights in August and it was truly magnificant. The only place that I have stayed that surpasses this is the One and Only Palmilla in Cabo. This is truly a 5 star resort. The food was authentic mexican done fantastically. We enjoyed every meal from breakfast through dinner. I suspect that eating Mexican/Mayan for 9 or ten days may get a little old though, even food done as well as this. Our room was a Superior room with an ocean view. There is no TV in the room which was really nice, getting away from it all. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was beautiful with a great view of the ocean. The service was amazing and the staff knew your name and made it a point to greet you by name every time they came across you. The beach was simply picturesque with big queen size double beds on the beach. I would have no problem recommending this resort to anyone. The spa was very nice too.

Reviews.Title: “An extraordinary place”
Reviews.Author: PedroPortugal
Reviews.Content: This is truly one of the world's best beach resorts. You can set the highest expectations and you won't be desapointed: an amazing beach, rooms, service, food, staff attitude, attention to details - everything is exceptional at this resort and they will make you feel special. I had stayed at La Samanna last year, which also belongs to the Orient Express group but I was quite disapointed so I wasn't expecting much but Maroma is a cut above the rest and the service is in line with Banyan Tree resorts in Asia, which is my favourite hotel chain. Of course the price is in line with the level of the resort, so be prepared to pay an expensive bill for this exclusive place. We stayed at a beach front suite (literally 10 steps away from the sand) and it included a private terrace with plunge pool a private gym (yes!) and a nice living room facing the ocean. There are 2 restaurants plus a spa menu for lunch. They are all good but the main restaurant is excellent. This is a small hotel, which means that you get a very personal service - everybody treats you by your name from the moment you arrive and you never need to sign any papers or bills throughout your stay. If you can afford this place, don't miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing Honeymoon at Maroma”
Reviews.Author: ciaobellaBoston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from an 8-night stay at Maroma for our honeymoon and couldn't have been happier with our choice. I had read many Trip Advisor reviews of the property and had high expectations, and all I can say is that Maroma exceeded all of them! As others have written, Maroma stands apart because of its wonderful and kind staff. Upon arrival at the hotel, we were greeted with several smiles and "Holas!," two margaritas and a tour of the grounds. By the second day everyone there knew our names. It means a lot to them that you learn theirs and attempt to speak in Spanish. The entire staff really go out of their way to make you feel like you are at home and are happy to help you with anything. On that note, the staff is constantly adding personal touches to make you feel special. We got upgraded to an ocean-facing suite, which had a spacious living room, bedroom and large bathroom. The room was decorated with red rose petals upon our arrival and they had also given us a complimentary bottle of champagne. On another night my husband and I came back from dinner and one of the staff was drawing a bubble bath in our plunge bath and adding rose petals and candles all around the bathroom. These are not things we requested...they just seemed to happen by magic! Every night the woman who did the turn-down service would also leave some kind of treat like chocolate-covered strawberries or a tequila cocktail. These are just some of the small touches that make you want to stay there and never go home...when it finally was time to go home we learned that Maroma has its own VIP lounge at the Cancun Airport for exclusive use by guests of Maroma and the Ritz-Carlton. Even upon leaving, we were once again surprised by the level of detail and thoughtfulness that they have put into making their guests comfortable. We spent most of our time at the beach, which is absolutely pristine, as it is raked several times a day and is therefore free of seaweed and debris. We never had a problem getting a beach bed and we easily spent all day out there just relaxing and swimming in the beautiful water. Definitely order lunch from Freddy's Bar and have it brought over to your beach bed/lounge chair. The shrimp quesadillas, ceviche and guacamole are so good and I keep wishing I had some here at home! Freddy's is also the perfect spot to have a pre or post-dinner cocktail. The pina coladas were some of the best we've tasted, but I don't think you could have a bad experience there! We had fun talking to Freddy himself, who is very funny and outgoing, and has lots of stories to share. We ate dinner most nights outside at El Restaurante and one night inside at El Sol. El Restaurante has a very nice selection and we particularly liked the fresh fish selections of the red snapper and shellfish. Sitting right on the beach at sunset is wonderful and we never tired of it. El Sol is really special and worth going to for more nouvelle cuisine. We thought of leaving Maroma one night for dinner but were enjoying the food and atmosphere so much that we were glad we stayed in. I recommend trying to get a room facing the water as you will get a nice breeze. We walked through the inner-facing courtyard areas in the evenings and it was always significantly hotter and muggier than the rooms facing the water. Also, the mosquitoes can be a problem on nights with little or no breeze, so bring repellent or plan to eat inside on those nights. Because Maroma is small, you will never feel like just another guest at a mega-resort. The staff really want to know who you are and how to make your stay the best that it can be! That level of service and kindness, combined with the paradise setting, make for a wonderful, magical place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Maroma, a Gorgeous, Romantic, Great Service Gem in Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: voyageurNY
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Maroma for 4 nights in late June, at one of the sian-nah suites. From start to finish, it was a wonderful experience. I had researched many other places before deciding on the Maroma (Parrot Cay; One & Only Palmilla (was undergoing construction during this period); las Ventanas; Four Seasons Punta Mita, etc., as well as the other hotels in this area:the Mandarin Oriental; Rosewood Mayakoba; and Tides) and finally decided on Maroma partly as a result of Tripadvisor reviews... and I was not disappointed. (as for price btw, it is expensive but for the kind of room and setting, in my view it was a better value than most of the others). The staff here are all super-friendly, making an effort to learn everyone's name, and service is with a smile. The Sian-nah suite was brand new, with a huge bathroom (with indoor and outdoor shower and jacuzzi), a gym room with an elliptical machine and weights; a terrace with a little plunge pool (which we did not use) and hammock (which we did) and another terrace facing the ocean, along with a rooftop outdoor massage area where masseuses from the spa (which is gorgeous btw) came and gave us massages... was super relaxing because we felt the breeze and could hear the sea... The beach set up is wonderful--tons of room btw, we never had a problem finding beach mattresses... the staff would sweep the algae off the beach every morning; they would open up umbrellas and serve drinks or food beachside. There are a few dining options and we were happy with all of them; we had lunch at Freddy's bar every day (excellent ceviche and tons of tequila to choose from); and also, since we were celebrating a special occasion, we had a special beachside romantic dinner set up one night, complete with flame-lit path to our table and again wonderful setting and custom-made food. On Friday night there was a fire show and mariachi band, all of which were very tasteful (on the one night we went to Playa del Carmen to the Mayan restaurant Yaxche--which we totally disliked-- we experienced a tacky version of a mariachi band). I would totally skip Playa del Carmen by the way. We did go to Tulum one day, which was a good cultural experience, but frankly I was content to just stay at the resort. It is a peaceful and quiet resort, not very kid friendly probably; for us without kids, it was a perfect quiet relaxing escape. There were special romantic touches at various points throughout our stay which made us love the Maroma and we would go back in a heart beat. By the way, upon arrival from Cancun airport, we were greeted by someone (make sure you go outside and avoid all the people who approach you indoors) and met the Maroma's driver in a swanky SUV (maybe an Escalade? but in any event, brand new with refreshing towels and bottled water); the trip to the hotel was less than 1/2 hour. The weather during our stay was hot, but less so than we had expected; I think it made a big difference to have an ocean-front room, as there is always a breeze. For noise sensitive people, note that you DO hear the waves at night, so take ear plugs if you are in one of those rooms... I went on the snorkeling trip, which was fun; but I missed the Temazcal as it was totally booked by the time I got my act together, so if you are interested book early.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: imike808
Reviews.Content: I can say the reviews on this site are completely accurate - the good ones anyway. My wife and I stayed at Maroma from June 26-30 and I think it was an experience we will never forget as long as we live. The staff is incredibly wonderful and KIND. The food is wonderful. DO splurge for a special dinner, it was so fun to plan the meal with the chef the day before. The best surprise for my wife. The beach beds are the best. We spent two FULL days on the beach - loved the beach menu. Ugh, I could go on forever. Just book it. Don't think twice. My wife cried when we left. And these days many sentences start with - "when we go back to Maroma......"

Reviews.Title: “Something Else That Was Excellent ....”
Reviews.Author: SlowTtraveller
Reviews.Content: Safe to say that our experience was in line with the glowing references elsewhere - the setting is sensational and the service is impeccable. But there are two things worth adding that, for us, set Maroma apart. First, there is a sincerity about the place - we never felt that anybody was working at being pleasant and friendly. It felt very genuine. Second, as a disabled traveller, from the moment we first contacted the resort, until the moment we left, they couldn't have done more. Moreover, they did it discreetly and spontaneously. I've never felt as relaxed. Don't hesitate!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic end to our Mexican holiday”
Reviews.Author: avb13
Reviews.Content: We booked the Sian Nah suite package with the 20% spa discount staying for four nights. We drove ourselves to the resort as we hired a car for the previous part of our trip to Playa Del Carmen and Chichzen Itza. However, we could have returned the vehicle as we had no desire to leave the resort during our stay. Upon our arrival we were greeted by name, handed a Maroma signature margarita, given a tour of the resort and shown to our beautiful ground floor suite with a fantastic ocean view. IMO the layout was beautiful, comfortable and the bathroom completely private if you forgot and left the curtains open. Due to having a room almost directly on the beach, some might find privacy a concern. But to be honest we had no problems with this as it was really not that easy to see into the living area unless you were very close to the window inside and out. And quite difficult to see into the bedroom. Between the living area and the bedroom are two large doors you could close for extra privacy. I loved lying in bed in the morning with the curtains just opened for that wonderful view of the sea. A coffee machine was provided ,as well as the coffee service brought to you each morning. We like very strong coffee and used the machine daily for espressos. Free internet service was very handy for us, as we had some work commitments to follow up and having provided this in room made it very easy. We found the bed and pillows comfortable. Plenty of room for our clothes and luggage. Molton Brown toiletries. Candles provided by the bath for that romantic evening and enough room for two although the little step in the tub as a bit odd to us. The double headed showers inside and out were a nice touch as well. Turndown service was beautiful with candles lighted in both the living and bed room areas. We were surprised with some beautiful petal arrangements on the bed twice during our stay. We found the private pool useful for having a fresh water cooling dip as it was quite hot during our summer visit. Some previous reviews claim of the pool being too cold. But we really found it quite refreshing. The beach is beautiful, with soft white sand and looks just like the photos. It was everything I could have hoped for. With plenty of large sun beds and chairs for sunning. We never had a problem getting a bed almost directly in front of our suite The beach beds were comfortable and we had good beach service. Although we did have to ask twice for an ice bucket to keep the beers cold, when it seemed no problem for some of the folks around us to get one. One comment, I was surprised to not find any way of washing the sand from your feet coming from the beach and getting to your room. I would have also liked a shower close to the beach lounging area. But, lucky for us we just used the shower in the private massage area very close to the beach. For my husbands birthday we splashed out and paid for the private beach front dinner. The set up was beautiful and our waiter couldn't have been better. . We dined in all the restaurants and had room service once for dinner and breakfast. The food was very enjoyable, but I must admit we had some meals just as good in Playa Del Carmen. But the view more than made up for it. The spa with lovely. But, in the steam/changing room there was only one seat, so once while waiting to be called for my appt. I had no where to sit, as the only chair was occupied. My husband enjoyed his first massage so much, he booked another for the last day. We also had the lovers chocolate massage and can highly recommend this treatment. Our therapists were first rate, We have enjoyed many treatments from top resorts and the therapists treating us truly made the experience. I would like to thank all the previous TA reports concerning the billing as this helped to know you would be paying for everything and budgeting accordingly. We only had a few surprises on checkout concerning drinks, but nothing out of hand. I saved and budged quite hard to experience this property to enjoy one of it's nicest suites and most of my expectations were met. We really enjoyed our stay at Maroma and would highly recommend the property.

Reviews.Title: “A class above all the rest”
Reviews.Author: JonoNewYork
Reviews.Content: J+M, New York. In a class by itself. The only thing that's better than beauty of the location and the charm, is the personalized service. My wife and I spent four memorable nights enjoying great food, great beach in a very refined atmosphere. We truly recommend it!!! PS: try the Maroma Margarita!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Profileraf
Reviews.Content: Paradise! My husband booked this resort through American Express for our 10 year anniversary. It was beautiful. Very Romantic. Candles light up the walkways at night. It is right on the ocean so you have a constant ocean breeze. The room we stayed in was considered an ocean view room. It was lovely. We had a large balcony with a hammock that was really great in the morning. Coffee was delivered to our room in the morning and we drank while looking at the ocean. The people Were amazing. Every person had a smile on their face. Everyone. And not a forced smile either. They really seemed to enjoy working there. They knew your name too. That made it even nicer to me. THere are no televisions in the room so if you are going to catch up on your tv not a good place to do it. The spa was beautiful too. Private steam and pool really unbelievable. Bars close at 10:30 but roomservice all night. Another great thing was the beach beds. BEACH BEDS with a waiter! You didnt have to move. Pina colada no problem. How relaxing. Really a great place LOVED IT AND WILL BE BACK!!!

Reviews.Title: “Maroma: Garden of Eden”
Reviews.Author: passionforadventure
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Maroma for three nights after spending two nights in Akumal for a friend's wedding. I don't think words could ever describe the true essence of Maroma. It is out of this world breathtaking. When we turned onto the long dirt road off the highway we had no idea what to expect! But we truly pulled up to paradise. We were kindly greeted by the general manager, and a woman named Gabriella, who was part of the hospitality staff, offered us Maroma margaritas (very potent!) and led us on a tour of the property. What I loved most about Maroma....lush landscaping, gorgeous flowers, refreshing, hidden pools, the iguanas/peacocks/& parrots, the hundreds of candles lit each night throughout the grounds, and of course the fact that it is all set on one of the top beaches in the world. We were in a garden-view room (#15, Las Rosas). When I entered the room I thought, "If this is the garden-view room then what could possibly be better in the higher room categories?!" We had a spacious porch with a sofa, hammock, and table/chairs. I loved the fact that had a door to the porch, which we could close for privacy. Each morning room service delivered coffee to a ledge outside our room, and we also enjoyed room service breakfast on the porch. It was very relaxing to sit outside each morning and listen to all of the birds. Our room looked like it had been recently renovated. The bed was very comfortable and had mosquito netting, which we pulled back (not needed for bugs, just romantic effect). Every night housekeeping lit candles in our room and turned on the Maroma CD. We commented on how much we enjoyed the music, and on our last day there Gabriella brought us a CD that she had made for us to take home! The staff were the friendliest and most genuine people I've ever met. They learned our names within 30 minutes of arrival and continued to call us by name the whole time we were there.
