For example, at dinner each night they would say, "Hi, Jennifer! How was your day? What would you like for dinner this evening?" When we were at Maroma we felt like we were staying at a friend's hacienda. The atmosphere was warm and intimate. One day we hopped on the motorboat that takes you out to the reef for snorkeling (only a 5-min. ride). We saw a variety of fish and would definitely recommend going (two trips a day--11am and 2pm). We also enjoyed a couples massage (ancient healing) at Kinan Spa. It was amazing! Other than that we just relaxed on the over-sized beach beds, where we could have stayed for days and days! Maroma has two entertainment rooms where you can watch TV and check your email. We prefer not having TV in our room on vacation, but it was nice to be able to check our email after we had checked out of our room and were waiting on airport transportation. I could go on and on about this magical place, but I think my pictures will do it more justice than my description :) All in all, Maroma is the ultimate luxury hideaway. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway”
Reviews.Author: mbtnyc
Reviews.Content: Arriving at Maroma was exactly what I needed to recharge after a long work year. It's not in Playa del Carmen as listed above but in the Riviera Maya area which was not that known until a lot of recent developments in the area. The property is a bit remote, but sits right on the most gorgeous beach... and was only about 30 minutes from the airport. The airport transfers were included in the price along with a couple of other goodies like a potent welcome margarita, full yucatan breakfast and a snorkel trip to the barrier reef which is right off of the property. I loved our ocean view room, and noticed even the lower category rooms were just a stone's throw away from the beach. It was paradise! The food was amazing, 2 restaurants, plus plenty of outdoor seating. And 2 pools, which were a nice change even with the ocean just steps away. The Kinan Spa was gorgeous and I only wanted to take my mexican therapist home with me as the lomi lomi massage was one of the best and most relaxing massages I have ever had! I tried the Temezcal, mayan steam bath, which I surprising enjoyed (wasn't sure about sitting in a dark sweat lodge with strangers, but it was a wonderful experience). This is definitely a place to go if you want to splurge a little. You can find cheaper options in the area, but I wouldn't have chosen a different place. I hope to return again... and again!

Reviews.Title: “Big Improvement”
Reviews.Author: emjaytx
Reviews.Content: Four years ago we stayed at this resort that had just been taken over by Orient Express Hotels and had had a horrid experience. What capped it off at the end was arranging a private romantic dinner on the beach and getting food poisoning. I wrote to the hotel and they offered me three free nights. Reluctant to go back I left it four years. It certainly has changed in that time. The food and service were impeccable. The one thing that still needs to change is the lack of privacy in most of the units. They do have a couple of very upscale suites that are private. This is an old property and although their rooms are pretty they certainly can not compare with The Tides or Rosewood's Mayakoba in River Maya. Be prepared for high prices in their restaurants and their spa is off the charts. And remember that they add 15% tax and 15% gratuity on tip of everything and you don't see any of your charges until you check out. However, the location of this resort on a stretch of beautiful white sand and Caribbean ocean is spectacular and that would be the reason to return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, relaxing, luxurious Maroma!”
Reviews.Author: LulubelleT
Reviews.Content: This review is late but we went to Maroma last spring for our "babymoon" a last trip before our third child's arrival in June. Since we were going without children and for four nights, I wanted warm weather, great beach, great food, spa and LUXURY. Also, wanted a grown up small resort with no children. The location of Maroma is fantastic, in the jungle but also on the nicest beach I have ever seen and we've been to many 5 star resorts in Bermuda, Hawaii, Mexico and the Carribean. The staff is lovely, I felt like a pregnant princess and there were two other pregnant couples there as well. We had a large, amazing junior suite with veranda overlooking beach. The food is amazing with three great restaurants. We went to the lighter fare spa restaurant for breakfast and lunch sometimes to fight off vacation pounds. We used the health club, had the beach butlers bring us drinks, napped, swam, snorked off the coast of the resort and the reef was incredible. My husband did the sweat ritual and liked it. Pools too were amazing...we left kicking and screaming. It was heavenly... My only teeny criticism is that EVERYTHING will cost something. Once we were asked if we wanted a tour of the jungle and the foliage, history, ecosystem. We said, sure, great! We found out after it was something ridiculous like $35 US a person. It was interesting but nothing great -- Maroma is expensive but worth every penny. Just be wary of excursions/suggestions/classes because they are additional.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Maroma”
Reviews.Author: hukalua
Reviews.Content: Yes, the Maroma is expensive but the service is definitely worth the money. This is the perfect place to get away to relax and not worry about a thing. The room and grounds a very well kept. Each night the light the entire place with candles... EVERYWHERE. By the end of the first day everyone knows your name and room number...and you don't have to sign for a thing. This may cause some surprises at the end of the trip when you get the bill but we thought it was worth it. The Maroma NEVER feels like a resort. The beach is the best in the area... (swept clean every morning) and there are 3 pools. The hotel was almost to capacity and at most there would be 2 other couples by the pool. There are plenty of options for food but it was nice to get out one day for something different. We set up a guide through the hotel to go to the Dos Ojos Cenotes... it was a magical experience. Concierge recommended getting our own car since we wanted to go see the ruins in Tulum as well. It could not have been easier. The agency dropped the car off in the morning (we had rented it for one day) and when we returned i gave the keys to the parking attendant and it was picked up the next morning. Our FAVORITE meal in Tulum was the Pollo Bronco on the main strip. They only serve roasted chicken, rice and tortillas. (a whole chicken is about 10 bucks). AWESOME. Located on the main strip in the center of town. The SPA at Maroma was excellent.... again, pricey, but great service. For fun we scheduled the Temezcal which is the Mayan equivalent of a sweat lodge... this is a must. It starts at 5 and lasts about an hour... in the end you jump into the ocean. We will definitely return to this magical place.

Reviews.Title: “OK, not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: bardasano
Reviews.Content: The service was fantastic. The beach amazing. Food was ok. But overall not worth the money. Too expensive for what it is. Some of the accounting is made confusing to sneak extra $ on the conversion, taxes, and tips. Watch out for extras. You never see any bill untill the last day. And forget about asking for a late check out, not gonna happen.

Reviews.Title: “You will love this place!”
Reviews.Author: oniks07
Reviews.Content: We travel to a sun/beach destination every year, and take our recommendations from sources such as Travel & Leisure, Conde Naste, and, of course, Trip advisor! Maroma was listed as one of the top 25 best Mexican resorts in Travel & Leisure one year, so we decided to try it after reading all of the rave reviews on tripadvisor. YOU WILL LOVE THIS PLACE! We agree with pretty much all of the reviews; however, someone mentioned that they had to get up every morning to reserve one of the beach loungers due to crowding. We didn't experience that problem, perhaps due to the time of year (April)? I'm not sure, but we never had to worry about finding a beach lounger. The resort was pretty empty when we were there (which we loved). By the time we got up and ate a leisurely breakfast, it was usually mid-morning when we made our way down to the beach, and there were still plenty of loungers. That being said, yes, the food and drinks are expensive, but the food is excellent, so you won't be disappointed. We gathered from reading the reviews that we would spend quite a bit for meals, so we were prepared. Without sounding redundant, I can't say enough wonderful things about the room (the verandah rooms are nice, and just a few steps away from the ocean view rooms. I wouldn't spend extra for the ocean view!), the service, and the food. YOU WILL LOVE THIS PLACE!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Luxe333
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Maroma and loved it. I was looking for a luxury holiday where I could relax and revive. I got both. The spa is great and so were all of the activities that oyu can do at the resort. Great food and friendly/ helpful staff. I hope to make it back there soon.

Reviews.Title: “Unique luxury hideaway”
Reviews.Author: NYtraveler29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Maroma to celebrate my husband's birthday and our wedding anniversary. Words cannot describe how truly special this place is. We arrived in Cancun to a beautiful, clean, well organized, newly redone airport. Quickly and painlessly, we cleared customs and were on our way to Maroma. The resort provides private transportation, which was very nice. We arrived at Maroma and were greeted by name at the entrance. We were given a "Margarita" and they showed us to our room - a very comfortable oceanview room with beautiful local handcrafted furniture. It was just above Freddy's bar and had a spectacular view of the caribbean sea. We wasted no time and went right to the main attraction (for us, at least) - the beach. We were blown away by the beach beds and the fantastic service by Daniel and Johnny. It was my husband's birthday that day, and Daniel brought us a birthday cake and two complimentary drinks. The beach is one of the best we have ever been to. Stunning blue sea with powdery white sand. The restaurants are both very good (Luis, the restaurant manager, was always around and is happy to customize any entree to your likings). I specially recommend staying there on a Friday night (we were there for two) and dining at "El restaurante". It is their barbecue night and the food is superb. We were not there on lobster season - but had plenty of other wonderful seafood options to choose from. We loved the spa - we booked a lomi lomi massage in a couples massage room. The staff was truly exceptional. The "hospitalidad" staff is also fantastic. They helped us plan our evenings outside of the resort, plan our day trip to Chichen Itza and even provided us with the resort maps so we wouldn't get lost on our way back "home" (we rented a car in Playa del Carmen for 2 days, so we could drive on our own to Chichen Itza and visit the towns around Maroma). They are all exceptional, but specially the afternoon/evening hosts - Carla and Priscilla. The staff is what makes this resort so special. We were very well impressed with the attentiveness of the service - they all know you by name by the second day and treat you like a part of the "family". We were also well impressed with the person taking care of the resident birds. He was this sweet Mayan man that took care of the parrots and other birds that live at Maroma as if they were his own. Everyone seems to truly enjoy their job. This is really an immersion experience into the Mexican/Mayan culture. They always speak to you in Spanish (and English, fear not) and some, if you're so interested, will even teach you some Mayan words. We love to travel and experience other cultures and we thought Maroma was exceptional for that. We have been to many beautiful luxury resorts in our lifetime, but this is the first we vowed to return even before we left. And we will - we have a reservation to go back in a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Maroma is Truly Magical”
Reviews.Author: NLS13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I hosted our wedding at Maroma in early February. Our experience was truly magical. We travel often to beautiful resorts however we both found Maroma to be our favorite destination thus far. Breakfast (which is complimentary) was so delicious. The staff goes out of their way to make each day memorable. We worked with Carena to plan our wedding and every detail was perfect. Our guests raved the entire time about how much they loved the resort and the people who work there. We we definitely be going back (hopefully for our anniversary). I have looked at photos from our vacation and my heart aches to be back on the warm sands in front of Maroma. BTW, if you have ever traveled to that area you may know that a good beach is hard to find. Maroma's beach is impeccable. if you want a truly memorable vacation, go to Maroma. If $550 a night for the garden view room is too expensive request the Garden "chichen" rooms. They are small but very sweet and have all the amenties that you will need. If you want to splurge, rent room #40--Casa Del Mar. AMAZING!!!! Try the Temazcal too. Very spiritual and relaxing-- a great way to start your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “One of our best vacations”
Reviews.Author: melmarshop
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a heavenly 7-night stay at Maroma from Jan. 10th to the 17th. It was everything I hoped it would be. We were celebrating our 16th anniversary and had been looking for a great place to go. A family member had highly recommended it to us so we looked it up online and I read all of the tripadvisor reviews before going. I was a bit worried that I perhaps I had built up my expectations too much given the large number of great reviews but I was not disappointed at all. My high expectations were met and often exceeded. Some reasons we liked Maroma: --The Mexican traditional style lends a sense of being in another land. We didn't want to be in a hotel that felt like any other 5-star hotel in the states. We spent an afternoon/evening at the Rosewood at Mayakoba with family who were vacationing there and, although the hotel is beautiful and their room was bigger and had the designer touch, it didn't feel like Mexico. The rooms (and the hotel) are more rustic but comfortable. Our room was big enough with Spanish tile flooring and a big tub that was more like a jacuzzi. --It is extremely quiet and peaceful. We were amazed at how uncrowded it seemed even though they were fully booked. I had worried that we wouldn't be able to get beach beds but we never had a problem getting one. Some mornings we put our things out by 7 or 8, others by 9 and there were still beds available. The restaurant almost always seemed to have just enough people to appear desirable but not so many that it was noisy or we couldn't pick the table we wanted. There were a couple of rainy nights when everyone had to eat inside rather than out on the patio and on those nights it was more full but still with available tables. --It never feels crowded. I mentioned the restaurants but the beach also feels relatively free of people. There is enough distance between beach beds and chairs to give privacy and there are not very many other people on the beach. We saw some walkers each day from the hotel south of Maroma but it never bothered us. I took a yoga class one morning and there were only four of us in the class. When I used the exercise room one morning, there was only one other woman in there for the first few minutes and then it was empty but for me. The times we used the spa (and it was almost fully booked), it seemed so quiet. I had the relaxation/waiting room to myself before a treatment and the his and hers after-massage rooms we had to ourselves after a couples massage. --The service was among the best I've experienced so far--attentive without being stuffy. I attribute part of it to the friendly nature of the people who work there. I never felt that they were hovering but the second I needed something there would almost always be someone right there, sometimes two or three. One morning at breakfast my husband dropped his camera lens under the table and immediately two or three waiters were there getting it for us. We never had to wait very long at all for food or our glasses to be refilled. The employees there often would say, "It is a pleasure to serve you" or "It is a blessing to serve you!" Johnny, the man in charge of helping people on the beach with their beds, umbrellas, and chairs works so hard to make sure people have the right amount of shade or sun, enough towels, the right position facing the sun,etc. We made friends with several of our servers. --It is very romantic. We had an ocean view room and loved waking up to the sounds and sight of the palm trees, beach, and ocean each morning. At night we would leave our shutters open to feel the perfect-temperature breezes. The peace and quiet and uncrowdedness all lend themselves to creating a place in which you can savor being with a loved one. One night we had a private dinner in "El Miradaor," a nook at the highest point of the hotel. The food was from "El Sol," the more formal restaurant and it was very good. I thought the portions were perfect and my husband did as well. Every night the candles that light up the place make it seem magical. On Friday night, after the traditional barbeque, we sat in the semi-circle of chairs (by ourselves) around the warm embers of a dying bonfire next to the ocean. Just north of the hotel there is just jungle along the beach rather than a string of hotels. There was a lit lantern next to each beach bed so even the beach was romantically lit (they didn't do this every night as some nights were rainy). --The beach and water are perfect. The vivid turquoise and jade colors in the ocean took my breath away. The sand is soft and powdery and the hotel keeps it so clean. There are even pretty shells to be found. The swimming is perfect because the ocean floor very gradually descends and the waves are not too big. The floor is not rocky and I couldn't see any coral. Some have mentioned it can get pretty windy which I worried about. I found that on the days it was windier, I was still comfortable being outside on the beach. --The clientele of the hotel seem to be mostly in their 40s and older. We found that the people that are there are there to relax, bond, and unwind. It seemed rare to find loud guests. Overall, this was a gem of a find and we will definitely go back. The only cons were: a couple of mornings the hot drink they delivered to our private patio was not hot and my husband found the bed to be not as comfortable as our own at home (Heirloom) although I thought it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “My First Choice in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: httraveler
Reviews.Content: The combination of locaton, beach, ambience, service and food ranks right with the best in Mexico as far as I am concerned. That in combination with the clear blue Carribean waters make this my first choice in Mexco. I recently stayed at Palmilla in Cabo so I have some basis for comparison. The location is remote and beautiful. The grounds are well kept and manicured. Not on the same scale as Palmilla, but every bit as pretty. The beach at Maroma is as fine a beach as you will find anywhere. Very clean, with plenty of two person lounges (mattresses) on the beach. We rarely left the beach and ate most of our lunches right there. Plenty of servers ready to bring you whatever you need. Palmilla has the edge on pools, but I will take the beach any day. Not only is the beach large and clean but the water is clear and beautiful. Perfect to get in and relax. Coral reefs are available for snorkeling less than five minutes by boat away. The beach and water are far superior to what you will find at Palmilla, but that is to be expected since Palmilla is on the Pacific. The ambience is quite romantic. (as is the ambience at Palmilla!) Unlike some resorts in Mexico, Maroma is "Mexican traditional." If you are looking for lots of glitz, then it is not for you. The resort is understated and laid back and at night lighting is provided by candles lit all over the property. Likewise service at Maroma was exceptional and the food was very good. Most of the staff seemd to know our names after the first day. I booked Maroma for my 20th wedding anniversary and for a few of our dinners made special arrangements in advance. We had one meal up in the tower and another on the beach. Although expensive, both were exceptional. I found the service at Maroma and Palmilla to be pretty equal, although Palmilla has a few touches (butler service etc) that might give it a slight edge. I also found the spas at both places to be very good. I will call it a tie. Finally the rooms. The rooms are very roomy and very nice, but they are older. Extremetly comfortable. But they don't compare to the suites at Palmilla. ( I am not sure anything does.) Perhaps a better comparison to the Palmilla would be the Sinh Suites but I don't know. This is the one area where Palmilla has a definite edge. Despite that edge, the overall luxury and ambience at Maroma, in combination with the superior beach and water make it every bit as desireable a getaway spot. More so for me because of the water and beach. My guess is others would pick Palmilla because of the luxrious rooms and surroundings but I would highly recommend Maroma if you are looking for a luxurious beach getaway. .

Reviews.Title: “one of the best, hands down”
Reviews.Author: bbggolden
Reviews.Content: To celebrate my husbands birthday, I was looking for a warm weather destination that would offer a relaxing and elegant getaway for us and our friends. I read some books and searched the web (including this site and Whatahotel.com, which was very helpful in arranging the details), and decided on Maroma -- WOW! We had an absolutely wonderful time at Maroma. We have traveled throughout the Caribbean and Mexico would very highly recommend Maroma over all the others. The service, warmth and sincere kindness of the people, the beauty of the facilities and property, the unique, yet authentic food were all beyond our expectations. Maroma deserves all of the awards it has received and many more. We look forward to repeating this trip many years coming.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise at its Best”
Reviews.Author: luvtotrvlGV
Reviews.Content: After thorough research & planning we decided on Maroma to celebrate our 10th Anniversary. Upon booking our vacation we were immediately contacted by the resort via email for any special requests that we may have prior to our arrival/during our stay. From the moment we arrived at the resort we truly felt transported to another time & place. Secluded in the jungles we arrived at the resort lobby to be received by all the charm and mystery of a Mayan inspired retreat. Our cares were lost as soon as we wandered through the resort & were shown our beautiful oceanfront Sian Nah Suite. Complete with a living room, seperate bedroom, exercise room, oversized bath with indoor/outdoor shower & private plunge pool. We knew that we chose the best of the best. From breakfasts in the Caribbean sun, to dinner by moonlight & candles, the food was as delicious as it was temptingly beautiful. To say one employee stood our over another would be unfair as they were all unique but shared in the same sense of warmth and passion in treating us as special guests at Maroma. The beach is gorgeous & well maintained. Our room was thoroughly cleaned each day with fresh linens twice a day & the most romantic turn down service we've ever experienced!! We had no "unexpected" surprises but received many wonderful surprises that made our stay both exciting & relaxing. Maroma is a beautiful sactuary of peace and tranquilty that has left us with a renewed sense of spirit and allowed us to reconnect to ourselves and each other. We are looking forward to our next stay at Moroma!!

Reviews.Title: “Great resport”
Reviews.Author: peterm1
Reviews.Content: I agree with the most recent review almost in its entirety. This is a great hotel and I would be extremely happy to go back. We previously stayed at Esencia down the coast early in 2007 so I will make some comparisons. I have some specific comments below, but keep in mind that they are a bit nit-picky since our overall experience was wonderful. Room: We had the room called La Luna, which was a Premium room with partial ocean view. It was quite small and the toilet seat was broken, but the bed was very comfortable and I loved being so close to the beach and main house/restaurant. I much preferred our room at Esencia, which was much bigger and brighter and had a plunge pool as well (although it was a bit more expensive and had a jungle view). Since we got a great deal on the room at Maroma we didn't really care that it was small. Food: We ate at the fancier El Sol the first night but from then on ate at the more casual El Restaurante for all of our meals. While the food was excellent at both places we liked the variety of El Restaurante more and the fact that it was less formal. They had an excellent guitar player playing classical music at El Sol and a great Mariachi band at El Restaurante. The food and drinks were very expensive at Maroma, but we ate a lot (the portions were quite big). They had the best corn soup I ever had and the Tres Leches cake was also really good. We ate every meal at the hotel all week long. At the Esencia, the food choices were more limited so we felt we had to leave the hotel once in a while to eat. Service: The service was fantastic in all respects. Everyone was incredibly friendly (as they were at Esencia). Beach: It is annoying how people get up at the crack of dawn, go out and put a book on a beach bed to reserve it, and don't come back for hours. They should implement a policy like at some other hotels where you can't leave stuff on the bed for more than an hour or so to reserve it. I had to get out there by 7:30am to get the last beach bed (and at least I stayed there to enjoy it, even if I was nearly alone!). The beach is beautiful, although I slightly preferred the beach at Esencia, which felt a little more deserted. The free snorkeling trip included with the room was really fun, but a bit too quick (less than an hour). Other facilities: We used the gym and spa as well as the tennis courts. All were quite nice (they have tennis equipment they will loan to you for free). The multimedia rooms were very comfortable and often empty, and they had a decent selection of books and DVDs. The wifi service rarely worked, however, and neither did the Ethernet in my room. We enjoyed sitting by the pools in the garden area and near the gym, and they were rarely crowded. We also liked playing pool in the billards room after dinner. In many ways, Maroma and Esencia have a similar vibe - exclusive, quiet, beautiful beaches, excellent service, etc. Maroma is a bit bigger and there were more things to do like tennis, a bigger spa and gym, etc. WHile I preferred the room at Esencia I know they have larger beautiful rooms at Maroma as well. In both places the staff learns your name and you don't need to deal with getting checks for meals or paying cash for anything the whole time, which was great. For me I would very happily stay at either place again and the decision of which place to stay would probably depend on what kind of promotions they were running at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Incomparable service”
Reviews.Author: pursuit
Reviews.Content: So my boyfriend and I agree on the rating--excellent. Our beach background--Cap Juluca, Ritz in St Thomas, Pacifica in Cabo, Grace Bay Club in Turks and Caicos, Biras Creek in Virgin Gorda. Returned to NYC from paradise last week....So interesting to read other reviews....not much more to add (agreed with most, disagreed with some--feel free to contact me if you would like specifics) so here's what we thought would be some helpful info if you decide to go (at least they would have been for me): -Hospitality was overwhelming. Nothing but smiles and willingness on everyone's part to make your stay memorable (someone raking seaweed on the beach came over and made our beachbed for us just because he saw me put my bag down; our waiter from El Sol put down our wine he had brought over to our private bonfire-see below-to help rearrange our chairs and then went to the laundry to bring us fresh towels from the dryer). -The concierge desk can arrange almost anything for you (granted, at a cost). My boyfriend was craving an ice cream sundae; with a little explanation and instructions on ingredients, we had a delicious 3 scoop gourmet ice cream sundae at exactly the time I had requested it. They also put together a private bonfire for us on the beach on our last night, where we sat under a cloudless sky with our port after dinner. It was fabulous. Shooting stars and all. -El Sol, the more formal restaurant, has air-conditioning indoors; El Restaurante does not. Only 7 outdoor tables at El Sol which are lovely (maybe 8?) but they filll up quickly and cannot be requested in advance. -I was stunned about the comment on small portions for the price; we both thought they were enormous. Food is excellent everywhere. I tended to stick to seafood but my boyfriend's venison and lamb were great. They can make whatever you request (I had a fish taco craving and requested a freshly caught Grouper ‘burrito” and was in foodie heaven). -the bottled Maroma water is purified still water, replaced every day in your room and free of charge. Fiji is $11/liter bottle. I don’t even want to know what our liter bottles of Evian cost. Steep. -They provide mosquito repellent in each room and have some at each restaurant if needed. -free ethernet access in each guest room (?correct techno term) but very spotty. Laptops for public use in the main entertainment room. For those who need it: great blackberry and AT&T wireless reception everywhere (sigh). -no satellite TV hook up in the guestrooms but you can request a TV and DVD player for $30/day ---caveat: their DVD collection is more classic than contemporary. -if you do not speak Spanish well, there will be some misunderstandings. Although many of the staff speak English well, no one is fluent. I had asked which Pinot Noirs they had by the glass and ended up with a bottle of Coppola (maybe $18 at the most in NYC--don't even want to know what the mark up was at El Sol. But we enjoyed it.) -Marina is at the east end of the resort (near the newer rooms which are immediately next to a neighboring resort), an easy walk from anywhere. I enjoyed the included snorkeliing which is a 30 second boat ride to the bordering reef (even saw a turtle), but it is certainly nothing compared to Turks (there is another farther reef snorkeling excursion which you can arrange at cost). I found it annoying that you had to pay $90 a day for hobie cat use, which has always been included at other resorts. They do have jetskis but no license to operate them. -I agree that beach is not as private as other places (Cap Juluca), and you will hear people talking around you. Don't believe them when they tell you that there are enough beach beds for every guest--there are about 60 rooms and maybe 15 beach beds...hmmmmm. Reserve early (i.e. put down a bag or a book). -One couple was irate when they found out (at checkout time on their bill) that the tequila they were "talked into" ordering was so expensive. You will never know the prices of the beverages you order (unless you ask; hence my shock about the cost of the Fiji---oh well). Cocktails seem to be generally NYC prices ($14-18 on average, coronas about 6). So if you don’t want to be surprised, ask before you order. -do NOT count on getting a good cup of coffee or espresso (I do not think this is unique to this resort, but par for the course in Mexico; wonder what the lattes at Starbucks in PDC taste like?). By the 3rd day and multiple requests/instructions/pleas, we resorted to tea service (although they never gave enough hot water and I finally asked for 2 carafes every day). If you must have coffee, bring instant. -taxi to Playa del Carmen can be called by concierge and is $20 each way; hotel car service is $28 each way (would arrange this in advance as it was unavailable our first trip out). The driver will pick you up for the return whenever and from wherever you ask. Hope this was helpful....bottom line is that we will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Tied for the best place we've ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: JonBoston
Reviews.Content: This is the first ever review I've written on TripAdvisor. I've searched and read tons of reviews, but this is the first time I've felt compelled to leave one of my own. Maroma is truly in a class of its own. The resort is absolutely gorgeous and spacious. We stayed in an ocean view room, which wasn't huge but completely adequate, especially since the resort offers plenty of space to lounge around. It's so private and intimate that you can easily find plenty of opportunity to be alone. The fact that the resort has 3 pristine, heated pools on top of a world class beach is amazing. In addition to single lounge chairs with ultra comfortable cushions, the beach has king size beds for two with plush pillows - the first time I've ever stayed at a resort with such a luxury. The food is truly gourmet, and for health-minded guests, one of the three restaurants, Cilantro, serves nutritious spa cuisine for breakfast and lunch. If you like to exercise and stay fit while you're away, there's a very modern fitness center, and daily classes, including spinning, yoga and pilates, as well as two lighted tennis courts. Through its special touches, Maroma feels authentic Mexican, from the varied selections at the Ceviche bar, to the 120 different types of tequila offered, to the classy Mexican serenaders singing outdoors at dinner time, to the woman who brings hot fresh made tortillas directly to your breakfast table (her hands still covered in dough). At night, Maroma is lit with 1,200 candles throughout the property to give it an elegant, romantic feel. Best of all, Maroma has better service than anywhere I've ever stayed (even better than Parrot Cay, which is renowned for treating its guests like royalty). Everyone is extremely friendly and ready to go out of their way to ensure you have the best stay possible. I have been to places that are accommodating with food substitutions, but Maroma will make make you virtually whatever you want, as long as they have it in the kitchen. My wife and I arrived at Maroma one day late due to a snowstorm in the Northeast, and the reservations manager was super friendly and flexible in changing the dates, offering to help in any way he could. To provide some context on how it stacks up against other similar resorts, in addition to Parrot Cay, my wife and I have been to Horned Dorset Primavera (a spectacular property in Puerto Rico), Royal Hideaway, the Ritz in St. Thomas, Caneel Bay, and Maroma is hands-down the winner. Only Kirini in Santorini, Greece can compare in total experience, but the view there gives it an advantage!

Reviews.Title: “Best trip ever -- Maroma is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Beachbulldoglover
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5-night stay at Maroma and can't say enough good things about this place. We've been to LIttle Dix and Caneel Bay and this is a step above even these legendary resorts. The people, the food, the personal touches and the amazing beauty of the beach and accommodations set this one apart. We've never enjoyed resort food as much -- it was not only local, delicious and beautiful but it felt pretty healthy as well. They have the best and freshest ceviche every day and it's amazing and assembled right in front of you. I hope they have the "best deal days" offer next fall b/c we'll surely be there if they do. We had a garden room overlooking the pool and it was very nice. Loved the Molten Brown products and special made bath salts and soaps they use. I think Maroma would be a fantastic place for a honeymoon b/c it is so romatic and lovely. Candles are set out at night to light the paths and you can dine right on the beach patio. The turndown service includes decadent sweet treats, candles and incense lit in your room. And your morning beverage of choice is delivered to your room daily. The spa was very nice - the temezcal spa treatment is the Mayan sweatlodge experience and we highly recommend it as well. We LOVED the wait staff and all the folks at Freddy's bar there. They make the best mojitos and the Maroma Margaritas made with the special Yucatan honey/anise liquer called xtabentun are heavenly! (if you can, bring some xtabentun back -- you can buy it at the airport -- do it for sure.) We miss Maroma already!

Reviews.Title: “Getaway from the cold northeast...”
Reviews.Author: BeachLoverinNJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Maroma in December 0f 2007. Room: We got a great rate for a master suite as a special promotion. The room was beautiful. It was right on the ocean and had wonderful Molton Brown spa products. Each morning they delivered the paper and your beverage choice to your balcony. Food: Breakfast was included and is excellent. It included fresh fruit and a full menu. Try the fresh made tortillas from the "grandma" who makes them fresh each morning. We ate dinner at the resort every night. The service and food were excellent. The portions are small for the price, but the ambiance was superb. Beach: Here is the shortcoming...it might have been the time of the year, but the beach was VERY windy and there was a lot of seaweed in the ocean. I didn't snorkel or swim much because of this, so this was very disappointing for us. Also, there is a lot of garbage that comes up on the beach. Spa: AMAZING! I had a hot rock massage and felt like I was transformed. Pools: 3 pools that are not heated. Overall, I would recommend Maroma. The people are friendly and the the resort is lush, however it was not my favorite. It was not as secluded as we thought it was going to be. My favorites are still Parrot Cay and Cuisinart. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “simply beautiful”
Reviews.Author: tss333
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 night stay at Maroma. The hotel and beach are simply beautiful. Pickup transfer at airport was flawless. A big white suv got us there in 35 minutes. We were greeted by a pretty senorita and hotel personnel all dressed in white. a quick tour through pathways lined with gorgeous plants and flowers of every variety led us to the main house and onto the beach. When you see the beach if don't have a smile from ear to ear go to a doctor. The buildings in white stucco and blue waters on a white powdery beachare amazing. The restaurant right at the beach is so awesome to eat at and gaze out at the ocean only 20 yards away. Service for all the restaurants was as close to perfect as you can get. All waiters were very polite, called us by our first name, and always has a smile. The food was very good, a little pricey but this wasn't the holiday inn. If you stay for a week you ma . y want to go outside hotel grounds and try other places to eat. Our room was rustic and mexican decorated. We had ocean view room but too many palm trees in our room was a problem to see ocean. The whole layout of the hotel is well thoughtout.. The grounds to walk thru are lined with so many pretty plants. The 3 pools are also beautiful. There was always a pool or beach butler to serve you in any way possible. No problem at hte beach getting lounges or the very cool beach beds. All around the service was great from head to toe. Maroma is right up there with other 5 star hotels, Ritz, four seasons, ect... The hotel staff tries very hard to make the stay nice and they succeed. I would tell anyone who loves a gorgeous beach and hotel to go Maroma. Its got to be the best of Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “One of the BEST places we have stayed!!”
Reviews.Author: BeachBumMadison_MS
Reviews.Content: This is the first review I have written, but have been using this site for years. My wife and I spent 6 nights at Maroma and it was everything we expected and more. I read a lot of reviews on here and one thing I look for is where the reviewers have traveled before. Having an idea of what people's perspective of nice is really helps. That being said, my wife and I like to stay at the best properties we can find, which unfortunately means the most expensive (in our experience). Our beach vacations include such places as Point Grace (Turks and Caicos), Bitter End Yacht Club and Biras Creek (BVI), Morningstar Beach Resort (St Thomas), Ritz (Grand Cayman), etc.. ACCOMADATIONS: Now back to Maroma, we stayed in their newly (at the time) built Sian Nah Suite. There are about 12 units, I believe, that are stand alone and directly on the beach - one level. The suites are very spacious, clean, and have a plunge pool, workout room, and huge bathroom! We got a deal on this at the time, because they were rolling them out for the first time. I definitely reccommend getting one of these if your budget allows. Accomadations/rooms are a big thing to me (even though we are rarely in the room) and this was "cream of the crop" by far in my travels to date. BEACH: The beach is gorgeous and water is great. Nothing can compare to Turks and Caicos, but Maroma's beach and water are top notch. Oh yeah, they have the BEST beach lounging furniture you will ever lay on in your life. Huge beds, with pillows sitting on the beach - scattered out far enough away from others to give you plenty of privacy. SERVICE: This is why people come to Maroma, the service was again second to none. The people are friendly, attentive, and most importantly there when you need them. If you know Spanish, you may never leave the place. FOOD: We stayed on property every night and the food was great. Breakfast was the best, in my opinion. Tequila tastings are a plus. OVERALL: Great place to stay, and as far as accomadations, I have not stayed anywhere better that those suites.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service, Beautiful Resort! A litle Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: mwiley
Reviews.Content: We just returned and had a fabulous 9 day honeymoon. The resort was beautiful with exotic flowers and tree's lining the pathways, and the ocean is stunning! We staying in a Ocean View room and found it to be perfect! It was quiet, we could not see other rooms or balconies within view. When we arrived there were red rose petals on the bed with Spanish music playing on the CD player. Coffee was delivered to our room each morning and on time. I came down with a little cold before we left, and one of the first nights I ran out of cough medicine and was up at 1am coughing, unable to sleep or get relief, I called the concierge desperate to see if, by chance, they had cough drops or any cough medicine available. They offered to open the boutique store to look for cough medicine. It was pooring rain, 1am , and in 10 minutes I had a knock at the door with a staff member handing me the medicine, with a smile! I was impressed and so thankful! The beach was pefect, the food was excellent. Our only disapointment was with the Fine dining Mayan restaurant , the portions were very, very small and very pricey. My husband asked for rare steak and it was not cooked right, they had to bring another one but did so quickly. Each night there are votive candles lining the paths, walkways, niches and stairs. It was a feast for the senses. Turn down service was each night, and we really enjoyed not having a TV in our room. The book lights were perfect and we both finished a book during our stay. It was such a relaxing, wonderful stay, we will definitely return to Maroma. We found it to be a little paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Maroma!”
Reviews.Author: JennyJoline
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an amazing stay at Maroma. It was all I had hoped for and more. We stayed for 4 nights in a garden view room - it was lovely. Our room overlooked the flower pool. Yes, it was close to the spa and further away from the main building. However it wasn't that far of a walk (though both my husband & I enjoy walking) and the grounds are beautiful. We found our accommodations to be very quiet. We also had a small balcony with a hammock. The breakfasts were, as has been stated here, delicious & bountiful! I have a severe nut allergy & did not have any problems at all with nuts during my entire stay. The staff knew our names & room numbers very quickly. (I wondered how this would work with our bill charges. No real problems - at check out, we had been charged for one person's snacks on the beach - I pointed out that it was incorrect, & it was immediately handled.) Maroma is a fabulous place to just relax and take it easy - which is what we did! The beach beds were wonderful. The staff is gracious, efficient, and kind but not overbearing in any way. My husband planned a special dinner on the beach for us (it was our 15th anniversary) with specific requests - it was delicious & extremely romantic! He even asked them to have a floral arrangement on our table with calla lilies - flowers that were in my wedding boquet. Maroma was able to fulfull his request - really, the staff is amazing! Our last night there we, as guests, were asked if we wanted to help return baby turtles to the ocean. Maroma protects turtle eggs and helps ensure their safe return to the Carribean. It was a fun, unexpected experience. Snorkeling was included in our package as well. I really enjoyed it - great instructor/guide. The beach is indeed absolutely gorgeous. I can't wait to return. Up there on my list of favorite places in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the Hype!!”
Reviews.Author: Kinsa
Reviews.Content: It pains me to write this, because I really really wanted to love this property. It is a beautiful property with average to mediocre management and service. And at the prices they charge, it should be a beautifuly property with incredible service. I honestly cannot understand the rave reviews this hotel gets on this site, normally I find the reviews to be spot on, but on this one, I have to say, I was shocked at the service once we arrived. First, we arrived in the middle of July at about 2 pm. We were a party with 2 rooms - the Sian Nah Suite and a regular, standard room. The Sian Nah suite is gorgeous!! Simply beautiful. The moment we walked into the room it was sweltering - we soon discovered the problem with the gorgous suite -- the Air conditioner DID NOT work for 2 full days - we were only planning to stay for 4 days, and with the AC out for 2 days the stay was basically ruined, as we sweated it out (literally) with mantience people trampling in and out for 2 days. What kind of 5 star hotel allows people to check into a room with a non-functioning A/C???? Now, to be fair, we did not pay for the room, obviously, and we left the resort on the 3rd day because we could not risk another day of our precious vacation ruined. But that was just it - our stay was ruined, as we were not provided a room with functioning A/C in the middle of the steamy jungle in July. We would have gladly paid for a room with functioning A/C, so that we could enjoy our vacation, but that did not happen. Notwithstanding the Sian Nah suite's problems - the standrad room was tiny, I mean SMALL - much smaller than the size of a regular hotel room. There is no sitting area, and not place to put your leggage. If you stay at this hotel DO NOT book the standard room. There is a huge difference in the rooms at this place, and there is a reason you do not see a picture of the standard room on the website. The service - not what people have raved about on this site - I don't know if we were there during an off time, but here are some examples - on the beach, we had to drag our own chairs around to where we wanted them, we were never assisted by anyone, I had to flag down a waiter to get food/drink service every single time. I was shocked at the poor nature of the beach service, in comparison to other Mayan Riviera resorts I have been to - go to the Azul Beach Resort if you truly want superior beach butler service for less than half the price of Maroma. Another example - I needed to call the front desk (to check on the status of the A/C), and didn't have the number - I asked 2 separate beach watiers for the number - neither returned, ever!! And I speak Spanish fluently, so it wasn't a language problem. Getting ice delievered to my room required 2-3 phone calls each time and was at least a 45 minute wait each time. I generally found the same level of inattentativeness with the restaraunts - nothing horrible, but nothing fantastic either, and at the prices they are charging, their service should be fantastic. Trust me, its not. On more big negative - there is no A/C in the restaurants during the day time. Probably not a big deal if you are there in December, but think twice about going here in the summer, when there is no breeze it is miserable. On to the positives - it is a beautiful resort. Truly romantic. The beach is fantastic. The sand is incredible, the water is nice and calm. If you go expecting mediocre service and a beautiful resort, this may be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Didnt meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: jcmbfla
Reviews.Content: After deciding on the Maya Riviera, we decided on the Maroma after reading Tripadvisors review. It might have been the high expectations, but we were somewhat disappointed. We arrived at approximately 1230. We called in advance and they assured us that if our room wasnt ready we would be able to change and sit by the pool when waiting for the room. My wife had flown to Miami the day before from Eastern Europe and we didnt sleep much the night before, so we were exhausted on arrival. They informed us that our room wouldnt be ready till 2 and told us we could have lunch or change and sit by a pool. Thinking it would be ready at 2 we opted for lunch. It was exceptionally hot and by the time lunch finished we were dieing. At 2 the room wasnt ready. Because of the heat and being so tired we started to get sick. At 230 we finally asked to get changed and the walked us across the entire property in the heat to a room to get changed in. We were sweating and thought we would throw up by the time we got there. Finally at 325 as I was walking to the lobby to tell them we would like to go to another hotel, I ran into a worker with the key. The room was nice and had pleasant views. Lots of little annoying things gave the impression that the management was gone and a bunch of teenagers were running the place. We'd sit at the table for 10 minutes waiting on a menu. And they would return in 30 seconds asking for our order. They would attempt to call us by our first names. I never use mine and my wifes was unpronounceable to the help so we never knew what they were saying. There were never towels by the pools. They would light all the candles in our room everynight. Some night we didnt get in till late and arrived to find a room with lots of burnt out candles. We had a snorkeling trip included in our package. every day we went they told us the harbor was closed by the state and we could try the next day. (there was a hurricane coming in 5 days) However we would see other boats going out and there was a notice in the paper that no restrictions yet. It was a nice property though not in the league of places like Las Ventanas in Cabo or the 4Seasons Jinbaran Bay. The landscaping looked kind of like a mid 80's Miami landscape architect. The desk help were mostly young teens and 20's who were very sweet, but didnt have customer service down. There were 2 parrots at the entrance that had pulled most of their feathers out, so this is not a place for the PETA inclined. That being said most of the stay we were able to not be around or hear other people. The neighbouring resorts were noisy (you could hear them) and crowded. The food was great. The room was nice. We went to The Tides a competitor for dinner one night and the service there was worse.

Reviews.Title: “Our New Favorite”
Reviews.Author: Gooferman
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Maroma to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary at the suggestion of a friend, and returned yesterday. We were expecting a very nice resort atmosphere and great service, but nothing could have prepared us for the perfection we found. Immediately upon arrival we were escorted on a brief tour of the property with an explanation of the many amenities that are available (we walked, but they had offered a golf cart if we preferred). The tour ended at our suite, where we found our luggage had been delivered and appropriately placed. The beach and water are spectacular, the resort is beautiful, the food is fantastic, the spa is like a dream, but far and away, the friendly, warm, expert service puts this place in a class of its own. Everyone knows you by name (how??) and greets you with a smile and a warm comment. I really believe that the staff wakes up each morning looking forward to coming to work to make sure that every guest’s stay in perfect. Ours was. There is a fine line between excellent and overbearing service. At Maroma, it was perfect, and seemed to come so natural. Our suite was pristine, with a spectacular ocean view; beautiful furnishings; plush bedroom; private, outdoor message room (top floor); fantastic and spacious bathroom (indoor and private outdoor showers, large tile tub); workout room; patio with a hammock and plunge pool; front deck overlooking the beach. The den accessed both patios and had great music cds for the Bose player. The way they lighted and candlelit the suite each evening for our return from dinner was tasteful and romantic. The candlelit stone walkways each evening made our five minute walk to and from dinner romantic, and that theme was carried out in the dining room/patio that overlooked the candlelit beach. I wonder who figured out the perfect volume and mix of music to have the band play at dinner, or the piano on the other nights. The attention to detail is something. And, of course, the food was delicious. Each morning, coffee, juice, rolls and a New York Times Digest were waiting at our door for us to enjoy at the time we requested—8am on day one, but at 6:30am after that. We realized that we could have coffee and juice and watch the sun rise right out of the Caribbean from our patio (we could have seen it from our bed). We enjoyed lazily watching the early beach walkers, whom we soon followed, as well as the Maroma workers raking the beach and preparing the plump beach mattresses and umbrellas for our arrival in a couple of hours. The daytime beach service was over the top. The beach “beds” were fantastic, and the umbrella was moved right on time to keep me and my book out of the sun while my wife worked on her tan right next to me. You couldn’t think you wanted something without it being instantly available. When we went into the water for a brief swim, our beach setup was refreshed for our return. I suggest ordering the guacamole and the gazpacho for a light lunch on the beach. If you really want to shoot the moon, have dinner on the beach (in the sand). They candle-light a manicured sand path to your beautifully set table, surrounded by torches and the surf, and serve a delicious meal prepared especially by the chef—who was happy to meet with me earlier in the day to plan a few personal surprise touches for my wife. The lamb was outstanding and the molten chocolate dessert almost sent me into a happy diabetic coma. Funny story: One night when I called and asked for two extra pillows, the doorbell rang less than 30 seconds later, literally. My wife and I just looked at each other and laughed because we just knew it was impossible for them to be there that fast. Apparently, they communicated by radio to housekeeping, who was right outside my door. We did our best to enjoy all of the amenities—massages, snorkeling, dinner on the beach, viewing the resort and surrounding area from the rooftop lookout, incredible beach service, the swimming pools—but we just could not get enough in 4 days, so we will have to go back. Expect to pay because it is not inexpensive, but you will get your money’s worth and leave planning your next return.

Reviews.Title: “Maroma Defines Excellence”
Reviews.Author: bougiekat
Reviews.Content: I had the unique advantage (and disadvantage) of staying at this elegant resort several days before Hurricane Dean made its way to the Yucatan. Finding out how a hotel will take care of you in the advent of an impending hurricane will tell you a lot about the professionalism of the staff. This hotel, its amenities and the service defined excellence. While admittedly pricey, this is an idyllic place to stay to feel removed from it all, but at the same time not cut off from the local flavor. You can stay at Maroma without ever leaving the hotel grounds, or, utilize their transportation service to take you to Playa del Carmen, Coba, Tulum, just about anywhere you like. The room (#28) was beautiful, the staff gracious and the food delicious. They told us the hotel was nearly booked, yet I never saw more than 12 people at a time. It may be a little too quiet for some, but you can't find a beach this private in many places. The only reason I can't give this the full 5 stars is because we unfortunately couldn't stay long enough to try all the hotel had to offer. The staff kept us very informed about the coming hurricane, and helped us to no end to make early flight arrangements to leave safely from Cancun. I'm happy to hear that Maroma escaped the damage, and I look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found!”
Reviews.Author: dydbrunet
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best place place we have ever stayed at! This was the second stop on our honeymoon (which we recently returned from). The rooms are great (especially the junior suite). Every night when you return to your room, the staff has lit candles all around and turned down your bed, refreshed any items that may need it and it is impeccably clean. The ocean view is picture-perfect. The grounds are well kept. They even rake the debris off from the beach. Attention to every detail is given. Every night before the sun went down, the staff went around placing votives all around the grounds. The food is tremendous (just be prepared for mexican food most of the time and don't forget you can order breakfast any way you want). The service is incredible. Most definitely a first-class rate resort. The spa is lovely and you have quite a selection to chose from. All the pools are well kept. There is only a short ride into Playa del Carmen. And this gives you a bit of a break from the resort. A nice, "European" feel town. The only compalint I am able to think of is the road to this resort is really, really bumpy. The value for your money is well worth this resort. We will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing”
Reviews.Author: gypsygirl15
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 10-day honeymoon in the Riviera Maya. Spent our first three days at Maroma, knowing we would need complete relaxation after the wedding and wanted to be a little pampered. A little, is an understatement. The staff, the food, the service and the surroundings were all top notch. It's pricey, no doubt -- we booked a garden room, which at $480 a night is the cheapest option -- but it was all worth it. It had a balcony overlooking the flower petal pool. And although there was a room below us and to the left, we felt completely secluded. We were greeted at the hotel with a tour from one of the gracious staff at the hospitality department and two potent margaritas. Staff took care of anything we needed -- from switching our car reservation, scheduling our excursions to supplying us with maps and advice. Food was great, but pricey. We never ate at the reservations-only restaurant El Sol. The tequila tasting was fun and the snorkeling trip, which is included in your stay, was beautiful and conducted by knowledgable and professional staff. Only downside was our shower, which is sort of a weird thing to point out. No shower curtains means constant overflowing the bathroom, but if that is the worst thing I can say about this place, well heck, who cares. If you're looking for total relaxation, intimate surroundings and a staff who caters to your every whim, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Divine R&R”
Reviews.Author: urbanadventurers
Reviews.Content: Went to Maroma seeking much needed R&R and an escape from our urban existence. Maroma did not disapoint in this regard. Things we loved: The beach did not disappoint-- the water was a beautifully clear and calm and the Maroma service makes the beach experience wonderful (as you can read about in other reviews). The service is impeccable. The staff is very warm and makes you feel very welcome and pampered. The grounds are lovely. The dining and bar settings can't be beat-- wind, sea, sun, or moon and stars-- lovely. Things to keep in mind: The rooms vary a lot in quality among room class. I would suggest asking for one in the older part of the hotel as the grounds and nearby amentites are much nicer. We were in an ocean view room on the 3rd floor with a private terrace with a great view. The private outdoor space is definitely the best part of the rooms as they are somewhat small and unspectacular, but comfortable (not sure about the suites though as we did not see them). Bathtubs in garden and ocean view rooms are uncomfortable and almost unuseable as such. Food was mediocre and overpriced. The only great meal we had there was on "grill night." All off-site retaurants are at least a $20, 20 minute cab ride away in playa del carmen. Overall, Maroma is a great choice if you want to lounge on a breath-taking beach and feel quite pampered. If you are the type of person who needs more stimulation then that, it may not be the best choice for you. (They do offer some expensive day trips-- we just didn't try them.) All that said, we LOVED our time at Maroma and were very sad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't live up to the beach!”
Reviews.Author: francescaBannerElkNc
Reviews.Content: Maroma sits on a beautiful beach which the hotel constantly cleans. The accomodations, service and food do not do justice to the beach. We stayed in a Sian Nah suite. The living room furniture was very impractical and uncomfortable ( not nap or reader friendly).The private plunge pool was unusable--in the shade and cold! Room service was Ok at breakfast, but a disaster at night. The menu and food quality at lunch was very good, but things fell apart at night. Poor menu, poor wine list and laughable service. I prearranged a massage in the suite for every other day. They even messed that up and I didn't get my massage the last day. No apologies--no nothing! It was next to impossible to get a newspaper delivered to the room. One day it took 4 phone calls--still no paper! A manager eventually showed up with one---3 hours later. On check out they wanted to know how much we enjoyed our stay. I told them we didn't and filled them in AGAIN on the problems we had. No one was very concerned. We will not return.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: prettyroe56
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed at maroma june 20 thru 27. we celebrated our 3rd anniversary and his 40th birthday. we were married in cap juluca 3 years ago and thought that was amazing... it didnt hold a candle to maroma. we stayed in casa del mar. our room was beautiful. we had our own private plunge pool a palapa with 2 massage tables underneath where we had outdoor massages, a double lounger all overlooking the beautiful white sand beach and the clear calm blue water. the food and service was outstanding . everyone i mean everyone made you feel that this was our home and couldnt do enough to meet all of our needs. the spa and the grounds were magnificent. we enjoyed several spa treatments. i would reccomend the mud bar.... it was an experience!!!!! we look forward to returning to see our maroma family

Reviews.Title: “Sublime, Relaxing Maroma”
Reviews.Author: susanmcd123
Reviews.Content: We just returned from five days/four nights at Maroma and we really enjoyed our stay. I just wish it had been a bit cooler, but we knew that since we were going in the middle of the summer, it was going to be hot, so we were not surprised. Here are my thoughts, in no particular order. Hope this is helpful to others! THE BEACH: The beach is beautiful with soft, fine, white sand and aquamarine water with small breakers. There may be a little tiny bit of seaweed floating in the ocean from time to time, but the stretch of beach in front of Maroma is beautiful -- it looks just like the website pictures. No rocks at all. They do have a crew that goes along the beach each morning and removes some of the piles of seaweed that have washed up over night, but there is really not much to clean up. To the right or south of Maroma's beach (if you are facing the sea) there is another resort called the Venta Club, however, it is not very obtrusive -- no notable noise. It is bigger, but the buildings are pretty low-profile and mostly back off the beach. And while you see people on their stretch of the beach, it is not a huge crowd. To the left or north, but quite a ways down the beach is the Iberostar -- a complex of four hotels with more than 1,200 rooms. It looks huge, but it is so far down the beach that you can't hear anything and can't really see any activity. We thought about walking down there one day, but it was such a looong walk that we never did it. Other than being able to see both resorts from the beach, neither intruded on the Maroma experience. Speaking of walking, you do see people walking down Maroma's beach -- presumably from Venta Club or Iberostar (the few who would walk that far) -- but the foot traffic is minimal and unobtrusive. You never feel like your private Maroma beach is being invaded by others. We did take a walk down the beach one day past Venta Club. While it was nice, a bit further down the beach where there is no development (yet) the beach is strewn with trash that has washed ashore – really unsightly and unfortunate. And it makes you wonder how there is no trash on the beaches in front of the resorts and why the government doesn’t clean it up … As for the Maroma beach experience -- it is great! The have a series of fabulous "beach beds" -- literally king size mattresses on wooden platforms covered in royal blue canvas with about six pillows of various sizes, a side table, a basket of the biggest beach towels I've ever seen and a huge canvas umbrella shading each beach bed. There are beach attendants who will move your umbrella at any time to shade you or expose you to the sun as you choose. In addition, these attendants will bring you drinks and snacks whenever you want. And late morning they bring you a complimentary tray laden with scented, cold towels, a delicious fruit beverage and a fruit skewer. The beach beds rock. One word of caution -- there are more guests than beach beds. After the beach beds, the next option are very nice adjustable wooden chaise lounges with big cushions. They are also shaded by umbrellas and offer the same service, but they aren't nearly as wonderful as the beach beds. There is also a row of adirondack chairs under permanent, non-adjustable thatched palapa umbrellas – your last resort if there are no chaises or beds. Our daily routine to ensure we got a beach bed was to walk down the beach from our room on the way to breakfast and put our beach bag, etc. on a beach bed. Once we finished breakfast we'd head to our "reserved" beach bed and hang out there most of the day. When we went in the ocean or pool, or for a walk, or even snorkeling, we'd leave our stuff behind to "reserve" the beach bed. This seemed to be pretty standard operating procedure for the guests, so no one got miffed. Of course, I wouldn't suggest leaving the beach bed for hours -- that's not fair -- but to be gone 45 minutes or an hour seemed totally acceptable. THE FOOD: I would say overall the food is good, but not exceptional, and definitely too expensive. Almost every lunch or dinner entree seemed to be overpriced by $4-8. And the service could drag a bit at times, but we were in no hurry, so it was actually kind of relaxing. Breakfast was included, and it was very good -- take full advantage of it! And they also bring morning coffee to your room and leave it outside your door. Breakfast -- which we ate each morning at the "casual" restaurant (El Restuarante) outside under an umbrella -- included two bread baskets, fruit and one breakfast entree. Very tasty. The spa restaurant also has breakfast but since it was not included in our package, we didn’t try it. Lunch can be taken at El Restaurante, the spa restaurant, or on the beach. We had lunch at El Restaurant -- again outside under an umbrella or at our beach bed. The restaurant menu and beach menu are different. Both are good, but I have to say, being able to order lunch from your beach bed and have the attendant bring it to you on a lovely tray is pretty awesome! We did not try the spa lunch but the menu looked good. Dinner is offered at El Restaurante and at the "fancier" restaurant "El Sol." Dinner was good -- a mix of seafood, meats, chicken and a few Mexican and Mayan choices. We ate dinner outside, too, but no umbrella necessary at night! LEAVING THE RESORT: We rented a car for a couple of days and did some adventuring. We rented the car through the hotel. It was more expensive than taking a cab to Playa to rent the car, but the convenience of having Budget bring the car to Maroma and the rental process taking three minutes, was worth the extra cost. You can also take cabs anywhere, or take advantage of Maroma’s seemingly pricey “excursions,” but we thought it would be more fun to do our own thing. We visited the Tulum ruins – they were okay. Heard Chichen Itza is MUCH better, but with only four days, we didn't want to go that far. We also went to Playa del Carmen -- Fifth Avenue, the main drag, reminded me a bit of main street in St. Thomas. We ate lunch one afternoon in Playa at a beach bar restaurant called Mamitas. Cool scene, crowded beach, okay food and bad service. We also at dinner in Playa at Palapa Hemingway's. Decent food, better prices than Maroma. I wanted to try the Mayan place in town called Yaxhe (sp?) but my boyfriend was hesitant – their menu looked GREAT. It was also interesting to see the massive amount of development underway along the Yucatan Peninsula. There is so much construction along the beach and in Playa Del Carmen. Fortunately everything that is being built is low-rise (unlike Cancun) but it astounding how MUCH is being built. And even though construction is low-rise, much of it is sprawling complexes, so rather than going up, they go out and out and out. I can image that eventually every piece of beach will be fronted by a resort – when operations like Rosewood, Mandarin Oriental, Banyan Tree and Kor Hotels put a stake in the ground, that’s big time. THE ROOMS: We had a Sian Nah suite and it was, indeed, fabulous. Our only complaint were the really shoddy shower heads in the shower. For a room that expensive and nice, the shower heads were of the quality you’d find in a Motel 6. Typically, high end rooms in five-star hotels have really nice shower heads. It was a bit surprising. Otherwise the room was great. We loved the plunge pool and the massage palapa and the bed was incredibly comfortable. The turn down service was also really wonderful. One piece of advice, if you book a Sian Nah suite, I would strongly advise you request one on the second level for two reasons – the plunge pool, although it’s a little bit smaller, it has waaay more privacy than the first floor plunge pool. Let’s not beat around the bush – part of the fun of a plunge pool is being able to enjoy it … au natural. Because of the lack of privacy for the first floor plunge pool, you really couldn’t do that without “putting on a show” for other guests. And the massage palapa for the second floor suites are located on the roof of your suite. They are covered by a thatch roof but are open-sided so you have a great 360 degree view and great breezes. The massage palapas on the main floor are much more enclosed and offer little view and breeze access. The second floor suites have bit smaller seating area and the balcony is a bit smaller than the first floor terrace, but the other attributes far outweigh these small minuses. As for the other rooms, we arrived very early – around 12:30, so our Sian Nah suite was not ready. They gave us a “hospitality room” until our room was ready. It was a garden view room, and while it was nicely decorated, it was quite small for the price and was set way back from the beach. I would highly recommend spending a bit more money to get a premium or ocean view room. I did not see the interior of those rooms, but they seemed to be bigger and much better positioned. I think anyone booking a garden view room would probably be disappointed with their accommodations. THE POOLS: The pools are very nice, but the one closest to the restaurants and the main area was heated too much. Its setting is beautiful – surrounded by lush foliage, but it felt like a hot tub. The spa pool was the best. The farthest away, but the largest and it has a bit of a beach view and the temp was just right. THE BREEZE: Thank goodness for it! We were there at the warmest time of the year and without the constant (literally breeze) we might have been miserable. It’s just plain HOT this time of year. But, during the middle of the day, if you are on the beach, but under an umbrella, or overlooking the beach from a covered restaurant terrace, there is a constant breeze that keeps you quite comfortable. Remove the cover and sit in the sun, you'll definitely be sweating, but the breeze, and a quick dip in the pool or ocean will cool you down. I was amazed that even during the heat of the day, if you were under cover, the breeze made a huge difference -- so lunch or breakfast next to beach, under an umbrella was fine. By dinnertime, when the sun had gone down, it was quite pleasant. When you get away from the beach and the BREEZE it can be quite uncomfortable -- even in the evening. For example, walking through Playa on Fifth Avenue in the late afternoon / early evening, we were positively drenched -- and the same goes for the ruins at Tulum, until we got to the edge of the bluff overlooking the sea and found the breeze again. Overall, we weren't miserable -- except for a few occasions when we were too far inland, but it was hot. If you check the weather for the area on the Weather Channel website, there is a reason it says 88 degrees / feels like 97 degrees.” THE STAFF: Finally, regarding the many raves about the staff on this website – they were all quite nice, and many did indeed know our names, but it wasn’t really as much of the be-all-end-all for us as it was for others. It was a nice bonus to have such an incredibly friendly and accommodating staff. Perhaps if we had been at the resort longer, it may have been more impactful for us. Overall we had a really positive experience. I would recommend Maroma to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “not quite the hype”
Reviews.Author: bobolito
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel and very easy to get to... just south of cancun airport. we stayed here for our honeymoon. at this time the service was decent, the outdoor bartenders were great. grounds were gorgeous. spa treatments terrible, and room had plumbing issues. very nice beach but not secluded enough. very loud hotel next door. would try other hotels before we would go back. hope these issues have been fixed.

Reviews.Title: “After further review...”
Reviews.Author: AZN8TIV
Reviews.Content: Maroma! Maroma! What a way to end our Honeymoon in Riviera Maya. In a sentence, my wife and I describe it as "sol y sombra" because you make this retreat as you like... you can have as much sun and beach as you'd like or you can tuck yourself away in the spa treatments and palapa's nestled throughout the property. We had superb service in the restaurants and on the beach mattresses. The personal conceirge service was fantastic and we fell in love with the genuine smile of Edgar in guest services. He went out of the way for our accommodations and piece of mind while at Maroma. Every hesitation we had on the cost/night was extinguished when we continually felt like a celebrity or when we had private walks on the beach to the north on what felt like an island at times... the hotel even sweeps up the seaweed. Overall, it was a fantastic honeymoon and our stay was too short. It surpassed our dreams and we left full of life. P.S. Make sure you get clarity on ocean views ... some views are ocean but completely obstructed by palm trees.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the Six button? Can I give Maroma a Six?”
Reviews.Author: gothammarc
Reviews.Content: Oh, my, where to even start? I just want to give Maroma a "6" on the 5-point scale. This was heaven and nirvana on earth. I'm a TripAdvisor freak -- I religiously read the reviews for every single property I'm considering going to -- but have never felt compelled to write before. I read all 148 reviews of Maroma before going, trying to understand how this property got 101 "5"s from this admittedly very tough crowd. Could it really be "all that"? Now I understand. We stayed 10 days in one of the Sian Nah suites, you can see the photos of the room attached to this review. Overall, I'd say Maroma is one of those places where photos can not possibly capture the sensibility of the place. This experience absolutely redefined luxury for me, and it was magic, magic, magic. I guess I was a little worried, given the price tag -- would this *really* be such an amazing experience for the price? Well, at my first lunch, they brought out 4 different typesof crackers, artfully arranged in a folding napkin extravaganza. I guess that made me feel like they really paid attention to every last little detail, and sure enough, they absolutely do. The staff is unbelievably friendly. Almost, just *almost* on the edge of too friendly, but they never go over that edge. They seem to pick up on when you want to be left alone. And they are just good, really warm people. The beds on the beach were just so great for crashing on all day, every day. The sand was perfect. The water phenomenal. We loved the snorkel trip and did a 1-hour sailing lesson with Sebastian -- wonderful! I found the main restaurant a little bit plain, me personally, so we ended up eating off the beach menu every day for breakfast and lunch, and then at "El Sol", their fancier restaurant, each night. Variety and presentation were New York City "foodie" quality. Wine list was not enough for a true oenophile, but for a dilettante like me, the mix of Puligny-Montrachet, Russian River Valley Pinot Noirs, and some fun South Africans and New Zealand whites was just perfect. The room, as you can see from the attached photos, is out of this world. Loved the plunge pool, especially. Their website makes it a little confusing, but both ground floor and 2nd floor suites have plunge pools.
