Having spent 10 days there, and having seen all the property at very close hand, I'd strongly recommend the 2nd floor suite -- more privacy, and you get a 3rd floor private massage palapa! One of the phenomenal things was the turn-down service -- little white candles all throughout the room every night. Gave the suite a magical, very romantic feeling. Let's see... what else was amazing? On on next-to-last day, we woke up a little sick (from sun, running around, and probably just being in a foreign country). Maroma's response? A doctor in our suite within 60 minutes along with the property manager!! He prescribed a few antiobiotics and we both felt well enough the rest of the day and even OK on the flight home. Ummm... try getting that experience anywhere else on the planet. And, oh, yes, the entire staff memorizes your first name within your fist day of being there. Gives it such a welcome, homey, feeling. I know, if you're a Manhattanite it probably sounds creepy, but trust me, it really isn't and it makes your experience warm and friendly. Actually, I'm remembering a whole bunch of stuff now, but I'd really rather you just go and experience Maroma for yourself. It is heaven, heaven, heaven, and the place deserves a "6" if there was any justice in the world. p.s. If you're looking for a fun, way "local" experience in Playa Del Carmen, go to "El Fogon" across from the Mega Mart -- our entire dinner was $17 for 2 people and was, actually, one of our favorites of the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world FABULOUS!!”
Reviews.Author: Roccochomp
Reviews.Content: Maroma is the real deal my friends. It is not for the "pseudo-luxe" crowd who think a Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton is "luxury". This is old world elegance, sophistication, service, ambiance and relaxation. No clampetts, no screaming kids, no guests with more money than class. People that come here GET IT. I could write pages and pages of a review. Let me just say that the property is exqusite. The beach truly deserves the best award in the world it has repeatedly earned. Our Sian Nah Suite was to die for. The food/drink/service was outstanding. The staff all know your name within hours of arrival, and treat you like family. It is like staying in someone's private home - it is that elegant. The management of Maroma and Orient Express are to be commended. This truly is as good as it gets. Oh, and did I mention the outstanding private dinner that Chef Gomez prepared for me and my wife on the rooftop Mirador to celebrate her 40th birthday? Simply magical...... Forget Hualalai, Forget Nevis, Forget Le Toiny, Forget Little Dix Bay. Forget Palmilla. If you want the best vacation of your life, with peace and quiet and no kids and everything in perfect order - Maroma is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic secluded location with white beach”
Reviews.Author: Sancarlo
Reviews.Content: Last March my wife and I had the pleasure to stay eight days at the Maroma resort. We found this resort to be very comfortable, romantic and was a pleasurable experience. The complex is divided in two sections – the original older side and an additional newer and luxurious side that features individual larger casitas with all the modern comforts. The Maroma, at least as experienced from the "older side", isn’t what I would call a five-star resort like Las Ventanas al Paraiso, but it does have a charm all of its own nevertheless. So here are the details - good and bad: Location: Located in a jungle facing a pristine white beach, this secluded “boutique” hotel offers access to much more than just beach and sun. It is close to the entertainment action of the closest town of Playa Del Carmen, or the larger Cancun. You are also close to the archeological sites of Tulum and Coba (where you can see Nohoch Mul – the tallest pyramid in the Maya World), the grandiose parks of Xel-Ha and Xcaret, the Sian Ka’an Biosphere Reserve and the thirty cenotes (sink holes filled with underground fresh water). You can also visit the new luxury communities of Puerto Aventura, known for its marina, Mayakoba, for its luxury resorts located among gold courses and fresh water canals, or the community of Akumal. Even on a cold rainy day, there is plenty to do around here. Accommodations: The small room we stayed in was facing the beach and had a decent balcony. It was located in the oldest section of the complex on the third floor above the restaurant. The rustic looking room offered no TV (unlike the newer luxurious casitas), but had a small stereo system. There isn't any Wi-Fi connection in the room, but you can access the Internet from their community room located near the entrance. The older building tends to suffer from some plumbing problems such as clogged drains, and the bathroom decor could use a remodeling. The tile bathtubs might look quaint, but aren’t comfortable and are hard to clean. I wonder how many times the staff really scrub those tubs. Service: The staff is very pleasant and courteous. They are always ready to help. The rooms could be cleaned better. The hotel employs a staff of beach cleaners in charge of always combing the sand to keep it pristine from seaweed and other debris that might wash up from the sea. Another team spends the sunset lighting up hundred of candles to illuminate the complex, transforming the resort into a magical place. They do have electricity, but the candles offer so much romantic ambiance... Beach: Great white beach with brilliant turquoise water. You will notice that the beach isn’t as clean when you leave the boundary of the resort, (that is because the public beaches don’t have the Maroma’s cleaning crews). Food: Great. We liked the local cuisine at both restaurants. The food isn’t cheap though. If you want more variety, you can drive to nearby Playa Del Carmen or at any other luxury resorts close by.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort on a beautiful beach”
Reviews.Author: B&TLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very secluded and intimate in comparison to most on Riviera Maya/Cancun. The sand is powder white and therefore never hot to walk on, and the bright blue double beds on the beach are very comfortable. Rooms are beautifully appointed and staff are charming. Complimentary morning tea and coffee is left outside the room every day. Food is generally good but suffers from too much complexity, apart from the excellent steak and french fries. The ceviche from the beach menu was divine. Service was generally excellent, with the exception of the inattention to the mini bar, which was not refilled during our whole stay, and then we were charged for several days' worth of missing drinks. (We found that charging for extra drinks which we had not consumed was common in Mexico as presumably we weren't expected to check). We travelled around Mexico a lot before we got to Maroma and I would certainly agree that food and drink are way overpriced here.

Reviews.Title: “The Reviews are True”
Reviews.Author: contributor90
Reviews.Content: We stayed in early January of this year. I'm not going to bother rewriting what everyone else said. The place is, indeed, paradise. It doesn't get any better than Maroma. We loved the turn-down service every night and the relaxing music. Our garden room (cheapest option) was one of the nicest rooms I have ever stayed in. I can't wait to go back and stay at a suite one day!! I can't imagine a place any more relaxing than this. The only possible down side is that you may even feel a bit uncomfortable having all those lovely people wait on you hand and foot! Of course that is what you are paying for-- so you don't mind! FYI, we saw Mena Suvari while we were there - that review is real. The place really is fit for the stars, and everyone feels like one when they are there (no matter who you are!) Its so quiet and laid back, though that no one seemed to take any note of the famous people there. Last but oh so very far from least, the food was exceptionally good (and I am a total food snob!)

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on Earth”
Reviews.Author: tinagella
Reviews.Content: There are not enough words to express the beauty, serenity and absolute lushness of Maroma. It was, without a doubt, the best beach vacation I have ever taken. Honeymooners both young and old will not be disappointed with the beach, the food, the impeccable service, the spa and of course the incomperable Maroma Margheritas. My only regret is that we were only able to stay a week and that we ventured off the property one evening for dinner. My advice, book it now, don't wince at the price! It is worth every penny and once you get there don't leave until you absolutely must because nothing comes close to Maroma.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world - a Meticulously Designed Dream!!”
Reviews.Author: dc5000
Reviews.Content: This place is an exquisite Mexican fantasy land. The service was attentive and respectful, the rooms luxurious and inviting. This is really a triumph of design and aesthetics backed with quality. Every detail contributed to an experience of beauty and tranquility. At night, it seemed as if the entire place was candle-lit. Food was outstandingly unique. NO KIDS!!! Loved that part of it. This is a QUIET place. Come here to rejuvenate, not to party.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra romantic, Spectacular beach!”
Reviews.Author: DivingGal34
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Maroma in June of 2006. My friends and I spent the first half of our vacation at Paraiso de la Bonita and the second half at Maroma, and I would definitely recommend Maroma over Paraiso for several reasons, that I will describe below. Accomodation: We stayed in the large bedroom in the main house, directly over the bar. Our balcony looked out over the restaurant to the beach. I think the rooms in the main house are the most romantic. There was a mosquito netting over the bed and a hammock on the balcony. As there were 3 of us we got an extra twin bed for the room which worked fine. I loved staying at the main house, it was so easy to get down to the beach, bar, and restaurant, and we had an unbelievable view of the beach. I really liked the morning coffee and juice delivered to our door, as well as the candles on every step leading up to our room at night. The only downsides were that our balcony was not very private, as everyone at the restaurant could see us. Also, the bathroom and shower were not quite as nice as I would expect for over $800 a night. All in all, though, it was a beautiful and romantic room and I'm glad we got it. Beach: Truly one of the most beautiful I've ever seen, and I've travelled all over the US, Bermuda, Carribean, and Mexico. The sand is powdery white and the sea is turquoise, with gorgeous surf crashing all day long. How it can be so different from the lagoon-like no-wave seaweedy conditions at Paraiso, less than an hour away, is puzzling to me. On the beach there are the most comfortable beds that you can lounge on all day. The staff are so helpful and would immediately arrange the beds for us, provide as much shade and towels as we needed. Beach service of drinks was wonderful. Grounds: Immaculately kept, tropical, with all sorts of little winding paths to explore. Paths were lit up at night from lights set into the paving, giving a very romantic effect. The two resident parrots were also fun, although one tried to eat my ponytail holder when he sat on my shoulder! There are a couple of pools, one shady and the other sunny, both nice for a quick dip. Pools were stocked with towels and very comfortable lounge chairs. Spa: Fantastic. My friends and I all did several treatments, manicures, and pedicures. They really cater to the ladies as the male spa staff all look like 20 year old models. This was slightly embarrassing when I did the "water massage" and had this ridiculously hot, buff guy moving me around the water for 30 minutes...but I got over it ;) Food/Drinks/Entertainment: We enjoyed the breakfast out on the patio every day. Fresh fruit was delicious, and the menu had all of the standard offerings. Lunch and dinner were uniformly delicious. We ate one night at the more expensive restaurant which was a real treat. Really enjoyed the wine and cocktails as well! The bar had great low-key live music often...usually one or more guys with a guitar singing traditional folk songs. It was a perfect end to the day to unwind in the bar after dinner listening to live music. Activities: The resort can arrange a variety of activities and private transportation, although at a high cost. We took a trip to see Tulum and got a private tour for the three of us, which was nice given that there were hundreds of people there. Our guide made sure we had cool drinks and towels afterwards, which was a treat after walking around all morning in the sun. I also took a trip to swim with the dolphins and manatees at the nearby marine center, which was great. The only downsides to my trip were that it was quite expensive, and I think the resort is more suited to couples than singles (I kept wishing I was there with a boyfriend or husband instead of with the girls) but overall I found it amazing. It would make a really wonderful honeymoon destination.

Reviews.Title: “Eat your heart out, Peter Island!”
Reviews.Author: eastsiders
Reviews.Content: This is the best beach resort we've ever stayed at, including Peter Island, Little Palm and Caneel Bay. The others are lovely, and Caneel Bay and Peter Island have beaches just as nice (maybe a little nicer for their smaller size and isolation), but what distinguishes Maroma is the exceptional level of service -- they really lived up to the "mi casa, su casa" cliche we were given during our arrival tour. There's a warmth and friendliness about the place and the entire staff that is surprisingly calming. There's not that much to do besides lying on a beach mattress, swimming in the sea or pool, snorkeling, taking out a cat, or taking a yoga class or massage. Some might find the low key quietude a little soporific, but if you're looking for a place to simply unwind and relax, Maroma is for you. They are extremely responsive to special requests, such as very early morning room service (5:30 am) so we could get an early start on our drive to Chichen Itza and beat the crowds (which we did -- we were finished by around 11:30, shortly after the tour buses arrived by the dozens). All this is not to short-change the rooms, which are absolutely perfect without the splashy condo-glitz of most big resorts. And it's a pleasure to stroll around the lush grounds -- the walk to the restaurant is a pleasure, especially as you pass the macaws or the peacock strolls by. And the spa is wonderful and well-run -- try the couples lomi-lomi massage. On one point, however, I have to disagree with one of the previous reviewers: don't bother with Playa del Carmen. We went there one night for dinner, and it's a nightmare -- a mile-long pedestrian mall lined with touristy restaurants and souvenir shops. We've gone to a lot of high-end places over the past 10 years, from the Caribbean to the Gritti, and we've always resisted re-visiting any of them because there's always a different great place we want to see. Maroma might just make us rethink that pattern.

Reviews.Title: “Mayan Riviera's Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: talkingbean
Reviews.Content: Based on friends' recommendations and since it seemed relatively easily accessible and not overrun with tourists compared to most beachy escapes (especially this time of year in the Caribbean!), my fiancee and I decided to pop down to Maroma for a few days of much-needed R&R. In a word: HEAVEN. It surpassed all expectations of what I imagined the Mayan Riviera could be and definitely caters to those "in the know" as there are no big signs on the highway, etc. Our room wasn't ready on arrival, but we wandered over to the spa in the meantime, which made us feel as though we'd stepped into an ancient healing temple of peace and tranquility. It's down the beach/through the garden from the main buildings, but not to be missed! The Lomi Lomi was one of the most interesting/energizing massages I've ever had, and therapists are truly exceptional, overseen by lovely Spa Manager (Sharon), who glows from the inside out with a smile that could not have been more welcoming. When our room was finally ready, a very sweet (presumably local) girl from guest services tracked us down, and we were unexpectedly upgraded to one of the most stunning suites imaginable (#65) ~ beyond worth the wait! This is definitely the room to book for any special occasion/celebration. A few guests seemed really annoyed one evening that there weren't enough tables in the casual restaurant (which does not accept reservations), and they were forced to wait. We weren't bothered in the slightest though, as it gave us more time to enjoy the barman's anecdotes (Tom Cruise and various other celebs) and recommendations on delicious cocktails and wine - never would have thought Mexican wine could be so delicious!! We're still kicking ourselves for not having allowed more time to snuggle into this secret paradise and agreed to do at least 10 days next trip, which can't come soon enough!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: Susanna7
Reviews.Content: Positively Heaven! My husband and I have traveled to many exclusive resorts in the world and this was one of the best if not the best. We were pampered with great food, service and genuine hospitality. We will go back actually checking our schedule for next year. The beach is endless, snorkeling beyond our expectations and every aspect of the trip could not have been better! GO!

Reviews.Title: “Xanadu-viera Maya”
Reviews.Author: FretteIntheWoods
Reviews.Content: Arriving in the cancun airport is some form of strange torture, screaming babies, etc. Entering the resort can only be called a transporting experience -you are greeted with a delicious maroma margarita, a smile and the lush foliage and flowers. They get everything right at Maroma --if you like your outdoor space to be equal in size and comfort to your indoor space, a bath to romance in and a beach bed with pillows on the beach to lay in, this is your spot. The staff treats you as a special guest in their home and be sure to ask Freddy for a mango or banana dacquiri. You will never have to sign a receipt as the staff make sure to know who you are and charge things to the room without requiring a signature --not having to sign a bill makes one forget reality even a bit more. The resorts grounds are impeccable and the details of candle lit walkways, coffee outside your door upon wakening and all of the luxuries and amenities you may require (we watched the world cup on the plasma screen tv) are present. Fresh towels are EVERYWHERE. It feels like there are no other guests other than you. Don't miss this place. Try the Chaya juice and don't miss breakfast!! We have been to La Samanna, which we loved, but would choose Maroma over La Samanna in a second!

Reviews.Title: “What a gorgeous and verdant resort with a genuinely Mexican atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: JSLondon
Reviews.Content: On the one rainy day of our 10 day Christmas/New Year holiday we checked out the other resorts along the coast. Apart from the Paraiso de la Bonita,they were ghastly in a scary Jurassic Park meets Radisson Hotel sort of way (especially the new Fairmont Mayakoba) We had a lovely barbecue dinner at the Paraiso, which is very cool and dramatic,but in a rather generic sort of way. We were a large family group (11) of 3 generations from both sides of the Atlantic, all very seasoned travelers. Every one of us adored the Maroma. The staff were totally adorable and unbelievably helpful. My mother had a fall and sprained her ankle. Immediately several staff carried her to her room,called an English speaking doctor,ordered a wheelchair, and were always available to help up the stairs. My brother organised a birthday dinner on the beach. The hotel made a candle lit runway to the table and organised a mariachi band. It was magical. The beach is just amazing,huge with white sand.There are proper loungers,huge double beds with bolsters and thatched umbrellas.The service was immaculate: food and drinks arrived almost before you realised you wanted them. We even had our breakfast on the beach-complete with flowers and table cloth.Breakfast is utterly amazing-enormous,delicious and made individually.Freddy's Bar is great and laid back-yummy cocktails. A special thank you to Carla from Hospitality who called endlessly to try to locate the suitcase containing all my Christmas presents,which British Airways lost for a week.GRRRR! The hotel and grounds are absolutely divine. From the beach you can see how harmonious the design is,with whitewashed buildings and thatched roofs.Also the spa is stunning and very Zen. Playa del Carmen is lots of fun at night,with some seriously cool and lively restaurants and bars. (Rather less adorable in the daylight) It's only 15 minutes away.Definitely a plus for our children-ages 18-27. I would say that the hotel staff goes the extra mile to make their guests happy, and in a very genuine way. It was the perfect holiday. Thank you Maroma.

Reviews.Title: “maroma”
Reviews.Author: papillonpictures
Reviews.Content: dear readers, i'm writing to you not only to gush about the wonderful experience i had over the new year holiday at Maroma Resort, but to also recommend it as a beautiful get-away. i wanted to spend the new year holiday in Mexico, but wasn't quite sure where to go-it being my first time and all. the travel agent that i was working with recommended this "fabulous" resort called Maroma and continued to tell me that i was located on the Carribean side of Mexico near all the Mayan ruins and culture. i was immediately sold! it was always a dream of mine to visit the Mayan ruins and experience the people and culture, so i went ahead and started planning my vacation. upon arriving at Maroma, i was already taken aback by the beautiful location, the well manicured grounds, and their truly exceptional hospitality. Maroma was the most exqusite resort i had ever been to and the most attentive. not only was i called upon by name from the moment i met any of the Maroma family, but my whole experience at Maroma just kept exceeding my expectations. the restaurants with their glorious cuisine, the friendliness of all the employees, the comforts of the rooms and suites, the exciting list of activites offered at the resort and elsewhere created the most special vacation i could have ever had and filled my life with a sense of renewal for the upcoming year. i carried the most cherished memories away with me and look forward to seeing all my new friends again at Maroma in the future. Maroma is a dream experience. i recommend it to anyone who wants to renew their spirit and enrich their life. peace and respect, mena suvari

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilacrose
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay which was the relaxing end to our 2 week trip visiting varoius different places in Mexico. It was a perfect setting, the grounds are stunning and the beach wonderful, it never feels crowded. We had a garden room overlooking one of the smaller pools on the upper floor; it was very private and had ample space, we loved the huge shower/sunken bath and the bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Only one night in El Restorante we found the service had lost the plot a little, maybe because it was raining and everyone was eating inside, but we were not offered the lovely breads or given the little dips they bring before the meal, our main course was brought before we were ready too. That was the only mishap and other evenings service was excellent although they perhaps could improve the vegetarian selections. The food we had was mainly superb. The pool and beach beds are fabulous, we discovered that if sitting on the beach nearer the beach bar they brought you trays of fruit drink, cold towels and fruit kebabs but if you sat further away or by the pool you missed out. We felt a little uncomfortable with the not signing for food/drinks especially as some of the staff had limited english and seemed unsure of our room number, our bill had a few things on it we definately did not have but had also missed some things off so overall it was probably about right so we did not make a fuss about it. We were shocked at the earlier review and were delighted not to have a TV in the room, who needs it when you can look out at wonderful pelicans diving for fish! The gym was great excellent equipment and a lovely view out from the running machines. All in all a lovely place, relaxing and luxurious, not quite as consistent service as one would get in similar hotels in the far east but not a problem overall.

Reviews.Title: “A Treasure”
Reviews.Author: advsrbill
Reviews.Content: It is pretty hard to find much bad to say about Maroma. We just got back - it was pretty windy & a little rainy. The service and staff are as good (and sincere about it) as we have seen anywhere! Beach service is excellent. Food is way above average for our American tastes. Had a little trouble with the snorkeling trip, but they were already aware of it and are going to change the operation. The reef that they take you to is just OK - but it is close and free. The AC unit was a built into the wall unit - so it was pretty noisy and drowned out the nicety sleeping to the sound of the ocean waves. We were in one of the new Sian Nah suites which were huge and the plunge pool was a nice touch. The busy Cancun airport is probably the worst part about the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Pants!”
Reviews.Author: aromamoaner
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 6 night stay at Maroma with my 12 year old son. When we arrived at Cancun airport nobody was there to take us to the hotel (which I had arranged beforehand). I had to phone the hotel to get them them to send a driver who did not arrive for 20 minutes. When he finally did arrive there was no apology. The room did not have a TV, DVD player or an extra bed, all of which had been requested and confirmed both at time of booking and a few days prior to arrival. Housekeeping delivered a TV and DVD player to the room but the TV did not have a remote (which made it almost impossible to operate). House keeping could not find a remote so in the end had to change the TV. The extra bed did not arrive for a few hours and when it did housekeeping brought in two mattresses on top of one another (because they had a problem finding a bed). The top mattress was dressed in just a single sheet. It was unusually cold for Riviera Maya in November. I requested a duvet and was delivered a blanket. Eventually we got a duvet. There was no key to the minibar which was unfortunate as my son judges hotels by the standard of the mini bar. We had to get the key delivered as well. I think most of the first night was spent trying to get the room sorted. During that first night a foul smell of sewage wafted in from the bathroom. The intensity of the smell increased to such an extent that we both got into the double bed, sprayed the sheets with after shave and hid under the duvet. The next morning the hotel assured me that the problem could be resolved by clearing a pipe in the bathroom but it would mean some disruption and a little time. We went to get some lunch. On our return there were a number of maintenance men in the bathroom pumping sewage out of the toilet, and both of the showers. There was a fair amount of what I can only describe as well, er.... poo all over the bathroom floor. The smell was pretty bad - on par with the worst public toilet in Scotland I would say. At one one stage the workmen locked us out of the bathroom for about an hour for fear of what we might have to endure. At that stage the hotel became affectionately known to us as "Aroma" We were moved to room 65 only after I insisted. This room was of the same category as the "poo" room but on the ground floor (which we preffered because of the beach access). Superb room with a gym, massage palapa, private pool, amazing beach view etc. They are expensive but worth it. You really can get comfortable in them. For the last 2 nights we downgraded to a standard sea view room because room 65 was booked. This was entireley my fault as I had only comitted to 3 nights. The standard room was awful. Dark, noisy (you could hear the staff a lot of the time), no seperate shower and it looked like it should have been decorated 20 years ago. There was no privacy there and the terrace was almost in the bar area. I was not happy there at all. I cannot believe the rack rate on that room is $790 plus taxes and other charges - that is serious money. (we paid less than that but it would would not be fair to the hotel to disclose the price). On the last night the remote control to our TV mysteriously disappeared after housekeeping had made up the room. Other observations are as follows; All the staff were very friendly, tried to help and meant well at all times. After I made a fuss about being charged for the poo night the hotel gave me another bill with the charge deleted. The weather was not good fot the first few days so I accept that may have clouded (pun intended) my view. Maroma has a beautiful beach. I recommend the hotel invests in some remote controls. The food was good but I dont like french fries which taste like cardboard. Aesthetically the whole place looks like it was built on the cheap. The finishings are nasty. It feels cold and empty and there needs to be more flowers/ plants. This is just my opinion (the minimalist argument does not stand up here - this is not a minimalist hotel) I would gladly stay at Aroma again only after the hotel has been knocked down and re-built.

Reviews.Title: “Personal Touch at Maroma”
Reviews.Author: MtnKat
Reviews.Content: This was our first honeymoon after five years of marriage. We were so ill on our first honeymoon, that we could not enjoy it. Maroma made the wait worthwhile! From the moment we were greeted with our Maroma Marguaritas to the sad farewells, we were spoiled and pampered. As it was our anniversary, they had a cake and chocolate covered strawberries greeting us upon check-in. They had also upgraded our room. It overlooked the Caribbean shore bordered by a powder white beach. Spectacular! Hospitality listened and responded quickly to each request for special provisions. The room was spotless and well appointed. We hired a guide to take us through the jungle outside the resort. She expertly described the flora and fauna that abounded just outside our door. We very much enjoyed the experience. The only recommendation we would suggest is that if you are driving, you be aware that The Piano Grill is the only obvious sign on the highway at dusk or dark. It is on the left coming from the airport. Be aware of "returnos" that the area uses instead of overpasses. To make a left off of a limited access highway, one must pass your destination and look for a returno, get in the turn lane and double back to the most wonderful, relaxing resort we have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “A Must!!!”
Reviews.Author: SparkyLuma
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent the last few days of our honeymoon at Maroma, and it was definitely the highlight of the trip! The hotel is beautiful and elegant, but without a single trace of stuffiness. The beach is gorgeous, the food is wonderful... but what makes Maroma truly special is the staff. Every single person greets you with a smile and a friendly hello, even if you're just passing on a pathway. Waiters and hospitality staff remember your name. Everyone is so warm and so nice, they can't do enough for you, but it never feels intrusive or phony. Truly the most gracious and welcoming hotel we've ever experienced. If you dive, my husband recommends the Cenotes trip. It's expensive, but he loved it. And the spa is wonderful -- I had a facial that was absolutely perfect. Treat yourself to a trip to Maroma -- trust me, you will love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just about as perfect as you can get”
Reviews.Author: ssumrow
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 5-night stay at Maroma. Since this was a "just because" trip, we didn't splurge for an ocean view room. However, our garden view room, Maroma's lowest category, could have easily been a top-tier room if the resort wasn't located oceanfront. The view of the pool area was great and the grounds are very lush. I think our room was located near the housekeeping department. Hense, our only complaint was the noice from the housekeeping carts that seemed to opperate very early to very late. The resort is top-notch. The beach (and especially the beach beds) is one of the best we've experienced. Manuel took great care of us on the beach and knew our names by the second day we were there. Maroma also has a great library. I forgot a book to read, but had no trouble finding a book in their lirbray. They also have two TV rooms (great for catching sports highlights), and a public use computer with Internet...great touches we didn't expect. The Kinan Spa is also very nice. We has messages there and were one of the best. However, check you bill. We were double charged and they also charged us for a $10 price increase that was not posted anywhere. The extra charges were prompty taken off--no problems. At Maroma, you don't sign for anything (drinks, food, etc.). They just ask for your room number. Therefore, it's a little difficult to keep tabs on your spending and make sure it's correct at checkout. However, the final bill was in the ballpark, so I had to guess it was correct. Maroma's food and drinks are outstanding. Be carefull....the Maroma Margarita can be addictive! The service at Maroma is excellent. Everyone is very friendly and accommodating. Upon our return, I e-mailed the resort to see if I could get the recipe for their Maroma Margarita. Within a day, I have a very nice e-mail with their "secret recipe." However, the letter stated that their margaritas are never as good without the white sand beach and the sound of the ocean. Even though I've jsut about mastered their margarita, they are right....never as good without the Maroma setting. You can't go wrong with Maroma. We are well traveled in the Caribbean and Mexico. We're very picky and it's hard to earn 5-stars with us. But Maroma is one of the best if not the best. Even though we didn't have one of their premium rooms, I can just imagine how this would have made Maroma even better. Next time, we're going to splurge!

Reviews.Title: “The Excitement of Paradise and the Luxury of Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: jricafort77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 9-day stay at Maroma Resort and already wishing we were waking up to the magical sunrise of soothing gentle waves and quite breeze of the Yucatan Peninsula. I will certainly miss the fresh coffee everyday, which was always waiting for us at our door around 6:00 AM. We arrived at Maroma Resort expecting nothing but full relaxation and great dining. To our pleasant surprise, the hospitality girls welcomed us with delicious margaritas and a wonderful room upgrade to a fabulous oceanfront master suite. The view from our suite was heavenly and to call it a paradise would be an understatement. It was more than what we could have asked for. I was certainly looking forward to the real Mexican Cuisine and was very delighted to have tried the Chilaquiles and Shrimp Ceviche. Infact, I had both dishes almost everyday because they were both scrumptious. Most of the meals we ordered were not on their menu so we were not deterred that their fine dining was closed for renovation. They made sure our dinner was prepared the way we wanted it. To top it all, my husband was very impressed with his dinner selections despite being a finicky eater. The beach at Maroma was the best one we have ever seen – talcum white sand, turquoise water and almost still like a pool. We certainly enjoyed our morning strolls along the shore and were always fascinated by the powder soft sand and magnificent scenery of the jungle, other neighboring resorts and people basking under the sun. The reason why our experience at Maroma Resort was superb in many ways is because the staff was very accommodating and the friendliest people on earth. Their hospitality is parallel to none. We were blown away and could not believe that in this modern era a lifestyle of luxurious hospitality they evoke still existed. We will always remember our new friends at Maroma – Lorena, Ricardo, Lupita, Lourdes, Mariana, Emilio and many more – Gracias para todos. We look forward to our return and we will seriously consider their yoga/spa package the next time around.

Reviews.Title: “It's all true!”
Reviews.Author: Phildiver
Reviews.Content: What others have said about the service, the rooms, the incredible beach - and above all, the people - it's all true. Having visited a number of unique resorts around the world, I have to say that Maroma ranks among the best. As a diver who has been to some incredible destinations, I wasn't expecting much. But again, I was very pleasantly surprised. Rafael and Sebastian at Azul Profundo run a first-class operation. Because it was the off-season, I was - often - the only client. The shallow dives were fun. Once the guys were satisfied with my scuba expertise, the fun really started - current dives that rolled along the outer reef with nothing but deep blue below. My thanks for a safe and thoroughly enjoyable experience. Others have spoken eloquently about the great rooms, personal touches and total service, so I'd just like to thank a few people who made my stay terrific: Freddy and Alejandra (spelling?) at the beach/restaurant bar. Great times, great jokes. And nothing was ever too much trouble. Lorena from Hospitality whose warm greeting set the tone for the entire stay. And Karia, who rescued the computer connection I left behind and got it back to me in 48 hours. To everyone at Maroma - thanks for a terrific experience. Hope to see you all again real soon!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Maroma!”
Reviews.Author: smith06
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our honeymoon in Maroma, and loved every minute of it! We spent the first few days at a condo in Playa Del Carmen, and weren't sure that Maroma would be worth the money...but it was! The beach and property as others have mentioned, are beautiful and secluded. The water is warm (of course) and calm.It did seem that there was some construction going on at one end of the resort, just south of the restaurant, but we didn't hear any construction noises and barely noticed anything going on there. One of the restaurants was closed due to renoavations still being made after last year's hurricane, but we did not actually see any work being done while we were there. They did mention the restaurant closure in the letters they left on our bed every night during the turn-down service. We thought the service was amazing! While we sat on the beach, lazy and hot, servers checked on us frequently to see if we needed drinks, food, or simply ice for our water. As soon as someone saw me getting towels from the large basket at the entrance to the beach, they rushed to stop me and carried them to our beach "bed" for me. And my husband and I were always greeted by name, and given a complimentary Spanish lesson during our meals! We ate breakfast and two dinners at the main restaurant. Breakfast was included, and was delicous and filling. Fresh fruit and amazing pastries were followed by either Mexican or American-style breakfasts. The dinners were amazing, much to my surprise. I didn't expect much, and was happy to learn that the food was as good as any top-notch restaurant where we live in San Francisco, a city noted for it's food-snobbery! We didn't try the other on-site restaurant, Cilantro, which featured a healthier, "Spa" menu. And the prices weren't outrageous, which I think surprised me even more. We had room service a couple of times are were very happy with it. The first time we ordered, it did take a little while. It was, however, Friday night, and I imagine it was very busy. The second time, it arrived very quickly. Coffee was always waiting outside of our door when we woke up, around 7:00 am. The turndown service was especially nice. The bathrooms were cleaned up a bit, and candles were lit. My husband especially enjoyed the chocolate left on the bed, and took to rationing them out so he could enjoy some when we got home. There was always a letter waiting for us on the bed with suggestions on what we might like to do or confirming any activities that we had arranged. We loved our room! We had an oceanview room, right above the bar, and had a large balcony with an amazing view. The bed was delicious and comfortable, and I slept deeply every night. I loved the plush rugs on either side of the bed, too. The bathrooms were nothing special, and the shower drain was slow to drain. The Mouton Brown bath products, however, more than made up for this. There weren't a lot of activities to do at Maroma, as others have mentioned, which was fine with us, as we mostly wanted to relax. My husband did go on a snorkeling trip, which he enjoyed very much, and we took a sail on the Hobie catamaran, which was included in our package. One guest we talked to had arranged to be taken on diving trips, and he seemed to enjoy it very much. I did have a great massge there. They have a beautiful facility, with a lovely relaxation room, and two "wet rooms" (one each for men and women), with a large shower, sauna and steam rooms, and a small plunge pool. I had a mud massage, which was very relaxing. The massage room was huge, with it's own very large shower. We also did the Temezcal treatment (part of our package), which is basically spending 40 minutes in a dark sweat lodge. After an initial period of claustrophobia-induced panic, it was actually very nice! And the evening ocean swim that followed it was wonderful. Check-out was pretty painless. We weren't too surprised by our charges. Gratuity or service charges are applied each time you order anything (yes, this applies to things like bottled water), so you are never actually tipping at the time of service. Given this, our check-out bill was pretty much what we expected. If you are thinking about taking a relaxing vacation to completely de-stress, Maroma is a perfect choice!

Reviews.Title: “HEAVEN!!!”
Reviews.Author: passionpormexico
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Maroma in April and I must say it was a great experience. From the moment you arrive you feel a sense of calm and peace. Everything in the room was perfect, the entire hotel is very nicely designed, every member of the staff was amazingly friendly like Freddy and Jose, specially in hospitality with Monica !! you can trust them with any questions regarding restaurants and shopping tips . We recommend to take the tour to Chichen Itza, it's a whole day tour but very well worth it. I highly recommend the Maroma to anyone looking for 5-star service and an amazingly relaxing vacation. We would go back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “welcoming, romantic maroma”
Reviews.Author: thomas01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 25th anniversary at Maroma during the first week in April. We wanted something special and decide to visit Maroma after it was chosen 'most romantic' by The Travel Channel. Simply put, we had a wonderful time. We have never felt more welcome at a resort hotel. We were welcomed by the hospitality staff with cool, moist towels and margaritas. We were first taken on a brief tour of the resort. The grounds are splendid and if there was any hurricane (Wilma) damage, we could not tell. We originally booked a gardenview room. To our pleasant surprise we were shown to an oceanfront room with a balcony and a beautiful view of the sea ( #24). We were told we had been given the room simply because it was available. What service! The room has cool tile floors and a beautiful, comfortable bed. The tiled tub has plenty of room for two! The balcony has a terrific view of the beach and ocean. We are early risers and found fresh coffee outside our door each morning. After our early morning 'power walk' along the beach, we had breakfast on the elegant stone patio right on the beach. We were usually alone and enjoyed the fresh juices, sweet rolls and omelettes. We spent most of the day on Maroma's great beach, reading, relaxing. The staff is attentive and friendly. I tried to speak what little Spanish I know, and the staff helped coax me along. Almost every staff member remembered our names. Maroma is secluded and quiet, with not a lot of activities on site. However, I see this as an advantage. Many activities can be arranged through hospitality or pursued on your own. For example, we enjoyed jet skiing at the Maroma Marina , a 5 minute drive away. You can then return to the quiet seclusion of Maroma. If you desire lots of people, packed beaches, and noise, hit the Venta Club down the beach. The activity packages are expensive. We drove ourselves to the ruins of Coba and Tulum one day saving money. After a hard day on the uncrowded beach, we spent the early evening with chips, salsa and drinks again on the stone beach patio . We met some other nice couples and had some lively conversations. Most evenings we drove to Playa del Carmen (15 min.) for dinner and a stroll down the pedestrian avenue. We had an excellent dinner one evening at Maroma and enjoyed it very much while being serenaded. Evenings at Maroma feel special as you stroll the grounds and hotel along the candle lit paths and stairways. We ended our evenings enjoying the quiet darkness of our balcony with only the sounds of the ocean and the feel of the sea breeze. Yes, Maroma is expensive, but worth it. You pay for the seclusion, and an outstanding staff that will make you feel very special. We would definitely visit Maroma again. One big word of caution about the Cancun airport. Departure is a mob scene and very slow. We arrived two hours before our flight and almost missed it. Give yourself plenty of time.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven or at least what we wish it to be.”
Reviews.Author: NNiven
Reviews.Content: We wanted for nothing and fell under the charm of the entire experience. It was like something from a dream, it didn't feel like a vacation, didn't feel like the Mexico we love, didn't evenn feel like any resort in the world...it is it's own, amazing place in some surreal, vivid place in time.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a Tranquil Experience”
Reviews.Author: keywestjoan
Reviews.Content: The staff was just wonderful. You wanted for nothing. Everyone was so professional. My experience with my massage at the spa was the most wonderful I have ever had. This Resort is a must for anyone who visits Maroma. Their tours were done with such professionalism. Scheduling and promptness for the tours was outstanding. Their drivers and tour guides were quick to offer information on the area and knowledgeable of all sights to see. Everything ordered from the menu was just delicious and served with elegance. I was treated with such respect from all the staff. The room was just something from a movie with flower petals on the bed to the scrumptious chocolates. Their beach a beautiful sigth to behold with the breathtaking Caribbean Sea. If you do not do the snorkel trip .........then you will surely miss one of their many beautiful scenes. Try NOT to miss the Dolphin Swim at Isla Mujeres...........Just Awesome!! I will never forget the fond memories of my experience at Maroma Hotel & Resort. The best to all who work Maroma resort and to all who visit. Thanks again, Joan Gaines Port Charlotte Florida

Reviews.Title: “Can't praise enough”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from another stay at Maroma Hotel. We were very happy to find the hotel with its wonderful architecture and its beautiful souroundings in tip-top shape. The beach is as beautiful as it was before the hurricane - over a mile of wide white powder sand. All the staff from management to hospitality and restaurant lived up to the spirit of the Maroma motto "a little bit of paradise ". The service is outstanding and everyone is very hospitable and attentive. A wonderful addition is the gourmet dinner service Maroma started recently at its El Sol restaurant. Executive Chef Guillermo Gomez is highly innovative and creative in combining tastes and textures and executes it all perfectly. Cannot wait to return to what has become our favorite spot in the Carribean.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Maroma is a natural paradise. The gardens and surrounds are gorgeous, but they do not look the least bit contrived. There is an abundance of beautiful birds and butterflies which adorn the gardens and surronds. Maroma's beach is one of the prettiest I have ever seen and I summer in Southampton and have been to Cap Julca in Anquilla, Eden Rock in St. Bart and Harbor Island in the Bahamas which has pink sand! Our room was charming and had a beautiful view of the sea. The food was delicious. Breakfasts were amazing and the staff would make anything you wanted, but the menu included just about anything you could possibly want including chocolate croissants which were made on the premises by the pastry chef. We ate lunch on the beach and in the two other restaurants-- even the spa menu is delicious. Dinners were also great and started with drinks and different hors d'oeures made by the chef each night. All this was topped off by the most delicious handmade chocolate wrapped in tissue left on your bed at night. The Spa is also beautiful and there are three beautiful pools for swimming that are never crowded. The work out room is only temporary, but it is very nice and in a good location. But you will spend most of your time on the king size beds on the beach which are so comfortable and accompanied by an umbrella and all the towels you need as well as constant beach service which becomes addictive. All this is over the top wonderful, but what really makes Maroma is the staff from the gardener to the maid who work so hard to make everything beautifull and enjoyable for you. Aron will take care of you during the day, Luis at night and you must ask Norberto to make you his special coffee after dinner. It is also a good idea to take a trip to the ruins and make a stop on the way back in Vallodin to see a Mexican colonial town and do some shoppng. Playa del Carmen is good for shopping, but the food and ambiance is better at Maroma. I just loved Maroma and cannot wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is giong to be a short review since words cannot describe my experience. My stay was outstanding. We were there with several other couples and they all felt the same way. This place was paradise. The staff was unbelievable with their service. You could not do anything yourself. Every little need was met. The grounds were fantastic even with the hurricane damage and construction. It's been 8 months since Wilma hit there and you almost cannot tell. I have never seen so much hard work and attention to detail. The food was excellent. I did not have one bad meal. We had a fishing trip one day and the chef agreed to cook our catch for our party (16 people). it was outstanding. The grounds, the staff, the views, the beach, the spa, the privacy, were all great. You owe it to yourself to visit the Maroma, if you want to relax and chill out a bit

Reviews.Title: “Maroma Magic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Maroma Magic - My husband and I celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary at the Maroma. We LOVED it there! The restaurant was excellent and we did not leave the hotel for even one meal. The prices were very reasonable. I would encourage the "romance package" and the ElMitador. It was very, very romantic! The turndown service was wonderful and the rooms immaculate(houseskeeping twice a day). The Kinan spa was wonderful. We sent to six spa treatements in 5 daysl. The personnel who work at the Maroma are wonderful. The housekeeping and turndown service impeccable. We would not hesitate to stay at the Maroma agaiin in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully relaxed yet luxurious (with some service issues)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a four-night stay at Maroma, and found it to be a near-perfect getaway. Like others, I was a bit concerned about some of the negative comments on the site (about the rooms, the service and the construction) but ultimately found that none of the criticisms (some of which were valid) detracted from our stay. Grounds and rooms: The hotel and grounds were beautiful and romantic, especially at night. The resort felt very isolated and removed from the real world. It was apparently fully booked, yet it felt completely uncrowded (always plenty of room in restaurants, on the beach, at the spa, etc). We felt relaxed immediately after arriving and left the resort only once during our stay. We had a junior suite, with an indoor/outdoor living room (really indoor, despite how it was advertised, but with large windows that could be opened to make it feel open to the outdoors) and a private sundeck that looked out onto the deserted beach on the northern end of the property (only downside to this view, which faces away from the rest of the resort, is the large-scale construction going on at a different property a few miles down the beach, but it is far enough away that it never bothered us). The room was large, comfortable and relatively simple, but with a number of beautiful touches (cozy throw rugs with slippers on each side of the bed, a variety of candles lit during each turndown, etc.). I probably wouldn't pick a junior suite again, only because it was an expensive option and we ultimately didn't spend a ton of time in the room. After seeing some of the less expensive rooms, we would have been equally content in any of them (we did not see the rooms in the newer section, however). As for the ongoing on-site construction, it was limited to the newer section of the hotel (near the spa and the neighboring Venta Club), and we could not hear any of it from our room or the common areas of the older part of the hotel (though my wife did hear some construction noise during her one outdoor massage in the spa). The beach: The beach is unbelievably beautiful, one of the nicest I've been to, with clear blue-green water and those incredibly decadent beach beds. We spent the majority of our stay camped out on the beach beds and that alone made the trip worthwhile. The beach attendants were very good about moving our umbrella to shade us, bringing us new towels, etc. Also really loved the way they'd bring around complimentary dishes of ice cream or sorbet in late morning, just when the sun was starting to get strong. The spa: Also really enjoyed the spa. We've been lucky enough to visit some incredible spas in the past and can be somewhat critical of the quality of treatments in some more out-of-the-way resorts, but my wife and I were very happy with the range of treatments (mostly massages) we received here. One new twist for me: before each massage, the masseuse washes and dries your feet in a large basin (probably to remove sand from all the barefooted vacationers but a very relaxing way to start the treatment). The spa itself is beautiful and open-aired, and felt very in tune with the its surroundings. It is not 100% operational, though, a fact that was not clearly communicated to us until our last day. For example, the spa has sauna and steam rooms, with plunge pools, but they were not up and running (though the very friendly spa manager showed them to us) due to some electricity restrictions resulting from some nearby construction. Contrary to some earlier reviews, the spa does have his and her relaxation rooms as well, though we not told about this option until after we had finished our last treatments of the stay (I don't think the locker rooms were open yet either, though it hardly mattered when you're ambling from your room to the spa and back again). Bottom line is that the spa was very,very nice and will be outstanding once all facilities are open. Food: El Sol, the fine dining room, was not yet open, though they served its dinner menu at the spa restaurant (really just outdoor tables grouped around one of the pools). We ate most of our meals at the more casual beachfront restaurant or on our beach bed. The more casual food was generally very good (excellent Mexican staples like guacamole and quesadillas), pretty reasonably-priced, and there was a wide enough selection that we didn't feel restricted in our options after eating there several times. The included breakfasts were very good as well. The fine dining menu was a little underwhelming. It was fine, but a little overpriced for the quality of the food. The menu was ambitious and decidedly non-Mexican but the preparation couldn't quite keep up (for example, I ordered venison and was emphatically informed that the chef recommended it medium, but it arrived overcooked). All in all, the food was always adequate to very good, but I can't say the food is the reason to stay here. Service: Ah, the service, one of the most divisive issues on this site. I would describe the service as well-intentioned, generally good but inconsistent. The staff was incredibly friendly and very accomodating. They bent over backwards to try to please, but over our stay, we noticed that the quality of the service could be erratic. One day on the beach, we practically had to stand on our beach bed and wave down the one waitress to get her to come take a drink order; most other days, we were practically catered to, with a waitress stopping by every 15-20 minutes or so to check up on us. Similarly, in the restaurants, most meals were extremely smooth, while at some we had slow service, missed drink orders, etc. It didn't bother us, since we were too relaxed to care, but I could see where these occasional lapses in service would really irk people paying these types of prices for a resort. More problematic were some miscommunications in the Hospitality/Activity office. It was not uncommon to get two different answers to the same question. One person told us we needed reservations for the fine dining restaurant, but we were told no reservations were taken when we called the restaurant itself. My visibly pregnant wife booked our snorkel trip with the activity desk, but shortly before our trip, the dive shop took one look at her and said they couldn't take her out, for liability reasons. When we separately tried to get a better understanding of what the off-site excursion included in our package entailed (to see if my wife could handle the level of activity), we each had a different trip described to us (though, to be fair, they tracked us down on the beach to apologize for the confusion and to offer to tailor the excursion to accomodate what we wanted to see and what my pregnant wife could handle). If you pointed out any problem to them, they were extremely apologetic and tried to make it up to you, and it was clear that they wanted feedback on ways to improve the service. But at the end of the day, you will be disappointed if you expect the seamless service you get at some resorts, like Four Seasons properties. All in all, we really enjoyed our stay and definitely plan to return one day. Sure, there is some room for improvement here and there, but the management appears aware of this and seems to be trying to address any issues that arise. It is a very romantic and relaxing property, and it will be even more incredible once the current construction is complete.

Reviews.Title: “Old world Mexican elegance”
Reviews.Author: FannyPeabody
Reviews.Content: We had heard of the Maroma after travelling to La Casa Que Canta, the #1 small boutique hotel in "Z wat" and decided to go and see what everyone was so pleased about. First of all if you can't get into Maroma, go to Casa Que Canta, it's amazing as well....harder to get into though... We were a bit nervous about the hurricane damage and the facility. The pictures on the website do not do the hotel justice first of all, and where the damage was great, you'd never know if you are a first time visitor. All I can say is that it must have been magnificent before, and now it's just amazing... So picture an old world Mexican mansion on the beach with an assortment of wonderful, authentic palapas surroundng it. First of all it's very secluded, and the road to find it is almost invisible to the eye, but offers a wonderful secret entrance through the jungle to arrive in what seems to be a Mayan entry way to the hotel. The people and service are way better than most brand hotels such as the Ritz, Four Seasons etc. and the friendliness and sincerity of the hotel staff is discerning, subtle, and ultimately elegant. We are spoiled, and this is the place to be quietly spoiled with simple yet oppulant taste. Our room was beautiful (#2), and the bed was luscious with a spacious balcony, hammock, and very elegant appointments from the sink, vanity, shower, and toilet. We were fotunate to have gotten one the best beach front suites, but be assured that all the rooms are nice, and even if you want to save $$$ and go to a garden room, it will be fine as the rest of the experience is amazing. I mean really, you're in your room to sleep and should be on the beach or in the bar enjoying a cold beer or cocktail. The beach front is impecable with beach beds for snoozing and great lunch service or cocktaill service. They are not out of control expensive for lunch and the assortment is wonderful from Lobster salad to great nachos. In general the food is well above average to very very good...I would not spend to much time there for dinner, venture out to Playa, or Morrellas up north. The spa is amazing, and very well worth the $$, there are a couple of tennis courts and the diving is great I heard. You never have to leave if you want or you can head out for day trips to Tulum beach (amazing) lots of rustic eco lodges, or north to Port Morrellas. Rent a car, it's inexpensive and the fun of exploring the coastal towns is real, we stumbled on Tulum beach and it was gorgeous (7-20 miles of desolate beach front) Drivng is easy and affords flexibility and avoids heavy taxi fares. Get an old beater rental car, it'll remind you of when you never had any money and how much fun it is to wing it again... We have travelled extensively at the higher end, and all over the map from Cortina,Rome, Santorini, Saint Tropez, etc, Maroma is a place to be spoiled yet in a mellow and discerning way. If you travel a lot, you know what I mean. if you want more rustic, more eco friendly and less expensive go to any number of great places on Tulum beach, They are cheap, very very mellow, and more on the hippy camping tour, but also very cool. I think the perfect package would be to go to Tulum for 3-5 days, melt away the stress, and then spend another 4 at Maroma being pampered. Wife/girlfriend/partner will love you!!! Oh yeah no kids and lots of fun couples, not too stuffy...

Reviews.Title: “Honestly and truly...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: ..a great resort. We also had our doubts based on the mixed reviews but it was everything we wanted and more. Like other guests mentioned, there is some construction but it's only in the most southern/newest part of the resort. We did not hear a thing and weren't bothered one bit. The beach is spectacular with very comfortable beach beds and "full" service. The staff is wonderful and your "wish is their command". They simply go out of their way to make you feel special and accomodate pretty much any request. The property is fabulous and very peaceful. The pools are great, the SPA is amazing. The restaurants and food are excellent. The only thing I might say is that it's a bit pricey. For US$650/night (after tax and service charges), the room was quite small (we stayed in a premium room) and nothing special. Also US$10 for a 1l bottle of water is also pushing it a little. But for us these were relatively small things and the rest more than compensated. We have been to many beautiful 5* resorts and our best resort with respect to overall ambiance and service to date remains the One&Only Kanuhura in the Maldives but our Maroma experience comes-in a very close second. We will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “We kept our expectations low based on recent reviews....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: And were just blown away by the service we received and how beautiful the property was! My husband and I were totally stressed out and just needed to decompress, based off of recent reviews we were not sure what we were getting into but we could not have been treated better! From the moment that we arrived and were handed our Maroma Margarita we were made to feel so special! Our dinner in the Mirador and the fabulous grilled lobster evening on the beach could not have been more romantic. One day I ordered a bottle of wine to enjoy while lounging on one of the beach beds, one of the wonderful attendants refilled the wine bucket three times without my having to ask so that the wine stayed chilled. Another evening my husband and I decided to enjoy a dvd from their selection in a tv room, we ordered some drinks and were so pleasantly surprised to see that when the drinks arrived they had graciously thought to make some popcorn for us to enjoy while watching the movie. In our opinion that is service! We did see the work being done on the villas towards the south end of the property, we honestly never heard any construction noise either during the day or in the evening. There is only one restaurant open and the temporary gym is still being housed in the theater but it did not take away from our overall fabulous experience. We will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECTION”
Reviews.Author: flyboi31
Reviews.Content: my partner and i stayed at the maroma last week, for 4 nights. i arrived early and was given a wonderful tour by the gracious hostess, mariana. don't let the rough, dirt road fool you... it only took a few minutes to feel relaxed and at peace with the place. the grounds are so beautiful. two parrots greet you as you enter, but be careful - they will eat the buttons on your shirt! the staff at the beach (patricia, almaron, and reina) were amazing!!! they could not have been more nice and accomodating, and always knew when you wanted them to be around. they are friendly and charming, and always addressed us by our names! the beach was soooooooo gorgeous!! the sand is white, cool, and soft. the water is clear and warm. we went to cancun (near the hilton) for an hour to play in the HUGE waves, and when we got back to the maroma, the waves were completely manageable, due to the reef a few hundred meters off shore. the beach in front of the hotel is spotless, however, if you walk along the beach, you will find LOTS and LOTS of trash (mostly plastic bottles, shoes, etc) all over the beach and into the forest. we were told that since the maroma does not own it, they do not clean it... but someone should. it is a disgrace to the beautiful area. perhaps a government agency could take care of this? the beds on the beach are clean, comfortable and fabulous - and you don't have to fight for one! the temazcal was interesting. the best part is going in the ocean after to cool off. nancy is very sweet and charming. the food is great. dinner was fantastic. the beef tenderloin was one of the best i have ever had. a little more light for dinner would be nice, we "borrowed" another candle from a nearby table to read the menus. breakfast is different, but very good. on the beach we had nachos, burgers and antojitos - all very good. the food is reasonably priced (ie, the same you would expect to pay in a large city). the room was nice. no tv's, but i didn't miss it. i love the patio and hammock. they bring coffee every morning, and it was a treat to have it on the patio. they could scrub the floors better, since there were lots of stains (ie coffee, sun lotion, etc) on the tiles. the huge, sunken tub is luxurious, but did not drain well. the a/c works very well. we never heard a neighbor, upstairs or on the side. the bed is romantic and very comfortable. there is construction at the hotel, along the southern half of the resort. however, we could not hear any construction noise during our entire stay, even on the beach, where you can see the construction. it is worth discussing this with the hotel directly, to avoid being booked in a room close to the construction. we were in room 5, as far to the north as one can be. the snorkeling trip was good, but nothing extraordinary. worth it though, for an hour and a half. we didn't get to visit the best part of the reef because of the currents. the instructors are very friendly and eager to share their knowledge of the sea. we did not swim in any of the pools, (we are not pool people) but they are awesome to look at - very nice gardens. excellent security, i felt comfortable leaving my expensive headphones and ipod on the beach while i walked or swam. they challenge you a little to get into the place, (we rented a car rather than arrive by taxi) to make sure you are suppose to be there, but after that, they know who you are. overall, this is a five star hotel, worth every penny. you do not have to worry about a thing... they have already taken care of it for you, and if they haven't, rest assured that they will. you will be pampered, and like me, you will be eager to return.

Reviews.Title: “Superlative service; on it's way to full recovery”
Reviews.Author: Clarkenn
Reviews.Content: Just spent a four night stay at Maroma. Had high expectations after seeing it ranked #1 by the Travel Channel a few years back. The pampering and exclusivity exceeded our expectations. They treat you like royalty. The beach and water are beautiful. Loved the "beach beds" and loungers. Service on the beach was outstanding. We stayed in the older section of the hotel and liked our room and the facilities, though we weren't as blown away as we'd thought we'd be. Architecture is authentic Mayan, accented with nice handmade touches, such as hand-carved, intricately painted room furnishings and bathroom tiles. Part of the reason we weren't blown away is that the grounds haven't fully recovered from the effects of the hurricanes. They aren't as lush as they normally are, though they've made excellent progress with replanting palm trees and bushes. It was still very nice and pretty. They are still doing construction on the villas, mainly in the newer section, but it did not bother us a bit. I wouldn't let either of those things deter you from going, but just be prepared for it.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: amieckow
Reviews.Content: We recently honeymooned at Maroma and had been looking forward to the trip almost more than the wedding! However, we were greatly disappointed. Upon arriving, we were told that our room wasn't ready, so we went to the restaurant to get something to eat while we waited. When we were there, one of the people from Hospitality came over and had us fill our our paperwork -- I noticed on the paperwork they had the room type listed as "GDN". I immediately asked if that meant a Garden Room and was informed that it did. I provided the girl with a copy of our itinerary, clearly marked that we were honeymooners and had reserved an Oceanview room. She went to talk to the manager, came back and told us that there weren't any Oceanview rooms available. (We had already paid for the trip, as we made our reservations through a travel agency.) We asked her what alternative they were offering us, since they weren't providing us with the room we had paid for. She left and then sent the reservations manager, Julio, to speak with us. Julio told us that "we are still recovering from a devestating hurricane and were going to call you and ask you if we could move you to another resort BUT WE DIDN'T" (emphasis is mine). Umm....You didn't call, and now can't accomodate my room preference? Not exactly the service one expects from a $500+/night facility. We eventually ended up with a Garden room for two nights, then a Junior Suite for the last three nights. The Garden room had a lightbulb with exposed wiring hanging in the shower and the room was extremely small. The shower in the Jr. Suite smelled like sewage, as did several other locations on the property. There were loud parties outside the Jr. Suite each night that we stayed there. The Spa has no locker room, no sauna, no steam room, no hot tub....Pretty much only treatment rooms. Unfortunately, this hotel seems to have opened way before it was ready to and this sentiment was echoed to us by other employees and other guests. The one shining star was our "romantic dinner" which was included with the romance package -- because the hotel wasn't completely opened, and therefore wasn't full, the Chef and my new husband sat down and made a menu just for us -- four courses, with wine. It was absolutely fantastic! And, it was served in a private room, in the tower above the dining room -- perfect. Fortunately, that was our last night there, so at least we ended on a high note. All in all, a very disappointing vacation -- we were happy to be going back to Le Meridien in Cancun (where we got married)!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible beach, amazing food, silly decor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Here's the best part: Maroma is deserted. Not more than a dozen people adorn the gorgeous white-sand beach (with crystal turquoise water) in the most crowded times, in peak season (we went in June). We were often the only people in the pool. Make no mistake, the place was fully booked - it's just large, and sparse. We stayed in the central, "older" part of the complex. I suspect people in the "newer" part could feel differently than us. Ask for a place in the main building. We stayed right above the main hall. There were plenty of hospitality staff, around constantly, to help you with anything. Any call to the front desk got an instant, HELPFUL response (and more bottled water!). If you love food - not big, gross portions, but delicious lobster, red snapper, steak, and vegeterian dishes - there are few places you will find with better food. The chef is a 5-star French chef and deserves every one. Every evening was like the best meal we had. The bar staff was a blast - we joked with the bartenders for hours. Plus, we met lots of entertaining couples, most of whom were on their honeymoon (we were not). The only possible criticism I could have is that the decor in the rooms was silly - bad Mexico terracotta and tile, unfitting to a place of this caliber (the lamps had badly-painted sunflowers on them). However, our room was very comfortable, with an excellent mattress, aggressive air conditioner, and was spotlessly clean at all times. Other than the silly decor, I just don't understand how you could complain about Maroma - it was amazing. It was the best place my wife and I have stayed (and we travel alot).

Reviews.Title: “Construction zone - but beautiful”
Reviews.Author: curiouschild
Reviews.Content: To be honest - we had mixed feelings about Maroma. On one hand, it was paradise. The beach is gorgeous, the resort is truly an oasis. It's located on a pretty much secluded stretch of beach and it is quite luxurious. On the other hand - it's lacking the amenities you would expect of a five star resort. I should context all of this with the fact that they were in the midst of a reconstruction effort after hurricaine Wilma. But still - if you're not up and ready, don't open. They didn't have water sports available. There were no working TVs on the resort. Only one restaurant was open - and the menu became stale after the sixth night. We spent $300 on dinner where the musical accompaniment was a drill and saw. All this without offering a discount. The one thing that truly makes Maroma special is the service and the people. The staff - mostly the wait staff - were so friendly, remembered your name at every meal, and are so eager to please. I was sad to say goodbye. I would come back to Maroma - but only once the place is fully up and runnning. Some other quick notes - the spa is gorgeous but expensive, the rooms are quite bare and not exactly luxurious. Have fun if you go - it's worth it if you're up for total relaxation and seclusion.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a truly remarkable hotel... I had the best time, staff is fantastic, romantic ambiance, there are candles all over the place at night, food is great... what else can I say? It truly was a wonderful experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible time at Maroma!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Maroma to spend our 1 year anniversary and it was incredilble!! I began reading reviews on this message board the night before we went and became very nervous at some of the reviews that I read. I'm not sure what these people were thinking! From the moment that you drive into the gates of the resort, you realize that you have just been transplanted to true paradise. The entire resort is lit by votive candles at night. You are greeted at the front door with a margarita and get a tour of the grounds. Our room was amazing and was cleaned 2x a day and at night, candles were lit along with aromatherapy. The only bad thing is the bathroom is basically in the bedroom with shutter doors. If you are not comfortable with the person that you are staying with, you might want separate rooms or become very friendly with the lobby bathroom. As far as activities, there aren't many. You come to Maroma to do nothing but relax. We spent every morning at the beach and the afternoons by the pool. It was perfect. We went snorkeling one day but I found it to be really rough and didn't love it. Otherwise, you can order food right on the beach, they have beds set up on the absolutely to die for white sand beach. water is gorgeous. The staff couldn't have been better or nicer. the spa is beautiful, i took a yoga class one morning which was spectacular at the top of a tower. One night we went into town which definitely was not worth it. very touristy and we wished we were back at the hotel. as far as food, i am a vegetarian so it was a bit difficult for me to eat but the food was good. i just did not have as much variation as everyone else. but they were very accomodating to my needs. I definitely recommend Maroma! oh - and tom cruise was there vacationing with katie holmes while we were there, which was fun!

Reviews.Title: “Where's the service?”
Reviews.Author: Lillybelle-Colorado
Reviews.Content: Having read all the mostly good reviews, I was dismayed at my experience. Yes, I am a particular and experienced traveler, and I must remember that this is in fact, Mexico...but, the prices are outrageous, and if you are happy just being on a nice beach, maybe you will find value, but I did not. Maroma started out as a private estate and the architectural details are stunning.
