Many years ago it opened to the public as a first rate small resort, with the owner stolling the property attending to details. Now it is part of a chain. The rooms are sufficiently nice, though our tub did not drain well, and the amenities are the same as a Best Western. The real problems are the wild prices being paid for mediocre services and food. Our expensive dinners were very average fare. The waitstaff was oblivious to people needing water, or people pooring their own $80 bottles of wine. The rolls were from the local Sam's club or some such place. My 5 piece shrimp beach lunch (nothing else!) was $18.00 with services. Every morning we had a standing request for coffee at 7:00 am, in room, and daily by 7:20 we had to call requesting our coffee and then it showed up. Is this a $600 night property? But perhaps the most offensive insult was the construction that was happening behind our room. When I booked the room through the parent company, Orient Express, they promised me the hotel was "built out" and there would be no construction. It's too bad they are so ill informed about their own properties. The drilling was so bad, we could not rest in our room during the day. What is great about this place is the surroundings, which nature bestowed upon this bay with generosity. The Italian club next door brings less privacy to Maromas area, but that's about it....more bodies, less exclusivity. The candle lit paths are enchanting, as is the turn down servivce. And in general, the Maya people are delightful. But, if you do stay here, I suspect you have more money than discriminating taste, because this place will cost about $900 per day with all your meals and snacks, and for that, I really want the bliss. There is a real disconnect between the prices and the services.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the points covered by one of the other reviews of this hotel entitled 'Nice but not worth the $$$.' This place really needs refurbishing, the rooms are tatty and although the beach is nice, if it is raining (and often does!) there ain't much else to do. We spent most of the time in the Spa, which was OK, but again expensive, and not really a 'Spa' ambience, no music, no relaxtaion area etc. We also spent some time in the fitness facilities, although they have nice flat screen TV's the treadmills broke 3 times! Not great if you are a work out fanatic. The best bits about this hotel are the pools, lovely beach and breakfast. The worst bits are the staff, (especially hospitality), the prices (we paid $220 for 2 lobsters!) and tatty rooms. NO TV, so if you like to veg out in the evening or want some background MTV on, forget it.! We actually checked out of this hotel when they overcharged us for an excursion (we paid $102 more). And went down the road to Paraiso De La Bonita. This was the best thing we ever did, hotel staff were outstanding, rooms were amazing and cheaper than Maroma! This was a 5 star hotel, if you go to Maroma expect 3 star with 5 star prices. Oh and I forgot you have to pay for drinking water too! When you are paying $600 a night that's a joke!

Reviews.Title: “Research Pays off, proper expectations of Maroma”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our 5 year wedding anniversary at Maroma the second week of June. We arrived a day after the crummy weather moved out and had sun all 5 days. I did a fair amount of research on Maroma prior to booking our trip. When you read some of the reviews on this site, take them with a grain of salt. Some people are more particular than others, but you will encounter some of the issues mentioned. It gave us proper perspective. I agree with all the comments about the service and meals. If you are looking to save a little money on dinner, I suggest room service (which is faster service than the dining room). We stayed in a beach front room in the new section and it was perfect. On that side, you have the spa, brand new gym, bar/lunch/breakfast area and new pool. Some of the past posts on this board spoke about the noisy Venta club near the new section. We did not hear any noise in the evening. We actually found the daytime view entertaining watching our native Italian friends truly enjoy the beach experience. The beach was perfect and the bed/chairs/loungers on the beach were first class. I will warn you that you will get sun even when sitting under the cloth umbrella. Best time to get sun is from 9-11:00 am and after 3:00 PM. Take small doses if you do not have a base. The snorkel trip was fun but not a lot to see. Make sure it is sunny when you go, as it will help see what fish are present. Most of the cool fish hide in the coral. The Catamaran trip was fun but expensive, we went around 5:00 PM. The Captain is very friendly and talkative. We wanted to take the Dolphin Discovery trip but my wife was pregnant and they said they would not allow her in the water because it somehow distracts the dolphins. The trip to/from the airport was great, traveling in a new Ford Expeditition. My wife was a little freaked out driving in to Maroma at night because it feels like they are taking you into the jungle to leave you there. We will return some day in the future and book an oceanfront or junior suite. The high-speed Internet connection worked just fine. Also, they have huge towels all over on the beach and pool and you just leave them when you are done. We had passports to travel but it was not required. However, I suggest you check out the gov web site because as of Dec 2005 there are some changes. Better safe than sorry, easier with a passport. When you get dropped off at the airport to leave, expect a long line at the check in. There is a chance they will check your bags for customs, depends on if a table is open when you approach the line. If you are looking for room rates better than rack rates on the Maroma web site, check travel web sites. I booked my trip through Andrew Harpers Q Club. It cost about 130 bucks to join but there is a significant room discount and free room upgrade based on availability. You can get a cheaper flight if you arrive in later to Cancun on American Airlines, possibly saving 200 a ticket. Great trip to just veg on the beach...have fun.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely wonderful...”
Reviews.Author: ko13
Reviews.Content: We went to Maroma last month and absolutely adored it... we found the service to be fantastic -- better than similar Caribbean resorts like Little Dix. The grounds were gorgeous, and extremely well-maintained. The concept of "handmade hospitality" permeates throughout, as all the buildings are constructed without machinery. The resort was started by an architect, so the buildings are interesting. We adored our 3rd floor room - it had a wonderful view of the ocean - and we looked forward to sitting on our porch each morning, watching the sun rise & drinking the coffee they brought. (They asked our coffee preferences when we got there.) The yoga class at the spa was outstanding -- Mary is the best teacher I've encountered anywhere. We loved our time on the beach -- both lounging in our chairs and lying on the beds they lay out each day... And breakfast was consistently outstanding - between the two of us I think we tried everything on the menu and it was excellent. Dinner was hit-or-miss -- the restaurant doesn't seem to know what it wants to be when it comes to dinner. We loved walking the grounds, and encountered peacocks, parrots, and chickens! And the thousands of candles at night make it incredibly romantic. One cautionary word - they are somewhat lax about having you sign for things on the beach... when we checked out we found someone else's lunch on our bill - they straightened it out for us no problem, but it did cause us to spend some additional time in check out. All in all it was absolutely wonderful... We'd definitely go back...

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Romantic; Want to Return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After researching a variety of exclusive resorts, we chose the Maroma for the beach and ambiance. It was almost everything that we expected -- romantic, relaxing, exclusive and expensive. We were met at our car with margaritas and shown the grounds on the way to our room. There was no "check-in" process beyond seeing our credit card in the room and asking whether we prefered coffee or tea for delivery in the morning. We had a premium room (#10) which was in a wonderful location in the older part and a very short distance from the beach. The room was very clean and comfortable. With the netting and flowers, the bed was very romantic. That said, the bed wasn't all that comfortable by U.S. standards but was typical of my other experiences in Mexico...a good quality mattress that was set on a platform without box springs. The room had a lot of "character" and looked out onto a gorgeous garden. It did not have a television, which we knew up front....I'm at a loss for why anyone would need a tv on vacation in paradise anyway. The best part of the room was the terrace which had a wonderful breeze, comfortable hammock, and beautiful view. The restaurant was very good, and breakfast was fantastic! Food was a bit pricey but on-par for what you'd typically expect at a resort location whether in Cozumel or New York. It definitely did NOT give me sticker shock, but it was not cheap either. The staff was very friendly, and their English was very good overall. There were a lot of little quirks that we considered a bit endearing. I guess the more tightly-wound amongst us might consider it annoying, but we found it a bit amusing. For example, we ordered a wake-up call one day (for an excursion) and it got repeated a 2nd day. We had to call to ask them NOT to wake us up again at 6a.m. Or at a meal the server may forget a knife or fork, etc. One day one of our glasses disappeared from the room and wasn't replaced for 2 days...things like that. With the little quirks, we also had nice surprises...the cocktail reception for all guests to meet each other so that we met our neighbors, the cat that visited us on our terrace, the peacock showing off for it's mate, soft soft sand, and of course Tom Cruise vacationing there too. We also met our "neighbors" and were able to say hello on the beach, at meals, etc. and that made the resort seem that much more friendly. The one thing we wouldn't do again is book a package. We chose the Romance package, which was a bit over-rated. The champagne did not arrive, the sunset cruise wasn't really an option, and the Tezmacal is definitely NOT for everyone - particularly the claustraphobic! Doing it again, we'd book a premium or ocean room without the package. We'd skip our Mayan ruins excursion and Playa Del Carmen but would repeat the Catamaran ride. We definitely want to return!

Reviews.Title: “A special place --- definitely will recommend.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want a great romantic getaway that you'll always remember, Maroma is a must do. We just returned from 5 nights in Maroma, and it's worth the price tag. The rough ride into the resort is great, and just adds to the allure of Maroma. If you want a perfectly paved road leading to a mega resort with 100's of rooms and 1000's of people, go to Cancun; if you want a unique experience in a beautiful place with an outstanding staff that knows who you are, I doubt that Maroma can be matched in the Yucatan. Our room had a great balcony complete with hammock, thatch roof, and an ocean view partially obscured by palms (which is exactly what was described at time of booking) great tile shower, mosquito netting, and great small details. Coffee waiting on the balcony each morning is great for tempting you out of the cozy bed to get your day going early. The lobby bar was near our front door; great for sticking our head out for dos cervezas o vino. Breakfast is fantastic, but then again, so is lunch and dinner. The soups alone are worth eating there (I think I tried them all). If you can, get the one table on the roof one night; that dinner just sent an already wonderful experience over the top. For active excursions; we'd definitely recommend the Nohoch tour by Alltournatives; which can be booked through Maroma's Hospitality staff. You are picked up early in a 1960's? Mercedes Unimog, which is like a small personnel carrier, and are brought on a long, packed day of kayaking, reef snorkeling, cenote snorkeling in different cenotes, roller-coaster like rides in the Unimog through the jungle, a visit to a Mayan family and a great authentic heavy Mayan lunch. All in one day for $130/person. You be tired and ready for the Maroma pool and bar when you get back, and realize again just how special Maroma is upon return. What can't be described is the feeling of Maroma and it's people---so I won't try. Go. Brett and Maggie, Florida

Reviews.Title: “Most Romantic Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our ten days at Maroma Resort and Spa were truly the most romantic of all of our adventures! The tropical flower petals strewn on our pure white bedspread set the tone for the vacation. We loved our junior suite and its proximity to the beach. We were just steps away from the most comfortable beach lounge chairs and the luxurious beach towels. Our coffee was always waiting on our veranda each morning. The staff cleaned our room immediately and kept us supplied with bottled water. We loved the walk to dinner- votive candles and torches lined every step of the path from our room to the dining room. We were always greeted with huge smiles from the staff, nearly all of whom knew our names from the day we arrived. We walked the beach daily, a two mile stretch of nearly uninhabited beauty. Thank you, Mr. Espinoza, for beautiful landscaping, excellent and varied cuisine, impeccable service, and peace and quiet. We will definitely be back! Steve and Nancy

Reviews.Title: “Everything it Claims”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Maroma lived up to some high expectations. Food, service, and aesthetics were all exceptional. High value although not inexpensive. Wonderfully peaceful and comfortable. Great landscaping and arhcitecture, birds and others indiginous animals. It is a truly fantastic get away.

Reviews.Title: “the BEST”
Reviews.Author: gabrieldlr
Reviews.Content: It can´t get any better.... I am here on my honeymoon and is the most romatic place on the planet .... thank god for letting the owner open his doors to the public......... Gabriel

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort for Adults Only”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0013
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have searched a very long time for the “perfect” resort in the Caribbean. We have high expectations and many requirements: NO children, a large, white, quiet, beach, grass huts that easily accommodate two people no matter where the sun is, and a top-drawer, full-service spa. We also want a romantic restaurant. Enjoying our breakfast quietly outside, under palm trees to the sound of birds, yet close to our room, is another of our desires. Yet a property high-tech enough to have good internet access, a community room with large screen plasma satellite televison (there is that occasional sporting event), and the same-day New York Times Fax Service and Herald Tribune. We have limited ourselves to resorts that have less than 50 rooms if they are set on less than 5 acres and up to 75 rooms if they are on over 10 acres. We want a resort where you can’t hear cars, buses, or motorcycles on the main highway or have hoards of people walking on the beach. Especially no “hawkers!” We have searched the Caribbean high and low from Tobago to the Turks and Bermuda to Belieze; staying at what we consider some of the “best” small resorts on numerous islands. Every year we try and find a new resort to fulfill our requirements, but always there is something missing. Last summer, by happenstance, we were watching the Travel Channel and were introduced to “Maroma” in Playa Del Maroma, south of Cancun. We just returned and felt compelled to share with others what an absolutely wonderful experience it was. Every requirement and every wish was exceeded. The restaurant is excellent. Beyond the regular restaurant, they have a special room on top of the old hacienda for one couple each night where you can dine by candlelight under the stars while looking out over the lush gardens and the beach. The most romantic setting we have ever experienced anywhere in the world. (Guys beware, if you take her there for dinner, she will expect to be proposed to, and she will say yes.) We signed up for the five-day “spa package” as relaxation was our main goal. The spa was second to none. The quality of the staff was outstanding and the setting in a recreated Mayan temple most aesthetically appealing and relaxing. The service in every area of the resort was “perfecto.” The staff knew our names by the second day and what we liked. The tropical setting spread out over acre after acre of lush spectacular gardens. At night they light over a thousand candles to line the walkways between the rooms and the restaurant. We just can’t say enough good things about our experience. My amateur photography depicts some of the views, but does not do it justice. Ralph and Barbara Bucks County Pennsylvania

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Great people”
Reviews.Author: tuje
Reviews.Content: Returned from our stay on Feb 16th. The hotel room we had was in great condition and the stafff catered to your wishes. The food we found was excellent as was the margaritas. Beach was beautifull and well maintained not signs of any trash or polution. Snorkeling was great. Maroma is on our list to go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Maroma -Gorgeous beach!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I are in our early 30's with no children and travel extensively. Overall, Maroma is a fantastic and unique resort but I agree with some of the other reviews that say that somehow the individual pieces fall short of making this and absolutely *amazing* resort. Billing seems to be an ongoing problem. I booked through Maroma directly and the original rate quote sent via email did not match the hardcopy mailed to my address. I was disappointed in the effort needed to straighten this out, but management did eventually agree to honor the original quote. I had saved the original email quote which was substantially less than the hard copy. We stayed at Maroma the second week in December just before high season and the resort was fairly quiet and empty. Would definitely recommend this "shoulder" season. We had our own car and the signs to Maroma could definitely use improvement. There is no sign for Maroma from the main highway, only for the Venta Club. The road into the resort at night is definitely an adventure..very dark and lots of potholes. We thought it was kind of fun, actually. The resort was working on road improvements the week that we were there in preparation for high season. We were met at the front and directed to reception where we immediately received a welcome margarita and were shown around the resort and to our room. My boyfriend is Lantono and speaks Spanish fluently which I believe made an impact on the positive reception we received. The girl that showed us around was very very nice but we did notice that some of the reception girls were a little rude and snotty to other guests. We had booked a garden room and were on the second floor in the Old Section with a tree blocking the view of the ocean. I am not sure if we were upgraded to a better class of room or not but we were very happy as we had expected no view whatsoever. If we climbed the stairs from our patio it went to the top of the resort with some beautiful lookout benches and some fantastic views. There was also a very nice enclosed reading room. Views from the top of the resort were fantastic. Our room was medium size with a queen bed with romantic netting and a gorgeous tile bathroom with a huge bath tub. Definitely more European and boutique hotel style than "American resort". People have different preferences which is why I am mentioning this. Very romantic, understated, and elegant. This is not Vegas. Emphasis is on quiet and relaxation. For some reason, I kept thinking of the hamlet at Versaille that Marie Antoinette built to play peasant. At night, candles were lit all over the resort which was absolutely beautiful. The pool in the old section was lovely but with the beach, why bother with the pool. We took advantage of the free included snorkel tour out to the Maroma reef. The coral is not in great shape and we didn't see too many fish but it was fun. I walked around the New Section and I prefer the Old Section. As other people have mentioned, the "dreadful" Venta Club is right next to the New Section. Very noisy and lots of people on that section of the beach. The beautiful white sand beach with turqoise water at Maroma was fairly empty and was the highlight of our stay. Breakfast was fantastic every morning. So relaxing to eat with such an amazing view. We had our own car so went into Playa del Carmen every night for dinner since reviews of the restuarant at Maroma were not so good. I think this contributed to our favorable impression over all. We at lunch at the hotel only one day and it was *VERY* expensive. No prices were listed which is always a bad sign so you never know how much you are spending and you never sign for anything. If you stay at Maroma I would definitely recommend having a car to avoid the feeling of being "trapped". We were able to arrange our own activities all around the area which was nice. Service at the restaurant and our maid service was excellent. Absolutely no complaints there. I would definitely stay at Maroma again because of the beautiful location.

Reviews.Title: “Top Drawer”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: first rate in every respect. courteous, competent, attentive service. they really have their act together. 3 phenomenal meals a day. kitchen is phenomenal. if you like to scuba dive, the staff takes things very seriously and know their waters. accomodations, spa, etc. all take the prize.

Reviews.Title: “Just Gets Better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from our seventh visit to this wonderful hotel on the most beautiful beach in Mexico.The new spa is a place of perfect peace and the services are teriffic. There have been many cosmetic changes since our first visit but the heart of Maroma is still the same. The same old friends in the restaurant and the bars, the same warm welcoming service at hospitality and the same sense of being totally taken care of. What a special place this is!!!

Reviews.Title: “What do you want it to be????”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow. !!! What a great 5 days. Just got gakc from a well rested vacation. A beautiful beach. Long walks in the morning. Great wether, great water, nice sand. A great venue to unwind and relax. We arrive early on Sunday afternoon. Stayed in the new building, nest to the Venta club. We really enjoyed being away from the main complex. The service was great, A pot of hot local coffee dropped of at our room every moning at 8:00. We had a great breakfast outside adjacent to the pool next to our room. Fresh fruit and breakfast cooked to order. Our server was Edith. A very nice lady who worked very hard to ensure that we were happy. We enjoyed the Bartender at the main bar. His name is Jose and he made us several fantastic margs. We dont care for the sweet margs, so he made us one where he crushes several limes and then mixes them with the appropriate tequila and mixers........ WOW.......... After a couple of those we went up to dinner and had a very nice dinner. We ate every night at the resort and enjoyed the yucatan cuisine. I amazed at the reviews. I guess you will always have people that are not going to be happy with anywhere they go. We have been to Hotel Bora Bora, Palmilla, Twin Dolphin, Round Hill, Mauna Kea, Mauna Lani, London paris, Reims, Grand Caymam, etc... so I would consider us well traveled not to mention a slew of state side vacations. Our view is that it is a wonderfull place to get away and escape from the day to day grind. This is our 3rd time to the area. We satyed in cancun the prior two times, have done all the ruins. This time we had the hotel get us a car for the day. We went to Coba and then into Playa Del Carmen........ What a fun day. I will close with this thought. We loved our stay and would highly recommend it ,but before you go ask youself, "what do you want it to be"?

Reviews.Title: “It's about getting away . . .”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is my first attempt at writing an on-line review of a hotel, and feel compelled to add my compliments to a resort property that seems to elicit conflicting opinion. We stayed at Maroma Feb. 4-8, and agreed it was among the top destinations we have visited in the last 2 years. Among other places we have stayed during that period have been Singita (Boulders Lodge), the Ellerman House in Capetown, the Ritz Carlton in San Francisco, Inn on the Blue Horizon in Viequez, and Hotel Coste in Paris. We went to Maroma for a romantic, relaxing weekend. Our intent was to enter the property and not leave until it was time for our departure from Mexico. We were entirely content with our surroundings. We stayed in room 31 in the older part of the hotel. I cannot comment on the rooms in the newer section, but after having walked the property agree that I would insist on receiving a room in the original complex. Our room was spacious, with a wonderful bathroom that during our stay had no plumbing problems whatsoever. The grounds are gorgeous, and the beach is spectacular. While it is true that much debris washes up on either side of the hotel beach, the hotel has teams of grounds crew out raking the sand every morning to make certain that the beach in front of the hotel is pristine. Overall, the food was very good to sometimes excellent, especially the local specialities. Both the food and wine are pricy, but that is to be expected at any removed, high-end resort property. We received unfailingly gracious, relaxed service. In short, I think we enjoyed our stay so much because we were looking for a remote-feeling getaway. If we had wanted a full-service resort, or service in the style of a Ritz-Carlton, we might not have been as satisfied. We are very laid back in our travel style (even though we often stay in very high-end properties), and so we appreciated the low-key, but genuinely attentive and charming, service.

Reviews.Title: “Three times and charmed every time!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the third time that my husband and I will be going to Maroma! We go every year during Valentine's Day. It is soooo romantic. We have had dinner on the beach last year-my husband reserved the whole outside resturaunt as well as the beach. We were all alone with the moon and stars shining down on us! Upon arriving for breakfast the very first day, we were greeted by our first names-very impressed that they already knew our names! Our rooms have always been beautiful-the service-impecable, beach-spotless and beautiful, food-always delicous ( I also recomend dinner in the bell tower) This is a wonderful place if you and your loved one need to escape the day to day hustle, relax, and just enjoy each others company! This is not the place to go to party!!!!! Thank you Maroma for always making our vacation perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Hit or miss”
Reviews.Author: stb3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel frequently, about 5-6 vacations per year. We are 31 years old. This resort has the makings of what could be a great vacation spot, but it just doesn't make it. The grounds were pretty, and lots of parrots, iguanas, and wildlife. If I were to rate only the grounds I would give it a great score, however, all of us know a vacation is made up of many things. BEACH- The beach directly in front of the hotel is beautiful, but Turks and Caicos is preferable, since the water is like pool water and not as rough. If you venture to the left of the hotel, there is a pollution problem and it was sad to see so much plastic washed up on the shore. To the right of the hotel is the DREADFUL Vento Club. The Maroma beach front rooms are located on this side. The Vento Club is a sea of lounge chairs packed so closely, that the topless europeans in their little thongs and speedos simply chose to walk our beach constantly. (I'm not against nudity but these were not supermodels, people) The music blasts for most of the day at the Vento Club and we could hear it from our room and on the beach, so we had to lay out at the other side of the hotel, instead of right in front of our room. The cool thing is that there are futons on the beach that are comfy and like sitting in bed all day. There is beach service, though sometimes extremely slow. ROOMS- Our room was #37, a beach front room. Great ocean view, a walk right onto the beach, but not so nice on the inside, not horrible, either. Our floor tiles had grout coming out, and the room was pretty small. The pillows were hard as rocks and quite lumpy, but we asked for better ones and they brought them. The shower was huge, but very dark. The air conditioner was a wall unit and so damn noisy. There were two main problems, though. The first was that there are only bamboo twigs on the windows, so the sun rose in my face EVERY morning at about 5:45am. I hated that. The second problem was that I could hear the people above me and also across from me, and there was a constant slamming door sound whenever a person came or went. I like to sleep, so I had major problems with this. FOOD- Hmmm. The food was OK. I am from Philadelphia, so I know good food. The people who wrote "gourmet" in their reviews really meant to say "a valiant attempt at gourmet." The breakfast and lunch menu was the same each day. Great margaritas. The salsa really is good, but I got sick of it by day three. Dinner had the most fluctuating menu that fails to describe the entrees entirely. I ordered grilled scallops one night and they were wrapped in bacon, which was not mentioned. If you find a bottle of COLD bottled water anywhere on the resort, you are in the know. SERVICE- Here is where I had the most problems. Don't be surprised if three people give you three different answers to the same question. We had to ask for so many things that we shoudn't have needed to ask for. The strangest thing was that we would meet other people at the hotel that had the absolute worst opinions of the hotel, and then there were those that just adored it. I say, don't risk it. SPA- Aesthetically, damn nice. The problem is that if you are used to spas, then it will bother you that there are no hooks to hang your stuff up at the steam or sauna or shower, no lockers, and when I got out of the steam room, the shower had a yucky, universal bar of soap in it and that was all!! (I guess they want you dirty for the treatments.) EXERCISE ROOM- Nice, complete gear, no problems here and used it three times.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not good enough (at these prices)!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a case of expectations not matching up to reality. Whilst Maroma benefits from a stunning location and a boutique type environment, a lot of things let it down. When you a paying Aman type prices ($500+ a night) you expect the same service and rooms. Unfortunately this was not the case. The rooms are dated, though romatic. In particular, the plumbing is unreliable, we had a lot of problems with hot water during our stay (as did a number of other guests). In addition, I was very surprised not to find slippers in the rooms, apparently they had "run out". As this was peak season, this is not acceptable. THe food, with the exception of breakfast (good and included), is average and expensive. I would say a rental car is essential to go to either Playa del Carmen or Cancun for better food. Service, though excellent by Mexican standards, was still not up to Four Seasons standards, where every member of staff does their utmost to help. The spa, I thought, was rather good. The treatments can be taken on the beach which is blissful and the staff is well trained and efficient. My "God" tratment was superb. The weather on our stay was not the best, which ruled out scuba diving during our stay. I had to make some enquiries outside the hotel and finally went diving close to Playa del Carmen for 25% of the cost they were offering! I agree with other reviewers that the hotel should offer more options outside the hotel if it cannot provide them itself. I understand Orient Express Hotels has taken over the property and is in the process of upgrading it. I would wait a few years before going back, hopefully things will improve. On a positive note the gym was excellent and the guest to staff ratio good.

Reviews.Title: “don't listen to bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just recently enjoyed our homeymoon at Maroma in October, and I must say it was amazing. The reason it is rated so well is not necessarily because of the luxury, but for the privacy and service. The beaches were immaculate, there were beach cleaners out ALL day keeping the beach perfect. As for the staff, we never felt that the service was lacking in our eight day stay. There are may reviews complaning about the service, but we never experienced this. I believe it has to do with how the vacationer treats the staff, if you are snotty and rude don't expect your service to be amazing. An example of the great service was one night during our dinner my husband started feeling sick, so he decided to go back to the room. I thanked our server for dinner, but told him we were going to have to cut it short. Not five minutes later our server appeared at our door with our bottle of unfinished wine, telling us that hopefully we could enjoy it later. After we thanked him, a few moments later, the front desk called saying they heard my husband was not feeling well, and asking if there was anything they could do. Now I think that is fabulous service. The only thing that wasn't great was that the drinks and food were somewhat overpriced, and there are not any other dining options. As a whole our trip was fantastic and we will go back. I reccomend it immensely, it is a beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it - this is no 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just came back from a 4 night stay at Maroma and it was NOT at all the 5 star luxury hotel experience we expected, or that is quoted by sources like Conde Nast. At the time of booking I was deciding between Ikal Del Mar and Maroma and unfortunately chose Maroma. I wish I would have paid more attention to this review site before booking...Let me first start by saying we are used to travelling around the world in luxury style so I have somtehing to compare this place to. If this is your first time at a supposedly 5 star resort - which Maroma is NOT...! - then you may have a different experience. As a reference point we have been to various hotels in the last year that included Four Seasons in Maui and Le Sireneuse. I have never written a review before but I felt so strongly that in this case I hope people get some use out of this before booking this hotel. First of all, the rooms are absolutely below even a 4 star hotel. The interior looks more like a cheap garage sale which their marketing literature addresses with "rustic". There is a big difference in my mind between rustic chic and Maroma which has cheap rooms. The bed while big was hard with rough linens. It was not very comfortable. Our terrace door was broken and our bathtub did not drain (this seems to be a familiar problem from the reviews on this site). The towels were rough, NOT soft at all, and the bathroom mat was a cheap old grayish mat that looked dirty. Oh and our safe was broken and despite multiple complaints remained unfixed. Our room also had a musty smell to it. In case people are wondering what room type it was, it was in the new part - a garden view room with a nice view of the pool and a little terrace. Second, the service was awful. Not at all what you would expect from a supposedly 5 star hotel. The woman who greeted us at the entrance was useless in explaning the property or show us around. She barely knew her way around. Our safe and bathtub remained unfixed despite numerous complaints. The waitress dropped my camera and seemed unconcerned. I asked for 2 beach towels and was met by a condescending answer - I was given 2 but felt it was a favor. The whirlpool is in the middle of the restaurant and was always dirty. We had booked a massage in a palapa and on the day it rained and the weather was cold. We wanted to reschedule but were told this was not possible so we had our massages while we were freezing. No one on the staff even bothered to help us reschedule or seemed they cared. And the hospitality suite was a joke. I could not understand why there were so many people there but no one around to actually offer any type of decent service. Third, the spa. I am not sure if I was the only one fooled but why do they call themselves a Spa if they have not yet opened their actual Spa facilities?? It is under construction and in fact none of the treatment rooms were even open yet. So your only choice is having the treatments in the palapa or in your room which in our case was not great since it was cold outside and our room smelled. I took their yoga class ($25 for an hour of mediocre yoga) and we were outside practicing yoga with hammers and construction noise all around us. That brings me to my last point, the grounds are not completed and there is construction and people everywhere - not to mention a dog that I think belonged to one of the many workers wandering the grounds. We did not feel we were in "lush tropical grounds" because of all the cement, trucks and unfinished buildings. I am curious if Maroma is actually advertising itself as having a fully renovated Spa and hotel with fully completed guest rooms because that is far from the truth. For the amount we paid, we wanted more privacy, peace, better service and quiet time... To be fair, there are positive points about the hotel. The beach is absolutely beautiful and the setting is very unique. The breakfast is great, really the best part of the day. We found the restaurant prices to be a little on the high side but not anything that was too far out of norm. Overall, we enjoyed the food. We also made it a point to rent a car and go to Playa Del Carmen (great!) and Tulum (beautiful). My only point of advice is that if you are looking for a true luxury hotel experience, don't go to Maroma. We checked out Ikal Del Mar and we wished we would have booked there instead, it was beautiful and much more romantic. I plan on writing this same letter to our travel agent and to Maroma. I am even thinking of writing to Conde Nast because I genuinely feel Maroma has a lot of people fooled into booking who come away feeling disappointed and ripped off and it is a shame because the hotel setting is so beautiful that they should address some of these concerns. Overall I really feel Maroma the way it is now is not worth it if you are expecting a luxury 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Everyone... Perfect for Us”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a six days at Maroma. We read the mixed reviews prior to our departure and I admit we were a bit concerned. However, we had an incredible time. I understand that not everyone wants to sit on the most beautiful white sand beach that we have ever seen. Or maybe that the water was to warm and blue for their liking. Ok, I know your saying that those are natural characteristics that are not provided by the resort. I agree, these conditions were merely the back drop to incredibly beautiful buildings, inviting palapas, casual hammocks, strong margaritas, candle lit dinners, delightful staff and great food. Yes this is not an inexpensive venture. But if cost is your consideration, I would suggest a cruise or an all inclusive resort (good luck my friend). As far as off site activities, we rented a car and ventured out ourselves through the hotels help, it was awesome, the ruins, the caves the scenery, the crazy drivers! Upon our departure we overheard another guest complaining about their bill. Like all great things in life, you have to pay for them. I am absolutely confident that Maroma is not for everyone (which is fine with us, we'd rather not have the masses ruing the understated nature of the resort). We loved it, it was hard to leave. We will return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Bittersweet memories...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here August 16th for 5 nights for our honeymoon. Upon arrival it was lush grounds and what seemed like friendly attentative staff. Must admit that after the initial shock of arrival, the wow factor disappeared fairly quickly. For over $500/night, we expected posh, comfortable, no problem accomodations. Our room, an ocean view room, had a tub that didn't drain, the door knob seemed broken to the front door and our A/C sounded like a diesel truck. The concept of "handmade hospitality" was not met by any means other than the scuba instructor, Jerome. He seemed to be the only one there who cared about quality service and friendly demeanor. I make the resort sound terrible, it wasn't really, just not what it claims to be. We had an enjoyable time, but I think largely due to ourselves, not the resort. I must admit, probably wouldn't stay there again, too costly for what you get. Like everyone says, breakfast was the best meal of the day there. Look for a deal if you want to stay there, if you stay at full price, you will probably be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Maroma was very Bleh..”
Reviews.Author: IslandGrll
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the maroma for 4 nights. After reading all the mixed reviews I was very hesitant. We are in our early 30's and have each done lots of traveling. I am not very hard to please I simply just usually want what I pay for or what is expected. I was very dissapointed in this hotel. I feel for the money there were much nicer resorts in the area ( although maybe not as quiet). I feel this hotel was definitly a 3 star, not a 5. Nothing in general was " wrong" it just didnt" wow" me like I thoguht it would. Driving around the area though there are plenty of other beautiful resorts that have that wow factor. Food was ok, not much of a choice.. room was just ok.. .. I would def stay someplace else next time.. the Iberostars looked beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “(read before making your reservation)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Basically, the problem with Maroma is the fact that it is touted as a four star resort, when in reality it is a two star. Never in my experience as a traveler have I encountered such a false advertisement. The service was third-rate, at best. I cannot express enough how rude and unhelpful the staff were. As seems to happen frequently at Maroma, there was a wedding going on while my wife and I were there. From the moment we arrived, it was made very clear that we were to be treated like second class citezens. Our room did have a beautiful view, but it was not worth being subjegated to late-night hip-hop music blasting in from the wedding beach party late into the evening- two of the four nights we were there. If we wanted hip-hop hurray, we could have stayed in New York. Maroma is certainly not service oriented. We would leave the room early in the morning, only to return after dusk with the room still the way we left it- it should not take an entire day for someone to come in and make the bed, at least, not in a hotel with such high rates. Like other guests, we ended up enjoying ourselves most while away from the hotel. And another note- the food was not so great- mediocre. Breakfast was the best, but that was all. Las Ventanas in Cabo san Lucas is a far superior establishment. You really cannot compare the two hotels (apples and oranges). Save yourself some money and check into an eco-lodge or a holiday inn.

Reviews.Title: “not worth it!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose to go to Maroma after reading great things about it. We travel to Mexico often and are looking for something on the yucatan. Our favorite place is Las ventanas in Cabo. I found this site and read the reviews two nights prior to leaving...I wish I had seen them earlier. Service was an issue for us. The people in the main office were nothing but rude and often confused. There was a large wedding going on while we were there and the staff made it very clear that they were priority. The resturant food was acceptable {breakfast was great} but for the prices you are paying it should be much more. Some dinners were worse than others. We started eating in Playa del Carmen every night. There really is not alot of privacy, when we needed someone we could never find them but they were always around when you wanted to be alone. The beach is beautiful but again not private at all. The rooms are mediocre at best. The quality sheets and towels are unacceptable for the prices that are charged. Our view was nice. We would never recommend Maroma. It is in no way worth the prices charged. Go to Las ventanas and see what it should be at a four star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Real Luxury”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Maroma for our honeymoon in June and loved it. We had a wonderful experience. I had read the reviews and they seemed very mixed. While we stayed I couldn't help but think about everything I had read. So I write this review with total honesty. I am not someone who has stayed in the finest places in the world but I do appriciate nice things and that is why we chose Maroma. First off our service was endlessly amazing the managemen and staff treated us like family, but thats the kind of service we prefer. They even went to far as to find pants for my husband after he complimented the manager on his. Not to say bad service doesn't happen but some want to be treated like royalty. I liked our room, it wasn't luxurious like you would get in a european style hotel, but I liked the style, I felt like I was in Mexico, crazy I know. And yes there is no tv, We knew that before we got there, in all the beauty that surrounded us we forgot TV ever happened. I have read a lot about the food some of it is true. Breakfast is great and included in the price, we really thought breakfast was the best thing going on the menu. I also thought the lunch menu was pretty incredible. Dinner does fall short, the food is expensive, but that should not come as a surprise when a standard room starts at $500 a night. I like to eat out, but three meals a day for seven days starts to make me sick. So we tried to simplify a bit we had some lovely lunches while sitting on the beach, those prices are far more reasonable and the food is very good. We ordered food in our room and shared grilled lobster once in the restaurant. It would be nice If Maroma would add another place to eat in the evening that has more casual fare, gourmet food every night is hard to eat. I saw someone who was offended by the no children policy, there are lots of nice places that allow children, but not so many that don't. Maroma is not great for children, it is a place for total peace and relaxation, we couldn't help but notice how quiet it was. We were often the only people in the pool. Kids need a place to be free to get crazy, this is not that place. As for the children spotting, there is another hotel down the beach and even further down we saw a dog sleeping on the beach and a place were it looked like local people were living, so maybe they are coming from someplace else. The beach is private but there is an Italian resort next door to the new side of Maroma, if it wasn't there your room at Maroma would probably be triple the price. Try and get a room on the opposite side. I believe luxury comes in different forms. Maroma offers luxury in a unpretentious way with its beautiful private beaches, lush landscape, quiet breezes and personable service. We loved Maroma, for us, it was a magical place we will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful with the non ethical hosts”
Reviews.Author: MPM_WORLDWIDE
Reviews.Content: We reserved an ocean view suite. According to the hotel information at the website of the hotel it meant unobstructed view to the ocean. When we got there we were looking to a garden. After complaining the only thing they could do is to lower our rate. That meant wasting over 3 hours before even getting to that room. They will offer a temporary room but that is simply unacceptable. It also means that many people do not get what they expect. The beach is the most beautiful one we have ever been to, but that has nothing to do with the hotel. Under any circunstance we recomend to dine at the "mirador" (highest place of the hotel) The menu is terrible and the price is ridiculous, specially considering the cockroaches that are part of the decoration at that particular place, and anyway you realy dine at a small room besides the mirador with very poor view. The road to get from the highway to the hotel is by all means terrible, considering the high scores given to the hotel. The people that carry your laugage is very slow, we ended up carrying our laugage instead of waiting for them for over 20 minutes to get to our room.

Reviews.Title: “the Most romatic Hotel in Latin America”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our honeymoon (10/11- 10/17) and we can not say enough about this place..it was fantastic. We have been reading the reviews of Maroma on this website for the past year in planning our honeymoon. Some of the reviews have been really surprising.... there is no way anyone in their right mind would give this place any kind of a negative review. We had the most unbelievable time of our lives. The staff bent over backwards to accommodate us in every way… One day it rained, they offered to bring a TV and DVD player to our room.. and in no time at all it was installed. And the food… what is with you people who have expressed that the food is average, frozen, not good , expensive… are you crazy? The food was the best part of the trip… starting with breakfast….you can order what you want or from a set menu. Each morning starts with juice, fresh fruit, breads and rolls and then on to your entrée. And dinner was another experience… we had the privilege of having a nights dinner on the beach….it is definitely a must for anyone staying at the hotel…. And yes the food was expensive…but you getting gourmet food…people…it’s not a BBQ stand. Yes, we were there when the hotel was awarded the 3rd best Hotel in Latin America.. and it is well deserved. If your reading this review now… please believe us… you won’t regret it.. and don’t rely on the any other bad reviews on here… the good ones outweigh the bad ones anyway. And lastly, Maroma is not only romantic and beautiful….It’s magical.

Reviews.Title: “3rd Rated Best Hotel in Latin America?????”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading Conde Naste's review of the Maroma Hotel and ranking it number 3 in the Latin America's, I was very excited about my stay, especially after not having had a vacation in 18 months! My excitement was short lived.......I will keep it brief because I do not want to give this place any more of my time. I was in one of the new rooms, but there was no place to sit in the room to read, except the hard cement bench with pillows, not very condusive to comfort. There was a TV cabinet, but no television????? The food was very, very average. The decor was that of perhaps the Guadalajara area, certainly not of the Mayan Riviera. There were children and dogs at the resort. While sitting on my patio, I observed one of the dogs lift his leg on one of the chaise lounges at the pool. But what really did it for me was the night my friend and I arrive back to the hotel in the rain. There were about 7 or 8 employees "milling" around with unbrellas and none came to help us into the lobby with an umbrella, none. When we advised the night manager, he told us that we had an umbrella in our room, but we were not in our room, we had just come back from dinner and were there in the lobby. They had also lost our key to our room and tried to tell us that we had lost it. We tried to explain that when we left the property in our car, the attendant ask and took our room key from us. We assumed that they did not want their keys leaving the property, and were very reluctant to give us another. We checked out after 2 nights, although we had booked 4 nights. I have no idea what Conde Naste was thinking when they gave the Maroma Hotel a 5 star rating and ranked them number 3 in ALL Latin America. I would give the Maroma Hotel a solid 3 stars and that is being kinder than they were to us in the pouring down rain!

Reviews.Title: “Don't wake me from this dream”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Maroma is heaven on earth! We went there for our honeymoon in May of 2003, and it was the perfect place for romance. The beach is the most beautiful I've ever seen, and I've done a good amount of traveling. Everything was wonderful! Just remember you will need to dress for dinner, so take the right clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Maroma was absolutely fantastic - a beautiful, welcoming hotel with wonderful people working there. I was very pleased that they had a driver meet us at the airport, as we'd had an extremely long journey. At last, we could relax and begin to enjoy our honeymoon. We were well and truly treated like royalty there and were surprised and pleased when they upgraded us to an Ocean View suite. Our room was about a 5-10 minute walk through the complex to get to the reception area. We didn't mind, we enjoyed spotting the lizards, iguanas, giant butterflies, birds and gheckos along the way. The Yucatan explorer package was just what we expected: a private tour with one of their drivers, a snorkeling tour just off the beach, a lovely massage and a wonderful dinner. Our driver for the day was a true gentleman and allowed us to enjoy a wonderful tour of Coba, Tulum and some cenotes - we even briefly stopped off to look at crocodiles! We also enjoyed the food on the other days as well. We could make do with just one portion, as they were always very generous. The friendly waiters always gave us an aperitif (we never knew what to expect, but it was great fun trying to guess what they eventually served up) and also offered delicious salsa with freshly baked tortilla chips before our meals (both lunch and dinner!). I don't know how some other reviewers went hungry, I sometimes struggled to finish my food! We were there at the beginning of September and moved on to Playa del Carmen for the following week. I heard that they lost a large part of their beach due to Ivan (luckily there was no worse damage), I hope they can recover quickly.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful honeymoon destination”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent our 7-night honeymoon at Maroma during the first week of August 2004. If you are looking for a quiet, romantic, and relaxing honeymoon retreat, then Maroma is an excellent choice. We stayed in a premium room with partial ocean views in the newer section, and it was spacious and romantically appointed. We recommend this section over the other part near El Sol, as it is a bit more secluded. We really appreciated the attention to detail and service (turn-down service each night, thorough cleaning daily, friendly and professional waiters in the restaurants, candles lighting the paths each evening). We did call hospitality about a problem with our tub drain (it was never fixed), but that was our only complaint, and on a relaxing honeymoon those kinds of details don't matter much. The beach was exquisite and delightfully deserted, there was live music nightly in the main restaurant, and we highly recommend massages on the beach. Food was actually reasonably priced (dinner especially) but they do really get you on the price of the wine. Breakfast and lunch were delicious. Keep in mind that during the summer months Maroma is a work in progress with construction and maintenance going on daily. Well worth it to go in the summer though because you feel as if you're one of the only guests there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: dawnp
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights in Maroma in a standard room. My husband and I loved it -- and we are VERY picky. The breakfast was wonderful and the beach is gorgeous. The beach and the pools were NEVER crowded (like some resorts). Our favorite part were the massages on the beach -- A MUST! (we got the spa rejuvenation package). I would recommend renting a car to get out if you want to do other things than lounging -- excursions through the hotel are a bit pricey (we went to Tulum, Playa del carmen for dinner, swimming with dolphins, Cozumel). Lounging on the beach with a margarita and their guacamole was perfect! The only downsides -- size of room was a little disappointing for the price, and items like ice-tea was pricey and added up quickly ($5 each). But I would definitely recommend Maroma to anyone who wanted a beautiful, relaxing, quiet resort!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I will preface this review by saying I am an extremely picky person. I traveled to Maroma for a quick 4 day escape, and wish that I would have been able to stay forever. As a single female traveller, I needed to find a place that met my needs for safety as well as my needs for relaxation....Maroma did just that. The staff was attentive to every need. They are friendly, generous and willing to please. I am a vegetarian and NEVER had problems finding anything on the menu. Breakfast (which is included in your room price) is prefaced with an entire plate of fresh fruit, choice of 3 fresh squeezed juices, homemade mexican rolls (3 -4 kinds) and regular wheat/white toast...and that's before you order. Lunch and dinner offer a LARGE VARIETY of choices....and yes, they are a little high on price, but the quality is worth every penny. One thing to remember as well is that tip is included and tacked onto the bill....so there is no need to tip the staff extra (even though you will want to every time you visit any one of the three restaurants). The spa is wonderful. Staff again is top notch. Hospitality service answers all of your questions and is eager to book any excursion out of Maroma if you so choose. Personally, I never left the resort. It was too wonderful to leave. The beach is beyond words and pictures. The website doesn't do this resort justice.....when I arrived I couldn't believe how magical this place is. Bottled water is replaced free of charge in your room 2-3 times a day, so take it with you wherever you go (otherwise you will have to purchase it). The exercise room is state-of-the-art, clean and almost always empty. Whether you want to take a walk through the jungle, lay on the beach, get a "Mexican Massage", eat the best fresh salsa ever or simply escape life and work for a while, Maroma is the place to do it. I slept 12 hours every night....not even intending to do so. This place takes every thought of the world, work and stress out of your body the second you arrive. Enjoy it. I did. And my husband and I will when we go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have read some of the negative reviews of the Maroma and I do not know how anyone can be down on the Maroma. My partner and I just spent 8 days there and had the most peaceful and relaxing time. All of the services were absolutely first rate and what you would except in a five star hotel. The staff was friendly and attentive and would almost telepathically anticipate your needs. The food was a little pricey and the wine was on the expensive side, but was not too out of the range of what you would expect a t a fine hotel. We had a car and found it helpful to get away to some of the nearby towns for dinner. We are seasoned travelers and felt that Maroma was one of the best experiences we ever had at a resort. We would highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to a Deception”
Reviews.Author: jorgevs_11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, just came back from 5 nights at Maroma. We celebrated our first anniversary. Last year we celebrated our honeymoon in the fallowing hotels… El Murmullo de la Casa que Canta (Ixtapa, México), Le Sirenuse (Positano Italy), Bauer (Venice, Italy), Hotel Splendido (Portofino, Italy) and Villa D´este (Lake Como , Italy). I mention these hotels because they represent part of the point of reference in this review. After saying all of the above our conclusion was that Maroma was close to a deception. Let me elaborate. Food and service at restaurants. The quality of the food is well below the standard of a hotel that charges you between $400 and $1,500 per night. Most of the food is close to flavorless, choices are few, and the service is really slow no matter how many people are in the restaurant at the same time. Plus, the food is expensive in terms of what they offer you. Since, Maroma is the only hotel in the beach and there is nothing around for at least 20 minutes driving, you don´t have any other choice but to eat there. Nevertheless, I need to mention that breakfasts (included in most packages) are fine and most choices delicious even though you need to wait some times at least 15 minutes in order for your order to really be taken. The best summary of our review of the food and the service is the following phrase of my Wife: “Please, I don´t want to eat here anymore. Let´s go somewhere else, even if we need to pay for a taxi”. We went several times to Playa del Carmen (20 minutes from Maroma) to have dinner and lunch. You need to pay $50 round trip in taxis. Everywhere we went in Playa del Carmen, was notoriously more delicious than Maroma, cheaper and good served. Rooms and facilities. Rooms are below average for the price they charge you. They were ok, but just that. The bathroom often smelled bad. And I always had the sensation that we were in an old hotel. Facilities aside from the lobby, are also below average. The pool in the old section of the hotel was always almost empty because I don´t know why it always appeared to be dirty. The pool in the newer section was much better. That´s were we spend all the time we wanted to be in a pool. The new section facility has some sections (such as the one in the beach) that make you feel you are in a third wolrd-third class hotel. Nevertheless, the gym was above my expectations. All the equipment is new and the gym room enjoyable. At night, staff at Maroma lite many candles, this makes the hotel look much better and more romantic. Beach and activities. Excellent. The beach is beautiful. It is the best beach we have ever visited. The water is transparent, waves are moderate, temperature of the water is not cold, and the shore is free of trash and weeds. Activities such as snorkeling, temascal and catamaran (included in most packages) are above average. In fact, the best we have had. Scuba diving is also a wonderful experience even though they charge you almost double the price you will pay in another place. Staff. Excellent attitude and service, except for the manager (I forgot her name, I do remember she was from Argentina). When I mentioned to her our critical point of view she showed few attention and almost no disposition to really make things better. It has been one of the less professional managers I have dealt with. But the hospitality team, was excellent and maybe the best part of Maroma. The bill. This was a bad experience. They charged us food and drinks we didn´t had and double the package we had. We needed to closely analyze the bill. After three revisions, and more than $2,500 less, we came to the final bill. We felt they wanted to rob us. We know it was not there intention, but at the end it was not a good experience. If you want to rest, with a beautifull view, eat real excellent food, have a nice room and a romantic atmosphere, and are not too much interested in scuba diving and snorkeling….go to El Murmullo de la Casa que Canta in Ixtapa, it is much better and truly a paradise…and by the way, much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “A Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: kimberly90210
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Maroma over the 4th of July weekend. I have done a lot of reading on Maromab before booking and it's rated as one of the best by Conte Nest and my travel agent highley recommended. Because of the price we have stayed in the past at Royal Hideaway and La Holla Mismaloya both have much superior service and quality of food. Both my partner and I have stayed at many hotels in Europe,Asia, U.S. High end $1,500 night (Aman properties and average end properties $200 night) We don't always stay at the best of the best but some occasions we splurge. Maroma is the worst hotel we have ever stayed at. While the setting is lovely and very romantic with candles lite everynight, very secluded in other words great setting. It's all off set by very average food at high prices. During dinner we had to track down the waiter 4 times and 1 hour later to get a dessert menu. We were asked the same questions over by different waiters. The staff seemed to only greet my partner when we passed by is that because females don't count?" For such a highley rated hotel they have lot to learn about quality ,service, and friendlieness. We made the best of what was a BIG disappointment. If you want good service don't go there!

Reviews.Title: “Maroma is Terrific!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights at the Maroma and did want to leave! From the moment we arrived we knew this was going to be just what we were looking for. Peacefulness, privacy, relaxing atmosphere, great beach, good food and great service. We have told many friends about Maroma and plan to come back annually!

Reviews.Title: “Paraiso Escondido”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from eight glorious days! We travel quite frequently, one of our favorite spots is Mexico, since it's such a quick flight from our home. We decided to try Maroma Resort & Spa. We're sure glad we did. It was absolutely magnificent. From the moment you arrive, the attention to detail and warm hospitality would make for a wonderful stay, even in increment weather conditions. All of the accommodations are superb. The beach is beautiful and private. We sailed with Victor and Javier on a Catamaran for a late afternoon sunset cruise, it was the best. Don't forget to dine under the stars on top of the observatory, the view is magnificent. Our thanks go to Felipe Espinoza, General Manager; Mireya and Alma, hospitality; Ruben, Antonio, Ivonne and all of the dining room staff, since we can't name them all, but all deserve to be recognized. Oh! and last Javier, Victor, and all the snorkeling and diving crew. We will definitely be visiting them real soon.

Reviews.Title: “Rain, Rain”
Reviews.Author: bstrick
Reviews.Content: Rain, Rain go away. Five days of rain, not the gentle type, but hurricane force weather. June. While this is not the fault of Maroma, I felt they were not equipped to handle the deluge. People were bored, the place was literally flooded. The dinners were overpriced. When we arrived they entry gate did not have our reservation so we had to argued with the gate attentant for a good 20 minutes, we speak no Spanish, before he finally let us pass through. The gym is minimalistic at best. The beach is beautiful, but the hotel is all show and no function. I was really disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The Resort is Truly a Leading Hotel of the World”
Reviews.Author: RelocationLady
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an eight day stay in Mexico. We stayed the first 4 days at Maroma. The next portion of our stay was at Secrets Capri. Maroma was beyond words. The beach is the prettiest I have ever seen and we have traveled to Tahiti and beyond. The service was excellent. The entire staff bent over backwards to accommodate the guest. The only beef I have was the food was too prices. Upon our arrival tired and exhausted we ate at the one rest. We had a drink the waiter said was perfect. Yes perfectly expensive. It was called a Bellini. and 4 drinks were over $80. Each day our food bill for the beach was around $60 including 1 drink> We did not like the food choices and the fish appeared frozen instead of fresh. We rented a car and drove into Playa a couple of nights to eat at the Blue Lobster which was great. We also went by cab once and at 20 plus tip each way got to expensive. I would suggest if you want to see the ruins, Playa Del Carmen rent a car at the airport and drive. The roads are great and if you rent in advance you will not have to pay the 80 per day the hotel arranged. We chose to go to Tulum which was about one hour south and easy drive. Our room was number 10. Beach direct view with a hammock I wish I had at home. The service at this hotel is spectacular but the internet did not work th entire time, but heck that is ok because I did not go to work. The drinks are weak but who cared. All you need is the beach and the atmosphere and that we got. The gift shop prices are lower than anywhere we shopped. I am always hesitant but this time they proved lower. some have commented on the bath room. The huge tub and shower accommodated 2 people. The bed at night makes you fall in love all over again. The staff again is excellent. then we went to secrets capri and nearly died. If I had not paid in advance I would have checked out and fled back to Maroma. If you want a romantic place, a perfect beach, great spa, and seclusion this is thehotel for you. We have never stayed at a place we really wanted to return to, but Maroma will be our yearly retreat from now on. Watch for the travel channels best of week and see Maroma then you will know what we mean.

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of heaven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just arrived home after spending 10 days in one of the most fantastic places in the world.From the moment you drive through the gates of maroma,you enter a different world. our ocean front rooms overlooked the best beach i have ever seen.So lay in the hammock and enjoy! Everything around is a joy, the staff are the most friendly and helpful,nothing is too much trouble. the gardens are just amazing,the only one i have seen to compare is the Villa Cimbrone Ravello, in Italy, The older part of the hotel is the place to be. Orient Express have done an amazing job to extend Maroma but it will take a while to gain the lushness of the original building and surroundings. Things that are must dos- Massage on the beach,the Temazecal, a trip with Victor on his boat..Go to Coba (early!) and climb the pyramid.eat dinner on the candlelit beach.and take factor 400 sun oil! I read the reviews on this site before i went and reading them now,im astonished any body could dream of critisizing! Idid see at first hand the kind of people who do complain, and would suggest maybe a cruise next time! The only thing to be wary of is to check the bill at the end of your time,the accounting can be as laidback as the place,but is easily resolved by the great staff in Hospitality. My respect and thanks to the staff who will make your stay unforgettable,Just go see!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Anniversary trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Maroma yesterday and had a fantastic time. We stayed three nights in an ocean front room and though the rate is higher we had a view of ocean and the lush lawn/garden and could enjoy the breeze. It was only a few steps to our palapa so you could go back and forth from the beach if you needed to. We took a snorkeling trip and a "jungle walk" with a guide to explain the plants, animals and local ecosystem. The dinners are expensive in the restaurant but you can also order something from the room service menu and eat on your own lovely patio. Staff was very friendly, room and furnishings are locally constructed and very beautiful. We stayed in the "old" part in Room 3. Certainly not the cheapest place in the area but if you want a small, intimate feel with no crowds and the ability to do nothing if you want, this is your place! We'd definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Oh, how the mighty have fallen!”
Reviews.Author: platehead
Reviews.Content: 5 years ago we stayed at the Maroma for 3 nites and it was one of the most wonderful places. Beautiful beach, property and excellent service. After staying there we raved about this place to all our friends saying you must go there. Last May while celebrating my 50th Birthday, although we could not get a reservation for a room at the Maroma for the dates we were in Mexico, my wife wanted to suprise me and have my birthday dinner at the Maroma restaurant. Well, first of all as we entered the grounds I noticed it was a bit more shabby than I had remembered. But I looked past that figuring it was the time and elements of being near the ocean. When we were greeted by the hostess, she said that shorts were not allowed at dinner. NO problem my mistake, so I went to the boutique and purchased some $80 pants (which I will probably never wear again, they looked fine for the Caribbean, not San Francisco Ca). When we sat down for dinner we mentioned to the hostess that it was my 50th Birthday dinner, and we have stayed here before and loved it. but we have about 2hours30 minutes for dinner since we had to pick up my sister in law at the Airport at 830PM. As we were sitting at the table, toasting my birthday, I noticed a couple being seated and the gentleman was wearing SHORTS! I did not want to make a big deal out of it , but I asked the hostess why I was not allowed to wear shorts and he was allowed. Her response was that he was ordering from the lunch menu. I looked at my watch and said it is 6PM, and it looks like he has the same menu we had. So I then asked "why were we not offered the "lunch menu", and why I had to buy $80 pants to have dinner and not him ??" She did not give me any answer. Well after dinner, which was expensive and not very special as it was 5 years ago, we asked for the check knowing we had a few more minutes before we had to go to the airport. It took a long time to get the check, so I left to bring the car around to the restaurant while my wife paid. I was still waiting. My wife finally got to the car and I asked her what took so long. She said they overcharged her by about $200.00 and she had to straighten it out. I felt so bad for my poor wife who really wanted to make it a special dinner for me, but we were treated so poorly it was one of the most insulting dinners we ever had. We were lied to, and as I figure it overcharged about $280.00 We have been to many to restaurants and hotels in Europe, Caribbean, Hawaii, and other places in the US. Not to mention we live in the SF Bay area, which we have our share of top restaurants and hotels. And we have also been to simple hamburger joints and "mom & pop" taquerias, but we have never been treated so poorly. And to top it off, I wrote a letter to the Maroma to tell them of my experience. They have never even responed!!!! I know this place sometimes gets mentioned in the "Best Beaches /Best Resorts" lists in travel magazines and on the Travel Channel. BUT unfortunately if they continue their slide in service I think their days are numbered for any "Best" list. For the prices they charge, especially for Mexico, you would think they could hire or train for better service. We will continue to tell our friends about this place, but now we will tell them you must NOT go!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort, Beach Overrated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were recent guests of the Maroma family and have nothing but positive things to say about our time in Mexico. The resort itself was absolutely fantastic! I only ventured to the new additions once, but it essentially mirrors the original property. Having said that, I would suggest staying either in the main "El Sol" building, or in the older section surrounding the Main pool as it is undoubtedly more tranquil than the new buildings which nestle against the louder Venta Club. The staff was phenomenal. Service was the best I have ever experienced (regardless of locale). Rooms were unique and "authentic", the deck and private hammocks perfect for late afternoon napping. The main restaurant hosts a wonderful breakfast each morning, and the lunch menu was equally satisfying. If you stay on premises for more than 5 days or so, I suggest venturing out for dinner at least once as the dinner menu is somewhat limited. The menu itself rotates from day to day, and is reasonably priced. The wine cellar is fairly extensive, and blends from all over the world. Food quality was good, but some of the non-Snapper seafood (fish only) dishes were not as fresh as they perhaps could have been. The beach was beautiful, the water warm and clear. On a down note, there was a good bit of debris both in the water and along the shore. You would never know this walking the beaches behind Maroma, but a walk to either point would prove otherwise. I suspect this was an anomaly due to recent storms and tradewinds, but it does make for an interesting swim. All in all a wonderful resort. The staff is exemplary and the beaches inviting. We definitely plan on returning in the future and will highly recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Maroma = Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Maroma Resort & Spa My husband and I came back tonight from our honeymoon. We had intended to stay there for 4 nights and then move to the nearby Royal Hideaway resort. We arrived at the other resort and immediately got on the phone with your travel agent to return to Maroma. We were there for 10 days. Staff is wonderful and they greet you with the words ?Welcome Home? and a frosty (and strong) margarita.Our room during the first 4 days was overlooking the main pool. Very quiet and beautiful. Our bed (white with flowing white fabric from the ceiling) had the word felicidades (happy honeymoon) spelled out in flowers and a bottle of champagne chilling on ice. When we returned to the resort, we had 2 different rooms to fit into their availability. Our last room #30 walked directly to the beach and had an amazing tile bath.
