Both were on the "main" side of the resort which we preferred.Small details that make Maroma worth it: Plenty of free bottled water in the rooms, free coffee or tea outside your door every morning, you never see a bill (which might make you nuts), they call you by name, breakfast is included in your room rate and it is a 4 course occasion, they bring free sorbet and fresh fruit to the beach during the day, there is room for everyone on the beach and it isn?t the kind of place where people are chair hogs, gym is brand new and well equipped, homemade chocolates on the bed each night and turn down that includes candles being lit around your room, great water pressure and massages available on the beach. The chef is wonderful and the menu is eclectic. He is very personable and has cooking demonstrations on certain days. I would recommend that people who share a room at this resort be very comfortable with each other. There are no shower curtains and the bathroom door is more befitting of a department store fitting room. You can see where they are building new things but we never heard any construction noises.If you are there for a special occassion tell them and they can set up a candlelit dinner on the beach or on their roof patio overlooking the pristine, beautiful beach. It is a flawless operation that is well run.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned from Maroma”
Reviews.Author: therm
Reviews.Content: I did not read any of the reviews from this web site prior to our stay at Maroma. I have just read some of the comments from visitors over the last year. Some of the negative reviews seem mostly accurate. However, my wife and I had a great time. I must reiterate that the beach is fabulous. The Ventaclub next door does not pose much of a problem if one stays closer to the main beach area near the restaraunt. I must agree that drinks, food and excursions are extremely overpriced. A one tank dive cost $90 if you are certified-this does not include scuba gear. The dive boat looks like a very small fishing boat made for a creek and you have to swim to the boat. I did not dive there. I went to Tank-ha downtown. We drank the water for 8 days and did not get ill. We must have iron stomachs. I would not pay for an ocean view room. The garden view rooms are fine a much less expensive and I don't think most of the "ocean front" rooms give any advantages in location or scenery. It would be nice to be a little closer to Playa del carmen. We rented a car from Hertz downtown and seemed to work for us. I will be looking forward to returning to the area but I might look closer to town like Ikal del mar. Overall I would recommend the Maroma but I would bring my own alcohol and make my own drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back last week and we absolutely loved it. The resort rooms and grounds are beautiful. The staff is extremely friendly. It is definitely a honeymooners paradise. I recommend asking to have a private dinner on the beach. The beach is incredible, no seaweed, rocks, or shells, just soft sand. The only negative is that the food and drinks are a little pricey, but taste great. The atmosphere is so relaxing we didn't want to come home.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Maroma Visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Maroma and we had a great time. Our room was very nice and the staff really made an effort to meet our every need. The beach/water was as beautiful as advertised and the food, especially breakfast & lunch, was good. We found it to be a very romantic, enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Words Cannot Describe”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from one of the most beautiful and relaxing weeks we have ever enjoyed. Yes, we were concerned that the experience would not live up to the price. We were NOT dissappointed! Our room was in the "old" section, overlooking the pool. The views were spectacular, we were surrounded by trees and gardens. Each night, the staff lit what must have been hundreds of candles to line the walkways. The atmosphere was as romantic as it can get! Perfect white sand beach - without the crowds of the larger resorts. We walked along the beach to some of the larger places and commented how lucky we were not to have the music blaring and the on-the-beach dance lessons. Our room was wonderfull, with a hammock on the porch overlooking the pool. We enjoyed the attentive staff - never have seen people work so hard to satisy your every wish. The food was good - a few disappointments at dinner - see last review - we learned to ask for special items to suit our tastes. The salads were fantastic - great mixed greens with tomato and avacado. Don't expect to be entertained other than by a small musical group in the main lobby each night. This is a place for quiet relaxation and enjoyment of the beautifully manicured gardens. Mexico, the way is should be. Enjoy it while you can.
